analyzed: kadā nu kho āgamissati iti evam mama ayana vacanam parammukhā mettam vacīkammam nāma
translated: When will he come? ’—this is verbal loving-kindness done to one who is absent.

analyzed: parammukhā mettam manokammam nāma  lābhā ati cīvara ādayaḥ laddha paccayāḥ dhammikā ati kuhanā ādi bhedam micchājīvam vajjetvā
translated: this was mental loving-kindness done to one who is absent.🔽‘Gain’ is the requisites of robes, etc., that are obtained. ‘Dhamma’ is the right livelihood that avoids wrong livelihood consisting in such things as hypocrisy, and so on.

original: dhammena samena bhikkhācāravattena uppannā. Antamaso pattapariyāpannamattampīti pacchimakoṭiyā🔽patte pariyāpannaṃ pattassa antogataṃ dvitikaṭacchubhikkhāmattampi. Appaṭivibhattabhogīti
analyzed: dhammena samena bhikkhā cāra vattena uppannāḥ antamaso patta pariyāpanna mattam pi iti pacchima koṭiyā  patte pariyāpannam pattassa antogatam appaṭivibhatta bhogi iti
translated: ‘Even to the extent of a mere handful’ is the minimum amount.

original: ettha dve paṭivibhattā nāma – āmisappaṭivibhattañca, puggalappaṭivibhattañca. Tattha
analyzed: ettha dve paṭivibhattāḥ nāma āmisa paṭivibhattañca puggala paṭivibhattañca tattha
translated: ‘Not shared’ : here there are two kinds of sharing: sharing of material things and sharing of persons.

original: – “ettakaṃ dassāmi, ettakaṃ na dassāmī”ti evaṃ cittena vibhajanaṃ āmisappaṭivibhattaṃ🔽nāma. “Asukassa dassāmi, asukassa na dassāmī”ti evaṃ cittena vibhajanaṃ pana puggalappaṭivibhattaṃ
analyzed: ettakam dassāmi ettakam na dassāmi iti evam cittena vibhajanam āmisa paṭivibhattam  nāma asukassa dassāmi asukassa na dassāmi iti evam cittena vibhajanam pana puggala paṭivibhattam
translated: “I will give this, I will not give that” — such a discriminating mind is called distribution of material things. “I will give to this one, I will not give to that one” — such a discriminating mind is called distribution of persons.

original: nāma. Tadubhayampi akatvā yo appaṭivibhattaṃ bhuñjati, ayaṃ appaṭivibhattabhogī nāma.
analyzed: nāma tat ubhayam pi a katvā yaḥ appaṭivibhattam bhuñjati ayam appaṭivibhatta bhogī nāma
translated: “I will give this, I will not give that” — such a discriminating mind is called “discrimination of material.” “I will give to this one, I will not give to that one” — such a discriminating mind is called “discrimination of person.” Without making either of these discriminations, he who eats what is not discriminated is called “one who eats what is not discriminated.”

original: Sīlavantehi sabrahmacārīhi sādhāraṇabhogīti ettha sādhāraṇabhogino idaṃ lakkhaṇaṃ,
analyzed: sīlavantehi sabrahmacārīhi sādhāraṇa bhogī iti ettha sādhāraṇa bhoginaḥ idam lakkhaṇaṃ
translated: “One who shares with virtuous companions in the life of purity” — here the characteristic of one who shares is this:

original: yaṃ yaṃ paṇītaṃ labbhati, taṃ taṃ neva lābhena lābhaṃ nijigīsanatāmukhena gihīnaṃ
analyzed: yam yam paṇītam labbhati tam tam na iva lābhena lābham nijigīsana tā mukhena
translated: Whatever is good that he gets, he does not give it to householders with the motive of getting more by way of profit,

original: deti, na attanā bhuñjati, paṭiggaṇhanto ca – “saṅghena sādhāraṇaṃ hotū”ti gahetvā
analyzed: deti na attanā bhuñjati paṭiggaṇhantaḥ ca saṅghena sādhāraṇam hotu uti gahetvā
translated: nor does he eat it himself. When he receives it, he takes it thinking, “Let it be shared by the Community,”

original: ghaṇṭiṃ paharitvā paribhuñjitabbaṃ saṅghasantakaṃ viya passati.
analyzed: ghaṇṭim paharitvā paribhuñjitabbam saṅgha santakam viya passati
translated: and he eats it after striking the gong and making it common to all as if it were the property of the Community.

original: Imaṃ pana sāraṇīyadhammaṃ ko pūreti, ko na pūretīti? Dussīlo tāva na pūreti. Na hi
analyzed: imam pana sāraṇīya dhammam ko pūreti kaḥ na pūreti iti dussīlaḥ tāva na pūreti na hi
translated: But who fulfills this quality of being easy to correct and who does not? The unvirtuous one does not fulfill it.

original: tassa santakaṃ sīlavantā gaṇhanti. Parisuddhasīlo pana vattaṃ akhaṇḍento pūreti.
analyzed: tassa santakam sīlavantāḥ gaṇhanti parisuddha sīlaḥ pana vattam a khaṇḍento pūreti
translated: He who is perfect in virtue fulfills it without breaking the observance.

original: Tatridaṃ vattaṃ – yo hi odissakaṃ katvā mātu vā pitu vā ācariyupajjhāyādīnaṃ vā deti,
analyzed: tatra idam vattam yaḥ hi odissakam katvā mātu vā pitu vā ācariya upajjhāya ādīnam vā deti
translated: Herein, he who gives with a view to a reward, to his mother or father or teacher or preceptor or some other respect-worthy person,

original: so dātabbaṃ deti, sāraṇīyadhammo panassa na hoti, palibodhajagganaṃ nāma hoti. Sāraṇīyadhammo🔽hi muttapalibodhasseva vaṭṭati. Tena pana odissakaṃ dentena gilānagilānupaṭṭhākaāgantukagamikānañceva
analyzed: saḥ dātabbam deti sāraṇīya dhammaḥ pana assa na hoti palibodha jagganam nāma hoti sāraṇīya dhammaḥ  hi mutta pali bodhassa iva vaṭṭati tena pana odissakam dentena gilāna gilāna upaṭṭhāka āgantuka gamikānam ca iva
translated: gives what should be given, but he does not have the virtue of being obliging. He has what is called the virtue of being free from debt.🔽For the virtue of being obliging is only proper for one who is free from debt.🔽But when he gives with a view to a reward, he should give to the sick and to those who tend the sick, to newcomers and to those about to go travelling,

original: navapabbajitassa ca saṅghāṭipattaggahaṇaṃ ajānantassa dātabbaṃ. Etesaṃ datvā avasesaṃ
analyzed: nava pabbajitassa ca saṅghāṭi patta ggahaṇam a jānantassa dātabbam etesam da tvā avasesam
translated: and to one who has recently gone forth and does not know how to get a robe, an alms-garment, and a rains-cloth. After giving to these,

original: therāsanato paṭṭhāya thokaṃ adatvā yo yattakaṃ gaṇhāti, tassa tattakaṃ dātabbaṃ.
analyzed: thera āsanataḥ paṭṭhāya thokam a datvā yaḥ yattakam gaṇhāti tassa tattakam dātabbaṃ
translated: he should give to the rest, starting from the head of the schoo1, as much as each one takes.

original: Avasiṭṭhe asati puna piṇḍāya caritvā therāsanato paṭṭhāya yaṃ yaṃ paṇītaṃ, taṃ datvā
analyzed: avasiṭṭhe asati puna piṇḍāya caritvā thera āsanataḥ paṭṭhāya yam yam paṇītam tam da tvā
translated: If there is not enough to give to all, he should go out for alms again and give to them starting with the head of the schoo1 whatever good things there are,

original: sesaṃ paribhuñjitabbaṃ. “Sīlavantehī”ti vacanato dussīlassa adātumpi vaṭṭati.
analyzed: sesam paribhuñjitabbam sīlavantehi iti vacanataḥ dussīlassa a dātum pi vaṭṭati
translated: and he should eat what remains. And because of the words “to those who are virtuous” it is allowable not to give to those who are unvirtuous.

original: Ayaṃ pana sāraṇīyadhammo susikkhitāya parisāya supūro hoti, no asikkhitāya parisāya.
analyzed: ayam pana sāraṇīya dhammo su sikkhitāya parisāya su pūraḥ hoti no a sikkhitāya parisāya
translated: But this friendliness is fulfilled only in a well-trained community, not in an untrained one.

original: Susikkhitāya hi parisāya yo aññato labhati, so na gaṇhāti. Aññato alabhantopi pamāṇayuttameva🔽gaṇhāti, nātirekaṃ. Ayaṃ pana sāraṇīyadhammo evaṃ punappunaṃ piṇḍāya caritvā laddhaṃ
analyzed: su sikkhitāya hi parisāya yaḥ aññatas labhati so na gaṇhāti aññatas a labhantaḥ api pamāṇa yuttam eva  gaṇhāti na atirekam ayam pana sāraṇīya dhammaḥ evam punappunam piṇḍāya caritvā laddham
translated: For in a well-trained community, one who gets it from another does not take it, and one who does not get it from another takes only a moderate amount, not too much.

original: laddhaṃ dentassāpi dvādasahi vassehi pūrati, na tato oraṃ. Sace hi dvādasame vasse
analyzed: laddham dentassa api dvādasahi vassehi pūrati na tatas oram sace hi dvādasame vasse
translated: But this friendliness is fulfilled only after twelve years, not sooner, by one who gives what he gets from time to time after going on continuous alms round.

original: sāraṇīyadhammapūrako piṇḍapātapūraṃ pattaṃ āsanasālāyaṃ ṭhapetvā nahāyituṃ gacchati
analyzed: sāraṇīya dhamma pūrakaḥ piṇḍapāta pūram pattam āsana sālāyam ṭhapetvā nahāyitum gacchati
translated: For if one who is fulfilling the friendliness places his alms bowl filled with alms food in the refectory and goes to bathe,

original: saṅghatthero ca kasseso pattoti, “sāraṇīyadhammapūrakassā”ti vutte “āharatha na”nti
analyzed: saṅgha thero ca kassa iso patto ti sāraṇīya dhamma pūrakassa ati vutte āharatha naṃ ti
translated: and if the senior elder of the Community asks, “Whose bowl is this?” and is told, “It belongs to one who is fulfilling the friendliness,” and he says, “Bring it; let us eat it,”

original: sabbaṃ piṇḍapātaṃ vicāretvā bhuñjitvā ca rittaṃ pattaṃ ṭhapeti, atha so bhikkhu rittaṃ
analyzed: sabbam piṇḍapātam vicāretvā bhuñjitvā ca rittam pattam ṭhapeti atha so bhikkhu rittam
translated: then the bowl is emptied by the senior elder eating it all.

original: pattaṃ disvā “mayhaṃ anavasesetvāva paribhuñjiṃsū”ti domanassaṃ uppādeti, sāraṇīyadhammo
analyzed: pattam disvā mayham an avasesetvā ava paribhuñjiṃsu iti domanassam uppādeti sāraṇīya dhammo
translated: If the bhikkhu who is fulfilling the friendliness sees that his bowl is empty, he becomes discontented, thinking, “They have eaten without leaving any for me.” And his friendliness is not fulfilled.

original: bhijjati, puna dvādasavassāni pūretabbo hoti. Titthiyaparivāsasadiso hesa, sakiṃ🔽khaṇḍe jāte puna pūretabbova. Yo pana – “lābhā vata me, suladdhaṃ vata me, yassa
analyzed: bhijjati puna dvādasa vassāni pūretabbo hoti titthiya parivāsa sadiso ha esa sakim  khaṇḍe jāte puna lābhāḥ vata me su laddham vata me yassa
translated: If it breaks, it must be filled again for twelve years. It is like the probation for one who has gone over to another sect. If it is broken, it must be filled again.

original: me pattagataṃ anāpucchāva sabrahmacārī paribhuñjantī”ti somanassaṃ janeti, tassa puṇṇo nāma hoti.🔽Evaṃ pūritasāraṇīyadhammassa pana neva issā, na macchariyaṃ hoti. So manussānaṃ piyo🔽hoti, sulabhapaccayo ca, pattagatamassa diyyamānampi na khīyati, bhājanīyabhaṇḍaṭṭhāne
analyzed: me patta gatam an āpucchāva sabrahmacārī paribhuñjanti iti somanassam janeti tassa puṇṇaḥ nāma hoti  evam pūrita sāraṇīya dhammassa pana na iva issā na macchariyam hoti saḥ manussānam piyaḥ  hoti sulabha paccayaḥ ca patta gatam assa diyyamānam pi na khīyati bhājanīya bhaṇḍa ṭṭhāne
translated: But one who thinks, “How fortunate I am that my fellows in the life of purity have used what I have offered without asking permission,” and who thus generates joy, is called “one who has filled the bowl.”

original: aggabhaṇḍaṃ labhati, bhaye vā chātake vā sampatte devatā ussukkaṃ āpajjanti.
analyzed: agga bhaṇḍam labhati bhaye vā chātake vā sampatte devatāḥ ussukkam āpajjanti
translated: And when the virtue of friendliness has been thus filled, there is no envy or avarice. He is dear to people, easy to address, and he gets requisites easily. What is given to him does not diminish but becomes never-ending. He gets the best place, the best lodging, the best seat, and the best requisites. If there is danger or fear, gods and men look after him.

original: Tatrimāni vatthūni – senagirivāsī tissatthero kira mahāgirigāmaṃ upanissāya viharati.
analyzed: tatra imāni vatthūni senagiri vāsī tissa theraḥ kira mahā giri gāmam upanissāya viharati
translated: Here are the stories of those who have filled the bowl. The elder Tissa, it seems, who lived at Senāgiri, dwelt in dependence on the great village of Giri.

original: Paññāsa mahātherā nāgadīpaṃ cetiyavandanatthāya gacchantā girigāme piṇḍāya caritvā
analyzed: paññāsa mahā therāḥ nāgadīpam cetiya vandana tthāya gacchantāḥ girigāme piṇḍāya caritvā
translated: Fifty great elders were going to the island of Tambapaṇṇi to worship the shrines. They entered the village of Giri for alms.

original: kiñci aladdhā nikkhamiṃsu. Thero pana pavisanto te disvā pucchi – “laddhaṃ, bhante”ti?
analyzed: kiñci aladdhāḥ nikkhamiṃsu thero pana pavisanto te disvā pucchi laddham bhante iti
translated: and they went out again without having received anything. But when the elder entered, he saw them and asked, “Did you get anything, venerable sirs? ”

original: Vicarimha āvusoti. So tesaṃ aladdhabhāvaṃ ñatvā āha – “bhante yāvāhaṃ āgacchāmi,
analyzed: vicarimha āvuso ti saḥ tesam a laddha bhāvam ñatvā āha bhante yāvā aham āgacchāmi
translated: “We searched, friend. ” The elder, realizing that they had received nothing, said, “Venerable sirs, stay here until I come back. ”

original: tāva idheva hothā”ti. Mayaṃ, āvuso, paññāsa janā pattatemanamattampi na labhimhāti.🔽Bhante, nevāsikā nāma paṭibalā honti, alabhantāpi bhikkhācāramaggasabhāgaṃ jānantīti.
analyzed: tāva idhā iva hotha ati mayam āvuso paññāsa janā patta temana mattam pi na labhimha ati  bhante nevāsikāḥ nāma paṭibalāḥ honti a labhantā api bhikkhācāra magga sabhāgam jānanti iti
translated: “Friend, we are fifty in number; we did not get even the space of a palm-leaf each. ”🔽“Venerable sirs, residents are able to do this; even if they do not get anything, they know where to go for alms. ”

original: Therā āgamesuṃ. Thero gāmaṃ pāvisi. Dhurageheyeva mahāupāsikā khīrabhattaṃ sajjetvā
analyzed: therāḥ āgamesum theraḥ gāmam pāvisi dhurageheyā iva mahā upāsikā khīra bhattam sajjetvā
translated: The elders waited. The elder entered the village. In a certain house a great female lay devotee had prepared rice-gruel and boiled rice for the elder.

original: theraṃ olokayamānā ṭhitā. Atha therassa dvāraṃ sampattasseva pattaṃ pūretvā adāsi,
analyzed: theram olokayamānā ṭhitā atha therassa dvāram sampattassa iva pattam pūretvā adāsi
translated: She was standing watching for him. When the elder reached the door, she filled his bowl with rice and gave it to him.

original: so taṃ ādāya therānaṃ santikaṃ gantvā gaṇhatha, bhanteti, saṅghattheraṃ āha. Thero
analyzed: saḥ tam ādāya therānam santikam gantvā gaṇhatha bhante iti saṅghattheram āha theraḥ
translated: He took it and went to the elders. He said to the chief elder, “Venerable sir, take this. ” The elder thought,

original: – “amhehi ettakehi kiñci na laddhaṃ, ayaṃ sīghameva gahetvā āgato, kiṃ nu kho”ti
analyzed: amhehi ettakehi kiñci na laddham ayam sīgham eva gahetvā āgataḥ kim nu khalu iti
translated: “We have not received anything, but he has come back quickly with this. What does this mean? ”

original: sesānaṃ mukhaṃ olokesi. Thero olokanākāreneva ñatvā “bhante, dhammena samena laddhapiṇḍapāto,
analyzed: sesānam mukham olokesi theraḥ olokana ākārena iva ñatvā bhante dhammena samena laddha piṇḍapāto
translated: He looked at the faces of the rest. The Elder knew by the look, “Venerable sirs, the alms food was obtained by me in accordance with the Dhamma.

original: nikkukkuccā gaṇhathā”tiādito paṭṭhāya sabbesaṃ yāvadatthaṃ datvā attanāpi yāvadatthaṃ bhuñji.
analyzed: nikkukkuccāḥ gaṇhatha ati āditaḥ paṭṭhāya sabbesam yāvadattham da tvā attanā api yāvadattham bhuñji
translated: Take it without scruple.” Beginning with this, he gave to all as much as they wanted. He himself ate as much as he wanted.

original: Atha naṃ bhattakiccāvasāne therā pucchiṃsu – “kadā, āvuso, lokuttaradhammaṃ paṭivijjhī”ti?
analyzed: atha nam bhatta kicca avasāne therā pucchiṃsu kadā āvuso lokuttara dhammam paṭivijjhi iti
translated: Then at the end of the meal the elders asked him, “Friend, when did you penetrate the supramundane state?”

original: Natthi me, bhante, lokuttaradhammoti. Jhānalābhīsi, āvusoti? Etampi me, bhante, natthīti.
analyzed: natthi me bhante lokuttara dhammo ti jhāna lābhī asi āvuso ti etam pi me bhante natthi iti
translated: “Venerable sirs, I have no supramundane state.” “Then, friend, have you attained jhāna?” “That too I have not, venerable sirs.”

original: Nanu, āvuso, pāṭihāriyanti? Sāraṇīyadhammo me, bhante, pūrito, tassa me dhammassa
analyzed: nanu āvuso pāṭihāriyanti sāraṇīya dhammo me bhante pūritaḥ tassa me dhammassa
translated: “Then, friend, have you performed a miracle?” “I have fulfilled the quality of being delightful, venerable sirs.

original: pūritakālato paṭṭhāya sacepi bhikkhusatasahassaṃ hoti, pattagataṃ na khīyatīti. Te🔽sutvā – “sādhu sādhu sappurisa, anucchavikamidaṃ tuyha”nti āhaṃsu. Idaṃ tāva – “pattagataṃ
analyzed: pūrita kālataḥ paṭṭhāya sace pi bhikkhu sata sahassam hoti patta gatam na khīyati iti te  sutvā sādhu sādhu sappurisa anucchavikam idam āhaṃsu idam tāva patta gatam
translated: From the time I fulfilled that quality, if there were a hundred thousand bhikkhus, there would be no exhaustion of what is put into my bowl.”

original: na khīyatī”ti ettha vatthu.
analyzed: na khīyati iti ettha vatthu
translated: When they heard this, they said, “Good, good, good man! This is fitting for you.” This is the story of “There would be no exhaustion of what is put into my bowl.”

original: Ayameva pana thero cetiyapabbate giribhaṇḍamahāpūjāya dānaṭṭhānaṃ gantvā imasmiṃ
analyzed: ayam eva pana thero cetiyapabbate giribhaṇḍa mahāpūjāya dānaṭṭhānam gantvā imasmin
translated: But this Elder, having gone to the place of distribution of gifts at the great festival of the distribution of robes at Cetiyapabbata, asked, “What is the best of the goods here? ”

original: ṭhāne kiṃ varabhaṇḍanti pucchi. Dve sāṭakā, bhanteti. Ete mayhaṃ pāpuṇissantīti.
analyzed: ṭhāne kim pucchi dve sāṭakāḥ bhante ti ete mayham pāpuṇissanti iti
translated: “Two cloths, venerable sir.” “They will fall to my share.”

original: Taṃ sutvā amacco rañño ārocesi – “eko daharo evaṃ vadatī”ti. Daharassa evaṃ cittaṃ,
analyzed: tam sutvā amaccaḥ raññaḥ ārocesi ekaḥ daharaḥ evam vadati iti daharassa evam cittam
translated: When the minister heard that, he reported the matter to the King, saying, “A young man says thus.” “The young man’s mind is like this,

original: mahātherānaṃ pana sukhumasāṭakā vaṭṭantīti vatvā mahātherānaṃ dassāmīti ṭhapeti.
analyzed: mahā therānam pana sukhuma sāṭakāḥ vaṭṭanti iti vatvā mahā therānam dassāmi iti ṭhapeti
translated: but fine cloths are suitable for the great elders.” So he set them aside, saying, “I shall give them to the great elders.”

original: Tassa bhikkhusaṅghe paṭipāṭiyā ṭhite dentassa matthake ṭhapitāpi te sāṭakā hatthaṃ
analyzed: tassa bhikkhu saṅghe paṭipāṭiyā ṭhite dentassa matthake ṭhapitā api te sāṭakā hatthaṃ
translated: When he was giving them out to the bhikkhu Sangha, which was seated in order of seniority, the cloths, though placed on the head of the young man,

original: nārohanti. Aññe ārohanti. Daharassa dānakāle pana hatthaṃ āruḷhā. So tassa hatthe
analyzed: na ārohanti aññe ārohanti daharassa dāna kāle pana hattham āruḷhā saḥ tassa hatthe
translated: would not go on to his hand. They went on to the hands of others. But when it was the young man’s turn to receive, they went on to his hand.

original: pātetvā amaccassa mukhaṃ oloketvā daharaṃ nisīdāpetvā dānaṃ datvā saṅghaṃ vissajjetvā
analyzed: pātetvā amaccassa mukham oloketvā daharam nisīdāpetvā dānam datvā saṅgham vissajjetvā
translated: He took them from his hand, looked at the minister’s face, seated the young man, gave the gift, and dismissed the Sangha.

original: daharassa santike nisīditvā – “bhante, imaṃ dhammaṃ kadā paṭivijjhitthā”ti āha. So
analyzed: daharassa santike nisīditvā bhante imam dhammam kadā paṭivijjhittha ati āha saḥ
translated: Then he sat down near the young man and asked him, “Venerable sir, when did you penetrate this True Idea? ”

original: pariyāyenāpi asantaṃ avadanto – “natthi mayhaṃ mahārāja lokuttaradhammo”ti āha. Nanu,🔽bhante, pubbe avacutthāti. Āma, mahārāja, sāraṇīyadhammapūrako ahaṃ, tassa me dhammassa🔽pūritakālato paṭṭhāya bhājanīyabhaṇḍaṭṭhāne aggabhaṇḍaṃ pāpuṇātīti. “Sādhu sādhu,
analyzed: pariyāyena api asantam a vadantaḥ natthi mayham mahā rāja lokuttara dhammo ti āha nanu  bhante pubbe avacuttha ati āma mahā rāja sāraṇīya dhamma pūrakaḥ aham tassa me dhammassa  pūrita kālataḥ paṭṭhāya bhājanīya bhaṇḍa ṭṭhāne agga bhaṇḍam pāpuṇāti iti sādhu sādhu
translated: “But, revered sir, did you not say so before?”🔽“Yes, great king, I am one who fulfills the duty of being friendly. Since I fulfilled that state, I have been given the best of the goods in the place where goods are stored.”

original: bhante, anucchavikamidaṃ tuyha”nti vanditvā pakkāmi. Idaṃ – “bhājanīyabhaṇḍaṭṭhāne🔽aggabhaṇḍaṃ pāpuṇātī”ti ettha vatthu.
analyzed: bhante anucchavikam idam vanditvā idam bhājanīya bhaṇḍa ṭṭhāne  aggabhaṇḍam pāpuṇāti iti ettha vatthu
translated: “Good, good, revered sir! This is fitting for you.” After paying homage to him, he departed. This is the incident referred to by the words “The best of the goods in the place where goods are stored.”

original: Brāhmaṇatissabhaye pana bhātaragāmavāsino nāgattheriyā anārocetvāva palāyiṃsu. Therī🔽paccūsasamaye – “ativiya appanigghoso gāmo, upadhāretha tāvā”ti daharabhikkhuniyo
analyzed: brāhmaṇa tissa bhaye pana bhātaragāma vāsinaḥ nāga ttheriyāḥ an ārocetvā ava palāyiṃsu therī  paccūsa samaye appa nigghosaḥ gāmaḥ upadhāretha tāva ati dahara bhikkhuniyo
translated: In the case of the “Brahmaṇī Tissa’s fear,” the inhabitants of the brother’s village fled without informing the nun Thullanandā. The nun🔽at dawn said: “The village is very quiet. Just wait and see.” She told the young bhikkhunīs

original: āha. Tā gantvā sabbesaṃ gatabhāvaṃ ñatvā āgamma theriyā ārocesuṃ. Sā sutvā “mā tumhe
analyzed: āha tāḥ gantvā sabbesam gata bhāvam ñatvā āgamma theriyāḥ ārocesuṃ sā sutvā mā tumhe
translated: to go and find out what was happening. They went and found that everyone had fled. They returned and told the nun. When she heard, she said: “Do not be afraid, sisters.

original: tesaṃ gatabhāvaṃ cintayittha, attano uddesaparipucchāyonisomanasikāresuyeva yogaṃ🔽karothā”ti vatvā bhikkhācāravelāyaṃ pārupitvā attadvādasamā gāmadvāre nigrodhamūle
analyzed: tesam gata bhāvam attanaḥ yogam  karotha ati vatvā bhikkhā cāra velāyam pārupitvā atta dvādasamāḥ gāmadvāre nigrodha mūle
translated: “Think over their departure, and apply yourselves to the recitation of the Law, to questioning, and to right reflection.”

original: aṭṭhāsi. Rukkhe adhivatthādevatā dvādasannampi bhikkhunīnaṃ piṇḍapātaṃ datvā “ayye,
analyzed: rukkhe adhivatthā devatā dvādasannam pi bhikkhunīnam piṇḍapātam da tvā ayye
translated: Having thus spoken, she put on her outer robe, and at the time when the Bhikkhunis usually go out for alms, she went to the village gate, and sat down at the foot of a banyan tree. The deity who dwelt in that tree gave alms to the twelve Bhikkhunis, and said, “Reverend Ladies,

original: mā aññattha gacchatha, niccaṃ idheva ethā”ti āha. Theriyā pana kaniṭṭhabhātā nāgatthero
analyzed: mā aññattha gacchatha niccam idha iva etha iti āha theriyā pana kaniṭṭha bhātā nāga tthero
translated: do not go elsewhere; come hither always.” But the younger brother of the Elder Nun, the Elder Nun named Nāgata,

original: nāma atthi, so – “mahantaṃ bhayaṃ, na sakkā idha yāpetuṃ, paratīraṃ gamissāmī”ti🔽attadvādasamova attano vasanaṭṭhānā nikkhanto theriṃ disvā gamissāmīti bhātaragāmaṃ
analyzed: nāma atthi saḥ mahantam bhayam na sakkā idha yāpetum para tīram gamissāmi iti  atta dvādasamaḥ iva attanaḥ vasana ṭhānā nikkhanto therim disvā gamissāmi iti
translated: thought, “This is a great calamity; it is impossible to live here. I will go to the other shore.”

original: āgato. Therī – “therā āgatā”ti sutvā tesaṃ santikaṃ gantvā kiṃ ayyāti pucchi. So
analyzed: āgataḥ therī therāḥ āgatā ati sutvā tesam santikam gantvā kim ayyā iti pucchi so
translated: Accordingly he left his dwelling-place, and went with twelve companions to the village of his sister. When the Elder Nun heard that the Elders had come, she went to them, and asked, “What is the matter, Reverend Sirs?”

original: taṃ pavattiṃ ācikkhi. Sā – “ajja ekadivasaṃ vihāreyeva vasitvā sve gamissathā”ti
analyzed: tam pavattim ācikkhi sā ajja eka divasam vihāreya iva vasitvā sve gamissatha ati
translated: They told her what had happened. She said to them, “Remain in the monastery to-day. To-morrow we will go.”

original: āha. Therā vihāraṃ agamaṃsu.
analyzed: āha therāḥ vihāram
translated: The Elders went to the monastery.

original: Therī punadivase rukkhamūle piṇḍāya caritvā theraṃ upasaṅkamitvā “imaṃ piṇḍapātaṃ🔽paribhuñjathā”ti āha. Thero – “vaṭṭissati therī”ti vatvā tuṇhī aṭṭhāsi. Dhammiko🔽tāta piṇḍapāto, kukkuccaṃ akatvā paribhuñjathāti. “Vaṭṭissati therī”ti. Sā pattaṃ🔽gahetvā ākāse khipi. Patto ākāse aṭṭhāsi. Thero – “sattatālamatte ṭhitampi bhikkhunibhattameva
analyzed: therī puna divase rukkha mūle piṇḍāya caritvā theram upasaṅkamitvā imam piṇḍapātam  paribhuñjatha ati āha theraḥ vaṭṭissati therī iti vatvā tuṇhī aṭṭhāsi dhammiko  tāta piṇḍapāto kukkuccam a katvā paribhuñjatha ati vaṭṭissati therī iti sā pattam  gahetvā ākāse patto ākāse aṭṭhāsi thero satta tāla matte ṭhitam pi bhikkhu nibhattam eva
translated: The Elder Nun went for alms in the village the next day, and after she had gone for alms, she approached the Elder and said, “Eat this alms food.”🔽The Elder said, “It will be all right, Nun,” and he stood there in silence. “Father, this alms food is in accordance with the Dhamma;🔽eat it without misgiving.” “It will be all right, Nun.” She took the bowl and threw it up into the air. The bowl remained suspended in the air. The Elder said, “The bowl of a nun remains suspended in the air at a height of seven tāla trees.🔽

original: therī”ti vatvā – “bhayaṃ nāma sabbakālaṃ na hoti, bhaye vūpasante ariyavaṃsaṃ kathayamāno,🔽‘bho piṇḍapātika, bhikkhunibhattaṃ bhuñjitvā vītināmayitthā’ti cittena anuvadiyamāno🔽santhambhetuṃ na sakkhissāmi, appamattā hotha theriyo”ti maggaṃ āruhi.🔽Rukkhadevatāpi – “sace thero theriyā hatthato piṇḍapātaṃ paribhuñjissati, na naṃ
analyzed: therī iti vatvā bhayam nāma sabbakālam na hoti bhaye vūpasante ariya vaṃsam kathayamānaḥ 🔽bho piṇḍapātika bhikkhunibhattam bhuñjitvā vītināmayittha ati cittena anuvadiyamānaḥ 🔽santhambhetum na sakkhissāmi appamattāḥ hotha theriyāḥ ti maggaṃ āruhi 🔽rukkha devatā api sace theraḥ theriyāḥ hatthataḥ piṇḍapātam paribhuñjissati na nam
translated: The Elder Nun went her round for alms the next day, and coming to the Elder, said, “Eat this alms-food, Reverend Sir.” The Elder said, “It will be all right, Nun,” and remained silent. “Reverend Sir, this alms-food is pure; do not hesitate, but eat it.” “It will be all right, Nun.” The Elder Nun took the bowl and threw it into the air. The bowl remained suspended in the air. The Elder said, “The alms-food of a nun, even though it be suspended in the air at the height of seven palm-trees, is still impure.” “Fear is not always present, Reverend Sir; when fear is absent, I shall be able to recite the Noble Lineage. If I am reproved by the thought, ‘You have eaten the alms-food of a nun and have passed the night,’ I shall be unable to stand erect. Be careful, Reverend Sir.” So saying, he mounted the road. The deity of the tree thought to herself, “If the Elder eats the alms-food from the hand of the Elder Nun, he will die.

original: nivattessāmi. Sace na paribhuñjissati, nivattessāmī”ti cintayamānā ṭhatvā therassa
analyzed: nivattessāmi sace na paribhuñjissati nivattessāmi iti cintayamānā ṭhatvā therassa
translated: I will turn back. If she does not eat, I will turn back.” Thinking thus, she stood there.

original: gamanaṃ disvā rukkhā oruyha pattaṃ, bhante, dethāti pattaṃ gahetvā theraṃ rukkhamūlaṃyeva🔽ānetvā āsanaṃ paññapetvā piṇḍapātaṃ datvā katabhattakiccaṃ paṭiññaṃ kāretvā dvādasa
analyzed: gamanam disvā rukkhā oruyha pattam bhante detha iti pattam gahetvā theram rukkha mūlaṃ yeva  ānetvā āsanam paññapetvā piṇḍapātam datvā kata bhatta kiccam paṭiññam kāretvā dvādasa
translated: Seeing the Elder’s approach, she descended from the tree, took the bowl, and said, “Venerable sir, give me the bowl.” She brought the Elder to the foot of the tree,

original: bhikkhuniyo dvādasa bhikkhū ca sattavassāni upaṭṭhahi. Idaṃ – “devatā ussukkaṃ āpajjantī”ti
analyzed: bhikkhuniyaḥ dvādasa bhikkhū ca satta vassāni upaṭṭhahi idam devatāḥ ussukkam āpajjanti iti
translated: prepared a seat, gave him alms, and when he had finished his meal, she had him promise to return. She looked after twelve bhikkhunīs and twelve bhikkhus for seven years. This is the incident referred to by the stanza.

original: ettha vatthu. Tatra hi therī sāraṇīyadhammapūrikā ahosi.
analyzed: ettha vatthu tatra hi therī sāraṇīya dhamma pūrikā ahosi
translated: For here the Elder Nun was one who fulfilled the state of being a comforter.

original: Akhaṇḍānītiādīsu yassa sattasu āpattikkhandhesu ādimhi vā ante vā sikkhāpadaṃ bhinnaṃ🔽hoti, tassa sīlaṃ pariyante chinnasāṭako viya khaṇḍaṃ nāma. Yassa pana vemajjhe bhinnaṃ,
analyzed: akhaṇḍāni iti ādīsu yassa sattasu āpatti kkhandhesu ādimhi vā ante vā sikkhāpadam bhinnam  hoti tassa sīlam chinna sāṭakaḥ viya khaṇḍam nāma yassa pana vemajjhe bhinnam
translated: In the passage beginning “Unbroken, etc.,” the virtue of one who has broken a training precept at the beginning or the end of the seven classes of offenses is called “broken,”🔽like a cloth that is torn at the edge. But that of one who has broken it in the middle is called “holed,”

original: tassa majjhe chiddasāṭako viya chiddaṃ nāma hoti. Yassa pana paṭipāṭiyā dve tīṇi
analyzed: tassa majjhe chidda sāṭakaḥ viya chiddam nāma hoti yassa pana paṭipāṭiyā dve tīṇi
translated: like a cloth that is torn in the middle. That of one who has broken it in two or three places

original: bhinnāni, tassa piṭṭhiyaṃ vā kucchiyaṃ vā uṭṭhitena visabhāgavaṇṇena kāḷarattādīnaṃ
analyzed: bhinnāni tassa piṭṭhiyam vā kucchiyam vā uṭṭhitena visa bhāga vaṇṇena kāḷaratta ādīnam
translated: When the parts are broken up, it is like a cow with a mottle of different colours such as black, red, etc., on its back or belly. This is called “streaky.”

original: aññataravaṇṇā gāvī viya sabalaṃ nāma hoti. Yassa pana antarantarā visabhāgabinducitrā🔽gāvī viya kammāsaṃ nāma hoti. Yassa pana sabbenasabbaṃ abhinnāni, tassa tāni sīlāni
analyzed: aññatara vaṇṇā gāvī viya sabalam nāma hoti yassa pana antarantarā visabhāga bindu citrā  gāvī viya kammāsam nāma hoti yassa pana sabbena sabbam abhinnāni tassa tāni sīlāni
translated: When it is like a cow with a pattern of different coloured spots, this is called “marbled.”🔽But when all the parts are unbroken, these virtues are called “unbroken,” “unpunctured,” “unmarred,” and “unflecked.”

original: akhaṇḍāni acchiddāni asabalāni akammāsāni nāma honti. Tāni panetāni taṇhādāsabyato
analyzed: akhaṇḍāni acchiddāni a sabalāni a kammāsāni nāma honti tāni pana itāni
translated: These virtues are “masterful” because they make one a master by freeing him from the slavery of craving, etc.;

original: mocetvā bhujissabhāvakaraṇato bhujissāni. Buddhādīhi viññūhi pasatthattā viññupasatthāni,🔽taṇhādiṭṭhīhi aparāmaṭṭhattā – “idaṃ nāma tvaṃ āpannapubbo”ti kenaci parāmaṭṭhuṃ🔽asakkuṇeyyattā ca aparāmaṭṭhāni, upacārasamādhiṃ vā appanāsamādhiṃ vā saṃvattayantīti
analyzed: mocetvā bhujissa bhāva karaṇataḥ bhujissāni buddha ādīhi viññūhi pasattha ttā viññu pasatthāni  taṇhā diṭṭhīhi a parāmaṭṭha ttā idam nāma tvam āpanna pubbaḥ ti kenacid parāmaṭṭhum  a sakkuṇeyya ttā ca a parāmaṭṭhāni upacāra samādhim vā appanā samādhim vā saṃvattayanti iti
translated: they are “esteemed by the wise” because they are esteemed by the Buddhas, etc., who are the wise;🔽they are “unsullied” because they are unadhered to by craving, etc., and because they cannot be sullied by anyone with “You have broken this or that training rule”;

original: samādhisaṃvattanikānīti vuccanti.
analyzed: samādhi saṃvattanikāni iti vuccanti
translated: and they are called “conducive to concentration” because they lead to access concentration and absorption concentration.

original: Sīlasāmaññagatā viharissantīti tesu tesu disābhāgesu viharantehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ
analyzed: sīla sāmañña gatāḥ viharissanti iti tesu tesu disābhāgesu viharantehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ
translated: They will live in common with the virtue: they will live in common with the virtue of the bhikkhus who live in the various directions.

original: samānabhāvūpagatasīlā viharissanti. Sotāpannādīnañhi sīlaṃ samuddantarepi devalokepi
analyzed: samāna bhāva upagata sīlāḥ viharissanti sotāpanna ādīnam hi sīlam deva loke pi
translated: For the virtue of stream-enterers and so on is the same even when they are living in the various realms of the world of men and the world of the gods,

original: vasantānaṃ aññesaṃ sotāpannādīnaṃ sīlena samānameva hoti, natthi maggasīle nānattaṃ.
analyzed: vasantānam aññesam sotāpanna ādīnam sīlena samānam eva hoti natthi magga sīle nānattam
translated: and it is the same as the virtue of other stream-enterers and so on. There is no difference in the virtue of the paths.

original: Taṃ sandhāyetaṃ vuttaṃ.
analyzed: tam sandhāya itam vuttam
translated: It is with reference to this that it is said that they will live in common with the virtue.

original: Yāyaṃ diṭṭhīti maggasampayuttā sammādiṭṭhi. Ariyāti niddosā. Niyyātīti niyyānikā.🔽Takkarassāti yo tathākārī hoti. Sabbadukkhakkhayāyāti sabbadukkhakkhayatthaṃ. Diṭṭhisāmaññagatāti
analyzed: yā ayam diṭṭhī iti magga sampayuttā sammādiṭṭhi ariyā ati niddosā niyyāti iti niyyānikā  takkarassa ati yaḥ tathākārī hoti sabba dukkha kkhayāya ati sabba dukkha kkhaya ttham diṭṭhi sāmañña gatā ati
translated: This view: right view associated with the path. Noble: without danger. It leads out: it leads out of the suffering of the three worlds.

original: samānadiṭṭhibhāvaṃ upagatā hutvā viharissanti. Vuddhiyevāti evaṃ viharantānaṃ vuddhiyeva
analyzed: samāna diṭṭhi bhāvam upagatāḥ hutvā viharissanti vuddhiyā iva ati evam viharantānam vuddhiyā iva
translated: The one who practises in accordance with it: the one who acts in this way. To the destruction of all suffering: for the purpose of the destruction of all suffering. They will live in common with the view: they will live having approached the state of having the same view.

original: bhikkhūnaṃ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihānīti.
analyzed: bhikkhūnam pāṭikaṅkhā no parihāni iti
translated: Increase only: only increase is to be expected for the bhikkhus who live in this way, not decrease.

original: 142. Etadeva bahulanti āsannaparinibbānattā bhikkhu ovadanto punappunaṃ etaṃyeva
analyzed: etat eva bahulam ti āsanna parinibbāna ttā bhikkhu ovadantaḥ punappunam etaṃ yeva
translated: This is the most: the Exalted One, in order to exhort the bhikkhus, again and again said this,

original: dhammiṃ kathaṃ karoti. Iti sīlanti evaṃ sīlaṃ, ettakaṃ sīlaṃ. Ettha catupārisuddhisīlaṃ
analyzed: dhammim katham karoti iti evam sīlam ettakam sīlam ettha catu pārisuddhi sīlam
translated: He gives them a talk on Dhamma. Thus the virtue: thus the virtue is of this sort, this much virtue. Herein, virtue consisting of the four abstinences🔽is virtue. Concentration is unification of cognizance. Understanding is insight.

original: sīlaṃ cittekaggatā samādhi, vipassanāpaññā paññāti veditabbā. Sīlaparibhāvitoti ādīsu
analyzed: sīlam citta ekagga tā samādhi vipassanā paññā paññā ati veditabbā sīla paribhāvitaḥ ti ādīsu
translated: In the case of the words “Steadfast in the virtue, etc.,”

original: yasmiṃ sīle ṭhatvāva maggasamādhiṃ phalasamādhiṃ nibbattenti. Eso tena sīlena paribhāvito🔽mahapphalo hoti, mahānisaṃso. Yamhi samādhimhi ṭhatvā maggapaññaṃ phalapaññaṃ nibbattenti,🔽sā tena samādhinā paribhāvitā mahapphalā hoti, mahānisaṃsā. Yāya paññāya ṭhatvā maggacittaṃ
analyzed: yasmin sīle ṭhatvā ava magga samādhim phala samādhim nibbattenti esaḥ tena sīlena paribhāvito  mahapphalaḥ hoti mahā nisaṃsaḥ yamhi samādhimhi ṭhatvā magga paññam phala paññam nibbattenti  sā tena samādhinā paribhāvitā mahapphalā hoti mahā nisaṃsā yāya paññāya ṭhatvā magga cittam
translated: it is the virtue in virtue of which they produce concentration of the path and concentration of fruition that is “steadied by that virtue.”🔽It is “great in fruit, great in profit.” It is the concentration in concentration of the path and concentration of fruition in virtue of which they produce understanding of the path and understanding of fruition that is “steadied by that concentration.”🔽It is “great in fruit, great in profit.” It is the understanding in virtue of which they produce cognizance of the path and cognizance of fruition that is “steadied by that understanding.”

original: phalacittaṃ nibbattenti, taṃ tāya paribhāvitaṃ sammadeva āsavehi vimuccati.
analyzed: phala cittam nibbattenti tam tāya paribhāvitam sammat eva āsavehi vimuccati
translated: It is “great in fruit, great in profit.” It is the understanding in virtue of which they are quite freed from taints that is “quite freed by that understanding.”

original: Yathābhirantanti buddhānaṃ anabhiratiparitassitaṃ nāma natthi, yathāruci yathāajjhāsayanti
analyzed: buddhānam an abhirati paritassitam nāma natthi yathāruci yathā ajjhāsayanti
translated: As he likes: there is no dissatisfaction or anxiety in Buddhas, but what is meant is that it is according to his liking, according to his wish.

original: pana vuttaṃ hoti. Āyāmāti ehi yāma. “Ayāmā”tipi pāṭho, gacchāmāti attho. Ānandāti
analyzed: pana vuttam hoti āyāma ati ehi yāma ayāma atipi pāṭhaḥ gacchāma ati atthaḥ ānanda ati
translated: Let us go: come, let us go. The reading is also “Āyāmā” , the meaning being “Let us go.” Ānanda:

original: bhagavā santikāvacarattā theraṃ ālapati. Thero pana – “gaṇhathāvuso pattacīvarāni,
analyzed: bhagavā theram ālapati theraḥ pana gaṇhatha āvuso patta cīvarāni
translated: The Blessed One spoke to the Elder because he was near. But the Elder announced to the bhikkhus: “Friends, take your bowls and outer robes.

original: bhagavā asukaṭṭhānaṃ gantukāmo”ti bhikkhūnaṃ āroceti.
analyzed: bhagavā asuka ṭṭhānam gantu kāmo ti bhikkhūnam āroceti
translated: The Blessed One wishes to go to such and such a place.”

original: 144. Ambalaṭṭhikāgamanaṃ uttānameva. Atha kho āyasmā sāriputtotiādi sampasādanīye vitthāritaṃ.
analyzed: ambalaṭṭhikā gamanam uttānam eva atha kho āyasmā sāriputta iti ādi sampasādanīye vitthāritam
translated: The visit to Pāṭali Village is well known. Then the venerable Sāriputta … and so on as in the Sampasādanīya Sutta.

analyzed: dussīla ādīnava vaṇṇanā

analyzed: siyā saḥ sayam eva amhākam vasana ṭṭhānam sampattaḥ ajja bhagavantam āvasathe maṅgalam  vadāpessāma ati etad attham eva upasaṅkamantā tasmai evam āhaṃsu yena  te kira buddhāḥ nāma arañña ajjhāsayā arañña ārāmāḥ antogāme vasitum iccheyyum vā no  vāti bhagavataḥ manam a jānantāḥ āvasatha āgāram ap paṭijaggitvā avaḥ āgamaṃsu idāni bhagavataḥ
translated: “He may have come to our dwelling-place of his own accord. Today we will have the Fortunate One recite the blessing in the dwelling-place.”🔽For this reason they said this. To the dwelling-place:🔽they did not prepare the dwelling-place, not knowing the Fortunate One’s mind, thinking: “Buddhas are inclined to the wilderness, they delight in the wilderness, they may or may not wish to live in the village.” Now the Fortunate One, having gone for alms in Sāvatthī, after returning from the alms-round, after eating the meal, after leaving the dwelling-place,

original: manaṃ ñatvā puretaraṃ gantvā paṭijaggissāmāti yenāvasathāgāraṃ, tenupasaṅkamiṃsu.
analyzed: manam ñatvā puretaram gantvā paṭijaggissāma ati yena āvasatha āgāram tena upasaṅkamiṃsu
translated: He may have come to our dwelling-place of his own accord. Today we will ask the Blessed One to recite the auspicious verses in the dwelling-place.” That is why they said this. To the dwelling-place: they did not prepare the dwelling-place, it seems, not knowing whether the Blessed One would wish to live in the village or not, thinking: “Buddhas are inclined to the forest, they delight in the forest.” Now, knowing the Blessed One’s wish, they went first and prepared it, thinking: “We will go to the dwelling-place.”

original: Sabbasantharinti yathā sabbaṃ santhataṃ hoti, evaṃ santhariṃ.
analyzed: sabba santharin ti yathā sabbam santhatam hoti evam santharim
translated: . Spread out: spread out so that it was all covered.

original: 149. Dussīloti asīlo nissīlo. Sīlavipannoti vipannasīlo bhinnasaṃvaro. Pamādādhikaraṇanti pamādakāraṇā.
analyzed: dussīlaḥ ti asīlaḥ nissīlaḥ sīla vipannaḥ ti vipanna sīlaḥ bhinna saṃvaraḥ pamāda adhikaraṇanti pamāda kāraṇā
translated: Immoral: unvirtuous, without virtue. His virtue decayed: his virtue is decayed, his virtue is broken. On account of negligence: for the reason of negligence.

original: Idañca suttaṃ gahaṭṭhānaṃ vasena āgataṃ pabbajitānampi pana labbhateva. Gahaṭṭho
analyzed: idam ca suttam gaha ṭṭhānam vasena āgatam pabbajitānam pi pana labbhate iva gaha ṭṭho

original: hi yena yena sippaṭṭhānena jīvitaṃ kappeti – yadi kasiyā, yadi vaṇijjāya, pāṇātipātādivasena
analyzed: hi yena yena sippa ṭṭhānena jīvitam kappeti yadi kasiyā yadi vaṇijjāya pāṇa atipāta ādi vasena
translated: For if he is heedless in his livelihood by farming, trading, etc.,🔽he will not be able to maintain his life by that means of livelihood, and then his capital will be lost.

original: pamatto taṃ taṃ yathākālaṃ sampādetuṃ na sakkoti, athassa mūlampi vinassati. Māghātakāle
analyzed: pamattaḥ tam tam yathākālam sampādetum na sakkoti athassa mūlam pi vinassati māghāta kāle
translated: But if he is heedless in killing living beings, etc., at the time of the barley-harvest,

original: pāṇātipātaṃ pana adinnādānādīni ca karonto daṇḍavasena mahatiṃ bhogajāniṃ nigacchati.🔽Pabbajito dussīlo ca pamādakāraṇā sīlato buddhavacanato jhānato sattaariyadhanato
analyzed: pāṇa atipātam pana adinnādāna ādīni ca karontaḥ daṇḍa vasena mahatim bhoga jānim nigacchati  pabbajitaḥ dussīlaḥ ca pamāda kāraṇā sīlataḥ buddha vacanataḥ jhānataḥ satta ariya dhanataḥ
translated: he will incur a great loss of wealth by way of punishment.

original: ca jāniṃ nigacchati.
analyzed: ca jānim nigacchati
translated: And the unvirtuous monk, because of his heedlessness, loses his virtue, the Buddha’s word, jhāna, and the seven treasures of the ariyans.

original: salākabhattamattampi na detī”ti catuparisamajjhe pāpako kittisaddo abbhuggacchati.
analyzed: salāka bhatta mattam pi na deti iti catu parisamajjhe pāpakaḥ kitti saddaḥ abbhut gacchati
translated: who does not give even a morsel of food.”

original: Pabbajitassa vā – “asuko nāma nāsakkhi sīlaṃ rakkhituṃ, na buddhavacanaṃ uggahetuṃ,
analyzed: pabbajitassa vā asukaḥ nāma na asakkhi sīlam rakkhitum na buddha vacanam uggahetum

analyzed: vejja kamma ādīhi jīvati chahi agāravehi samannāgataḥ ti evam abbhut gacchati

analyzed: avisāradaḥ ti gahaṭṭho tāva avassam bahūnam sannipāta ṭṭhāne keci mama kammam jānissanti

original: atha maṃ niggaṇhissantī”ti vā, “rājakulassa vā dassantī”ti sabhayo upasaṅkamati,
analyzed: atha mam niggaṇhissanti iti vā rāja kulassa vā dassanti iti sabhayaḥ upasaṅkamati
translated: Then they will arrest me,” or “They will inform the king,” approaches with fear.

original: maṅkubhūto pattakkhandho adhomukho aṅgulikena bhūmiṃ kasanto nisīdati, visārado hutvā
analyzed: maṅku bhūtaḥ pattakkhandho adhomukhaḥ aṅgulikena bhūmim kasantaḥ nisīdati visāradaḥ hutvā
translated: He sits down with a troubled mind, shoulders drooping, head down, scratching the ground with his toe, unable to speak confidently.

original: kathetuṃ na sakkoti. Pabbajitopi – “bahū bhikkhū sannipatitā, avassaṃ koci mama kammaṃ
analyzed: kathetum na sakkoti pabbajitaḥ api bahū bhikkhū sannipatitāḥ avassam koci mama kammaṃ
translated: An ordained person, too, thinking “Many bhikkhus are assembled. Some will know my deed.

analyzed: jānissati atha me uposatham pi pavāraṇam pi ṭhapetvā sāmaññataḥ cāvetvā nikkaḍḍhissanti iti  sabhayaḥ upasaṅkamati visāradaḥ hutvā kathetum na sakkoti ekaccaḥ pana dussīlaḥ api dappito
translated: Then they will suspend me from the uposatha and the pavarana, and will expel me from the monkhood,”🔽approaches with fear. He is unable to speak confidently. But some, though unvirtuous, move about as if they were confident.

original: viya vicarati, sopi ajjhāsayena maṅku hotiyeva.
analyzed: viya vicarati saḥ api ajjhāsayena maṅku hotiyā iva
translated: But they are troubled in mind.

original: Sammūḷho kālaṅkarotīti tassa hi maraṇamañce nipannassa dussīlakamme samādāya pavattitaṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: sammūḷhaḥ kālaṅkaroti iti tassa hi maraṇa mañce nipannassa dussīla kamme samādāya pavattita ṭṭhānam
translated: “Dies confused” : for when he lies on his deathbed, he remembers the unvirtuous deeds he committed and the places where he committed them.

original: āpāthamāgacchati, so ummīletvā idhalokaṃ passati, nimīletvā paralokaṃ passati, tassa
analyzed: āpātham āgacchati saḥ ummīletvā idha lokam passati nimīletvā para lokam passati tassa

analyzed: vāretha ati viravantaḥ marati tena vuttam sammūḍhaḥ kālam karoti iti pañcama padam uttānam eva
translated: He dies crying out, “Stop, stop!” Hence it was said above, “He dies confused.” The fifth case is self-evident.

original: 150. Ānisaṃsakathā vuttavipariyāyena veditabbā.🔽151. Bahudeva rattiṃ dhammiyā kathāyāti aññāya pāḷimuttakāya dhammikathāya ceva āvasathānumodanāya🔽ca ākāsagaṅgaṃ otārento viya yojanappamāṇaṃ mahāmadhuṃ pīḷetvā madhupānaṃ pāyento
analyzed: ānisaṃsa kathā vutta vipariyāyena veditabbā  bahu deva rattim dhammiyā kathāya ati aññāya pāḷimuttakāya dhammi kathāya ca iva āvasatha anumodanāya  ca ākāsagaṅgam otārentaḥ viya yojana ppamāṇam mahā madhum pīḍetvā madhu pānam pāyentaḥ
translated: The explanation of the benefits should be understood in the opposite sense to the foregoing.🔽For a long time: for a long period, for a whole night. With talk on the Dhamma: with talk on the Dhamma that is good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, with its own meaning, with its own phrasing.

original: viya bahudeva rattiṃ sandassetvā sampahaṃsetvā uyyojesi. Abhikkantāti atikkantā khīṇā
analyzed: viya bahu deva rattim sandassetvā sampahaṃsetvā uyyojesi abhikkantā ati atikkantā khīṇā
translated: He instructed and gladdened them with talk on the Dhamma as one who was pouring a great vat of honey might fill a hundred pots with honey,🔽and then he dismissed them, saying, “Go, monks, it is getting late.”

original: khayavayaṃ upetā. Suññāgāranti pāṭiyekkaṃ suññāgāraṃ nāma natthi, tattheva pana ekapasse
analyzed: khaya vayam upetā suññāgāranti pāṭiyekkam suññāgāram nāma natthi tattha eva pana eka passe
translated: Gone beyond: gone beyond, passed beyond, gone to the end of, reached the end of. To an empty place: there is no such thing as an empty place by itself. But in a place where there are no people,

original: sāṇipākārena parikkhipitvā – “idha satthā vissamissatī”ti mañcakaṃ paññapesuṃ. Bhagavā
analyzed: sāṇi pākārena parikkhipitvā idha satthā vissamissati iti mañcakam paññapesum bhagavā
translated: and they had a couch prepared there, thinking: “Here the Teacher will rest.”

original: – “catūhipi iriyāpathehi paribhuttaṃ etesaṃ mahapphalaṃ bhavissatī”ti tattha sīhaseyyaṃ
analyzed: catūhi pi iriyāpathehi paribhuttam etesam mahapphalam bhavissati iti tattha sīhaseyyam
translated: The Blessed One thought: “If they use the four postures of bodily action here, it will be very fruitful for them,” and so he lay down there in the lion’s posture.

original: kappesi. Taṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ – “suññāgāraṃ pāvisī”ti.
analyzed: kappesi tam sandhāya vuttam suññāgāram pāvisi iti
translated: The words “he entered an empty building” refer to this.

original: Pāṭaliputtanagaramāpanavaṇṇanā
analyzed: pāṭaliputta nagara māpana vaṇṇanā
translated: The description of the founding of the city of Pāṭaliputta

translated: Sunidha and Vassakāra: two brahmins named Sunidha and Vassakāra. Great ministers of Magadha:

analyzed: sahassam sahassam hutvā vatthūni iti ghara vatthūni cittāni namanti nivesanāni mā āpetunti

analyzed: raññam ca rāja mahāmattānam ca nivesanāni māpetum vatthu vijjā pāṭhakānam cittāni namanti

analyzed: idha yakkha gāhaḥ idha bhūta gāhaḥ pāsāṇaḥ vā khāṇukaḥ vā atthi iti passanti te tadā

analyzed: sippam jappitvā devatāhi saddhim mantayamānāḥ viya māpenti athavā na īsam sarīre devatā

analyzed: adhimuccitvā tattha tattha nivesanāni māpetum cittam catūsu koṇesu khāṇuke  koṭṭetvā vatthumhi gahita matte paṭivigacchanti saddhānam kulānam saddhā devatā tathā
translated: possess their bodies and incline their thoughts to the building of palaces here and there. They, having driven in stakes in the four corners,

analyzed: karonti assaddhānam kulānam assaddhāḥ devatā ava kim kāraṇā saddhānam hi evam hoti

analyzed: atha mayam sīlavantānam dassanam dhamma katham pañhā vissajjanam anumodanañca sotum
translated: Then we shall be able to hear the virtuous ones’ preaching of the Dhamma, answering of questions, and expressions of appreciation,

analyzed: labhissāma manussāḥ dānam da tvā amhākam pattim dassanti iti
translated: and people will give gifts to us, showing us the merit.”

original: Tāvatiṃsehīti yathā hi ekasmiṃ kule ekaṃ paṇḍitamanussaṃ, ekasmiṃ vā vihāre ekaṃ
analyzed: tāvatiṃsehi iti yathā hi ekasmim kule ekam paṇḍita manussam ekasmin vā vihāre ekam
translated: “Among the Thirty-Three”: just as in a single family the wise man is pointed to and in a single monastery the learned bhikkhu is pointed to,

analyzed: bahussuta bhikkhum upādāya asuka kule manussā paṇḍitāḥ asuka vihāre bhikkhū bahu ssutā ti  saddaḥ abbhuggacchati evam eva sakkam devarājānam vissakammam ca devaputtam upādāya  tāvatiṃsā paṇḍitā ati saddaḥ abbhuggataḥ tena āha tāvatiṃsehi iti tāvatiṃsehi saddhiṃ
translated: and the report goes round that “in such and such a family there are wise men” and “in such and such a monastery the bhikkhus are learned,”

analyzed: mantetvā api viya māpenti iti attho  yāvatā ariyam āyatanam ti yattakam ariyaka manussānam osaraṇa ṭhānam nāma atthi yāvatā
translated: so too, the report went round that “the Thirty-Three are wise” because of Sakka Ruler of Gods and the divine youth Pañcasikha. Hence “among the Thirty-Three” is said. The meaning is that they sang as if they had consulted the Thirty-Three.🔽“As far as the noble region”: as far as there is a place of refuge for noble human beings.

original: vaṇippathoti yattakaṃ vāṇijānaṃ ābhatabhaṇḍassa rāsivaseneva kayavikkayaṭṭhānaṃ nāma,
analyzed: vaṇippatho ti yattakam vāṇijānam rāsi vasena iva kaya vikkaya ṭṭhānam nāma
translated: “As far as the market place”: as far as there is a place for the buying and selling of goods brought by traders,

original: vāṇijānaṃ vasanaṭṭhānaṃ vā atthi. Idaṃ agganagaranti tesaṃ ariyāyatanavaṇippathānaṃ
analyzed: vāṇijānam vasana ṭṭhānam vā atthi idam agga nagaram ti tesam ariya āyatana vaṇippathānam
translated: Or it is a place where merchants live. This will be the chief city, the best, the most excellent of all the noble cities and towns.

original: idaṃ agganagaraṃ jeṭṭhakaṃ pāmokkhaṃ bhavissatīti. Puṭabhedananti bhaṇḍapuṭabhedanaṭṭhānaṃ,🔽bhaṇḍabhaṇḍikānaṃ mocanaṭṭhānanti vuttaṃ hoti. Sakalajambudīpe aladdhabhaṇḍampi hi
analyzed: idam agga nagaram jeṭṭhakam pāmokkham bhavissati iti puṭabhedanam ti bhaṇḍa puṭabhedana ṭhānaṃ  bhaṇḍa bhaṇḍikānam mocana ṭṭhānan ti vuttam hoti sakala jambudīpe a laddha bhaṇḍam pi hi
translated: The place where the merchants will break open their bundles: it is a place where they will unload their goods,

original: idheva labhissanti, aññattha vikkayena agacchantampi ca idheva gamissati. Tasmā idheva
analyzed: idhā iva labhissanti aññattha vikkayena agacchantam pi ca idhā iva gamissati tasmai idhā iva
translated: where they will unload their wares. For even goods that have not been obtained in the whole of India will be obtained here. And those who come from other places to sell their wares will go back after selling them here. Therefore

original: puṭaṃ bhindissantīti attho. Catūsu hi dvāresu cattāri sabhāyaṃ ekanti evaṃ divase
analyzed: puṭam bhindissanti iti attho catūsu hi dvāresu cattāri sabhāyam ekam ti evam divase
translated: they will break open their bundles here. For every day in the four gates and in the city itself

original: divase pañcasatasahassāni uṭṭhahissantīti dasseti.
analyzed: divase pañca sata sahassāni uṭṭhahissanti iti dasseti
translated: five hundred thousand people will rise up.

original: Aggito vātiādīsu cakārattho vā-saddo. Agginā ca udakena ca mithubhedena ca nassissatīti
analyzed: aggitaḥ vā ati ādīsu cakāra atthaḥ vā saddaḥ agginā ca udakena ca mithu bhedena ca
translated: By fire, water, and the king’s men: the word vā has the sense of “or.” The meaning is: it will be destroyed by fire, water, and the king’s men.

original: attho. Ekakoṭṭhāso agginā nassissati, nibbāpetuṃ na sakkhissanti. Ekaṃ gaṅgā gahetvā
analyzed: attho eka koṭṭhāsaḥ agginā nassissati nibbāpetum na sakkhissanti ekam gaṅgā gahetvā
translated: One section will be destroyed by fire; they will not be able to extinguish it. The Ganges will carry off one section;

original: gamissati. Eko – “iminā akathitaṃ amussa, amunā akathitaṃ imassā”ti vadantānaṃ pisuṇavācānaṃ
analyzed: gamissati ekaḥ iminā a kathitam amussa amunā a kathitam imassa ati vadantānam pisuṇa vācānam
translated: One will perish by the slanderous speech of those who say, “This one did not say this, that one did not say that,” and who,

original: vasena bhinnānaṃ manussānaṃ aññamaññabhedeneva nassissatīti attho. Iti vatvā bhagavā
analyzed: vasena bhinnānam manussānam aññamañña bhedena iva nassissati iti attho iti vatvā bhagavā
translated: by the division of people through mutual slander, will perish by mutual division. Having said this, the Fortunate One

original: paccūsakāle gaṅgāya tīraṃ gantvā katamukhadhovano bhikkhācāravelaṃ āgamayamāno nisīdi.
analyzed: paccūsa kāle gaṅgāya tīram gantvā kata mukha dhovanaḥ bhikkhā cāra velam āgamayamānaḥ nisīdi
translated: went to the bank of the Ganges at dawn, and after washing his mouth as was his custom, he sat down to wait for the time of the alms-round.

original: 153. Sunidhavassakārāpi – “amhākaṃ rājā samaṇassa gotamassa upaṭṭhāko, so amhe pucchissati,
analyzed: amhākam rājā samaṇassa gotamassa upaṭṭhāko saḥ amhe pucchissati
translated: Sunīdha and Vassakāra thought: ‘Our King is a supporter of the ascetic Gotama, and he will ask us,

original: ‘satthā kira pāṭaligāmaṃ agamāsi, tassa santikaṃ upasaṅkamittha, na upasaṅkamitthā’ti.
analyzed: satthā kira pāṭaligāmam agamāsi tassa santikam upasaṅkamittha na upasaṅkamittha ati
translated: ‘The Teacher has come to Pāṭali Village, have you approached him, or have you not?’

original: Upasaṅkamimhāti ca vutte – ‘nimantayittha, na nimantayitthā’ti ca pucchissati. Na
analyzed: upasaṅkamimha ati ca vutte nimantayittha na nimantayittha ati ca pucchissati na
translated: And if we say, ‘We have approached him,’ he will ask, ‘Have you invited him to a meal, or have you not?’

original: nimantayimhāti ca vutte amhākaṃ dosaṃ āropetvā niggaṇhissati. Idaṃ cāpi mayaṃ āgataṭṭhāne
analyzed: nimantayimha iti ca vutte amhākam dosam āropetvā niggaṇhissati idam ca api mayam āgata ṭṭhāne
translated: And if we say, ‘We have not invited him,’ he will find fault with us and punish us. And this place we have come to

original: nagaraṃ māpema, samaṇassa kho pana gotamassa gatagataṭṭhāne kāḷakaṇṇisattā paṭikkamanti,
analyzed: nagaram māpema samaṇassa kho pana gotamassa gata gata ṭṭhāne kāḷakaṇṇi sattāḥ paṭikkamanti
translated: “Let us build a city. Wherever the recluse Gotama goes, black bees follow him.🔽We will have the city proclaimed as a festival in his honour.”

original: taṃ mayaṃ nagaramaṅgalaṃ vadāpessāmā”ti cintetvā satthāraṃ upasaṅkamitvā nimantayiṃsu.
analyzed: tam mayam nagara maṅgalam vadāpessāma iti cintetvā satthāram upasaṅkamitvā nimantayiṃsu
translated: So it was that they approached the Teacher and invited him.

original: Tasmā – “atha kho sunidhavassakārā”tiādi vuttaṃ.🔽Pubbaṇhasamayanti pubbaṇhakāle. Nivāsetvāti gāmappavesananīhārena nivāsanaṃ nivāsetvā
analyzed: tasmā atha kho sunidha vassaka arāti ādi vuttam  pubbaṇha samayam ti pubbaṇha kāle nivāsetvā ati gāma ppavesana nīhārena nivāsanam nivāsetvā
translated: “Then Sunīdha and Vassakāra” and so on is said.🔽In the morning time: in the morning. Having dressed: having put on the lower and upper robes for the purpose of entering the village.🔽Having taken up the carrying-pole: having taken up the carrying-pole that is fastened to the body.

original: kāyabandhanaṃ bandhitvā. Pattacīvaramādāyāti pattañca cīvarañca ādiyitvā kāyappaṭibaddhaṃ katvā.
analyzed: kāya bandhanam bandhitvā patta cīvaram ādāya ati pattam ca cīvaram ca ādiyitvā kāya ppaṭibaddham katvā
translated: Having taken bowl and robe: having taken the bowl and robe and fastened them to the body.

original: Sīlavantetthāti sīlavante ettha. Saññateti kāyavācāmanehi saññate.🔽Tāsaṃ dakkhiṇamādiyeti saṅghassa dinne cattāro paccaye tāsaṃ gharadevatānaṃ ādiseyya,
analyzed: sīlavantā itthā ati sīlavante ettha saññate iti kāya vācā manehi saññate  tāsam dakkhiṇam ādiyeti saṅghassa dinne cattāraḥ paccaye tāsam ghara devatānam ādiseyya
translated: The virtuous: the virtuous ones here. The restrained: restrained by body and speech.🔽To them: to those household deities.

original: pattiṃ dadeyya. Pūjitā pūjayantīti – “ime manussā amhākaṃ ñātakāpi na honti, evampi
analyzed: pattim dadeyya pūjitā pūjayantī iti ime manussāḥ amhākam ñātakā api na honti evam pi
translated: Having given to the Community, he should give to them. Having worshipped: “These people are not even our relatives.

original: no pattiṃ dentī”ti ārakkhaṃ susaṃvihitaṃ karothāti suṭṭhu ārakkhaṃ karonti. Mānitā🔽mānayantīti kālānukālaṃ balikammakaraṇena mānitā “ete manussā amhākaṃ ñātakāpi na
analyzed: no pattim denti iti ārakkham su saṃvihitam karotha ati suṭṭhu ārakkham karonti mānitā  mānayanti iti kāla anukālam bali kamma karaṇena mānitāḥ ete manussāḥ amhākam ñātakāḥ api na
translated: and do not give the reward.”

original: honti, catumāsachamāsantare no balikammaṃ karontī”ti mānenti, mānentiyo uppannaṃ parissayaṃ haranti.
analyzed: honti catu māsa cha māsa antare no bali kammam karonti iti mānenti mānentiyaḥ uppannam parissayam haranti
translated: They honour them and respect them: they honour them by making offerings to them from time to time, and they respect them by removing any affliction that may have arisen.🔽Then they rely on him: then they rely on that wise man.

original: Tato nanti tato naṃ paṇḍitajātikaṃ manussaṃ. Orasanti ure ṭhapetvā saṃvaḍḍhitaṃ,
analyzed: tatas nanti tatas nam paṇḍita jātikam manussam ure ṭhapetvā saṃvaḍḍhitam
translated: They cherish him: they cherish him as one who was born and reared at their breasts.

original: yathā mātā orasaṃ puttaṃ anukampati, uppannaparissayaharaṇatthameva tassa vāyamati,
analyzed: yathā mātā orasam puttam anukampati uppanna parissaya haraṇa attham eva tassa vā āyamati
translated: Just as a mother cherishes her child at her breast out of compassion, striving to remove any affliction that has arisen,

original: evaṃ anukampantīti attho. Bhadrāni passatīti sundarāni passati.
analyzed: evam anukampanti iti atthaḥ bhadrāni passati iti sundarāni passati
translated: so too they cherish him. They see what is good: they see what is beautiful.

original: 154. Uḷumpanti pāragamanatthāya āṇiyo koṭṭetvā kataṃ. Kullanti valliādīhi bandhitvā kataṃ.
analyzed: uḷumpanti pāra gamana atthāya āṇiyaḥ koṭṭetvā katam kullanti valli ādīhi bandhitvā katam
translated: A raft: a raft made by lashing together bamboos, etc., for the purpose of crossing over. A boat: a boat made by sewing together the skins of animals or the skins of reptiles with the intestines of cattle.

original: “Ye taranti aṇṇava”nti gāthāya aṇṇavanti sabbantimena paricchedena yojanamattaṃ gambhīrassa
analyzed: ye taranti aṇṇavanti gāthāya aṇṇavanti sabbantimena paricchedena yojana mattam gambhīrassa
translated: “Those who cross the ocean” : the ocean is a fathom-deep body of water bounded by the shore.

original: ca puthulassa ca udakaṭṭhānassetaṃ adhivacanaṃ. Saranti idha nadī adhippetā. Idaṃ
analyzed: ca puthulassa ca udakaṭṭhānassa etam adhivacanam saranti idha nadī adhippetā idam
translated: and the ocean is a term for the place where the water collects in a great pit. A river is intended here. This is

original: vuttaṃ hoti, ye gambhīravitthataṃ taṇhāsaraṃ taranti, te ariyamaggasaṅkhātaṃ setuṃ
analyzed: vuttam hoti ye gambhīra vitthatam taṇhā saram taranti te ariya magga saṅkhātam setum
translated: what is said: Those who cross over the deep and wide river of craving, having made a bridge consisting of the Noble Path,

original: katvāna. Visajja pallalāni anāmasitvā udakabharitāni ninnaṭṭhānāni. Ayaṃ pana idaṃ
analyzed: katvāna visajja pallalāni an āmasitvā udaka bharitāni ninna ṭṭhānāni ayam pana idam
translated: having abandoned the low-lying places filled with water, without taking them, this one

original: appamattakaṃ taritukāmopi kullañhi jano pabandhati. Buddhā ca buddhasāvakā ca vināyeva
analyzed: appamattakam taritu kāmaḥ api kullam hi janaḥ pabandhati buddhā ca buddha sāvakā ca
translated: though wishing to cross over this little, the people bind a raft. But the Buddhas and the Buddhas’ disciples, without a raft,

original: kullena tiṇṇā medhāvino janāti.
analyzed: kullena tiṇṇā medhāvinaḥ janāti
translated: the wise people have crossed.

original: Paṭhamabhāṇavāravaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: paṭhama bhāṇa vāra vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The first recitation section is finished.

original: Ariyasaccakathāvaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the “Discussion of the Noble Truths”

original: 155. Koṭigāmoti mahāpanādassa pāsādakoṭiyaṃ katagāmo. Ariyasaccānanti ariyabhāvakarānaṃ🔽saccānaṃ. Ananubodhāti abujjhanena ajānanena. Appaṭivedhāti appaṭivijjhanena. Sandhāvitanti
analyzed: koṭi gāmaḥ ti mahāpanādassa pāsāda koṭiyam kata gāmaḥ  saccānam an anubodhāti a bujjhanena a jānanena appaṭivedhāti appaṭivijjhanena sandhāvitanti
translated: Koṭigāma: the village built at the corner of the palace of the Great Treasurer. The Noble Truths: the truths that make for the Noble State.

original: bhavato bhavaṃ gamanavasena sandhāvitaṃ. Saṃsaritanti punappunaṃ gamanāgamanavasena
analyzed: bhavataḥ bhavam gamana vasena sandhāvitam punappunam gamana āgamana vasena
translated: Not understanding: through not waking up, through not knowing. Not penetrating: through not penetrating. Running: running through going from existence to existence. Wandering: through going and coming again and again.

original: saṃsaritaṃ. Mamañceva tumhākañcāti mayā ca tumhehi ca. Atha vā sandhāvitaṃ saṃsaritanti
analyzed: saṃsaritam mamañca iva tumhākañca ati mayā ca tumhehi ca atha vā sandhāvitam
translated: “Together with me and you” means with me and with you. Or alternatively, “having run and gone together” means having run and gone together.

original: sandhāvanaṃ saṃsaraṇaṃ mamañceva tumhākañca ahosīti emamettha attho veditabbo. Bhavanetti
analyzed: sandhāvanam saṃsaraṇam tumhākam ca ahosi iti atthaḥ veditabbaḥ
translated: “I and you”: either “me and you” or “me and you have been running and revolving.” Or else: “Running and revolving” means “running and revolving together.” The meaning here should be understood as follows: “There has been running and revolving together between me and you.”

original: samūhatāti bhavato bhavaṃ nayanasamatthā taṇhārajju suṭṭhu hatā chinnā appavattikatā.
analyzed: samūhata ati bhavataḥ bhavam nayana samatthā taṇhā rajju suṭṭhu hatā chinnā appavattika tā
translated: “The fetter that leads to future becomings”: the fetter of craving, which is capable of leading from becoming to becoming, has been well destroyed, cut off at the root, made like a palm stump, done away with so that it is no longer subject to future arising.

original: Anāvattidhammasambodhiparāyaṇavaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of “having reached the supreme state of sublime security from bondage” is finished.

original: 156. Nātikāti ekaṃ taḷākaṃ nissāya dvinnaṃ cūḷapitumahāpituputtānaṃ dve gāmā. Nātiketi ekasmiṃ ñātigāmake. Giñjakāvasatheti iṭṭhakāmaye āvasathe.
analyzed: nātikā ati ekam taḷākam nissāya dvinnam cūḷa pitu mahāpitu puttānam dve gāmā nātikā iti ekasmim ñāti gāmake giñjaka āvasatheti iṭṭha kāmaye āvasathe
translated: “Nātika”: there were two villages belonging to two brothers, the younger brother and the elder brother, near a single lotus pond. “Nātike”: in a single village of their relatives. “In the brick house”: in a house made of bricks.

original: 157. Orambhāgiyānanti heṭṭhābhāgiyānaṃ, kāmabhaveyeva paṭisandhiggāhāpakānanti attho.
analyzed: orambhāgiyānam ti heṭṭhābhāgiyānam paṭisandhi ggāhāpakānam ti attho
translated: “The lower fetters”: the fetters that are lower, the meaning is, that take rebirth only in the sense-desire becoming.

original: Oranti laddhanāmehi vā tīhi maggehi pahātabbānītipi orambhāgiyāni. Tattha kāmacchando,
analyzed: oranti laddha nāmehi vā tīhi maggehi orambhāgiyāni tattha kāmacchando
translated: “The lower” is also that which is to be abandoned by the three paths that have the name “lower.” Therein, sensual desire,

original: byāpādoti imāni dve samāpattiyā vā avikkhambhitāni, maggena vā asamucchinnāni nibbattavasena
analyzed: byāpādaḥ ti imāni dve samāpattiyā vā a vikkhambhitāni maggena vā a samucchinnāni nibbatta vasena
translated: These two, not being suppressed by attainment or eradicated by the path,

original: uddhaṃ bhāgaṃ rūpabhavañca arūpabhavañca gantuṃ na denti. Sakkāyadiṭṭhiādīni tīṇi
analyzed: bhāgam rūpa bhavam ca arūpa bhavam ca gantum na denti sakkāya diṭṭhi ādīni tīṇi
translated: do not allow the rebirth-linking to go up to the form and formless worlds. The three, namely, personality view, etc.,

original: tattha nibbattampi ānetvā puna idheva nibbattāpentīti sabbānipi orambhāgiyāneva.
analyzed: tattha nibbattam pi ānetvā punar idha iva nibbattāpenti iti sabbāni api orambhāgiyāni eva
translated: bring back the rebirth-linking that has gone there and make it be reborn here again. So all are only lower fetters.

original: Anāvattidhammāti paṭisandhivasena anāgamanasabhāvā.🔽Rāgadosamohānaṃ tanuttāti ettha kadāci karahaci uppattiyā ca, pariyuṭṭhānamandatāya
analyzed: an āvatti dhammā ati paṭisandhi vasena an āgamana sabhāvā  rāga dosa mohānam ettha kadāci karahaci uppattiyā ca pariyuṭṭhāna manda tāya
translated: “Not subject to further becoming”: not liable to come back by way of rebirth-linking.🔽“With the reduction of greed, hatred and delusion”: here the reduction should be understood as twofold, according to the reduction of occurrence and the reduction of obsession.

original: cāti dvedhāpi tanubhāvo veditabbo. Sakadāgāmissa hi puthujjanānaṃ viya abhiṇhaṃ rāgādayo
analyzed: ca ati dvedhā api tanu bhāvaḥ veditabbo sakadāgāmissa hi puthujjanānam viya rāga ādayaḥ
translated: For the once-returner’s greed, hatred and delusion do not occur frequently as do those of ordinary men,

original: nuppajjanti, kadāci karahaci uppajjanti. Uppajjamānā ca puthujjanānaṃ viya bahalabahalā
analyzed: na uppajjanti kadāci karahaci uppajjanti uppajjamānā ca puthujjanānam viya bahala bahalā
translated: but they occur now and then. And when they occur, they do not occur in the same strong form as in ordinary men,

original: nuppajjanti, makkhikāpattaṃ viya tanukatanukā uppajjanti. Dīghabhāṇakatipiṭakamahāsīvatthero
analyzed: na uppajjanti makkhikā pattam viya tanuka tanukāḥ uppajjanti dīghabhāṇaka tipiṭaka mahāsīva tthero
translated: but they occur in a mild form, like a gnat’s sting. The Elder Mahā-Siva, the Dīgha reciter and Tripiṭaka master,

original: panāha – “yasmā sakadāgāmissa puttadhītaro honti, orodhā ca honti, tasmā bahalā kilesā.🔽Idaṃ pana bhavatanukavasena kathita”nti. Taṃ aṭṭhakathāyaṃ – “sotāpannassa sattabhave
analyzed: pana āha yasmā sakadāgāmissa putta dhītaraḥ honti orodhā ca honti tasmā bahalā kilesā  idam pana bhava tanuka vasena kathitan ti tam aṭṭhakathāyam sotāpannassa satta bhave
translated: and he says this: “Because the son and daughter of the once-returner are still subject to the round of rebirths and because they are still subject to the round of rebirths, their defilements are still strong.🔽But this is said in terms of the thinning of the round of rebirths.” But this is contradicted in the commentary, which says: “For the stream-enterer there is no thinning of the round of rebirths except in the eighth existence.

original: ṭhapetvā aṭṭhame bhave bhavatanukaṃ natthi. Sakadāgāmissa dve bhave ṭhapetvā pañcasu
analyzed: ṭhapetvā aṭṭhame bhave bhava tanukam natthi sakadāgāmissa dve bhave ṭhapetvā pañcasu
translated: For the once-returner there is no thinning of the round of rebirths except in the five existences.

original: bhavesu bhavatanukaṃ natthi. Anāgāmissa rūpārūpabhave ṭhapetvā kāmabhave bhavatanukaṃ
analyzed: bhavesu bhava tanukam natthi anāgāmissa rūpa arūpa bhave ṭhapetvā kāma bhave bhava tanukam
translated: For the non-returner there is no thinning of the round of rebirths except in the sensual-sphere existence.

original: natthi. Khīṇāsavassa kismiñci bhave bhavatanukaṃ natthī”ti vuttattā paṭikkhittaṃ hoti.🔽Imaṃ lokanti imaṃ kāmāvacaralokaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ. Ayañcettha adhippāyo, sace hi🔽manussesu sakadāgāmiphalaṃ patto devesu nibbattitvā arahattaṃ sacchikaroti, iccetaṃ
analyzed: natthi khīṇāsavassa kismiñci bhave bhava tanukam natthi iti vutta ttā paṭikkhittam hoti  imam lokam ti imam kāmāvacara lokam sandhāya vuttam ayam ca ittha adhippāyaḥ sace hi  manussesu sakadāgāmi phalam pattaḥ devesu nibbattitvā arahattam sacchikaroti icca etam
translated: For the one whose cankers are destroyed there is no thinning of the round of rebirths anywhere.”🔽“This world” is said with reference to the sense-sphere world. The intention here is this: if one who has attained the fruit of once-returner among human beings is reborn among the gods and realizes arahatship, that is good.

original: kusalaṃ. Asakkonto pana avassaṃ manussalokaṃ āgantvā sacchikaroti. Devesu sakadāgāmiphalaṃ

analyzed: ca iva phala samāpatti vīriyena ca paṭipaṇāmetvā ati vikkhambhetvā jīvita saṅkhāranti
translated: and by the energy of fruition attainment. Having suppressed: having suppressed them. Life formation:

original: ettha jīvitampi jīvitasaṅkhāro. Yena jīvitaṃ saṅkhariyati chijjamānaṃ ghaṭetvā ṭhapiyati,🔽so phalasamāpattidhammopi jīvitasaṅkhāro. So idha adhippeto. Adhiṭṭhāyāti adhiṭṭhahitvā
analyzed: ettha jīvitam pi jīvita saṅkhāraḥ yena jīvitam saṅkhariyati chijjamānam ghaṭetvā  so phala samāpatti dhammaḥ api jīvita saṅkhāro saḥ idha adhippetaḥ adhiṭṭhāyāti adhiṭṭhahitvā
translated: Herein, life itself is the life formation. That by which life is formed, by which life is kept going when it is about to cease,🔽that is the life formation. That is intended here. Having resolved: having resolved,

analyzed: pavattetvā jīvita ṭṭhapana samattham phala samāpattim samāpajjeyyanti ayam ettha saṅkhepa tthaḥ

original: khaṇikasamāpatti. Khaṇikasamāpatti ca antosamāpattiyaṃyeva vedanaṃ vikkhambheti,🔽samāpattito vuṭṭhitamattassa kaṭṭhapātena vā kaṭhalapātena vā chinnasevālo viya udakaṃ
analyzed: khaṇika samāpatti khaṇika samāpatti ca anto samāpattiyam yeva vedanam vikkhambheti  samāpattitaḥ vuṭṭhita mattassa kaṭṭhapātena vā kaṭhala pātena vā chinna sevālo viya udakaṃ
translated: but that was momentary attainment. And momentary attainment suppresses only feeling in the attainment itself,

original: puna sarīraṃ vedanā ajjhottharati. Yā pana rūpasattakaṃ arūpasattakañca niggumbaṃ
analyzed: puna sarīram vedanāḥ ajjhottharati yā pana rūpa sattakam a rūpa sattakam ca niggumbam
translated: but as soon as he emerges from the attainment the feeling invades the body again like water a water-logged stump. But when he attains fruition attainment with life-continuum consciousness,

analyzed: nijjaṭam katvā mahāvipassanā vasena samāpannā samāpatti sā suṭṭhu vikkhambheti yathā

original: nāma purisena pokkharaṇiṃ ogāhetvā hatthehi ca pādehi ca suṭṭhu apabyūḷho sevālo
analyzed: nāma purisena pokkharaṇim ogāhetvā hatthehi ca pādehi ca suṭṭhu apabyūḷhaḥ sevālo

analyzed: dasa māse mā uppajjittha ati samāpattim samāpajji samāpatti vikkhambhitā vedanā
translated: and he entered upon and abided in the attainment, thinking “Do not arise for ten months.” The pain suppressed by the attainment

original: Gilānā vuṭṭhitoti gilāno hutvā puna vuṭṭhito. Madhurakajāto viyāti sañjātagarubhāvo

original: sañjātathaddhabhāvo sūle uttāsitapuriso viya. Na pakkhāyantīti nappakāsanti, nānākārato

translated: “Without making either external or internal” : without making either the ideas or the person either external or internal.

analyzed: ācariyamuṭṭhi nāma hoti dahara kāle kassaci a kathetvā pacchima kāle maraṇa mañce nipannā  piyamanāpassa antevāsikassa kathenti evam tathāgatassa idam mahallaka kāle pacchima ṭṭhāne
translated: when they lie down on their deathbed in their later years, without having taught anyone anything during their youth,

analyzed: kathessāmi iti muṭṭhim katvā pariharissāmi iti ṭhapitam kiñci natthi iti dasseti  aham bhikkhu saṅgham ti aham eva bhikkhu saṅgham pariharissāmi iti vā mamuddesikaḥ ti aham

analyzed: uddisitabba ṭṭhena uddesaḥ assa ati mamuddesikaḥ mam yā iva uddisitvā mama  bhikkhu saṅghaḥ hotu mama accayena vā mā ahesum yam vā tam vā hotu uti iti vā yassa

translated: The description of the discussion of the signless
