analyzed: pañcavidham veram na vaḍḍhati kusalo ca jahāti pāpakanti kusalaḥ pana ñāṇa sampannaḥ
translated: the five kinds of enmity do not increase. “ The skillful one abandons evil” : but the skillful one, endowed with knowledge,

original: ariyamaggena anavasesaṃ pāpakaṃ lāmakaṃ akusalaṃ jahāti. Rāgadosamohakkhayā sa nibbutoti🔽so imaṃ pāpakaṃ jahitvā rāgādīnaṃ khayā kilesanibbānena nibbutoti. Iti cundassa ca
analyzed: ariya maggena anavasesam pāpakam lāmakam akusalam jahāti rāga dosa moha kkhayā sa nibbutaḥ ti  so imam pāpakam jahitvā rāga ādīnam khayā kilesa nibbānena nibbutaḥ ti iti cundassa ca
translated: abandons evil, bad, unwholesome states without remainder by means of the Noble Path. “ He is quenched through the destruction of lust, hatred, and delusion” :

original: dakkhiṇaṃ, attano ca dakkhiṇeyyasampattiṃ sampassamāno udānaṃ udānesīti.
analyzed: dakkhiṇam attanaḥ ca dakkhiṇeyya sampattim sampassamānaḥ udānam udānesi iti
translated: having abandoned this evil, he is quenched through the destruction of lust, hatred, and delusion, through the extinction of defilements. Thus, seeing the gift of Cunda and his own worthiness of offerings, he uttered this exalted utterance.

original: Catutthabhāṇavāravaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: catuttha bhāṇa vāra vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the fourth recitation-section is finished.

original: Yamakasālāvaṇṇanā
translated: The Description of the Twin Miracle

original: 198. Mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhinti idha bhikkhūnaṃ gaṇanaparicchedo natthi. Veḷuvagāme
analyzed: mahatā bhikkhu saṅghena saddhinti idha bhikkhūnam gaṇana paricchedaḥ na atthi veḷuvagāme
translated: “Together with a great community of bhikkhus” : here there is no limit to the number of bhikkhus. In the village of Veḷuvana

original: vedanāvikkhambhanato paṭṭhāya hi – “na cirena bhagavā parinibbāyissatī”ti sutvā tato
analyzed: vedanā vikkhambhanato paṭṭhāya hi na cirena bhagavā parinibbāyissati iti sutvā tatas
translated: from the time of the suppression of the pain, having heard that “before long the Blessed One will attain final Nibbana,” from that

original: tato āgatesu bhikkhūsu ekabhikkhupi pakkanto nāma natthi. Tasmā gaṇanavītivatto saṅgho
analyzed: tatas āgatesu bhikkhūsu eka bhikkhu pi pakkantaḥ nāma na atthi tasmā gaṇana vītivattaḥ saṅghaḥ
translated: And when the monks came, there was not a single monk who had left. Therefore the Sangha was beyond counting.

original: ahosi. Upavattanaṃ mallānaṃ sālavananti yatheva hi kalambanadītīrato rājamātuvihāradvārena🔽thūpārāmaṃ gantabbaṃ hoti, evaṃ hiraññavatiyā pārimatīrato sālavanuyyānaṃ, yathā
analyzed: upavattanam mallānam yathā iva hi kalamba nadī tīrataḥ rāja mātu vihāra dvārena  thūpa ārāmam gantabbam hoti evam hiraññavatiyā pārima tīrataḥ sālavan uyyānam yathā
translated: The Mallans’ Sal Wood near Upavattana: just as one can go from the gate of the Queen’s Monastery across the Kalambā River to the Thūpārāma,🔽so one can go from the other side of the Hiraññavati River to the Sal Wood Park. Just as the Thūpārāma is to Anurādhapura,

original: anurādhapurassa thūpārāmo, evaṃ taṃ kusinārāyaṃ hoti. Yathā thūpārāmato dakkhiṇadvārena
analyzed: anurādhapurassa thūpārāmaḥ evam tat kusinārāyam hoti yathā thūpārāmataḥ dakkhiṇa dvārena
translated: so it was to Kusinārā. Just as the road from the Thūpārāma by the southern gate

original: nagaraṃ pavisanamaggo pācīnamukho gantvā uttarena nivatto, evaṃ uyyānato sālavanaṃ
analyzed: nagaram pavisana maggo pācīna mukhaḥ gantvā uttarena nivattaḥ evam uyyānataḥ sāla vanam
translated: to the city turns east and then north, so the road from the park to the Sal Wood

original: pācīnamukhaṃ gantvā uttarena nivattaṃ. Tasmā taṃ – “upavattana”nti vuccati. Antarena🔽yamakasālānaṃ uttarasīsakanti tassa kira mañcakassa ekā sālapanti sīsabhāge hoti,
analyzed: pācīna mukham gantvā uttarena nivattam tasmā tam upavattananti vuccati antarena  yamaka sālānam tassa kira mañcakassa ekā sāla panti sīsa bhāge hoti
translated: turns east and then north. That is why it is called “Upavattana.”🔽Between the twin sal trees, at the head: it is said that one of the sal tree trunks of that bed was at the head,

original: ekā pādabhāge. Tatrāpi eko taruṇasālo sīsabhāgassa āsanno hoti, eko pādabhāgassa.
analyzed: ekā pāda bhāge tatra api ekaḥ taruṇa sālaḥ sīsa bhāgassa āsannaḥ hoti ekaḥ pāda bhāgassa
translated: and one was at the foot. There too, one young sal tree was near the head, and one was near the foot.

original: Api ca yamakasālā nāma mūlakhandhaviṭapapattehi aññamaññaṃ saṃsibbitvā ṭhitasālāti
analyzed: api ca yamakasālā nāma mūla khandha viṭapa pattehi aññam aññam saṃsibbitvā ṭhita sālā ati
translated: The twin-sal-tree pavilion is a pavilion built by interlacing the roots, trunks, branches, and leaves of the twin sal trees.

original: vuttaṃ. Mañcakaṃ paññapehīti tasmiṃ kira uyyāne rājakulassa sayanamañco atthi, taṃ
analyzed: vuttam mañcakam paññapehi iti tasmim kira uyyāne rāja kulassa sayana mañcaḥ atthi tam
translated: “Make up a bed” : it seems that in that park there was a bed belonging to the royal family.

original: sandhāya paññapehīti āha. Theropi taṃyeva paññapetvā adāsi.
analyzed: sandhāya paññapehi iti āha theraḥ api taṃ yeva paññapetvā adāsi
translated: The Elder made it up and gave it to him.

original: Kilantosmi, ānanda, nipajjissāmīti tathāgatassa hi –
analyzed: kilantaḥ asmi ānanda nipajjissāmi iti tathāgatassa hi
translated: “I am tired, Ānanda, I will lie down” : for the Tathāgata

original: “Gocari kaḷāpo gaṅgeyyo, piṅgalo pabbateyyako;
analyzed: gocari kaḷāpaḥ gaṅgeyyaḥ piṅgalaḥ pabbateyyakaḥ
translated: “Gocari, Kaḷāpo, Gaṅgeyyo, Piṅgalo, Pabbateyyako,

original: Hemavato ca tambo ca, mandākini uposatho;
analyzed: hemavataḥ ca tambaḥ ca mandākini uposathaḥ
translated: Hemavato, Caṇḍo, Mandākini, Uposatho,

original: Chaddantoyeva dasamo, ete nāgānamuttamā”ti. –🔽Ettha yaṃ dasannaṃ gocarisaṅkhātānaṃ pakatihatthīnaṃ balaṃ, taṃ ekassa kaḷāpassāti.
analyzed: ete nāgānam uttamā ati  ettha yam dasannam gocari saṅkhātānam pakati hatthīnam balam tam ekassa kaḷāpassa ati
translated: Chaddanto, the tenth, these are the best of the elephants.”🔽Herein, the strength of ten ordinary elephants called “rangers” is the same as that of one Kaḷāpa elephant.

original: Evaṃ dasaguṇavaḍḍhitāya gaṇanāya pakatihatthīnaṃ koṭisahassabalappamāṇaṃ balaṃ, taṃ
analyzed: evam dasaguṇa vaḍḍhitāya gaṇanāya pakati hatthīnam koṭi sahassa bala ppamāṇam balam tam
translated: In this way, by the method of increasing tenfold, the strength of a hundred thousand ordinary elephants is the same as that of one Gaṅgeya elephant.

original: sabbampi cundassa piṇḍapātaṃ paribhuttakālato paṭṭhāya caṅgavāre pakkhittaudakaṃ
analyzed: sabbam pi cundassa piṇḍapātam paribhutta kālataḥ paṭṭhāya caṅgavāre pakkhitta odakam
translated: And all that strength is less than a sixteenth part of the strength of the elephant Cundaka.

original: viya parikkhayaṃ gataṃ. Pāvānagarato tīṇi gāvutāni kusinārānagaraṃ, etasmiṃ antare
analyzed: viya parikkhayam gatam pāvānagarataḥ tīṇi gāvutāni kusinārānagaram etasmin antare
translated: and it was as if it had been completely destroyed. Kusinārā was three leagues from Pāvā,🔽and although he had sat down to rest twenty-five times on the way, he had come with great effort.

original: pañcavīsatiyā ṭhānesu nisīditvā mahatā ussāhena āgacchantopi sūriyassa atthaṅgamitavelāyaṃ
analyzed: pañcavīsatiyāḥ ṭhānesu nisīditvā mahatā ussāhena āgacchantaḥ api sūriyassa atthaṅgamita velāyam
translated: But when the sun had set,

original: sañjhāsamaye bhagavā sālavanaṃ paviṭṭho. Evaṃ rogo sabbaṃ ārogyaṃ maddanto āgacchati.🔽Etamatthaṃ dassento viya sabbalokassa saṃvegakaraṃ vācaṃ bhāsanto – “kilantosmi,
analyzed: sañjhā samaye bhagavā sālavanam paviṭṭhaḥ evam rogaḥ sabbam ārogyam maddantaḥ āgacchati  etam attham dassentaḥ viya sabba lokassa saṃvega karam vācam bhāsantaḥ kilantaḥ asmi
translated: at the time of the first watch of the night, the Exalted One entered the Sāla Grove. Thus the disease, crushing all health, came on.

original: ānanda, nipajjissāmī”ti āha.
analyzed: ānanda nipajjissāmi iti āha
translated: As if showing this fact, he spoke these words, which were calculated to arouse the whole world, saying: “I am tired, Ānanda, I will lie down.”

original: Kasmā pana bhagavā evaṃ mahantena ussāhena idhāgato, kiṃ aññattha na sakkā parinibbāyitunti?
analyzed: kasmā pana bhagavā evam mahantena ussāhena idha āgataḥ kim aññattha na sakkā parinibbāyitunti
translated: But why did the Exalted One come here with such great effort? Was it not possible for him to attain final Nibbāna elsewhere?

original: Parinibbāyituṃ nāma na katthaci na sakkā, tīhi pana kāraṇehi idhāgato, idañhi bhagavā
analyzed: parinibbāyitum nāma na katthaci na sakkā tīhi pana kāraṇehi idhāgataḥ idam hi bhagavā
translated: It is not possible to attain final Nibbāna anywhere one likes. He came here for three reasons. For the Exalted One saw that

original: evaṃ passati – “mayi aññattha parinibbāyante mahāsudassanasuttassa atthuppatti na
analyzed: evam passati mayi aññattha parinibbāyante mahāsudassana suttassa atthuppatti na
translated: if he attained final Nibbāna elsewhere, the fulfilment of the meaning of the Mahāsudassana Sutta would be delayed.

original: bhavissati, kusinārāyaṃ pana parinibbāyante yamahaṃ devaloke anubhavitabbaṃ sampattiṃ
analyzed: bhavissati kusinārāyam pana parinibbāyante yam aham deva loke anubhavitabbam sampattim
translated: “When I attain extinction at Kusinārā, I shall enjoy the prosperity that I should have enjoyed in the deva world right here in the human world.

original: manussalokeyeva anubhaviṃ, taṃ dvīhi bhāṇavārehi maṇḍetvā desessāmi, taṃ me sutvā
analyzed: anubhavim tam dvīhi bhāṇavārehi maṇḍetvā desessāmi tam me sutvā
translated: I shall adorn it with two recitations and teach it. After hearing it,

original: bahū janā kusalaṃ kātabbaṃ maññissantī”ti.
analyzed: bahū janā kusalam kātabbam maññissanti iti
translated: many people will think that they should do good.”

original: Aparampi passati – “maṃ aññattha parinibbāyantaṃ subhaddo na passissati, so ca buddhaveneyyo,
analyzed: aparam pi passati mam aññattha parinibbāyantam subhaddaḥ na passissati saḥ ca buddha veneyyaḥ
translated: He sees yet another reason: “Subhadda will not see me attain extinction elsewhere. He is a person to be converted by the Buddha,

original: na sāvakaveneyyo; na taṃ sāvakā vinetuṃ sakkonti. Kusinārāyaṃ parinibbāyantaṃ pana🔽maṃ so upasaṅkamitvā pañhaṃ pucchissati, pañhāvissajjanapariyosāne ca saraṇesu patiṭṭhāya
analyzed: na sāvaka veneyyaḥ na tam sāvakāḥ vinetum sakkonti kusinārāyam parinibbāyantam pana  mam saḥ upasaṅkamitvā pañham pucchissati pañha vissajjana pariyosāne ca saraṇesu patiṭṭhāya
translated: not by a disciple. The disciples are not able to convert him. But when I attain extinction at Kusinārā,🔽he will approach me and ask a question. At the end of my answer to the question, he will go for refuge

original: mama santike pabbajjañca upasampadañca labhitvā kammaṭṭhānaṃ gahetvā mayi dharamāneyeva
analyzed: mama santike pabbajjam ca upasampadam ca labhitvā kammaṭṭhānam gahetvā mayi dharamāneya iva
translated: and receive the going forth and the full admission in my presence. He will take up a meditation subject and while I am still alive

original: arahattaṃ patvā pacchimasāvako bhavissatī”ti.
analyzed: arahattam patvā pacchimasāvakaḥ bhavissati iti
translated: he will attain perfection and become my last disciple.”

original: Aparampi passati – “mayi aññattha parinibbāyante dhātubhājanīye mahākalaho bhavissati,
analyzed: aparam pi passati mayi aññattha parinibbāyante dhātu bhājanīye mahā kalahaḥ bhavissati
translated: He sees yet another reason: “If I attain extinction elsewhere, there will be a great quarrel over the distribution of my relics,

original: lohitaṃ nadī viya sandissati. Kusinārāyaṃ parinibbute doṇabrāhmaṇo taṃ vivādaṃ vūpasametvā
analyzed: lohitam nadī viya sandissati kusinārāyam parinibbute doṇa brāhmaṇaḥ tam vivādam vūpasametvā
translated: and blood will be seen like a river. After the Buddha’s cremation, the brahmin Doṇa will settle the dispute.

original: dhātuyo vibhajissatī”ti. Imehi tīhi kāraṇehi bhagavā evaṃ mahantena ussāhena idhāgatoti veditabbo.
analyzed: dhātuyaḥ vibhajissati iti imehi tīhi kāraṇehi bhagavā evam mahantena ussāhena idha āgataḥ ti veditabbo
translated: Blood will be seen flowing like a river. When the Blessed One has attained final Nibbana in Kusinārā, the brahmin Dona will settle that dispute and distribute the relics.” For these three reasons the Blessed One came to this place with such great pomp.

original: Sīhaseyyanti ettha kāmabhogīseyyā, petaseyyā, sīhaseyyā, tathāgataseyyāti catasso seyyā.🔽Tattha – “yebhuyyena, bhikkhave, kāmabhogī sattā vāmena passena sentī”ti ayaṃ kāmabhogīseyyā. Tesu hi yebhuyyena dakkhiṇena passena sayantā nāma natthi.
analyzed: sīha seyyanti ettha kāmabhogī seyyā peta seyyā sīha seyyā tathāgata seyyā ati catasso seyyā  tattha yebhuyyena bhikkhave kāma bhogī sattāḥ vāmena passena senti iti ayam kāma bhogīseyyā tesu hi yebhuyyena dakkhiṇena passena sayantā nāma natthi
translated: Lion-like posture: there are four postures, namely, the posture of an enjoyer of pleasures, the posture of a ghost, the posture of a lion, and the Tathāgata’s posture.🔽Herein, the posture of an enjoyer of pleasures is this: “Bhikkhus, for the most part those who enjoy pleasures lie on their right side” . For they do not lie on their right side because they are free from lust.

original: “Yebhuyyena, bhikkhave, petā uttānā sentī”ti ayaṃ petaseyyā. Appamaṃsalohitattā hi petā aṭṭhisaṅghāṭajaṭitā ekena passena sayituṃ na sakkonti, uttānāva senti.
analyzed: yebhuyyena bhikkhave petāḥ uttānāḥ senti iti ayam petaseyyā appa maṃsa lohita ttāḥ hi petāḥ aṭṭhi saṅghāṭa jaṭitāḥ ekena passena sayitum na sakkonti uttānāḥ ava senti
translated: The posture of a ghost is this: “Bhikkhus, for the most part ghosts lie face downwards” . For ghosts are lean and their bones and joints are constricted, so they cannot lie on their stomachs.

original: “Sīho, bhikkhave, migarājā dakkhiṇena passena seyyaṃ kappeti…pe… attamano hotī”ti
analyzed: sīhaḥ bhikkhave miga rājā dakkhiṇena passena seyyam kappeti pe atta manaḥ hoti iti
translated: The posture of a lion is this: “Bhikkhus, a lion, king of beasts, lies on his right side to lie down, to sleep, to wake up, and to rise up. He is pleased with that posture, and he is confident in that posture” .

original: ayaṃ sīhaseyyā. Tejussadattā hi sīho migarājā dve purimapāde ekasmiṃ ṭhāne, pacchimapāde
analyzed: ayam sīhaseyyā tejussadattā hi sīhaḥ miga rājā dve purima pāde ekasmim ṭhāne pacchima pāde
translated: This is the lion’s posture. For the lion, king of beasts, puts his two front paws together in one place, and his two hind paws in another,

original: ekasmiṃ ṭhāne ṭhapetvā naṅguṭṭhaṃ antarasatthimhi pakkhipitvā purimapādapacchimapādanaṅguṭṭhānaṃ🔽ṭhitokāsaṃ sallakkhetvā dvinnaṃ purimapādānaṃ matthake sīsaṃ ṭhapetvā sayati. Divasaṃ🔽sayitvāpi pabujjhamāno na utrasanto pabujjhati, sīsaṃ pana ukkhipitvā purimapādādīnaṃ🔽ṭhitokāsaṃ sallakkheti. Sace kiñci ṭhānaṃ vijahitvā ṭhitaṃ hoti – “na yidaṃ tuyhaṃ
analyzed: ekasmin ṭhāne ṭhapetvā naṅguṭṭham antara satthimhi pakkhipitvā purima pāda pacchima pāda naṅguṭṭhānam  ṭhita ukāsam sat lakkhetvā dvinnam purima pādānam matthake sīsam ṭhapetvā sayati divasam  sayitvā api pabujjhamānaḥ na utrasantaḥ pabujjhati sīsam pana ukkhipitvā purima pāda ādīnam  ṭhita ukāsam sallakkheti sace kiñci ṭhānam vijahitvā ṭhitam hoti na tuyham
translated: and then he puts his tail between his thighs and puts his head on the place where his paws are and goes to sleep.🔽When he has slept during the day and wants to get up, he does not get up suddenly in a flurry,🔽but he lifts up his head and looks to see if there is room for his front paws, etc.,

original: jātiyā sūrabhāvassa ca anurūpa”nti anattamano hutvā tattheva sayati, na gocarāya🔽pakkamati. Avijahitvā ṭhite pana – “tuyhaṃ jātiyā ca sūrabhāvassa ca anurūpamida”nti
analyzed: jātiyā sūra bhāvassa ca hutvā tattha iva sayati na gocarāya  pakkamati a vijahitvā ṭhite pana tuyham jātiyā ca sūra bhāvassa ca anurūpam idanti
translated: and if he finds that any part is missing, he is not satisfied and he goes on lying there, not going out to hunt for food.

original: haṭṭhatuṭṭho uṭṭhāya sīhavijambhitaṃ vijambhitvā kesarabhāraṃ vidhunitvā tikkhattuṃ
analyzed: haṭṭha tuṭṭhaḥ uṭṭhāya sīha vijambhitam vijambhitvā kesara bhāram vidhunitvā tikkhattum
translated: But if he finds that all is there, he is pleased and satisfied, and he gets up. He yawns the lion’s yawn, shakes his tawny-coloured mane, and looks out in the four directions. Then he jumps down from the rock and stretches himself like a tawny lion.

original: sīhanādaṃ naditvā gocarāya pakkamati.
analyzed: sīha nādam naditvā gocarāya pakkamati
translated: he goes out to his resort, having roared his lion’s roar.

original: “Catutthajjhānaseyyā pana tathāgatassa seyyāti vuccati”. Tāsu idha sīhaseyyā āgatā. Ayañhi tejussadairiyāpathattā uttamaseyyā nāma.
analyzed: catuttha jhāna seyyā pana tathāgatassa seyyā ti vuccati tāsu idha sīha seyyā āgatā ayam hi tejussa dairiyā pathattā uttamaseyyā nāma
translated: “But the Blessed One’s lying-down in the fourth jhāna is called his ‘lying-down as a lion.’ Of these, the lying-down as a lion is intended here. For this is called the supreme lying-down since it is the state of having the appearance of fire.

original: Pāde pādanti dakkhiṇapāde vāmapādaṃ. Accādhāyāti atiādhāya, īsakaṃ atikkamma ṭhapetvā.
analyzed: pāde pādanti dakkhiṇa pāde vāma pādam accādhāya ati atiādhāya īsakam atikkamma ṭhapetvā
translated: He places the right foot on the left thigh: he places the right foot on the left thigh. Having bent the left leg: having bent the left leg,

original: Gopphakena hi gopphake, jāṇunā vā jāṇumhi saṅghaṭṭiyamāne abhiṇhaṃ vedanā uppajjati,
analyzed: gopphakena hi gopphake jāṇunā vā jāṇumhi saṅghaṭṭiyamāne abhiṇham vedanā uppajjati
translated: for if the ankle of the right foot or the knee of the left leg were to touch, then pain would arise frequently,

original: cittaṃ ekaggaṃ na hoti, seyyā aphāsukā hoti. Yathā pana na saṅghaṭṭeti, evaṃ atikkamma
analyzed: cittam ekaggam na hoti seyyā a phāsukā hoti yathā pana na saṅghaṭṭeti evam atikkamma
translated: the mind would not become concentrated, and the lying-down would be uncomfortable. But if it is placed so as not to touch,

original: ṭhapite vedanā nuppajjati, cittaṃ ekaggaṃ hoti, seyyā phāsu hoti. Tasmā evaṃ nipajji.
analyzed: ṭhapite vedanā nuppajjati cittam ekaggam hoti seyyā phāsu hoti tasmai evam nipajji
translated: then pain does not arise, the mind becomes concentrated, and the lying-down is comfortable. That is why he lies down in this way.

original: Anuṭṭhānaseyyaṃ upagatattā panettha – “uṭṭhānasaññaṃ manasi karitvā”ti na vuttaṃ.
analyzed: anuṭṭhānaseyyam upagata ttā pana ittha uṭṭhāna saññam manasi karitvā iti na vuttam
translated: But since he has gone to the lying-down of non-restraint, it is said: “Having directed his mind to the perception of non-restraint” .

original: Kāyavasena cettha anuṭṭhānaṃ veditabbaṃ, niddāvasena pana taṃ rattiṃ bhagavato bhavaṅgassa
analyzed: kāya vasena ca ittha anuṭṭhānam veditabbam niddā vasena pana tam rattim bhagavataḥ bhavaṅgassa
translated: Herein, the non-restraint should be understood as the non-restraint of sleep, but as the non-restraint of breathing,

original: okāsoyeva nāhosi. Paṭhamayāmasmiñhi mallānaṃ dhammadesanā ahosi, majjhimayāme subhaddassa
analyzed: okāsoya iva na ahosi paṭhama yāmasmin hi mallānam dhamma desanā ahosi majjhima yāme subhaddassa
translated: there was no opportunity. For in the first watch of the night there was the teaching of the Dhamma to the Mallas, in the middle watch

analyzed: pāramiyā pūritā tasmai na kho aham etāya pūjāya pūjitaḥ nāma homi iti  kasmai pana bhagavā aññattha ekam umā puppha mattam pi gahetvā buddha guṇe āvajjetvā katāya
translated: Therefore I am not to be worshipped with such worship.”

original: pūjāya buddhañāṇenāpi aparicchinnaṃ vipākaṃ vaṇṇetvā idha evaṃ mahantaṃ pūjaṃ paṭikkhipatīti?
analyzed: pūjāya buddha ñāṇena api aparicchinnam vipākam vaṇṇetvā idha evam mahantam pūjam paṭikkhipati iti
translated: Why did the Exalted One refuse such a great act of worship here, after extolling elsewhere the immeasurable results of an act of worship consisting of merely taking up a single flower of the umā flower and recollecting the virtues of the Buddha?

original: Parisānuggahena ceva sāsanassa ca ciraṭṭhitikāmatāya. Sace hi bhagavā evaṃ na paṭikkhipeyya,
analyzed: parisā anuggahena ca iva sāsanassa ca cira ṭṭhiti kāma tāya sace hi bhagavā evam na paṭikkhipeyya
translated: Out of compassion for his followers and out of a desire to make the Dispensation last long. If the Exalted One had not refused,

original: anāgate sīlassa āgataṭṭhāne sīlaṃ na paripūressanti, samādhissa āgataṭṭhāne samādhiṃ
analyzed: anāgate sīlassa āgata ṭṭhāne sīlam na paripūressanti samādhissa āgata ṭṭhāne samādhim
translated: in the future, in the place of virtue, they would not have fulfilled virtue; in the place of concentration, they would not have fulfilled concentration;

original: na paripūressanti, vipassanāya āgataṭṭhāne vipassanāgabbhaṃ na gāhāpessanti. Upaṭṭhāke🔽samādapetvā pūjaṃyeva kārentā viharissanti. Āmisapūjā ca nāmesā sāsanaṃ ekadivasampi
analyzed: na paripūressanti vipassanāya āgata ṭṭhāne vipassanā gabbham na gāhāpessanti upaṭṭhāke  samādapetvā pūjam yeva kārentāḥ viharissanti āmisa pūjā ca nāma īsā sāsanam eka divasampi
translated: They will not be fulfilled. They will not take up the meditation subject in the place where they have reached insight. They will live on,

original: ekayāgupānakālamattampi sandhāretuṃ na sakkoti. Mahāvihārasadisañhi vihārasahassaṃ
analyzed: eka yāgu pāna kāla mattam pi sandhāretum na sakkoti mahāvihāra sadisam hi vihāra sahassam
translated: persuading their supporters to make offerings. And this material offering cannot maintain the Dispensation even for a day or a morning or an evening. For a thousand monasteries like the Great Monastery

original: mahācetiyasadisañca cetiyasahassampi sāsanaṃ dhāretuṃ na sakkonti. Yena kammaṃ kataṃ,🔽tasseva hoti. Sammāpaṭipatti pana tathāgatassa anucchavikā pūjā. Sā hi tena patthitā
analyzed: mahā cetiya sadisam ca cetiya sahassam pi sāsanam dhāretum na sakkonti yena kammam katam  tassa iva hoti sammā paṭipatti pana tathāgatassa anucchavikā pūjā sā hi tena patthitā
translated: and a thousand Cetiyas like the Great Cetiya cannot maintain the Dispensation. It is only he who has done the work🔽that it is of use to. But right practice is a fitting offering to the Enlightened One. For that is what he desired,

original: ceva, sakkoti sāsanañca sandhāretuṃ, tasmā taṃ dassento yo kho ānandātiādimāha.
analyzed: ca iva sakkoti sāsanam ca sandhāretum tasmā tam dassentaḥ yaḥ kho ānanda iti ādim āha
translated: and it can maintain the Dispensation. Therefore, showing that, the Blessed One said: “And, Ananda, that which is the true path, the way to the cessation of suffering, that will I now point out to you. Listen and attend closely to what I shall say.”

original: Tattha dhammānudhammappaṭipannoti navavidhassa lokuttaradhammassa anudhammaṃ pubbabhāgapaṭipadaṃ
analyzed: tattha dhamma anudhamma ppaṭipanno ti navavidhassa lokuttara dhammassa anudhammam pubbabhāga paṭipadam
translated: Herein, he practices in conformity with the Dhamma means he practices the preliminary part of the path that is in conformity with the ninefold supramundane Dhamma .

original: paṭipanno. Sāyeva pana paṭipadā anucchavikattā “sāmīcī”ti vuccati. Taṃ sāmīciṃ paṭipannoti
analyzed: paṭipanno sāyā iva pana paṭipadā anucchavikattā sāmīcī iti vuccati tam sāmīcim paṭipanno ti
translated: But that practice itself is called “proper conduct” because it is fitting . He practices that proper conduct.

original: sāmīcippaṭipanno. Tameva pubbabhāgapaṭipadāsaṅkhātaṃ anudhammaṃ carati pūretīti anudhammacārī.
analyzed: sāmīci paṭipannaḥ tam eva pubbabhāga paṭipadā saṅkhātam anudhammam carati pūreti iti anudhamma cārī
translated: He is one who practices in conformity with the Dhamma.

original: Pubbabhāgapaṭipadāti ca sīlaṃ ācārapaññatti dhutaṅgasamādānaṃ yāva gotrabhuto sammāpaṭipadā
analyzed: pubbabhāga paṭipadā ati ca sīlam ācāra paññatti dhutaṅga samādānam yāva gotrabhuto sammā paṭipadā
translated: The “preliminary training” is the training in virtue, the training in the ways of behavior and deportment, and the undertaking of the ascetic practices, up to the right way of practice that is conducive to the destruction of the taints.

original: veditabbā. Tasmā yo bhikkhu chasu agāravesu patiṭṭhāya paññattiṃ atikkamati, anesanāya🔽jīvikaṃ kappeti, ayaṃ na dhammānudhammappaṭipanno. Yo pana sabbaṃ attano paññattaṃ
analyzed: veditabbā tasmā yaḥ bhikkhu chasu agāravesu patiṭṭhāya paññattim atikkamati an esanāya  jīvikam kappeti ayam na dhamma anudhamma ppaṭipannaḥ yaḥ pana sabbam attanaḥ paññattam
translated: Therefore, a bhikkhu who, having established himself in the six bases of contact, transgresses the rules of proper conduct,🔽and who makes a living by improper means, is not one who practices in conformity with the Dhamma. But one who does not transgress any of the rules of training that have been laid down for him,

original: sikkhāpadaṃ jinavelaṃ jinamariyādaṃ jinakāḷasuttaṃ aṇumattampi na vītikkamati, ayaṃ🔽dhammānudhammappaṭipanno nāma. Bhikkhuniyāpi eseva nayo. Yo upāsako pañca verāni
analyzed: sikkhāpadam jinavelam jinamariyādam jinakāḷa suttam aṇumattam pi na vītikkamati ayam  dhammānudhammappaṭipanno nāma bhikkhuniyā api esa iva nayaḥ yaḥ upāsako pañca verāni
translated: not even to the extent of a thread’s end, is one who practices in conformity with the Dhamma.

original: dasa akusalakammapathe samādāya vattati appeti, ayaṃ na dhammānudhammappaṭipanno.
analyzed: dasa akusala kamma pathe samādāya vattati appeti ayam na dhamma anudhamma ppaṭipanno
translated: The same method applies to the bhikkhunī. A lay follower who undertakes the five precepts and the ten training precepts, but who violates them, is not one who practices in conformity with the Dhamma.

original: Yo pana tīsu saraṇesu, pañcasupi sīlesu, dasasu sīlesu paripūrakārī hoti, māsassa
analyzed: yaḥ pana tīsu saraṇesu pañcasu pi sīlesu dasasu sīlesu paripūra kārī hoti māsassa
translated: But one who fulfills the three refuges, the five precepts, and the ten precepts, and who observes the uposatha and pavāraṇā ceremonies, is one who practices in conformity with the Dhamma.

original: aṭṭha uposathe karoti, dānaṃ deti, gandhapūjaṃ mālāpūjaṃ karoti, mātaraṃ pitaraṃ
analyzed: karoti dānam deti gandha pūjam mālā pūjam karoti mātaram pitaram
translated: He performs the eight Uposatha duties, he gives gifts, he makes offerings of perfumes and garlands, he tends mother and father,

original: upaṭṭhāti, dhammike samaṇabrāhmaṇe upaṭṭhāti, ayaṃ dhammānudhammappaṭipanno nāma.
analyzed: upaṭṭhāti dhammike samaṇa brāhmaṇe upaṭṭhāti ayam dhamma anudhamma paṭipannaḥ nāma
translated: he tends recluses and brahmans, he tends the sick, he tends the elders of the family. This is called one who practices in conformity with the Dhamma.

original: Upāsikāyapi eseva nayo.
analyzed: upāsikā ayapi e sā iva nayo
translated: The same method applies to a female lay follower.

original: Paramāya pūjāyāti uttamāya pūjāya. Ayañhi nirāmisapūjā nāma sakkoti mama sāsanaṃ
analyzed: paramāya pūjāya ati uttamāya pūjāya ayam hi nirāmisa pūjā nāma sakkoti mama sāsanam
translated: With the highest form of worship: with the best form of worship. For this is called worship that is not material. It is able to support my Dispensation.

original: sandhāretuṃ. Yāva hi imā catasso parisā maṃ imāya pūjessanti, tāva mama sāsanaṃ majjhe
analyzed: sandhāretum yāva hi imāḥ catassaḥ parisāḥ mam imāya pūjessanti tāva mama sāsanam majjhe
translated: For as long as these four assemblies worship me with this, for that long my Dispensation will shine

original: nabhassa puṇṇacando viya virocissatīti dasseti.
analyzed: nabhassa puṇṇa candaḥ viya virocissati iti dasseti
translated: like the full moon in the middle of the sky.

original: Upavāṇattheravaṇṇanā
analyzed: upavāṇatthera vaṇṇanā
translated: The Story of the Elder Upavāṇa

original: 200. Apasāresīti apanesi. Apehīti apagaccha. Thero ekavacaneneva tālavaṇṭaṃ nikkhipitvā
analyzed: apasāresi iti apanesi apehi iti apagaccha theraḥ eka vacanena iva tāla vaṇṭam nikkhipitvā
translated: He dismissed: he sent away. Go away: depart. The elder, after placing the palm-leaf fan to one side with a single word,

original: ekamantaṃ aṭṭhāsi. Upaṭṭhākotiādi paṭhamabodhiyaṃ anibaddhupaṭṭhākabhāvaṃ sandhāyāha.
analyzed: eka mantam aṭṭhāsi upaṭṭhāka iti ādi anibaddha upaṭṭhāka bhāvam sandhāya āha
translated: stood at one side. The attendant: the elder said this referring to the fact that he was not a regular attendant at the first Enlightenment Tree.

original: Ayaṃ, bhante, āyasmā upavāṇoti evaṃ therena vutte ānando upavāṇassa sadosabhāvaṃ
analyzed: ayam bhante āyasmai upavāṇo ti evam therena vutte ānandaḥ upavāṇassa sa dosa bhāvam
translated: “Venerable Sir, this venerable Upavāṇa” — when the elder said this, Ānanda thought: “Upavāṇa has a fault.

original: sallakkheti, ‘handassa niddosabhāvaṃ kathessāmī’ti bhagavā yebhuyyena ānandātiādimāha.🔽Tattha yebhuyyenāti idaṃ asaññasattānañceva arūpadevatānañca ohīnabhāvaṃ sandhāya
analyzed: sallakkhā iti handassa niddosa bhāvam kathessāmi iti bhagavā yebhuyyena ānanda ati ādim āha  tattha yebhuyyena ati idam asañña sattānam ca iva arūpa devatānam ca ohīna bhāvam sandhāya
translated: He reflected, “I will tell him how to get rid of the trouble.” So he said, “For the most part, Ānanda … ”🔽Herein, for the most part is said

original: vuttaṃ. Apphuṭoti asamphuṭṭho abharito vā. Bhagavato kira āsannapadese vālaggamatte
analyzed: vuttam apphuṭaḥ ti a samphuṭṭhaḥ a bharitaḥ vā bhagavataḥ kira āsanna padese vā ālagga matte
translated: with reference to the inferiority of the non-percipient beings and the immaterial deities. Uncrowded means uncrowded or unfilled. For the Blessed One, it seems, had made room for himself the size of a single thread-line in a space near him,

original: okāse sukhumattabhāvaṃ māpetvā dasa dasa mahesakkhā devatā aṭṭhaṃsu. Tāsaṃ parato
analyzed: okāse sukhumatta bhāvam māpetvā dasa dasa mahesakkhāḥ devatāḥ aṭṭhaṃsu tāsam paratas
translated: and ten very powerful deities stood there. Behind them twenty each,

original: vīsati vīsati. Tāsaṃ parato tiṃsati tiṃsati. Tāsaṃ parato cattālīsaṃ cattālīsaṃ.
analyzed: vīsati vīsati tāsam paratas tiṃsati tiṃsati tāsam paratas cattālīsam cattālīsam
translated: behind them thirty each, behind them forty each,

original: Tāsaṃ parato paññāsaṃ paññāsaṃ. Tāsaṃ parato saṭṭhi saṭṭhi devatā aṭṭhaṃsu. Tā aññamaññaṃ
analyzed: tāsam paratas paññāsam paññāsam tāsam paratas saṭṭhi saṭṭhi devatāḥ aṭṭhaṃsu tāḥ aññamaññam
translated: behind them fifty each, behind them sixty deities stood. They did not obstruct one another

original: hatthena vā pādena vā vatthena vā na byābādhenti. “Apehi maṃ, mā ghaṭṭehī”ti vattabbākāraṃ
analyzed: hatthena vā pādena vā vatthena vā na byābādhenti apehi mam mā ghaṭṭehi iti vattabba ākāram
translated: with their hands or feet or garments. There was no need for them to say, “Go away, do not touch me.”

original: nāma natthi. “Tā kho pana devatāyo dasapi hutvā vīsatipi hutvā tiṃsampi hutvā cattālīsampi
analyzed: nāma natthi tāḥ kho pana devatāyaḥ dasa pi hutvā vīsati pi hutvā tiṃsam pi hutvā cattālīsam pi
translated: Ten of them, twenty of them, thirty of them, forty of them,

original: hutvā paññāsampi hutvā āraggakoṭinitudanamattepi tiṭṭhanti, na ca aññamaññaṃ byābādhentī”ti
analyzed: hutvā paññāsam pi hutvā āragga koṭi nitudana matte pi tiṭṭhanti na ca aññam aññam byābādhenti iti
translated: and they stood in a space the size of a hundred or a thousand leagues without crowding each other.”🔽They were just like the monks who had been described.

original: vuttasadisāva ahesuṃ. Ovārentoti āvārento. Thero kira pakatiyāpi mahāsarīro hatthipotakasadiso.
analyzed: vutta sadisā ava ahesuṃ ovārento ti āvārento theraḥ kira pakatiyā api mahā sarīraḥ hatthi potaka sadisaḥ
translated: “He was covering” means he was covering. The Elder was naturally of a large body, like a young elephant.

original: So paṃsukūlacīvaraṃ pārupitvā atimahā viya ahosi.
analyzed: saḥ paṃsukūla cīvaram atimahāḥ viya ahosi
translated: He was even more so when he put on the rag-robe.

original: Tathāgataṃ dassanāyāti bhagavato mukhaṃ daṭṭhuṃ alabhamānā evaṃ ujjhāyiṃsu. Kiṃ pana🔽tā theraṃ vinivijjha passituṃ na sakkontīti? Āma, na sakkonti. Devatā hi puthujjane
analyzed: tathāgatam dassanāya ati bhagavataḥ mukham daṭṭhum a labhamānāḥ evam ujjhāyiṃsu kim pana  tāḥ theram vinivijjha passitum na sakkonti iti āma na sakkonti devatāḥ hi puthujjane
translated: “To see the Tathāgata”: they were not able to see the face of the Blessed One, and so they complained in this way. But why🔽were they not able to see the Elder after penetrating him?🔽Yes, they were not able. For deities are able to see ordinary people after penetrating them, but not those whose cankers are destroyed.

original: vinivijjha passituṃ sakkonti, na khīṇāsave. Therassa ca mahesakkhatāya tejussadatāya
analyzed: vinivijjha passitum sakkonti na khīṇāsave therassa ca mahesakkha tāya tejussada tāya
translated: And because the Elder was of great dignity and had a great deal of splendor,

original: upagantumpi na sakkonti. Kasmā pana therova tejussado, na aññe arahantoti? Yasmā
analyzed: upagantum pi na sakkonti kasmā pana theraḥ uva tejussadaḥ na aññe arahanto ti yasmā
translated: they were not able to approach him. But why was the Elder alone of great splendor, and not the other arahats?

original: kassapabuddhassa cetiye ārakkhadevatā ahosi.
analyzed: kassapa buddhassa cetiye ārakkha devatā ahosi
translated: Because he was a deity who guarded the shrine of the Buddha Kassapa.

original: Vipassimhi kira sammāsambuddhe parinibbute ekagghanasuvaṇṇakkhandhasadisassa dhātusarīrassa🔽ekameva cetiyaṃ akaṃsu, dīghāyukabuddhānañhi ekameva cetiyaṃ hoti. Taṃ manussā ratanāyāmāhi
analyzed: vipassimhi kira sammāsambuddhe parinibbute eka ghana suvaṇṇa kkhandha sadisassa dhātu sarīrassa  ekam eva cetiyam dīgha āyuka buddhānam hi ekam eva cetiyam hoti tam manussāḥ
translated: When the Fully Enlightened Vipassī had finally passed away, they erected a single monument for his bodily relics, which were like a mass of pure gold.

original: vidatthivitthatāhi dvaṅgulabahalāhi suvaṇṇiṭṭhakāhi haritālena ca manosilāya ca mattikākiccaṃ
analyzed: vidatthi vitthatāhi dvaṅgula bahalāhi suvaṇṇiṭṭhakāhi haritālena ca manosilāya ca mattikā kiccam
translated: For the bodily relics of Buddhas who live long are enshrined in a single monument. Men, using gold plates a span in width and a finger in thickness, and also harīṭaka leaves, and also precious stones, and also clay mixed with the essence of harīṭaka oil,

original: tilateleneva udakakiccaṃ sādhetvā yojanappamāṇaṃ uṭṭhapesuṃ. Tato bhummā devatā yojanappamāṇaṃ,🔽tato ākāsaṭṭhakadevatā, tato uṇhavalāhakadevatā, tato abbhavalāhakadevatā, tato cātumahārājikā
analyzed: tila telena iva udaka kiccam sādhetvā yojana ppamāṇam uṭṭhapesum tatas bhummāḥ devatāḥ yojana ppamāṇam  tatas ākāsaṭṭhaka devatā tatas uṇha valāhaka devatā tatas abbha valāhaka devatā tatas cātumahārājikā
translated: and also water mixed with the essence of harīṭaka oil, built up the monument to the height of a league. Then the earth deities built up a monument to the height of a league,

original: devatā, tato tāvatiṃsā devatā yojanappamāṇaṃ uṭṭhapesunti evaṃ sattayojanikaṃ cetiyaṃ
analyzed: devatā tatas tāvatiṃsāḥ devatāḥ yojana ppamāṇam uṭṭhapesunti evam satta yojanikam cetiyam
translated: then the deities of the sky, then the deities of the hot springs, then the deities of the rain-pools, then the deities of the Four Kings’ heaven, then the deities of the Tāvatiṃsa heaven, and so the monument was built up to a height of seven leagues.

original: ahosi. Manussesu mālāgandhavatthādīni gahetvā āgatesu ārakkhadevatā gahetvā tesaṃ🔽passantānaṃyeva cetiyaṃ pūjesi.
analyzed: ahosi manussesu mālā gandha vattha ādīni gahetvā āgatesu ārakkha devatāḥ gahetvā tesam 🔽passantānam yeva cetiyam pūjesi
translated: When men came bringing garlands, perfumes, etc., the protective deities took them and worshipped the monument in the presence of the men themselves.

original: Tadā ayaṃ thero brāhmaṇamahāsālo hutvā ekaṃ pītakaṃ vatthaṃ ādāya gato. Devatā tassa🔽hatthato vatthaṃ gahetvā cetiyaṃ pūjesi. Brāhmaṇo taṃ disvā pasannacitto “ahampi🔽anāgate evarūpassa buddhassa cetiye ārakkhadevatā homī”ti patthanaṃ katvā tato cuto🔽devaloke nibbatti. Tassa devaloke ca manussaloke ca saṃsarantasseva kassapo bhagavā
analyzed: tadā ayam theraḥ brāhmaṇa mahāsālaḥ hutvā ekam pītakam vattham ādāya gataḥ devatā tassa  hatthataḥ vattham gahetvā cetiyam pūjesi brāhmaṇaḥ tam disvā pasanna cittaḥ aham pi  anāgate evarūpassa buddhassa cetiye ārakkha devatā homi iti patthanam katvā tatas cutaḥ  deva loke nibbatti tassa deva loke ca manussa loke ca saṃsarantassa iva kassapaḥ bhagavā
translated: At that time this Elder was a great Brahman, and he went, taking a yellow cloth. The goddess🔽took the cloth from his hand and worshipped the shrine. The Brahman, seeing this, was filled with faith, and made his Earnest Wish, saying, “In the future may I become a guardian of the shrine of a Buddha such as this.” After he had passed from that state of existence,🔽he was reborn in the World of the Gods. As he passed from existence in the World of the Gods and was reborn in the human world, the time came for the appearance in the world of the🔽Blessed One Kassapa.

original: loke uppajjitvā parinibbāyi. Tassāpi ekameva dhātusarīraṃ ahosi. Taṃ gahetvā yojanikaṃ🔽cetiyaṃ kāresuṃ. So tattha ārakkhadevatā hutvā sāsane antarahite sagge nibbattitvā🔽amhākaṃ bhagavato kāle tato cuto mahākule paṭisandhiṃ gahetvā nikkhamma pabbajitvā🔽arahattaṃ patto. Iti cetiye ārakkhadevatā hutvā āgatattā thero tejussadoti veditabbo.
analyzed: loke uppajjitvā parinibbāyi tassa api ekam eva dhātu sarīram ahosi tam gahetvā yojanikam 🔽cetiyam kāresuṃ saḥ tattha ārakkha devatāḥ hutvā sāsane antarahite sagge nibbattitvā 🔽amhākam bhagavataḥ kāle tatas cutaḥ mahā kule paṭisandhim gahetvā nikkhamma pabbajitvā 🔽arahattam patto iti cetiye ārakkha devatā hutvā āgata ttā thero tejussadā ti veditabbo
translated: At that time the Elder was a great Brahman householder. He took a yellow cloth and went to the shrine. A deity took the cloth from his hand and worshipped the shrine with it. The Brahman, seeing this, was filled with joy. He made his Earnest Wish, saying, “In the future may I become a guardian deity of a shrine of a Buddha such as this.” After his death he was reborn in the World of the Gods. As he passed from birth to birth in the World of the Gods and in the world of men, the time came when the Blessed One Kassapa appeared in the world. The Blessed One Kassapa attained extinction. They took his relics and built a shrine a league in size. He became a guardian deity of that shrine. When the Dispensation of the Blessed One Kassapa had disappeared, he was reborn in the World of the Gods. In the dispensation of our own Blessed One he was reborn in a great family. He went forth from home into the homeless state, and attained Arahatship. Thus the Elder should be understood as one who became known as Tejosaddha because he was a guardian deity of a shrine.

original: Devatā, ānanda, ujjhāyantīti iti ānanda, devatā ujjhāyanti, na mayhaṃ puttassa añño koci doso atthīti dasseti.
analyzed: devatāḥ ānanda ujjhāyanti iti iti ānanda devatāḥ ujjhāyanti na mayham puttassa aññaḥ koci doso atthi iti dasseti
translated: “The deities are grumbling” : thus the deities are grumbling, showing that there is no other fault in my son.

original: 201. Kathaṃbhūtā pana, bhanteti kasmā āha? Bhagavā tumhe – “devatā ujjhāyantī”ti
analyzed: kathaṃbhūtā pana bhantā iti kasmai āha bhagavā tumhe devatāḥ ujjhāyanti iti
translated: “But what sort of deities, venerable sir?” Why does he ask this? The Exalted One says to you, “The deities are grumbling.”

original: vadatha, kathaṃ bhūtā pana tā tumhe manasi karotha, kiṃ tumhākaṃ parinibbānaṃ adhivāsentīti🔽pucchati. Atha bhagavā – “nāhaṃ adhivāsanakāraṇaṃ vadāmī”ti tāsaṃ anadhivāsanabhāvaṃ
analyzed: vadatha katham bhūtā pana tā tumhe manasi karotha kim tumhākam parinibbānam adhivāsenti iti  pucchati atha bhagavān na aham adhivāsana kāraṇam vadāmi iti an adhivāsana bhāvam
translated: What sort of deities do you have in mind? Do they consent to your attaining final Nibbana?🔽He asks this. Then the Exalted One, saying, “I do not say this because I consent,”

original: dassento santānandātiādimāha.
analyzed: dassentaḥ santa ānanda iti ādim āha
translated: shows their non-consent with the words “I do not say this, Ananda.”

original: Tattha ākāse pathavīsaññiniyoti ākāse pathaviṃ māpetvā tattha pathavīsaññiniyo. Kandantīti
analyzed: tattha ākāse pathavī saññiniyaḥ ti ākāse pathavim māpetvā tattha pathavī saññiniyaḥ kandanti iti
translated: Therein, “in the sky, with earth-perception” : having caused earth to appear in the sky, they have the perception of earth there. “They weep” :

original: rodanti. Chinnapātaṃ papatantīti majjhe chinnā viya hutvā yato vā tato vā papatanti.
analyzed: rodanti chinna pātam papatanti iti majjhe chinnāḥ viya hutvā yatas vā tatas vā papatanti
translated: they cry. “They fall down, sprawling” : they fall down here and there as if they were cut in the middle.

original: Āvaṭṭantīti āvaṭṭantiyo patitaṭṭhānameva āgacchanti. Vivaṭṭantīti patitaṭṭhānato
analyzed: āvaṭṭanti iti patita ṭṭhānam eva āgacchanti vivaṭṭanti iti patita ṭṭhānato
translated: “They roll back and forth” : rolling back and forth, they come to the place where they have fallen.

original: parabhāgaṃ vaṭṭamānā gacchanti. Apica dve pāde pasāretvā sakiṃ purato sakiṃ pacchato
analyzed: parabhāgam vaṭṭamānāḥ gacchanti apica dve pāde pasāretvā sakim puratas sakim pacchatas
translated: and they go on turning round and round. Moreover, they turn round and round by stretching out two feet and then turning over once forwards and once backwards, or by turning over once to the left and once to the right.

original: sakiṃ vāmato sakiṃ dakkhiṇato saṃparivattamānāpi – “āvaṭṭanti vivaṭṭantī”ti vuccanti.🔽Santānanda, devatā pathaviyaṃ pathavīsaññiniyoti pakatipathavī kira devatā dhāretuṃ🔽na sakkoti. Tattha hatthako brahmā viya devatā osīdanti. Tenāha bhagavā – “oḷārikaṃ
analyzed: sakim vāmatas sakim dakkhiṇatas saṃparivattamānā api āvaṭṭanti vivaṭṭanti iti vuccanti  santa ānanda devatā pathaviyam pathavī saññini oti pakati pathavī kira devatāḥ dhāretum  na sakkoti tattha hatthakaḥ brahmā viya devatāḥ osīdanti tena āha bhagavā oḷārikam
translated: “They turn round and round” is said of them.🔽“Deities who are earth-bound and earth-deities” : it seems that the deities of the earth element are unable to support the earth,

original: hatthaka, attabhāvaṃ abhinimmināhī”ti. Tasmā yā devatā pathaviyaṃ pathaviṃ māpesuṃ,
analyzed: hatthaka atta bhāvam abhinimmināhi iti tasmai yāḥ devatā pathaviyam pathavim
translated: and so they sink down like Hatthaka the brahman.11 That is why the Blessed One said, “Hatthaka, create a gross material body for yourself.”

original: tā sandhāyetaṃ vuttaṃ – “pathaviyaṃ pathavīsaññiniyo”ti.
analyzed: tā sandhāya itam vuttam pathaviyam pathavī saññiniyaḥ ti
translated: Therefore this was said with reference to those deities who have made the earth appear in the earth element.

original: Vītarāgāti pahīnadomanassā silāthambhasadisā anāgāmikhīṇāsavadevatā.
analyzed: vīta rāgā ati pahīna domanassā silā thambha sadisā anāgāmi khīṇa āsava devatā
translated: “Deities who are free from lust” : deities who are non-returners and arahats, free from grief, like pillars of stone.

original: Catusaṃvejanīyaṭhānavaṇṇanā
analyzed: catu saṃvejanīya ṭhāna vaṇṇanā
translated: The Four Ways of Attending to the Repulsiveness of Food

original: 202. Vassaṃvuṭṭhāti buddhakāle kira dvīsu kālesu bhikkhū sannipatanti upakaṭṭhāya
analyzed: buddha kāle kira dvīsu kālesu bhikkhū sannipatanti upakaṭṭhāya
translated: “Who have completed the rains”: it seems that at two times the bhikkhus gather together in the dispensation of the Buddha, on the Uposatha day and on the day for the observance of the rains.

original: vassūpanāyikāya kammaṭṭhānaggahaṇatthaṃ, vuṭṭhavassā ca gahitakammaṭṭhānānuyogena
analyzed: vassūpanāyikāya kammaṭṭhāna ggahaṇa attham vuṭṭha vassā ca gahita kammaṭṭhāna anuyogena
translated: for the purpose of taking up a meditation subject at the beginning of the rains, and for the purpose of announcing any special attainment that may have been made during the rains by the practice of the meditation subject taken up.

original: nibbattitavisesārocanatthaṃ. Yathā ca buddhakāle, evaṃ tambapaṇṇidīpepi apāragaṅgāya
analyzed: nibbattita visesa ārocana attham yathā ca buddha kāle evam tambapaṇṇi dīpe pi apāragaṅgāya
translated: And just as it was in the time of the Buddha, so too in Tambapaṇṇi Island,

original: bhikkhū lohapāsāde sannipatiṃsu, pāragaṅgāya bhikkhū tissamahāvihāre. Tesu apāragaṅgāya
analyzed: bhikkhū loha pāsāde sannipatiṃsu pāragaṅgāya bhikkhū tissa mahāvihāre tesu apāragaṅgāya
translated: the monks of the Western Group assembled in the Lohapāsāda, and the monks of the Eastern Group assembled in the Great Monastery.

original: bhikkhū saṅkārachaḍḍakasammajjaniyo gahetvā āgantvā mahāvihāre sannipatitvā cetiye
analyzed: bhikkhū saṅkāra chaḍḍaka sammajjaniyaḥ gahetvā āgantvā mahāvihāre sannipatitvā cetiye
translated: The monks of the Western Group took with them the rubbish of the shrine and the sweeping of the shrine, and after coming and assembling in the Great Monastery,

original: sudhākammaṃ katvā – “vuṭṭhavassā āgantvā lohapāsāde sannipatathā”ti vattaṃ katvā
analyzed: sudhā kammam katvā vuṭṭhavassāḥ āgantvā loha pāsāde sannipatatha ati vattam katvā
translated: after doing the shrine’s food-offering, they announced: “Having completed the rains, assemble in the Lohapāsāda.”

original: phāsukaṭṭhānesu vasitvā vuṭṭhavassā āgantvā lohapāsāde pañcanikāyamaṇḍale, yesaṃ
analyzed: phāsuka ṭṭhānesu vasitvā vuṭṭha vassāḥ āgantvā loha pāsāde pañca nikāya maṇḍale yesam
translated: After living in comfortable places, having completed the rains, they came and assembled in the Lohapāsāda in the Pañcanikāya pavilion. Those who had mastered the texts recited the texts,

original: pāḷi paguṇā, te pāḷiṃ sajjhāyanti. Yesaṃ aṭṭhakathā paguṇā, te aṭṭhakathaṃ sajjhāyanti.
analyzed: pāḷi paguṇā te pāḷim sajjhāyanti yesam aṭṭhakathā paguṇā te aṭṭhakatham sajjhāyanti
translated: and those who had mastered the commentaries recited the commentaries.

original: Yo pāḷiṃ vā aṭṭhakathaṃ vā virādheti, taṃ – “kassa santike tayā gahita”nti vicāretvā
analyzed: yaḥ pāḷim vā aṭṭhakatham vā virādheti tam kassa santike tayā gahitan ti vicāretvā
translated: Anyone who contradicted the texts or the commentaries was questioned thus: “From whom did you learn it?”

So tāya

original: vattapaṭipattiyā aparihāniṃ patthayamāno evamāha.
analyzed: vatta paṭipattiyāḥ aparihānim patthayamānaḥ evam āha
translated: He said this wishing for non-decline in the practice of the duties.

original: Atha bhagavā – “ānando manobhāvanīyānaṃ dassanaṃ na labhissāmī”ti cinteti, handassa,
analyzed: atha bhagavā ānandaḥ manaḥ bhāvanīyānam dassanam na labhissāmi iti cintā iti handassa
translated: Then the Blessed One thought: “Ānanda will not get to see the venerable ones who are worthy of reverence,” and he thought:

analyzed: manobhāvanīyānam dassanaṭṭhānam ācikkhissāmi yattha vasantaḥ itas citas ca an āhiṇḍitvā ava
translated: “I will tell him the places where he can see the venerable ones who are worthy of reverence, where, living here and there, without wandering about,

original: lacchati manobhāvanīye bhikkhū dassanāyāti cintetvā cattārimānītiādimāha.
analyzed: lacchati manaḥ bhāvanīye bhikkhū dassanāya ati cintetvā cattārimāni itiādim āha
translated: he will get to see the venerable ones who are worthy of reverence.” And so he said: “Ānanda, there are these four places, etc.”

original: Tattha saddhassāti buddhādīsu pasannacittassa vattasampannassa, yassa pāto paṭṭhāya🔽cetiyaṅgaṇavattādīni sabbavattāni katāneva paññāyanti. Dassanīyānīti dassanārahāni🔽dassanatthāya gantabbāni. Saṃvejanīyānīti saṃvegajanakāni. Ṭhānānīti kāraṇāni, padesaṭhānāneva vā.
analyzed: tattha saddhassa ati buddha ādīsu pasanna cittassa vatta sampannassa yassa pāto paṭṭhāya  cetiyaṅgaṇa vatta ādīni sabba vattāni katāni eva paññāyanti dassanīyāni iti dassana ārahāni  dassana tthāya gantabbāni saṃvejanīyāni iti saṃvega janakāni ṭhānāni iti kāraṇāni padesa ṭhānāni eva vā
translated: Herein, of faith means of one who has a mind of confidence in the Buddha, etc., and who is endowed with the practice of duties. His duties,🔽beginning with the duties of the shrine terrace, etc., are seen to be performed. Are worthy of being seen means are worthy of being seen.🔽They should be gone to for the purpose of seeing. Are inspiring means are arousers of spiritual anxiety. Places means reasons, or sites.

original: Ye hi kecīti idaṃ cetiyacārikāya satthakabhāvadassanatthaṃ vuttaṃ. Tattha cetiyacārikaṃ
analyzed: ye hi keci iti idam cetiya cārikāya satthaka bhāva dassana tham vuttam tattha cetiya cārikam
translated: Whatever means whatever. This was said in order to show that the shrine terrace is the place for the practice of duties and the place for the practice of meditation. Herein, the practice of duties is the practice of the duties of the shrine terrace, etc.

original: āhiṇḍantāti ye ca tāva tattha tattha cetiyaṅgaṇaṃ sammajjantā, āsanāni dhovantā bodhimhi🔽udakaṃ siñcantā āhiṇḍanti, tesu vattabbameva natthi asukavihāre “cetiyaṃ vandissāmā”ti
analyzed: āhiṇḍantā ati ye ca tāva tattha tattha cetiyaṅgaṇam sammajjantāḥ āsanāni dhovantāḥ bodhimhi  udakam siñcantāḥ āhiṇḍanti tesu vattabbam eva na atthi asuka vihāre cetiyam vandissāma ati
translated: “Wandering about”: those who wander about there, sweeping the shrine terrace, washing the seats, sprinkling water on the Bodhi Tree, etc.,🔽need not be told that by going forth from the monastery with a serene mind to worship the shrine in such and such a place,

original: nikkhamitvā pasannacittā antarā kālaṅkarontāpi anantarāyena sagge patiṭṭhahissanti yevāti dasseti.
analyzed: nikkhamitvā pasanna cittāḥ antarā kālaṅkarontā api anantarāyena sagge patiṭṭhahissanti yeva ati dasseti
translated: and dying on the way, they will be established in heaven without delay.

original: Ānandapucchākathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: ānanda pucchā kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the question asked by Ananda.

original: 203. Adassanaṃ, ānandāti yadetaṃ mātugāmassa adassanaṃ, ayamettha uttamā paṭipattīti
analyzed: a dassanam ānanda ati yat etam mātugāmassa a dassanam ayam ettha uttamā paṭipatti iti
translated: “Ananda, non-appearance” : the Blessed One shows that the non-appearance of women is the highest practice here.

original: dasseti. Dvāraṃ pidahitvā senāsane nisinno hi bhikkhu āgantvā dvāre ṭhitampi mātugāmaṃ
analyzed: dasseti dvāram pidahitvā senāsane nisinnaḥ hi bhikkhu āgantvā dvāre ṭhitam pi mātugāmam
translated: For a bhikkhu who is seated in his dwelling with the door closed, even if a woman stands at the door

original: yāva na passati, tāvassa ekaṃseneva na lobho uppajjati, na cittaṃ calati. Dassane
analyzed: yāva na passati tāva assa ekaṃsena iva na lobhaḥ uppajjati na cittam calati dassane
translated: his lust does not arise all at once, nor does his mind become excited, as long as he does not see her. But when there is appearance🔽of her, then both happen. Therefore the Blessed One said: “Ananda, non-appearance.”

original: pana satiyeva tadubhayampi assa. Tenāha – “adassanaṃ ānandā”ti. Dassane bhagavā sati
analyzed: pana satiyā iva tat ubhayam pi assa tena āha adassanam ānanda ati dassane bhagavā sati
translated: “Ananda, appearance” :

original: kathanti bhikkhaṃ gahetvā upagataṭṭhānādīsu dassane sati kathaṃ paṭipajjitabbanti🔽pucchati. Atha bhagavā yasmā khaggaṃ gahetvā – “sace mayā saddhiṃ ālapasi, ettheva🔽te sīsaṃ pātessāmī”ti ṭhitapurisena vā, “sace mayā saddhiṃ ālapasi, ettheva te maṃsaṃ
analyzed: katham ti bhikkham gahetvā upagata ṭṭhāna ādīsu dassane sati katham paṭipajjitabbam ti  pucchati atha bhagavā yasmai khaggam gahetvā sace mayā saddhim ālapasi etthā iva  te sīsam pātessāmi iti ṭhita purisena vā sace mayā saddhim ālapasi ettha iva te maṃsam
translated: How? – When he sees the place where he has gone to receive alms, etc., how should he conduct himself?🔽The Blessed One said, “It would be better for him to take a sword and stab himself in the heart than that he should speak thus to a woman.

original: murumurāpetvā khādissāmī”ti ṭhitayakkhiniyā vā ālapituṃ varaṃ. Ekasseva hi attabhāvassa
analyzed: murumurāpetvā khādissāmi iti ṭhita yakkhiniyā vā ālapitum varam ekassa iva hi atta bhāvassa
translated: For if he speaks thus, he will be killed or bound and imprisoned or banished, or he will suffer various forms of misfortune.

original: tappaccayā vināso hoti, na apāyesu aparicchinnadukkhānubhavanaṃ. Mātugāmena pana
analyzed: tad paccayā vināsaḥ hoti na apāyesu aparicchinna dukkha anubhavanam mātugāmena pana
translated: But if he does not speak thus, he will not suffer such misfortune.”

original: ālāpasallāpe sati vissāso hoti, vissāse sati otāro hoti, otiṇṇacitto sīlabyasanaṃ
analyzed: ālāpa sallāpe sati vissāsaḥ hoti vissāse sati otāraḥ hoti otiṇṇa citto sīla byasanam
translated: “It would be better for him to take a sword and stab himself in the heart🔽Than to speak thus to a woman.🔽For if he speaks thus, he will be killed or bound or imprisoned,🔽Or banished, or he will suffer various forms of misfortune.

original: patvā apāyapūrako hoti; tasmā anālāpoti āha. Vuttampi cetaṃ –
analyzed: patvā apāya pūrakaḥ hoti tasmai an ālāpo ti āha vuttam pi
translated: But if he does not speak thus, he will not suffer such misfortune.”🔽“He may speak with one whose hand holds a sword,

original: “Sallape asihatthena, pisācenāpi sallape;
analyzed: sallape asi hatthena pisācena api sallape
translated: And with a demon too he may speak;🔽He may sit down with a poisonous snake,

original: Āsīvisampi āsīde, yena daṭṭho na jīvati;
analyzed: āsīde yena daṭṭho na jīvati
translated: By whom, if bitten, he will not live;🔽But alone he should not speak

original: Na tveva eko ekāya, mātugāmena sallape”ti. ;
analyzed: na tu eva ekaḥ ekāya mātu gāmena sallapa iti
translated: With a woman, not even with one of his own kin.”

original: Ālapantena panāti sace mātugāmo divasaṃ vā pucchati, sīlaṃ vā yācati, dhammaṃ vā
analyzed: ālapantena panāti sace mātu gāmaḥ divasam vā pucchati sīlam vā yācati dhammam vā
translated: “But if they speak to him”: if a woman speaks to him, asking about the day, requesting the observance-day ceremony,

original: sotukāmo hoti, pañhaṃ vā pucchati, tathārūpaṃ vā panassa pabbajitehi kattabbakammaṃ
analyzed: sotu kāmaḥ hoti pañham vā pucchati tathārūpam vā panassa pabbajitehi kattabba kammaṃ
translated: wanting to hear the Dhamma, or asking a question, or if she has some business to be done with a monk,

original: hoti, evarūpe kāle anālapantaṃ “mūgo ayaṃ, badhiro ayaṃ, bhutvāva baddhamukho nisīdatī”ti
analyzed: hoti evarūpe kāle an ālapantam mūgaḥ ayam badhiraḥ ayam bhutvā ava baddha mukhaḥ nisīdati iti
translated: then if he does not speak, she says, “He’s dumb, he’s deaf, he eats and then sits with his mouth shut.”

original: vadati, tasmā avassaṃ ālapitabbaṃ hoti. Evaṃ ālapantena pana kathaṃ paṭipajjitabbanti🔽pucchati. Atha bhagavā – “etha tumhe, bhikkhave, mātumattīsu mātucittaṃ upaṭṭhapetha,
analyzed: vadati tasmai avassam ālapitabbam hoti evam ālapantena pana katham paṭipajjitabbam ti  pucchati atha bhagavā tumhe bhikkhave mātumattīsu mātu cittam upaṭṭhapetha
translated: Therefore he should speak. But how should he conduct himself when he speaks?

original: bhaginimattīsu bhaginicittaṃ upaṭṭhapetha, dhītumattīsu dhītucittaṃ upaṭṭhapethā”ti
analyzed: bhagini mattīsu bhagini cittam upaṭṭhapetha dhītu mattīsu dhītu cittam upaṭṭhapetha ati
translated: The Buddha gave this advice: “Come, monks, in regard to women, generate the perception of a mother in regard to those of your mother’s age, the perception of a sister in regard to those of your sister’s age, and the perception of a daughter in regard to those of your daughter’s age.”

original: imaṃ ovādaṃ sandhāya sati, ānanda, upaṭṭhapetabbāti āha.
analyzed: imam ovādam sandhāya sati ānanda upaṭṭhapetabbā iti āha
translated: “You should establish mindfulness, Ananda.”

original: 204. Abyāvaṭāti atantibaddhā nirussukkā hotha. Sāratthe ghaṭathāti uttamatthe arahatte
analyzed: a byāvaṭā ati a tanti baddhā nirussukkāḥ hotha sāra atthe ghaṭatha ati uttamatthe arahatte
translated: “Be restrained” means be very restrained, be without negligence. “Strive for the highest goal” means strive for the highest goal of arahatship.

original: ghaṭetha. Anuyuñjathāti tadadhigamāya anuyogaṃ karotha. Appamattāti tattha avippamuṭṭhasatī.
analyzed: ghaṭetha anuyuñjatha ati tad adhigamāya anuyogam karotha appamattā ati tattha a vippamuṭṭha satī
translated: Strive: apply yourselves. Be devoted: make endeavour to attain it. Be not slothful: be not forgetful there.

original: Vīriyātāpayogena ātāpino. Kāye ca jīvite ca nirapekkhatāya pahitattā pesitacittā viharatha.
analyzed: vīriya ātāpa yogena ātāpino kāye ca jīvite ca nirapekkha tāya pahita ttā pesita cittāḥ viharatha
translated: Be ardent: be zealous through energy. Be composed: be resolute, with your minds set on the goal, without regard for body or life.

original: 205. Kathaṃ pana, bhanteti tehi khattiyapaṇḍitādīhi kathaṃ paṭipajjitabbaṃ. Addhā
analyzed: katham pana bhante ti tehi khattiya paṇḍita ādīhi katham paṭipajjitabbam addhā
translated: How, venerable sir? : how should the wise khattiyas and so on behave? They will certainly ask me:

original: maṃ te paṭipucchissanti – “kathaṃ, bhante, ānanda tathāgatassa sarīre paṭipajjitabba”nti;
analyzed: mam te paṭipucchissanti katham bhante ānanda tathāgatassa sarīre paṭipajjitabbanti
translated: “How, venerable sir, should we behave towards the Tathāgata’s bodily relics?”

original: “tesāhaṃ kathaṃ paṭivacanaṃ demī”ti pucchati. Ahatena vatthenāti navena kāsikavatthena.
analyzed: katham paṭivacanam demi iti pucchati ahatena vatthena ati navena kāsika vatthena
translated: “What answer should I give them?” with new cloth: with new linen cloth.

original: Vihatena kappāsenāti supothitena kappāsena. Kāsikavatthañhi sukhumattā telaṃ na gaṇhāti,🔽kappāso pana gaṇhāti. Tasmā “vihatena kappāsenā”ti āha. Āyasāyāti sovaṇṇāya. Sovaṇṇañhi
analyzed: vihatena kappāsena ati su pothitena kappāsena kāsika vattham hi sukhuma tā telam na gaṇhāti  kappāsaḥ pana gaṇhāti tasmai vihatena kappāsena ati āha āyasāya ati sovaṇṇāya sovaṇṇam hi
translated: With cotton wool: with well-carded cotton wool. For linen cloth does not absorb oil because it is so fine,🔽but cotton wool does. That is why he said “with cotton wool.” In an iron casket: in a gold casket. For gold is what is meant by the word “iron”

original: idha “ayasa”nti adhippetaṃ.
analyzed: idha ayasanti adhippetam
translated: here.

original: Thūpārahapuggalavaṇṇanā
analyzed: thūpa araha puggala vaṇṇanā
translated: The Description of Persons Worthy of a Shrine

original: 206. Rājā cakkavattīti ettha kasmā bhagavā agāramajjhe vasitvā kālaṅkatassa rañño🔽thūpārahataṃ anujānāti, na sīlavato puthujjanassa bhikkhussāti? Anacchariyattā. Puthujjanabhikkhūnañhi
analyzed: rājā cakkavattī iti ettha kasmai bhagavā agāra majjhe vasitvā kālaṅkatassa rañño  thūpāra hatam anujānāti na sīlavataḥ puthujjanassa bhikkhussa ati an acchariya ttā puthujjana bhikkhūnam hi
translated: Why does the Blessed One allow a monument to be erected for a king who has died while still a layman and not for an ordinary virtuous bhikkhu? Because it is not remarkable. For it is not remarkable🔽

original: thūpe anuññāyamāne tambapaṇṇidīpe tāva thūpānaṃ okāso na bhaveyya, tathā aññesu ṭhānesu.
analyzed: thūpe anuññāyamāne tamba paṇṇi dīpe tāva thūpānam okāsaḥ na bhaveyya tathā aññesu ṭhānesu
translated: Why does the Blessed One allow a monument for a king who has died while living as a layman but not for an ordinary virtuous bhikkhu? Because it is not remarkable. For if monuments were allowed for ordinary virtuous bhikkhus, there would not be room for them even in the island of Tambapaṇṇi, to say nothing of other places.

original: Tasmā “anacchariyā te bhavissantī”ti nānujānāti. Rājā cakkavattī ekova nibbattati,
analyzed: tasmai anacchariyā te bhavissanti iti na anujānāti rājā cakkavattī ekaḥ iva nibbattati
translated: Therefore he does not allow them, thinking, “They would not be remarkable.” But a Wheel-turning Monarch appears only once,

original: tenassa thūpo acchariyo hoti. Puthujjanasīlavato pana parinibbutabhikkhuno viya mahantampi
analyzed: tenassa thūpaḥ acchariyaḥ hoti puthujjana sīlavataḥ pana parinibbuta bhikkhunaḥ viya mahantam pi
translated: and so his monument is remarkable. But it is proper to render great honour even to an ordinary virtuous person who has attained extinction,

original: sakkāraṃ kātuṃ vaṭṭatiyeva.
analyzed: sakkāram kātum
translated: just as to a bhikkhu who has attained extinction.

original: Ānandaacchariyadhammavaṇṇanā🔽207. Vihāranti idha maṇḍalamālo vihāroti adhippeto, taṃ pavisitvā. Kapisīsanti dvārabāhakoṭiyaṃ
analyzed: vihāranti idha maṇḍala mālo vihāro ti adhippeto tam pavisitvā dvāra bāha koṭiyam
translated: The Description of the Wonderful Things about Ānanda

original: ṭhitaṃ aggaḷarukkhaṃ. Rodamāno aṭṭhāsīti so kirāyasmā cintesi – “satthārā mama saṃvegajanakaṃ
analyzed: ṭhitam aggaḷa rukkham rodamāno aṭṭhāsi iti so kira ayasmā cintesi satthārā mama saṃvega janakam
translated: Here the “dwelling” is the circular room; the “entering” is entering it. The “door-post” is the tree trunk standing at the door-post corner. “He stood weeping” . It seems that the venerable one thought, “The Master has gone to final extinction without rousing a sense of urgency in me.

original: vasanaṭṭhānaṃ kathitaṃ, cetiyacārikāya sātthakabhāvo kathito, mātugāme paṭipajjitabbapañho
analyzed: vasana ṭṭhānam kathitam cetiya cārikāya sātthaka bhāvaḥ kathitaḥ mātugāme paṭipajjitabba pañho
translated: The place where he lived was told, the meaningfulness of the Cetiya-circumambulation was told, the question of how to behave towards women was

original: vissajjito, attano sarīre paṭipatti akkhātā, cattāro thūpārahā kathitā, dhuvaṃ ajja
analyzed: vissajjitaḥ attanaḥ sarīre paṭipatti akkhātā cattāro thūpārahā kathitā dhuvam ajja
translated: answered, the practice in one’s own body was explained, the four who are worthy of a shrine were told, today the Fortunate One will certainly

original: bhagavā parinibbāyissatī”ti, tassevaṃ cintayato balavadomanassaṃ uppajji. Athassa
analyzed: bhagavā parinibbāyissati iti tassa ivam cintayataḥ balava domanassam uppajji athassa
translated: attain Final Emancipation.” While he was thinking thus, he experienced a great sorrow. Then this occurred to him:

original: etadahosi – “bhagavato santike rodanaṃ nāma aphāsukaṃ, ekamantaṃ gantvā sokaṃ tanukaṃ
analyzed: etat ahosi bhagavataḥ santike rodanam nāma a phāsukam ekamantam gantvā sokam tanukam
translated: “It is not comfortable to weep in the presence of the Fortunate One, having gone to one side I will make my sorrow

original: karissāmī”ti, so tathā akāsi. Tena vuttaṃ – “rodamāno aṭṭhāsī”ti.🔽Ahañca vatamhīti ahañca vata amhi, ahaṃ vatamhītipi pāṭho. Yo mama anukampakoti yo
analyzed: karissāmi iti saḥ tathā akāsi tena vuttam rodamānaḥ aṭṭhāsi iti  aham ca vatamhi iti aham ca vata amhi aham pāṭhaḥ yaḥ mama
translated: less.” He did so. Therefore it is said: “stood weeping”

original: maṃ anukampati anusāsati, sve dāni paṭṭhāya kassa mukhadhovanaṃ dassāmi, kassa pāde
analyzed: mam anukampati anusāsati sve dāni paṭṭhāya kassa mukha dhovanam dassāmi kassa pāde
translated: “I too” means “I also”, “I too” is also a reading. “The one who had compassion on me” means the one who had compassion on me, who instructed me, “From tomorrow onwards now, whose face-washing water will I give, whose feet

original: dhovissāmi, kassa senāsanaṃ paṭijaggissāmi, kassa pattacīvaraṃ gahetvā vicarissāmīti
analyzed: dhovissāmi kassa senāsanam paṭijaggissāmi kassa patta cīvaram gahetvā vicarissāmi iti
translated: will I wash, whose dwelling place will I look after, whose bowl and robe will I take and wander with?”

original: bahuṃ vilapi. Āmantesīti bhikkhusaṅghassa antare theraṃ adisvā āmantesi.
analyzed: bahum vilapi āmantesi iti bhikkhu saṅghassa antare theram a disvā āmantesi
translated: He lamented much. He addressed: not seeing the Elder in the midst of the Community of Bhikkhus, he addressed him.

original: Mettena kāyakammenāti mettacittavasena pavattitena mukhadhovanadānādikāyakammena.
analyzed: mettena kāya kammena ati metta citta vasena pavattitena mukha dhovana dāna ādi kāya kammena
translated: With kindly bodily action: with bodily action that occurred with a mind of loving-kindness, with such bodily action as giving a face-washing.

original: Hitenāti hitavuddhiyā katena. Sukhenāti sukhasomanasseneva katena, na dukkhinā dummanena🔽hutvāti attho. Advayenāti dve koṭṭhāse katvā akatena. Yathā hi eko sammukhāva karoti
analyzed: hitena ati hita vuddhiyā katena sukhena ati sukha somanassena iva katena na dukkhinā dummanena  hutvā iti atthaḥ advayena ati dve koṭṭhāse katvā akatena yathā hi ekaḥ karoti
translated: With what is beneficial: with what is done for the sake of welfare and progress. With what is pleasant: with what is done with pleasantness and gladness, not with what is done with pain and sorrow.

original: na parammukhā, eko parammukhāva karoti na sammukhā evaṃ vibhāgaṃ akatvā katenāti
analyzed: na parammukhāḥ ekaḥ karoti na sammukhāḥ evam vibhāgam a katvā katena ati
translated: The meaning is: with what is offered. With what is not double: with what is not done by making a division into two parts. For just as one does what is done face to face and not behind the back, and another does what is done behind the back and not face to face, so this is said in order to show that it is done without making such a division.

original: vuttaṃ hoti. Appamāṇenāti pamāṇavirahitena. Cakkavāḷampi hi atisambādhaṃ, bhavaggampi
analyzed: vuttam hoti appamāṇena ati pamāṇa virahitena cakkavāḷam pi hi ati sambādham bha vaggam pi
translated: With what is measureless: with what is done without measure. For even the world-sphere is too confined, and even the summit of existence is too low

original: atinīcaṃ, tayā kataṃ kāyakammameva bahunti dasseti.
analyzed: ati nīcam tayā katam kāya kammam eva bahunti dasseti
translated: for the bodily action done by you.

original: Mettena vacīkammenāti mettacittavasena pavattitena mukhadhovanakālārocanādinā vacīkammena.
analyzed: mettena vacī kammena ati metta citta vasena pavattitena mukha dhovana kāla ārocana ādinā vacī kammena
translated: With kindly verbal action: with verbal action that occurred with a mind of loving-kindness, with such verbal action as announcing the time for face-washing.

original: Api ca ovādaṃ sutvā – “sādhu, bhante”ti vacanampi mettaṃ vacīkammameva. Mettena manokammenāti
analyzed: api ca ovādam sutvā sādhu bhante iti vacanam pi mettam vacī kammam eva mettena manaḥ kammena ati
translated: And after hearing the advice, the mere words “Good, venerable sir” are also a friendly verbal action. With a friendly mental action:

original: kālasseva sarīrapaṭijagganaṃ katvā vivittāsane nisīditvā – “satthā arogo hotu, abyāpajjo🔽sukhī”ti evaṃ pavattitena manokammena. Katapuññosīti kappasatasahassaṃ abhinīhārasampannosīti
analyzed: kālassa iva sarīra paṭijagganam katvā vivitta āsane nisīditvā satthā arogaḥ hotu a byāpajjaḥ  sukhī iti evam pavattitena mano kammena kata puññaḥ asi iti kappa sata sahassam abhinīhāra sampannaḥ asi iti
translated: after attending to his body early in the morning, he should sit down in solitude and generate the thought “May the Master be free from illness and affliction and live happily.”🔽With the mental action thus produced. You have made merit: you have made a resolution for a hundred thousand eons.

original: dasseti. Katapuññosīti ca ettāvatā vissattho mā pamādamāpajji, atha kho padhānamanuyuñja.
analyzed: dassa iti kata puññaḥ asi iti ca ettāvatā vissatthaḥ mā pamādam āpajji atha kho padhānam anuyuñja
translated: With the words “You have made merit” he shows that he is confident that the Elder will not fall into negligence but will rather apply himself to the task in hand.

original: Evañhi anuyutto khippaṃ hohisi anāsavo, dhammasaṅgītikāle arahattaṃ pāpuṇissasi.
analyzed: evam hi anuyuttaḥ khippam hohisi anāsavaḥ dhamma saṅgīti kāle arahattam pāpuṇissasi
translated: For if you apply yourself thus, you will soon become free from cankers and attain arahatship at the time of the recitation of the Dhamma.

original: Na hi mādisassa katapāricariyā nipphalā nāma hotīti dasseti.
analyzed: na hi mādisassa kata pāricariyā nipphalā nāma hoti iti dasseti
translated: For the service rendered to one like me does not go unrewarded.

original: 208. Evañca pana vatvā mahāpathaviṃ pattharanto viya ākāsaṃ vitthārento viya cakkavāḷagiriṃ
analyzed: evam ca pana vatvā mahā pathavim pattharantaḥ viya ākāsam vitthārentaḥ viya cakkavāḷa girim
translated: Having said this, he seemed to stretch out the great earth, to expand the sky, to level the Cakkavāḷa mountain,

original: osārento viya sineruṃ ukkhipento viya mahājambuṃ khandhe gahetvā cālento viya āyasmato
analyzed: osārentaḥ viya sinerum ukkhipentaḥ viya mahā jambum khandhe gahetvā cālentaḥ viya āyasmataḥ
translated: to lift up Mount Sineru, to take the great Jambu tree in his arms and shake it.

original: ānandassa guṇakathaṃ ārabhanto atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi. Tattha “yepi te,
analyzed: ānandassa guṇa katham ārabhantaḥ atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi tattha ye pi te
translated: When he began to speak in praise of Ānanda’s qualities, the Exalted One addressed the bhikkhus.🔽Why was it not said: “Bhikkhus, even now”? Because there is no other Buddha.

original: bhikkhave, etarahī”ti kasmā na vuttaṃ? Aññassa buddhassa natthitāya. Eteneva cetaṃ🔽veditabbaṃ – “yathā cakkavāḷantarepi añño buddho natthī”ti. Paṇḍitoti byatto. Medhāvīti
analyzed: bhikkhave etarahi iti kasmā na vuttam aññassa buddhassa na thitāya etena iva ca itaṃ  veditabbam yathā cakkavāṭ antare pi aññaḥ buddhaḥ na atthi iti paṇḍito ti byattaḥ medhāvī iti
translated: And this can be understood🔽in the same way as that there is no other Buddha in other world systems.

original: khandhadhātuāyatanādīsu kusalo.
analyzed: khandha dhātu āyatana ādīsu kusalaḥ
translated: “Wise” means competent. “Intelligent” means skilled in the aggregates, elements, sense bases, etc.

original: 209. Bhikkhuparisā ānandaṃ dassanāyāti ye bhagavantaṃ passitukāmā theraṃ upasaṅkamanti,🔽ye ca “āyasmā kirānando samantapāsādiko abhirūpo dassanīyo bahussuto saṅghasobhano”ti
analyzed: bhikkhu parisā ānandam dassanāya ati ye bhagavantam passitu kāmāḥ theram upasaṅkamanti  ye ca āyasmā kira ānandaḥ samanta pāsādikaḥ abhirūpaḥ dassanīyaḥ bahu sutaḥ saṅgha sobhanaḥ ti
translated: “A company of bhikkhus” means those who approach the Elder to see him because they wish to see the Exalted One.🔽And those who come because they have heard the Elder’s qualities: “The venerable Ānanda is all-around pleasing, handsome, and well-spoken, an ornament of the Saṅgha.”

original: therassa guṇe sutvā āgacchanti, te sandhāya “bhikkhuparisā ānandaṃ dassanāya upasaṅkamantī”ti
analyzed: therassa guṇe sutvā āgacchanti te sandhāya bhikkhu parisā ānandam dassanāya upasaṅkamanti iti
translated: With reference to them it is said: “A company of bhikkhus approaches Ānanda to see him.”

original: vuttaṃ. Esa nayo sabbattha. Attamanāti savanena no dassanaṃ sametīti sakamanā tuṭṭhacittā.
analyzed: vuttam esa nayaḥ sabbattha attamanā ati savanena naḥ dassanam sameti iti sa kamanā tuṭṭha cittā
translated: The same method applies in all cases. “Delighted” means that the delight of hearing does not meet the delight of seeing. They were satisfied and happy.

original: Dhammanti “kacci, āvuso, khamanīyaṃ, kacci yāpanīyaṃ, kacci yoniso manasikārena kammaṃ
analyzed: dhammanti kacci āvuso khamanīyam kacci yāpanīyam kacci yonisas manasikārena kammaṃ
translated: “Dhamma” means: “I hope, friend, that it is bearable, I hope that it is getting better, I hope that you are getting well,

original: karotha, ācariyupajjhāye vattaṃ pūrethā”ti evarūpaṃ paṭisanthāradhammaṃ. Tattha bhikkhunīsu
analyzed: karotha ācariya upajjhāye vattam pūretha ati evarūpam paṭisanthāra dhammam tattha bhikkhunīsu
translated: “Is it allowable, friend? Is it possible? Are you doing your work with proper attention? Are you fulfilling the duties to your teachers and preceptors?” This is the kind of conversation that is allowable. But when bhikkhunīs come,

original: – “kacci, bhaginiyo, aṭṭha garudhamme samādāya vattathā”ti idampi nānākaraṇaṃ hoti.🔽Upāsakesu āgatesu “upāsaka, na te kacci sīsaṃ vā aṅgaṃ vā rujjati, arogā te puttabhātaro”ti
analyzed: kacci bhaginiyaḥ aṭṭha garu dhamme samādāya vattatha ati idam pi nānākaraṇam hoti  upāsakesu āgatesu upāsaka na te kacci sīsam vā aṅgam vā rujjati arogā te putta bhātarā oti
translated: he does not converse with them in this way, saying, “Sisters, are you fulfilling the eight important principles?”

original: na evaṃ paṭisanthāraṃ karoti. Evaṃ pana karoti – “kathaṃ upāsakā tīṇi saraṇāni pañca
analyzed: na evam paṭisanthāram karoti evam pana karoti katham tīṇi saraṇāni pañca
translated: When laymen come, he does not converse with them in this way, saying, “Layman, I hope your head and feet are all right. I hope your children and family are all right.” He converses with them in this way: “Layman, do you observe the three refuges and the five precepts?

original: sīlāni rakkhatha, māsassa aṭṭha uposathe karotha, mātāpitūnaṃ upaṭṭhānavattaṃ pūretha,
analyzed: sīlāni rakkhatha māsassa aṭṭha uposathe karotha mātā pitūnam upaṭṭhāna vattam pūretha
translated: Do you observe the eight precepts on the uposatha days? Do you fulfill the duties to your mother and father?

original: dhammikasamaṇabrāhmaṇe paṭijaggathā”ti. Upāsikāsupi eseva nayo.
analyzed: dhammika samaṇa brāhmaṇe upāsikāsu pi esa iva nayaḥ
translated: Do you look after righteous recluses and brahmans?” He converses with laywomen in the same way.

original: Idāni ānandattherassa cakkavattinā saddhiṃ upamaṃ karonto cattārome bhikkhavetiādimāha.
analyzed: idāni ānanda therassa cakkavattinā saddhim upamam karontaḥ cattāro me bhikkhave ti ādim āha
translated: Now, in order to illustrate the Elder Ānanda’s conversation with the Wheel-turning Monarch, the Exalted One said, “Bhikkhus, there are these four kinds of persons found existing in the world.”

original: Tattha khattiyāti abhisittā ca anabhisittā ca khattiyajātikā. Te kira – “rājā cakkavattī
analyzed: tattha khattiyā ati abhisittā ca an abhisittā ca khattiya jātikā te kira rājā cakkavattī
translated: Herein, Khattiya means those of Khattiya race, both those anointed to be kings and those not anointed. For it is said that a king who is a wheel-turner

original: nāma abhirūpo dassanīyo pāsādiko ākāsena vicaranto rajjaṃ anusāsati dhammiko dhammarājā”ti
analyzed: nāma abhirūpaḥ dassanīyaḥ pāsādikaḥ ākāsena vicarantaḥ rajjam anusāsati dhammikaḥ dhamma rājā ati
translated: Herein, Khattiyas are those of Khattiya race, both those consecrated with the sprinkling and those not so consecrated. They are said to have heard this talk of the Blessed One’s, and so on. They are pleased because they think ‘The universal monarch is a handsome, comely, graceful man who rules his realm by flying through the air. He is a righteous king who rules by the Dhamma’.

original: tassa guṇakathaṃ sutvā “savanena dassanampi sama”nti attamanā honti. Bhāsatīti kathento
analyzed: tassa guṇa katham sutvā savanena dassanam pi samanti attamanāḥ honti bhāsati iti kathento
translated: They are pleased because they think ‘Seeing him is as good as hearing him’.

original: – “kathaṃ, tātā, rājadhammaṃ pūretha, paveṇiṃ rakkhathā”ti paṭisanthāraṃ karoti.
analyzed: katham tātā rāja dhammam pūretha paveṇim rakkhatha ati paṭisanthāram karoti
translated: He speaks: he welcomes them by saying ‘How is it, sirs, do you fulfil the king’s duties? Do you keep the line of succession pure? ‘

original: Brāhmaṇesu pana – “kathaṃ ācariyā mante vācetha, kathaṃ antevāsikā mante gaṇhanti,🔽dakkhiṇaṃ vā vatthāni vā kapilaṃ vā alatthā”ti paṭisanthāraṃ karoti. Gahapatīsu –
analyzed: brāhmaṇesu pana katham ācariyāḥ mante vācetha katham antevāsikāḥ mante gaṇhanti  dakkhiṇam vā vatthāni vā kapilam vā alattha ati paṭisanthāram karoti gahapatīsu
translated: He welcomes them by saying ‘How is it, teachers, do you teach the mantras? Do your pupils learn the mantras?🔽Have you received any gifts, cloth, or gold? ‘

original: “kathaṃ tātā, na vo rājakulato daṇḍena vā balinā vā pīḷā atthi, sammā devo dhāraṃ
analyzed: katham tātā na vaḥ rāja kulataḥ daṇḍena vā balinā vā pīḍā atthi sammā devaḥ
translated: He welcomes them by saying ‘How is it, sirs, are you not oppressed by the king’s court with threats of punishment and violence? Does the king send you rain in due season? Are your crops successful? ‘

original: anupavecchati, sassāni sampajjantī”ti evaṃ paṭisanthāraṃ karoti. Samaṇesu – “kathaṃ,
analyzed: anupavecchati sassāni sampajjanti iti evam paṭisanthāram karoti samaṇesu katham
translated: He welcomes them by saying ‘How is it,

original: bhante, pabbajitaparikkhārā sulabhā, samaṇadhamme na pamajjathā”ti evaṃ paṭisanthāraṃ karoti.
analyzed: bhante pabbajita parikkhārā sulabhā samaṇa dhamme na pamajjatha ati evam paṭisanthāram karoti
translated: “Venerable sirs, requisites for those gone forth are easy to come by; do not neglect the ascetic life.”

original: Mahāsudassanasuttadesanāvaṇṇanā🔽210. Khuddakanagaraketi nagarapatirūpake sambādhe khuddakanagarake. Ujjaṅgalanagaraketi
analyzed: khuddaka nagaraka iti nagara pati rūpake sambādhe khuddaka nagarake ujjaṅgala nagarakā iti
translated: The explanation of the Mahāsudassana Sutta🔽In a small town: in a town that is cramped, like a town in miniature. In a jungle town:

original: visamanagarake. Sākhānagaraketi yathā rukkhānaṃ sākhā nāma khuddakā honti, evameva
analyzed: visama nagarake sākhānagarake iti yathā rukkhānam sākhāḥ nāma khuddakāḥ honti evam eva
translated: in a town that is uneven. In a branch town: just as the branches of trees are small,
