analyzed: aññesam mahā nagarānam sākhā sadise khuddaka nagarake khattiya mahā sālā ati khattiya mahā sāra ppattā
translated: so too, in a town that is small like a branch of a big town. Great clansmen: great Khattiyas who have attained the status of great clansmen.

original: mahākhattiyā. Esa nayo sabbattha.
analyzed: mahākhattiyāḥ esa nayo sabbattha
translated: The same method applies in all cases.

original: Tesu khattiyamahāsālā nāma yesaṃ koṭisatampi koṭisahassampi dhanaṃ nikhaṇitvā ṭhapitaṃ,
analyzed: tesu khattiya mahāsālāḥ nāma yesam koṭi satam pi koṭi sahassam pi dhanam nikhaṇitvā ṭhapitam
translated: Among them, the great clansmen are those who have stored away a hundred thousand or a hundred million in treasure,

original: divasaparibbayo ekaṃ kahāpaṇasakaṭaṃ nigacchati, sāyaṃ dve pavisanti. Brāhmaṇamahāsālā
analyzed: divasa paribbayaḥ ekam kahāpaṇa sakaṭam nigacchati sāyam dve pavisanti brāhmaṇa mahā sālā
translated: and who make a daily profit of a cartload of kahāpaṇas. The great brahmans

original: nāma yesaṃ asītikoṭidhanaṃ nihitaṃ hoti, divasaparibbayo eko kahāpaṇakumbho nigacchati,
analyzed: nāma yesam asīti koṭi dhanam nihitam hoti divasa paribbayaḥ ekaḥ kahāpaṇa kumbhaḥ nigacchati
translated: are those who have stored away eighty-four hundred-thousand kahāpaṇas, and who make a daily profit of a kahāpaṇa jar.

original: sāyaṃ ekasakaṭaṃ pavisati. Gahapatimahāsālā nāma yesaṃ cattālīsakoṭidhanaṃ nihitaṃ
analyzed: sāyam eka sakaṭam pavisati gahapatimahāsālā nāma cattālīsa koṭi dhanam nihitam
translated: The great householders are those who have forty koṭis of treasure stored up,

original: hoti, divasaparibbayo pañca kahāpaṇambaṇāni nigacchanti, sāyaṃ kumbho pavisati.
analyzed: hoti divasa paribbayaḥ pañca kahā paṇambaṇāni nigacchanti sāyam kumbho pavisati
translated: who spend five hundred kahāpaṇas a day, and who at night bring in a jar full of treasure.

original: Mā hevaṃ, ānanda, avacāti ānanda, mā evaṃ avaca, na imaṃ “khuddakanagara”nti vattabbaṃ.🔽Ahañhi imasseva nagarassa sampattiṃ kathetuṃ – “anekavāraṃ tiṭṭhaṃ nisīdaṃ mahantena
analyzed: mā ha ivam ānanda avaca ati ānanda mā evam avaca na imam khuddaka nagaram ti vattabbam  aham hi imassa eva nagarassa sampattim kathetum aneka vāram tiṭṭham nisīdam mahantena
translated: Do not say so, Ānanda, do not say so. This should not be called a small town.

original: ussāhena, mahantena parakkamena idhāgato”ti vatvā bhūtapubbantiādimāha. Subhikkhāti🔽khajjabhojjasampannā. Hatthisaddenāti ekasmiṃ hatthimhi saddaṃ karonte caturāsītihatthisahassāni🔽saddaṃ karonti, iti hatthisaddena avivittā, hoti, tathā assasaddena. Puññavanto panettha
analyzed: ussāhena mahantena parakkamena idha āgataḥ iti vatvā bhūta pubba nti ādim āha subhikkhā iti  khajja bhojja sampannāḥ hatthi saddena ati ekasmin hatthimhi saddam karonte catur asīti hatthi sahassāni  saddam karonti iti hatthi saddena avivittā hoti tathā assa saddena puññavantaḥ pana ittha
translated: For I have been speaking of the prosperity of this town, saying: “I have come here with great effort and great exertion, standing and sitting many times.”

original: sattā catusindhavayuttehi rathehi aññamaññaṃ anubandhamānā antaravīthīsu vicaranti,
analyzed: sattā catu sindhava yuttehi rathehi aññam aññam anubandhamānāḥ antara vīthīsu vicaranti
translated: Having said this, he spoke the verse beginning “In the past.” It was prosperous means it was rich in food and drink. With the sound of elephants means when one elephant trumpeted, eighty-four thousand elephants trumpeted. Thus it was never without the sound of elephants. So too with the sound of horses. But the meritorious beings there rode in chariots drawn by four thoroughbreds, following one another, and roamed in the cross-roads.

original: iti rathasaddena avivittā hoti. Niccaṃ payojitāneva panettha bheriādīni tūriyāni,🔽iti bherisaddādīhipi avivittā hoti. Tattha sammasaddoti kaṃsatāḷasaddo. Pāṇitāḷasaddoti
analyzed: iti ratha saddena a vivittā hoti niccam payojitāna eva pana ittha bheri ādīni tūriyāni  iti bheri sadda ādīhi pi avivittā hoti tattha samma saddo ti kaṃsa tāḷa saddo pāṇi tāḷa saddo ti
translated: So she is never without the sound of chariots. But here the sound of drums and other musical instruments is always present,🔽So she is never without the sound of drums and so on. Herein, the sound of gongs is the sound of bronze cymbals. The sound of hand-clapping is the sound of clapping the hands in various ways.

original: pāṇinā caturassaambaṇatāḷasaddo. Kuṭabherisaddotipi vadanti.
analyzed: pāṇinā vadanti
translated: They also say that it is the sound of a small drum.

original: Asnātha pivatha khādathāti asnātha pivatha khādatha. Ayaṃ panettha saṅkhepo, bhuñjatha
analyzed: a snātha pivatha khādatha ati a snātha pivatha khādatha ayam pana itthā saṅkhepaḥ bhuñjatha
translated: “Bathe, drink, eat,” is the sound of the words “bathe, drink, eat.” But the meaning here in brief is this:🔽she is never without the sound of the tenth, namely, “Eat, drink, drink, eat.”

original: bhoti iminā dasamena saddena avivittā hoti anupacchinnasaddā. Yathā pana aññesu nagaresu🔽“kacavaraṃ chaḍḍetha, kudālaṃ gaṇhatha, pacchiṃ gaṇhatha, pavāsaṃ gamissāma, taṇḍulapuṭaṃ
analyzed: bhoti iminā dasamena saddena avivittā hoti anupacchinna saddā yathā pana aññesu nagaresu  kacavaram chaḍḍetha kudālam gaṇhatha pacchim gaṇhatha pavāsam gamissāma taṇḍula puṭam
translated: But just as in other cities

original: gaṇhatha, bhattapuṭaṃ gaṇhatha, phalakāvudhādīni sajjāni karothā”ti evarūpā saddā
analyzed: gaṇhatha bhatta puṭam gaṇhatha phalaka avudha ādīni sajjāni karotha ati evarūpā saddā
translated: “Throw away the rubbish, take a spade, take a basket, we shall go on a picnic, take a bag of rice, take a bag of flour, get ready the weapons such as axes,” and so on,

original: honti, na yidha evaṃ ahosīti dasseti.
analyzed: honti na evam ahosi iti dasseti
translated: and there are such sounds, so it was not so here. This is how the construction should be understood here.

original: “Dasamena saddenā”ti ca vatvā “kusāvatī, ānanda, rājadhānī sattahi pākārehi parikkhittā
analyzed: dasamena saddena ati ca vatvā kusāvatī ānanda rājadhānī sattahi pākārehi parikkhittā
translated: “With the tenth cry” means that the city of Kusinārā was surrounded by seven walls.

original: ahosī”ti sabbaṃ mahāsudassanasuttaṃ niṭṭhāpetvā gaccha tvaṃ ānandātiādimāha. Tattha
analyzed: ahosi iti sabbam mahāsudassana suttam niṭṭhāpetvā gaccha tvam ānanda ati ādim āha tattha
translated: “With the tenth cry of grief” , and so on, and then he concluded the whole of the Mahāsudassana Sutta with the words, “Ānanda, the royal capital of Kusāvatī was surrounded by seven successive concentric outer walls made of gold” , and then he said, “Go, Ānanda” , and so on. Herein,

original: abhikkamathāti abhimukhā kamatha, āgacchathāti attho. Kiṃ pana te bhagavato āgatabhāvaṃ🔽na jānantīti? Jānanti. Buddhānaṃ gatagataṭṭhānaṃ nāma mahantaṃ kolāhalaṃ hoti, kenacideva🔽karaṇīyena nisinnattā na āgatā. “Te āgantvā bhikkhusaṅghassa ṭhānanisajjokāsaṃ saṃvidahitvā
analyzed: abhikkamatha ati abhimukhā kamatha āgacchatha ati attho kim pana te bhagavataḥ āgata bhāvam  na jānanti iti jānanti buddhānam gata gata ṭṭhānam nāma mahantam kolāhalam hoti kenacid eva  karaṇīyena nisinnattā na āgatā te āgantvā bhikkhu saṅghassa ṭhāna nisajja ukāsam saṃvidahitvā
translated: “Go forward” means “Go forward and come” . But did they not know that the Exalted One was coming?

original: dassantī”ti tesaṃ santike avelāyampi bhagavā pesesi.
analyzed: dassanti iti tesam santike avelāyam pi bhagavā pesesi
translated: They knew, but there was a great commotion because of the Exalted One’s coming and going, and they had not come because they were sitting engaged in some business. “They will come and make a place for the community of bhikkhus to sit down and lie down” , and so he sent the Exalted One to them even out of season.

original: Mallānaṃ vandanāvaṇṇanā🔽211. Amhākañca noti ettha no kāro nipātamattaṃ. Aghāvinoti uppannadukkhā. Dummanāti
analyzed: mallānam vandanā vaṇṇanā  amhākam ca no ti ettha no kāraḥ nipāta mattam aghāvino ti uppanna dukkhā dummanā ti
translated: The Exalted One’s going to the Mallas’ town

original: anattamanā. Cetodukkhasamappitāti domanassasamappitā. Kulaparivattaso kulaparivattaso
analyzed: anatta manā cetaḥ dukkha samappitā ati domanassa samappitā kula parivattaso kula parivattaso
translated: Herein, the word “our” is a mere particle. “Afflicted” means suffering. “Sorrowful” means unhappy. “Oppressed by the grief in their hearts” means oppressed by sorrow. “From family to family” means from house to house.

original: ṭhapetvāti ekekaṃ kulaparivattaṃ kulasaṅkhepaṃ vīthisabhāgena ceva racchāsabhāgena
analyzed: ṭhapetvā iti ekekam kula parivattam kula saṅkhepam vīthi sabhāgena ca iva racchā sabhāgena
translated: Excepting: except for each family, each group of families, each street, and each square.

original: ca visuṃ visuṃ ṭhapetvā.
analyzed: ca visum visum ṭhapetvā
translated: Apart: apart from each one.

original: Subhaddaparibbājakavatthuvaṇṇanā
analyzed: subhadda paribbājaka vatthu vaṇṇanā
translated: The story of the wanderer Subhadda

original: 212. Subhaddo nāma paribbājakoti udiccabrāhmaṇamahāsālakulā pabbajito channaparibbājako.
analyzed: subhaddaḥ nāma paribbājakaḥ ti udicca brāhmaṇa mahāsāla kulā pabbajitaḥ channa paribbājako
translated: The wanderer Subhadda: the wanderer Channa, who went forth from a great brahmin family of the Udicca clan.

original: Kaṅkhādhammoti vimatidhammo. Kasmā panassa ajja evaṃ ahosīti? Tathāvidhaupanissayattā.
analyzed: kaṅkhā dhammo ti vimati dhammo kasmā pana assa ajja evam ahosi iti tathāvidha aupanissaya ttā
translated: A doubtful doctrine: a doctrine of doubt. But why did he have this doubt only today? Because of the presence of the necessary conditions.

original: Pubbe kira puññakaraṇakāle dve bhātaro ahesuṃ. Te ekatova sassaṃ akaṃsu. Tattha jeṭṭhakassa🔽– “ekasmiṃ sasse navavāre aggasassadānaṃ mayā dātabba”nti ahosi. So vappakāle bījaggaṃ
analyzed: pubbe kira puñña karaṇa kāle dve bhātaraḥ ahesum te ekatas va sassam akaṃsu tattha jeṭṭhakassa  ekasmim sasse nava vāre agga sassa dānam mayā dātabban ti ahosi saḥ vappa kāle bījaggam
translated: Formerly, it seems, in the days of his merit-making, he had two brothers. They cultivated a field together. The elder brother🔽thought, “I will give the first-fruits of the field to the Sangha of bhikkhus headed by the Buddha.” He gave the seed-grain,

original: nāma datvā gabbhakāle kaniṭṭhena saddhiṃ mantesi – “gabbhakāle gabbhaṃ phāletvā dassāmā”ti
analyzed: nāma da tvā gabbha kāle kaniṭṭhena saddhim mantesi gabbha kāle gabbham phāletvā dassāma ati
translated: but when the time came for sowing, he consulted with his younger brother, saying, “Let us break up the clods and sow.”

original: kaniṭṭho – “taruṇasassaṃ nāsetukāmosī”ti āha. Jeṭṭho kaniṭṭhassa ananuvattanabhāvaṃ
analyzed: kaniṭṭhaḥ taruṇa sassam nāsetu kāmo asi iti āha jeṭṭhaḥ kaniṭṭhassa an anuvattana bhāvam
translated: The younger brother said, “You want to destroy the young crop.” The elder brother said, “I will not do as you say.”

original: ñatvā khettaṃ vibhajitvā attano koṭṭhāsato gabbhaṃ phāletvā khīraṃ nīharitvā sappinavanītena🔽saṃyojetvā adāsi, puthukakāle puthukaṃ kāretvā adāsi, lāyanakāle lāyanaggaṃ, veṇikaraṇe🔽veṇaggaṃ, kalāpādīsu kalāpaggaṃ, khalaggaṃ, khalabhaṇḍaggaṃ, koṭṭhagganti evaṃ ekasasse
analyzed: ñatvā khettam vibhajitvā attano koṭṭhāsataḥ gabbham phāletvā khīram nīharitvā sappi navanītena  saṃyojetvā adāsi puthuka kāle puthukam kāretvā adāsi lāyana kāle lāyanaggam veṇi karaṇe  veṇaggam kalāpa ādīsu kalāpaggam khalaggam khalabhaṇḍaggam koṭṭhaggam ti evam eka sasse
translated: and having divided the field, he broke open the womb of his own portion, took out the milk, mixed it with fresh butter,

original: navavāre aggadānaṃ adāsi. Kaniṭṭho pana uddharitvā adāsi.
analyzed: nava vāre aggadānam adāsi kaniṭṭhaḥ pana uddharitvā adāsi
translated: and gave it to the Elder. When it was time to make curds, he gave the best of the curds, when it was time to make butter, he gave the best of the butter, when it was time to make ghee, he gave the best of the ghee, when it was time to make cakes, he gave the best of the cakes, when it was time to make a bundle, he gave the best of the bundles, when it was time to make a load, he gave the best of the loads, when it was time to make a bag, he gave the best of the bags, when it was time to make a store, he gave the best of the store. Thus he gave the best of the nine portions of the single field.🔽But the younger brother gave after taking out his own portion.

original: Tesu jeṭṭhako aññāsikoṇḍaññatthero jāto. Bhagavā – “kassa nu kho ahaṃ paṭhamaṃ dhammaṃ🔽deseyya”nti olokento “aññāsikoṇḍañño ekasmiṃ sasse nava aggadānāni adāsi, imaṃ aggadhammaṃ
analyzed: tesu jeṭṭhakaḥ aññāsikoṇḍañña theraḥ jātaḥ bhagavā kassa nu kho aham paṭhamam dhammaṃ  deseyyanti olokento ekasmin sasse nava agga dānāni adāsi imam agga dhammaṃ
translated: Of these, the elder brother became the Elder Aññāsikoṇḍañña. The Blessed One, looking about, thinking, “To whom shall I first preach the Dhamma?”

original: tassa desessāmī”ti sabbapaṭhamaṃ dhammaṃ desesi. So aṭṭhārasahi brahmakoṭīhi saddhiṃ
analyzed: tassa desessāmi iti sabba paṭhamam dhammam desesi so aṭṭhārasahi brahmakoṭīhi saddhiṃ
translated: saw that Aññāsikoṇḍañña had given the best of the nine portions of the single field, and he thought, “I will preach the best of the Dhamma to him.” Thus he preached the Dhamma to him first. Together with eighteen koṭis of Brahmās,

original: sotāpattiphale patiṭṭhāsi. Kaniṭṭho pana ohīyitvā pacchā dānassa dinnattā satthu
analyzed: sotāpatti phale patiṭṭhā asi kaniṭṭhaḥ pana ohīyitvā pacchā dānassa dinnattā satthu
translated: he was established in the fruit of stream-entry. But the younger brother, because he gave after taking out his own portion, was established in the fruit of once-returner.

original: parinibbānakāle evaṃ cintetvā satthāraṃ daṭṭhukāmo ahosi.
analyzed: parinibbāna kāle evam cintetvā satthāram daṭṭhu kāmaḥ ahosi
translated: and at the time of his attainment of Nibbāna he thought thus and desired to see the Teacher.

original: Mā tathāgataṃ viheṭhesīti thero kira – “ete aññatitthiyā nāma attano gahaṇameva gaṇhanti,
analyzed: mā tathāgatam viheṭhesi iti theraḥ kira ete añña titthiyāḥ nāma attanaḥ gahaṇam eva gaṇhanti
translated: “Do not annoy the Tathāgata” – the Elder, it seems, thought: “These sectarians take up their own views,

original: tassa vissajjāpanatthāya bhagavato bahuṃ bhāsamānassa kāyavācāvihesā bhavissati,
analyzed: tassa vissajjāpana thāya bhagavataḥ bahum bhāsamānassa kāya vācā vihesā bhavissati
translated: and in order to explain them, the Blessed One will have to speak much, and there will be annoyance of body and speech,

original: pakatiyāpi ca kilantoyeva bhagavā”ti maññamāno evamāha. Paribbājako – “na me ayaṃ
analyzed: pakatiyā api ca kilanto yā iva bhagavā iti maññamānaḥ evam āha paribbājakaḥ na me ayam
translated: and the Blessed One is already tired by nature.” Thinking thus, he said: “Do not annoy the Tathāgata.” The wanderer thought: “This bhikkhu does not give me an opportunity,

original: bhikkhu okāsaṃ karoti, atthikena pana anuvattitvā kāretabbo”ti theraṃ anuvattanto
analyzed: bhikkhu okāsam karoti atthikena pana anuvattitvā kāretabbaḥ iti theram anuvattanto
translated: but when one has a need, one should follow the other and get it done.” Following the Elder,

original: dutiyampi tatiyampi āha.
analyzed: dutiyam pi tatiyam pi āha
translated: he said a second and a third time.

original: 213. Assosi khoti sāṇidvāre ṭhitassa bhāsato pakatisoteneva assosi, sutvā ca pana
analyzed: assosi kho ti sāṇi dvāre ṭhitassa bhāsato pakati sotena iva assosi sutvā ca pana
translated: “He heard” – he heard with his normal ear the voice of the one standing at the Sāṇā Gate. Having heard,

original: subhaddasseva atthāya mahatā ussāhena āgatattā alaṃ ānandātiādimāha. Tattha alanti
analyzed: subhaddassa iva atthāya mahatā ussāhena āgata ttā alam ānanda ati ādim āha tattha alam ti
translated: he said: “Enough, Ānanda,” etc., because he had come with great effort for the sake of Subhadda. Herein, “enough”

original: paṭikkhepatthe nipāto. Aññāpekkhovāti aññātukāmova hutvā. Abbhaññiṃsūti yathā tesaṃ
analyzed: paṭikkhepa atthe nipātaḥ añña apekkhaḥ uvā ti aññātu kāmaḥ iva hutvā abbhaññiṃsu iti yathā tesam
translated: is a negative particle. “Only wishing to know” means being desirous of knowing. “They announced” means they told him.

original: paṭiññā, tatheva jāniṃsu. Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti – sace nesaṃ sā paṭiññā niyyānikā, sabbe
analyzed: paṭiññā tathā iva jāniṃsu idam vuttam hoti sace na isam sā paṭiññā niyyānikā sabbe
translated: and they knew it to be so. This is what is meant: if their claim were the escape,🔽they would have penetrated it. If not, they would not have penetrated it. Therefore,

original: abbhaññaṃsu, no ce, na abbhaññaṃsu. Tasmā kiṃ tesaṃ paṭiññā niyyānikā, aniyyānikāti
analyzed: no ce na abbhaññaṃsu tasmā kim tesam paṭiññā niyyānikā a niyyānikā ati
translated: what is the use of their claim being the escape or not being the escape?

original: ayameva tassa pañhassa attho. Atha bhagavā tesaṃ aniyyānikabhāvakathanena atthābhāvato
analyzed: ayam eva tassa pañhassa atthaḥ atha bhagavā tesam aniyyānika bhāva kathanena attha abhāvato
translated: This is the meaning of the question. Then the Blessed One, by saying “No,” rejected the question because it was meaningless

original: ceva okāsābhāvato ca “ala”nti paṭikkhipitvā dhammameva desesi. Paṭhamayāmasmiñhi
analyzed: ca iva okāsa abhāvato ca alanti paṭikkhipitvā dhammam eva desesi paṭhama yāmasmin hi
translated: and because it was out of place, and he taught the Dhamma. For in the first watch of the night

original: mallānaṃ dhammaṃ desetvā majjhimayāme subhaddassa, pacchimayāme bhikkhusaṅghaṃ ovaditvā
analyzed: mallānam dhammam desetvā majjhima yāme subhaddassa pacchima yāme bhikkhu saṅgham ovaditvā
translated: the Blessed One had taught the Dhamma to the Mallas, in the middle watch to Subhadda, and in the last watch he had advised the Sangha of bhikkhus.

original: balavapaccūsasamaye parinibbāyissāmicceva bhagavā āgato.🔽214. Samaṇopi tattha na upalabbhatīti paṭhamo sotāpannasamaṇopi tattha natthi, dutiyo
analyzed: balava paccūsa samaye parinibbāyissām icca iva bhagavā āgataḥ  samaṇaḥ api tattha na upalabbhati iti paṭhamaḥ sotāpanna samaṇaḥ api tattha natthi dutiyaḥ
translated: Then, thinking: “I shall attain final Nibbana at the end of the night,” he came to the river Kakuttha.🔽“Even a recluse is not found there”: there is not even a first-stream-enterer recluse there,

original: sakadāgāmisamaṇopi, tatiyo anāgāmisamaṇopi, catuttho arahattasamaṇopi tattha natthīti
analyzed: sakadāgāmi samaṇaḥ api tatiyaḥ anāgāmi samaṇaḥ api catuttho arahatta samaṇaḥ api tattha natthi iti
translated: a second-stream-enterer recluse, a non-returner recluse, or an arahant recluse there.

original: attho. “Imasmiṃ kho”ti purimadesanāya aniyamato vatvā idāni attano sāsanaṃ niyamento
analyzed: imasmin kho ti purima desanāya aniyamataḥ vatvā idāni attano sāsanam niyamento
translated: “The meaning” : after stating the previous teaching without specifying, now, in order to specify his own dispensation,

original: āha. Suññā parappavādā samaṇebhīti catunnaṃ maggānaṃ atthāya āraddhavipassakehi catūhi,
analyzed: āha suññā parappavādā samaṇebhi iti catunnam maggānaṃ atthāya āraddha vipassakehi catūhi
translated: he said: “Empty are the doctrines of others of the four paths for the sake of the four who have begun insight,

original: maggaṭṭhehi catūhi, phalaṭṭhehi catūhīti dvādasahi samaṇehi suññā parappavādā tucchā
analyzed: magga ṭṭhehi catūhi phala ṭṭhehi catūhi iti dvādasahi samaṇehi suññā parappavādā tucchā
translated: of the four who are on the paths, and of the four who are on the fruits. Thus they are empty of the twelve ascetics. They are void,

original: rittakā. Ime ca subhaddāti ime dvādasa bhikkhū. Sammā vihareyyunti ettha sotāpanno
analyzed: rittakāḥ ime ca subhaddā ti ime dvādasa bhikkhū sammā vihareyyunti ettha sotāpannaḥ
translated: hollow, and vain. And these, Subhadda, are the twelve bhikkhus. They would fare rightly” : here, one who has entered the stream

original: attano adhigataṭṭhānaṃ aññassa kathetvā taṃ sotāpannaṃ karonto sammā viharati nāma.
analyzed: attanaḥ adhigata ṭṭhānam aññassa kathetvā tam sotāpannam karonto sammā viharati nāma
translated: teaches the stage he has attained to another and makes him enter the stream, and so he fares rightly.

original: Esa nayo sakadāgāmiādīsu. Sotāpattimaggaṭṭho aññampi sotāpattimaggaṭṭhaṃ karonto
analyzed: esa nayo sakadāgāmi ādīsu sotāpatti magga ṭṭho aññam pi sotāpatti magga ṭṭham karonto
translated: This is the method in regard to the once-returner, etc. One who is on the path of stream-entry makes another also enter the path of stream-entry,

original: sammā viharati nāma. Esa nayo sesamaggaṭṭhesu. Sotāpattimaggatthāya āraddhavipassako
analyzed: sammā viharati nāma esa nayo sesa magga aṭṭhesu sotāpatti magga tthāya āraddha vipassako
translated: and so he fares rightly. This is the method in regard to those who are on the same path. One who has begun insight for the sake of the path of stream-entry

original: attano paguṇaṃ kammaṭṭhānaṃ kathetvā aññampi sotāpattimaggatthāya āraddhavipassakaṃ
analyzed: attano paguṇam kammaṭṭhānam kathetvā aññam pi sotāpatti magga tthāya āraddha vipassakam
translated: teaches his own familiar meditation subject to another who has begun insight for the sake of the path of stream-entry,

original: karonto sammā viharati nāma. Esa nayo sesamaggatthāya āraddhavipassakesu. Idaṃ sandhāyāha
analyzed: karontaḥ sammā viharati nāma esa nayo sesa magga atthāya āraddha vipassakesu idam sandhāya āha
translated: He is called “one who lives rightly” when he does it. The same method applies to those who have begun insight meditation for the sake of unity. With reference to this he said: “They would live rightly.”

original: – “sammā vihareyyu”nti. Asuñño loko arahantehi assāti naḷavanaṃ saravanaṃ viya nirantaro assa.
analyzed: sammā vihareyyunti asuññaḥ lokaḥ arahantehi assa ati naḷa vanam sara vanam viya nirantaraḥ assa
translated: The world would not be empty of arahats. It would be uninterrupted like a thicket of reeds or a thicket of bamboo.

original: Ekūnatiṃso vayasāti vayena ekūnatiṃsavasso hutvā. Yaṃ pabbajinti ettha yanti nipātamattaṃ.
analyzed: ekūnatiṃsaḥ vayasā ati vayena ekūnatiṃsa vassaḥ hutvā yam pabbajin ti ettha yan ti nipāta mattam
translated: Twenty-nine years: having reached the age of twenty-nine years. Having gone forth: the word yanti is merely a particle.

original: Kiṃ kusalānuesīti “kiṃ kusala”nti anuesanto pariyesanto. Tattha – “kiṃ kusala”nti
analyzed: kim kusala anuesi iti kim kusalanti anuesanto pariyesanto tattha kim kusalanti
translated: What is the profitable to seek? Seeking, searching for what is profitable. Herein, what is profitable is

original: sabbaññutaññāṇaṃ adhippetaṃ, taṃ gavesantoti attho. Yato ahanti yato paṭṭhāya ahaṃ🔽pabbajito, etthantare samadhikāni paññāsa vassāni hontīti dasseti. Ñāyassa dhammassāti
analyzed: sabbaññuta ññāṇam adhippetam tam gavesanto ti attho yatas aham iti yatas paṭṭhāya aham  pabbajitaḥ etthantare samadhikāni paññāsa vassāni honti iti dasseti ñāyassa dhammassa ati
translated: intended as the knowledge of omniscience; the meaning is, seeking that. Since I went forth: since the time when I went forth.🔽In the interval there have been more than fifty years, is what is shown. The Dhamma of the discipline: the Dhamma of the noble path.

original: ariyamaggadhammassa. Padesavattīti padese vipassanāmagge pavattanto. Ito bahiddhāti
analyzed: ariya magga dhammassa padesa vattī iti padese vipassanā magge pavattantaḥ itas bahiddhā ti
translated: A region’s practiser: practising in a region, in insight meditation. Outside here:

original: mama sāsanato bahiddhā. Samaṇopi natthīti padesavattivipassakopi natthi, paṭhamasamaṇo
analyzed: mama sāsanataḥ bahiddhā samaṇaḥ api na atthi iti padesa vatti vipassakaḥ api na atthi paṭhama samaṇo
translated: outside my dispensation. There is not even an ascetic: there is not even an insight meditator who is a region’s practiser, a first-class ascetic,

original: sotāpannopi natthīti vuttaṃ hoti.
analyzed: sotāpannaḥ pi na atthi iti vuttam hoti
translated: “There is no one who has entered the stream” means that there is no one who has entered the stream.

original: Ye etthāti ye tumhe ettha sāsane satthārā sammukhā antevāsikābhisekena abhisittā,
analyzed: ye ettha ati ye tumhe ettha sāsane satthārā sammukhāḥ antevāsika abhisekena abhisittā
translated: “You who have been consecrated by the Teacher in your presence with the consecration of a disciple” means that you who have been consecrated by the Teacher in your presence with the consecration of a disciple in this Dispensation,

original: tesaṃ vo lābhā tesaṃ vo suladdhanti. Bāhirasamaye kira yaṃ antevāsikaṃ ācariyo –
analyzed: tesam vaḥ lābhā tesam vaḥ bāhira samaye kira yam antevāsikam
translated: “it is a gain for you, it is a great gain for you” means that at the time of the outside teacher, it seems, when a teacher said to a disciple,

original: “imaṃ pabbājehi, imaṃ ovada, imaṃ anusāsā”ti vadati, so tena attano ṭhāne ṭhapito
analyzed: imam pabbājehi imam ovada imam anusāsa ati vadati so tena attanaḥ ṭhāne ṭhapitaḥ
translated: “Ordain this one, instruct this one, advise this one,” he was placed in his own position by that.

original: hoti, tasmā tassa – “imaṃ pabbajehi, imaṃ ovada, imaṃ anusāsā”ti ime lābhā honti.
analyzed: hoti tasmā tassa imam pabbajehi imam ovada imam anusāsa ati ime lābhāḥ honti
translated: Therefore, “Ordain this one, instruct this one, advise this one” were gains for him.

original: Therampi subhaddo tameva bāhirasamayaṃ gahetvā evamāha.
analyzed: theram pi subhaddaḥ tam eva bāhira samayam gahetvā evam āha
translated: The elder Subhadda, taking that same outside teacher’s time, spoke thus.🔽“He obtained” : how did he obtain it? The elder, it seems, took him to one side,

original: Alattha khoti kathaṃ alattha? Thero kira naṃ ekamantaṃ netvā udakatumbato pānīyena
analyzed: alattha khoti katham alattha thero kira nam ekamantam netvā udaka tumbataḥ pānīyena
translated: wetted his head with water from a water-pot,

original: sīsaṃ temetvā tacapañcakakammaṭṭhānaṃ kathetvā kesamassuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni
analyzed: sīsam temetvā tacapañcaka kammaṭṭhānam kathetvā kesa massuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni
translated: explained the meditation subject of the five lower fetters, had his hair and beard shaved,🔽had him clothed in yellow robes,

original: acchādāpetvā saraṇāni datvā bhagavato santikaṃ ānesi. Bhagavā upasampādetvā kammaṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: acchādāpetvā saraṇāni da tvā bhagavato santikam ānesi bhagavā upasampādetvā kammaṭṭhānaṃ
translated: gave him the refuges, and brought him to the Blessed One. The Blessed One ordained him and gave him a meditation subject,

original: ācikkhi. So taṃ gahetvā uyyānassa ekamante caṅkamaṃ adhiṭṭhāya ghaṭento vāyamanto
analyzed: ācikkhi saḥ tam gahetvā uyyānassa eka mante caṅkamam adhiṭṭhāya ghaṭentaḥ vā āyamantaḥ
translated: The Blessed One explained it to him. He took it, and after determining a walk in a certain part of the park, he exerted and strove.

original: vipassanaṃ vaḍḍhento saha paṭisambhidāhi arahattaṃ patvā āgamma bhagavantaṃ vanditvā
analyzed: vipassanam vaḍḍhento saha paṭisambhidāhi arahattam patvā āgamma bhagavantam vanditvā
translated: Increasing insight, he reached Arahantship together with the discriminations. He came to the Blessed One, paid homage to him,

original: nisīdi. Taṃ sandhāya – “acirūpasampanno kho panā”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: tam sandhāya acira upasampannaḥ kho pana itiādi vuttam
translated: and sat down. The words “not long after his full admission” and so on were said referring to him.

original: So ca bhagavato pacchimo sakkhisāvako ahosīti saṅgītikārakānaṃ vacanaṃ. Tattha yo
analyzed: so ca bhagavato pacchimaḥ sakkhi sāvako ahosi iti saṅgīti kārakānam vacanam tattha yaḥ
translated: And he was the Blessed One’s last disciple who was a witness, according to the compilers of the Commentaries. Herein,

original: bhagavati dharamāne pabbajitvā aparabhāge upasampadaṃ labhitvā kammaṭṭhānaṃ gahetvā🔽arahattaṃ pāpuṇāti, upasampadampi vā dharamāneyeva labhitvā aparabhāge kammaṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: bhagavati dharamāne pabbajitvā aparabhāge upasampadam labhitvā kammaṭṭhānam gahetvā  arahattam pāpuṇāti upasampadam pi vā labhitvā aparabhāge kammaṭṭhānam
translated: one who goes forth while the Blessed One is still living, obtains admission afterwards, takes up a meditation subject,🔽and reaches Arahantship, or who obtains admission while the Blessed One is still living, takes up a meditation subject afterwards,

original: gahetvā arahattaṃ pāpuṇāti, kammaṭṭhānampi vā dharamāneyeva gahetvā aparabhāge arahattameva
analyzed: gahetvā arahattam pāpuṇāti kammaṭṭhānam pi vā gahetvā apara bhāge arahattam eva
translated: and reaches Arahantship, or who takes up a meditation subject while the Blessed One is still living, and reaches Arahantship afterwards,

original: pāpuṇāti, sabbopi so pacchimo sakkhisāvako. Ayaṃ pana dharamāneyeva bhagavati pabbajito
analyzed: pāpuṇāti sabbaḥ api so pacchimaḥ sakkhi sāvakaḥ ayam pana dharamāneya iva bhagavati pabbajitaḥ
translated: is all of them a “last disciple who was a witness.” But this Elder went forth

original: ca upasampanno ca kammaṭṭhānañca gahetvā arahattaṃ pattoti.
analyzed: ca upasampanno ca kammaṭṭhānañca gahetvā arahattam pattoti
translated: and he was fully admitted to the Order, and he took up a meditation subject, and he reached Arahantship.

original: Pañcamabhāṇavāravaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: pañcama bhāṇa vāra vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the fifth recitation section is finished.

original: Tathāgatapacchimavācāvaṇṇanā
translated: The Exalted One’s last words

original: 216. Idāni bhikkhusaṅghassa ovādaṃ ārabhi, taṃ dassetuṃ atha kho bhagavātiādi vuttaṃ.🔽Tattha desito paññattoti dhammopi desito ceva paññatto ca, vinayopi desito ceva paññatto
analyzed: idāni bhikkhu saṅghassa ovādam ārabhi tam dassetum atha kho bhagavā iti ādi vuttaṃ  tattha desito paññattoti dhammaḥ api desitaḥ ca iva paññatto ca vinayaḥ api desitaḥ ca iva paññatto
translated: Now the Exalted One began his exhortation to the community of bhikkhus. To show this, the text says, “Then the Exalted One said to the bhikkhus.”

original: ca. Paññatto ca nāma ṭhapito paṭṭhapitoti attho. So vo mamaccayenāti so dhammavinayo
analyzed: ca paññatto ca nāma ṭhapito paṭṭhapito ti attho saḥ vaḥ mamaccayena ati so dhamma vinayo
translated: Herein, taught and formulated means that the Dhamma and the Discipline were both taught and formulated. Formulated means established and laid down. That Dhamma and Discipline

original: tumhākaṃ mamaccayena satthā. Mayā hi vo ṭhiteneva – “idaṃ lahukaṃ, idaṃ garukaṃ,
analyzed: tumhākam mamaccayena satthā mayā hi vaḥ ṭhitena iva idam lahukam idam garukam
translated: will be your teacher after my passing away. For it was only because I was present that you could say, “This is a light matter, this a serious matter;

analyzed: idam sa tekiccham idam atekiccham idam loka vajjam idam paṇṇatti vajjam ayam āpatti
translated: this can be done, this cannot be done; this is allowable, this is not allowable.”

original: puggalassa santike vuṭṭhāti, ayaṃ āpatti gaṇassa santike vuṭṭhāti, ayaṃ saṅghassa
analyzed: puggalassa santike vuṭṭhāti ayam āpatti gaṇassa santike vuṭṭhāti ayam saṅghassa

analyzed: santike vuṭṭhāti iti satta āpatti khandha vasena otiṇṇe vatthusmim sa khandhaka parivāraḥ
translated: and it is in the vicinity that he awakens.”

original: ubhatovibhaṅgo vinayo nāma desito, taṃ sakalampi vinayapiṭakaṃ mayi parinibbute tumhākaṃ
analyzed: ubhatas vibhaṅgaḥ vinayaḥ nāma desitaḥ tam sakalam pi vinaya piṭakam mayi parinibbute tumhākam
translated: The Vinaya, which is called the “dual-version commentary,”

original: satthukiccaṃ sādhessati.
analyzed: satthu kiccam sādhessati
translated: is taught in the context of the seven classes of offenses, together with the individual classes of offenses.🔽The entire Vinaya Piṭaka will accomplish the duties of a teacher for you🔽after I have attained final Nibbāna.🔽And while I was still alive, I analyzed and taught the discourses of the Sutta Piṭaka

original: Ṭhiteneva ca mayā – “ime cattāro satipaṭṭhānā, cattāro sammappadhānā, cattāro iddhipādā,
analyzed: ṭhitena iva ca mayā ime cattāro satipaṭṭhānā cattāro sammappadhānā cattāro iddhipādā
translated: in various ways, such as “These are the four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four bases of spiritual success,

analyzed: pañca indriyāni pañca balāni satta bojjhaṅgāḥ ariyaḥ aṭṭhaṅgikaḥ maggo ti tena tena ākārena
translated: the five faculties, the five powers, the seven factors of awakening, and the noble eightfold path.”

analyzed: ime dhamme vibhajitvā vibhajitvā suttanta piṭakam desitam tam sakalam pi suttanta piṭakam

analyzed: mayi parinibbute tumhākam satthu kiccam sādhessati ṭhitena iva ca mayā ime pañca kkhandhāḥ
translated: in various ways, such as “These are the five aggregates,

original: dvādasāyatanāni, aṭṭhārasa dhātuyo, cattāri saccāni, bāvīsatindriyāni, nava hetū,
analyzed: dvādasa āyatanāni aṭṭhārasa dhātuyaḥ cattāri saccāni bāvīsati indriyāni nava hetū
translated: the twelve sense spheres, the eighteen elements, the four noble truths, the twenty-two faculties, the nine causes,

analyzed: cattāro āhārā satta phassā satta vedanā satta saññā satta sañcetanā satta cittāni  tatra api ettakāḥ dhammāḥ kāmāvacarāḥ ettakāḥ rūpāvacarāḥ ettakāḥ arūpāvacarāḥ ettakā  pariyāpannāḥ ettakāḥ apariyāpannāḥ ettakāḥ lokiyāḥ ettakāḥ lokuttarāḥ ti ime dhamme
translated: the four nutriments, the seven stations of consciousness, the seven stations of perception, the seven kinds of pleasure and pain, the seven kinds of consciousness.🔽Herein, ‘so many ideas belong to the Sensuous-Object Sphere, so many to the Fine-material Sphere, so many to the Immaterial Sphere,🔽so many are included, so many are not included, so many are mundane, so many are supramundane’ .🔽These ideas

analyzed: vibhajitvā vibhajitvā catuvīsati samanta paṭṭhāna ananta naya mahā paṭṭhāna paṭimaṇḍitam 🔽abhidhamma piṭakam desitam tam sakalam pi abhidhamma piṭakam mayi parinibbute tumhākam 🔽satthu kiccam sādhessati 🔽iti sabbam petam abhisambodhitaḥ yāva parinibbānā pañcacattālīsa vassāni bhāsitam lapitam 🔽tīṇi piṭakāni pañca nikāyāḥ navaṅgāni catur āsīti dhammakkhandha sahassāni iti 🔽evam mahā apabhedam hoti iti imāni catur asīti dhammakkhandha sahassāni tiṭṭhanti aham
translated: There are four nutriments, seven stations of consciousness, seven stations of equanimity, seven abodes of beings, seven misapprehensions, seven bonds, seven latent tendencies, seven kinds original: ekova parinibbāyāmi. Ahañca kho pana dāni ekakova ovadāmi anusāsāmi, mayi parinibbute

translated: I shall attain final Nibbana all alone. But now I instruct and admonish you alone. After my final Nibbana

original: imāni caturāsīti dhammakkhandhasahassāni tumhe ovadissanti anusāsissantīti evaṃ bhagavā
analyzed: imāni catur asīti dhammakkhandha sahassāni tumhe ovadissanti anusāsissanti iti evam bhagavā
translated: these 84,000 sections of the Dhamma will instruct and admonish you.” Thus the Blessed One,🔽showing many reasons, instructed: “He will be your teacher after my passing away.” Then, showing the future practice,

original: bahūni kāraṇāni dassento – “so vo mamaccayena satthā”ti ovaditvā puna anāgate cārittaṃ🔽dassento yathā kho panātiādimāha.🔽Tattha samudācarantīti kathenti voharanti. Nāmena vā gottena vāti navakāti avatvā🔽“tissa, nāgā”ti evaṃ nāmena vā, “kassapa, gotamā”ti evaṃ gottena vā, “āvuso tissa,
analyzed: bahūni kāraṇāni dassento saḥ vaḥ mamaccayena satthā ati ovaditvā puna anāgate cārittam  dassentaḥ yathā kho pana ati ādim āha  tattha samudācaranti iti kathenti voharanti nāmena vā gottena vā ati avatvā  tissa nāgā ti evam nāmena vā kassapa gotamā ti evam gottena vā āvuso tissa
translated: he said, “But, bhikkhus, in the future there will be some bhikkhus” .🔽Herein, they will talk about them thus: “He is a bhikkhu of such a name,” or “He is a bhikkhu of such and such a clan,” or “He is a bhikkhu of such a village or town,” or “He is a bhikkhu of such a country.”🔽Or they will talk about them thus: “He is a bhikkhu called so-and-so,” or “He is a bhikkhu of such and such a clan,” or “He is a bhikkhu called so-and-so of such a village or town,” or “He is a bhikkhu called so-and-so of such a country.”

original: āvuso kassapā”ti evaṃ āvusovādena vā samudācaritabbo. Bhanteti vā āyasmāti vāti bhante🔽tissa, āyasmā tissāti evaṃ samudācaritabbo. Samūhanatūti ākaṅkhamāno samūhanatu,
analyzed: āvuso kassapa ati evam āvuso vādena vā samudācaritabbaḥ bhante iti vā āyasma ati vā ati bhante 🔽tissaḥ tissā iti evam samudācaritabbaḥ samūhanatu uti ākaṅkhamānaḥ samūhanatu
translated: Or they will talk about them thus: “He is a bhikkhu called so-and-so,” or “He is a bhikkhu of such and such a clan,” or “He is a bhikkhu called so-and-so of such a village or town,” or “He is a bhikkhu called so-and-so of such a country.”🔽Or they will talk about them thus: “He is a bhikkhu called so-and-so,” or “He is a bhikkhu of such and such a clan,” or “He is a bhikkhu called so-and-so of such a village or town,” or “He is a bhikkhu called so-and-so of such a country.”🔽Or they will talk about them thus: “He is a bhikkhu called so-and-so,” or “He is a bhikkhu of such and such a clan,” or “He is a bhikkhu called so-and-so of such a village or town,” or “He is a bhikkhu called so-and-so of such a country.”

original: yadi icchati samūhaneyyāti attho. Kasmā pana samūhanathāti ekaṃseneva avatvā vikappavacaneneva
analyzed: yadi icchati samūhaneyyā iti kasmā pana ekaṃsena iva avatvā vikappa vacanena iva
translated: But why did he not abolish it outright, saying, “Abolish it,” but rather established it by a special pronouncement?

original: ṭhapesīti? Mahākassapassa balaṃ diṭṭhattā. Passati hi bhagavā – “samūhanathāti vuttepi
analyzed: ṭhapesi iti mahākassapassa balam diṭṭhattā passati hi bhagavā vutte pi
translated: Because he saw the strength of the Elder Mahā Kassapa. For the Exalted One saw that even if he had said, “Abolish it,”

original: saṅgītikāle kassapo na samūhanissatī”ti. Tasmā vikappeneva ṭhapesi.🔽Tattha – “ekacce therā evamāhaṃsu – cattāri pārājikāni ṭhapetvā avasesāni khuddānukhuddakānī”tiādinā
analyzed: saṅgīti kāle kassapaḥ na samūhanissati iti tasmai vikappena iva ṭhapesi  tattha ekacce therāḥ evam āhaṃsu cattāri pārājikāni ṭhapetvā avasesāni khudda anukhuddakāni iti ādinā
translated: Kassapa would not have abolished it at the time of the rehearsal. Therefore he established it by a special pronouncement.

original: nayena pañcasatikasaṅgītiyaṃ khuddānukhuddakakathā āgatāva vinicchayo pettha samantapāsādikāyaṃ
analyzed: nayena pañca satika saṅgītiyam khudda anukhuddaka kathā āgatā ava vinicchayo pettha samantapāsādikāyam
translated: Herein, the discussion of the minor and very minor rules is found only in the rehearsal of the five hundred, where the elders said, “Except for the four pārājikas, the rest are minor and very minor” . The commentary on this is given in the Samantapāsādikā.

original: vutto. Keci panāhu – “bhante, nāgasena, katamaṃ khuddakaṃ, katamaṃ anukhuddaka”nti
analyzed: vuttaḥ keci pana āhu bhante nāgasena katamam khuddakam katamam anukhuddakam ti
translated: But some say that the Elder Nāgasena knew the minor and very minor rules because he was asked by King Milinda, “Venerable sir, what is minor and what is very minor?”

original: milindena raññā pucchito. “Dukkaṭaṃ, mahārāja, khuddakaṃ, dubbhāsitaṃ anukhuddaka”nti
analyzed: milindena raññā pucchitaḥ dukkaṭam mahā rāja khuddakam dubbhāsitam anukhuddakam ti
translated: and replied, “Minor, great king, is wrong conduct by body and wrong conduct by speech, and very minor is wrong conduct by mind” .

original: vuttattā nāgasenatthero khuddānukhuddakaṃ jānāti. Mahākassapo pana taṃ ajānanto –
analyzed: vutta ttā nāgasena theraḥ khuddānukhuddakam jānāti mahākassapaḥ pana tam a jānantaḥ
translated: But the Elder Mahā Kassapa, not knowing the minor and very minor rules,

original: “Suṇātu me, āvuso, saṅgho santamhākaṃ sikkhāpadāni gihigatāni, gihinopi jānanti –
analyzed: suṇātu me āvuso saṅghaḥ santamhākam sikkhāpadāni gihi gatāni gihinaḥ api jānanti
translated: “Venerable sirs, let the Sangha listen to me. There are training rules for us that are also for householders. Householders know:

original: “idaṃ vo samaṇānaṃ sakyaputtiyānaṃ kappati, idaṃ vo na kappatī”ti. Sace mayaṃ khuddānukhuddakāni
analyzed: idam vaḥ samaṇānam sakyaputtiyānam kappati idam vaḥ na kappati iti sace mayam khuddānukhuddakāni
translated: ‘This is allowable for you monastics, this is not allowable for you monastics.’ If we abolish the minor and minor training rules,

original: sikkhāpadāni samūhanissāma, bhavissanti vattāro – “dhūmakālikaṃ samaṇena gotamena🔽sāvakānaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ, yāva nesaṃ satthā aṭṭhāsi, tāvime sikkhāpadesu sikkhiṃsu,🔽yato imesaṃ satthā parinibbuto, na dānime sikkhāpadesu sikkhantī”ti. Yadi saṅghassa
analyzed: sikkhāpadāni samūhanissāma bhavissanti vattāraḥ dhūmakālikam samaṇena gotamena  sāvakānam sikkhāpadam paññattam yāva nesam satthā aṭṭhāsi tau ime sikkhāpadesu sikkhiṃsu  yatas imesam satthā parinibbutaḥ na dāni ime sikkhāpadesu sikkhanti iti yadi saṅghassa
translated: there will be those who say, ‘When the ascetic Gotama was alive,

original: pattakallaṃ, saṅgho apaññattaṃ na paññapeyya, paññattaṃ na samucchindeyya, yathāpaññattesu
analyzed: patta kallam saṅghaḥ a paññattam na paññapeyya paññattam na samucchindeyya yathā paññattesu
translated: the training rules were practiced by his disciples, but now that he has attained final extinguishment, they don’t practice them.’ If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should not make what has not been laid down, nor abolish what has been laid down.

original: sikkhāpadesu samādāya vatteyya. Esā ñattīti –
analyzed: sikkhāpadesu samādāya vatteyya esā ñattī iti
translated: The Sangha should undertake and follow the training rules as they have been laid down. This is the motion.

original: Kammavācaṃ sāvesīti. Na taṃ evaṃ gahetabbaṃ. Nāgasenatthero hi – “paravādino okāso
analyzed: kamma vācam sāvesi iti na tat evam gahetabbam nāgasena theraḥ hi paravādinaḥ okāsaḥ
translated: He should recite the announcement: but it should not be taken like this. For the Elder Nāgasena said:🔽“The opponents have an opportunity

original: mā ahosī”ti evamāha. Mahākassapatthero “khuddānukhuddakāpattiṃ na samūhanissāmī”ti kammavācaṃ sāvesi.
analyzed: mā ahosi iti evam āha mahākassapa ttheraḥ khuddānukhuddaka āpattim na samūhanissāmi iti kamma vācam sāvesi
translated: The Elder Kassapa the Great said, “I shall not conceal a grave or minor offence,” and he recited the Kammavācā.

original: Brahmadaṇḍakathāpi saṅgītiyaṃ āgatattāsamantapāsādikāyaṃ vinicchitā.🔽Kaṅkhāti dveḷhakaṃ. Vimatīti vinicchituṃ asamatthatā, buddho nu kho, na buddho nu🔽kho, dhammo nu kho, na dhammo nu kho, saṅgho nu kho, na saṅgho nu kho, maggo nu kho,
analyzed: brahmadaṇḍa kathā api vinicchitā  kaṅkhāti dveḷhakam vimatī iti vinicchitum asamattha tā buddhaḥ nu kho na buddhaḥ nu  kho dhammaḥ nu kho na dhammaḥ nu kho saṅghaḥ nu kho na saṅghaḥ nu kho maggaḥ nu kho
translated: The story of the Brahmā’s rod is given in the Saṅgīti and is commented on in the Samantapāsādikā.

original: na maggo nu kho, paṭipadā nu kho, na paṭipadā nu khoti yassa saṃsayo uppajjeyya,🔽taṃ vo vadāmi “pucchatha bhikkhave”ti ayamettha saṅkhepattho. Satthugāravenāpi na
analyzed: na maggaḥ nu kho paṭipadā nu kho na paṭipadā nu khoti yassa saṃsayaḥ uppajjeyya  tam vaḥ vadāmi pucchatha bhikkhave ti ayam ettha saṅkhepa atthaḥ satthu gāravena api na
translated: Doubt is twofold: doubt and uncertainty. Uncertainty is the inability to decide. “Is he enlightened or not? Is it the Dhamma or not? Is it the Saṅgha or not? Is it the path or not? Is it the practice or not?” If doubt arises in one,🔽I say to you: “Ask, bhikkhus.” This is the meaning in brief.

original: puccheyyāthāti mayaṃ satthusantike pabbajimha, cattāro paccayāpi no satthu santakāva,
analyzed: puccheyyātha ati mayam satthu santike pabbajimha cattāro paccayā api no satthu santakā ava
translated: “You should not ask out of respect for the Teacher.” “We went forth in the presence of the Teacher. The four requisites are also the Teacher’s.

original: te mayaṃ ettakaṃ kālaṃ kaṅkhaṃ akatvā na arahāma ajja pacchimakāle kaṅkhaṃ kātunti
analyzed: te mayam ettakam kālam kaṅkham a katvā na arahāma ajja pacchima kāle kaṅkham kātunti
translated: We have not asked for so long. We are not worthy to ask today, at the end.”

original: sace evaṃ satthari gāravena na pucchatha. Sahāyakopi bhikkhave sahāyakassa ārocetūti🔽tumhākaṃ yo yassa bhikkhuno sandiṭṭho sambhatto, so tassa ārocetu, ahaṃ etassa bhikkhussa
analyzed: sace evam satthari gāravena na pucchatha sahāyakaḥ api bhikkhave sahāyakassa ārocetu uti  tumhākam yaḥ yassa bhikkhuno sandiṭṭhaḥ sambhatto saḥ tassa ārocetu aham etassa bhikkhussa
translated: If you do not ask the Teacher out of respect, then, monks, a friend should inform a friend.

original: kathessāmi, tassa kathaṃ sutvā sabbe nikkaṅkhā bhavissathāti dasseti.
analyzed: kathessāmi tassa katham sutvā sabbe nikkaṅkhāḥ bhavissatha ati dasseti
translated: He shows that whoever is a friend of a monk should inform him, “I will tell this monk, and having heard his explanation, all of you will be free from doubt.”

original: Evaṃ pasannoti evaṃ saddahāmi ahanti attho. Ñāṇamevāti nikkaṅkhabhāvapaccakkhakaraṇañāṇaṃyeva,🔽ettha tathāgatassa na saddhāmattanti attho. Imesañhi, ānandāti imesaṃ antosāṇiyaṃ
analyzed: evam pasannaḥ iti evam saddahāmi aham ti atthaḥ ñāṇam eva ati nikkaṅkha bhāva paccakkha karaṇa ñāṇam yeva  ettha tathāgatassa na saddhā mattan ti atthaḥ imesam hi ānanda ati imesam antosāṇiyam
translated: Thus have I heard means I have faith in this way, I believe it, is the meaning. Knowledge itself means the knowledge that makes manifest the state of being free from doubt.🔽The meaning is that here there is no mere faith in the Realised One. Of these five hundred monks sitting inside the room,

original: nisinnānaṃ pañcannaṃ bhikkhusatānaṃ. Yo pacchimakoti yo guṇavasena pacchimako. Ānandattheraṃyeva sandhāyāha.
analyzed: nisinnānam pañcannam bhikkhu satānam yaḥ pacchimakaḥ ti yaḥ guṇa vasena pacchimakaḥ sandhāya āha
translated: the last one means the last one in terms of virtue. He speaks with reference to the Elder Ānanda alone.

original: 218. Appamādena sampādethāti satiavippavāsena sabbakiccāni sampādeyyātha. Iti bhagavā
analyzed: appamādena sampādetha ati sati avippavāsena sabba kiccāni sampādeyyātha iti bhagavā
translated: Accomplish all things with heedfulness means you should accomplish all things by not being separated from mindfulness. Thus the Fortunate One,

original: parinibbānamañce nipanno pañcacattālīsa vassāni dinnaṃ ovādaṃ sabbaṃ ekasmiṃ appamādapadeyeva
analyzed: parinibbāna mañce nipannaḥ pañcacattālīsa vassāni dinnam ovādam sabbam ekasmin
translated: and lying on the bed of his final passing, for forty-five years he gave the whole advice in just one verse on heedfulness.

original: pakkhipitvā adāsi. Ayaṃ tathāgatassa pacchimā vācāti idaṃ pana saṅgītikārakānaṃ vacanaṃ.
analyzed: pakkhipitvā adāsi ayam tathāgatassa pacchimā vācā ti idam pana saṅgīti kārakānam vacanam
translated: He lay down on the bed prepared for his final passing, and he gave the advice he had given for forty-five years, all of it, in the single phrase “Be earnest,” and he gave it to them. This was the last utterance of the Tathāgata. This is the statement of the compilers of the canon.

original: Parinibbutakathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: parinibbuta kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The description of the parinibbāna

original: 219. Ito paraṃ yaṃ parinibbānaparikammaṃ katvā bhagavā parinibbuto, taṃ dassetuṃ🔽atha kho bhagavā paṭhamaṃ jhānantiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha parinibbuto bhanteti nirodhaṃ
analyzed: itas param yam parinibbāna parikammam katvā bhagavā parinibbutaḥ tam dassetuṃ  atha kho bhagavā paṭhamam jhāna nti ādi vuttam tattha parinibbutaḥ bhante ti nirodham
translated: Now, in order to show how the Blessed One attained final Nibbāna after performing the duties of his last day, it is said:

original: samāpannassa bhagavato assāsapassāsānaṃ abhāvaṃ disvā pucchati. Na āvusoti thero🔽kathaṃ jānāti? Thero kira satthārā saddhiṃyeva taṃ taṃ samāpattiṃ samāpajjanto yāva🔽nevasaññānāsaññāyatanā vuṭṭhānaṃ, tāva gantvā idāni bhagavā nirodhaṃ samāpanno, antonirodhe
analyzed: samāpannassa bhagavataḥ assāsa passāsānam abhāvam disvā pucchati na āvuso ti thero  katham jānāti theraḥ kira satthārā saddhiṃyā iva tam tam samāpattim samāpajjantaḥ yāva  nevasaññānāsaññāyatanāḥ vuṭṭhānam tāva gantvā idāni bhagavā nirodham samāpannaḥ antonirodhe
translated: “Then the Blessed One, having risen from that concentration, addressed the venerable Ānanda” , and so on. Herein, “He has attained final Nibbāna, venerable sir” : he asks this because he sees that there is no more in-breath and out-breath in the Blessed One who has entered cessation. “No, friend” :

original: ca kālaṅkiriyā nāma natthīti jānāti.
analyzed: ca kālaṅkiriyā nāma natthi iti jānāti
translated: How does the elder know? The elder had entered upon the various kinds of attainment together with the Master, it seems, and he had gone as far as the emergence from the base consisting of neither perception nor non-perception. Now the Blessed One has entered cessation. And there is no such thing as death in the cessation that is the Blessed One’s final Nibbāna. That is how he knew.

original: Atha kho bhagavā saññāvedayitanirodhasamāpattiyā vuṭṭhahitvā nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṃ🔽samāpajji…pe… tatiyajjhānā vuṭṭhahitvā catutthajjhānaṃ samāpajjīti ettha bhagavā
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā saññā vedayita nirodha samāpattiyāḥ vuṭṭhahitvā nevasaññānāsaññāyatanam  samāpajjipe tatiya jhānā vuṭṭhahitvā catuttha jhānam samāpajji iti ettha bhagavā
translated: Then the Blessed One, emerging from the attainment of the cessation of perception and feeling, entered the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception.

original: catuvīsatiyā ṭhānesu paṭhamajjhānaṃ samāpajji, terasasu ṭhānesu dutiyajjhānaṃ, tathā
analyzed: catuvīsatiyāḥ ṭhānesu paṭhama jhānam samāpajji terasasu ṭhānesu dutiya jhānam tathā
translated: … emerging from the third jhana he entered the fourth jhana. Herein, the Blessed One entered the first jhana in twenty-four places, the second jhana in thirteen places,

original: tatiyajjhānaṃ, pannarasasu ṭhānesu catutthajjhānaṃ samāpajji. Kathaṃ? Dasasu asubhesu,🔽dvattiṃsākāre aṭṭhasu kasiṇesu, mettākaruṇāmuditāsu, ānāpāne, paricchedākāseti imesu🔽tāva catuvīsatiyā ṭhānesu paṭhamajjhānaṃ samāpajji. Ṭhapetvā pana dvattiṃsākārañca
analyzed: tatiya jhānam pannarasasu ṭhānesu catuttha jhānam samāpajji katham dasasu asubhesu  dvattiṃsa ākāre aṭṭhasu kasiṇesu mettā karuṇā muditāsu āna apāne pariccheda ākāsā iti imesu  tāva catuvīsatiyā ṭhānesu paṭhamajjhānam samāpajji ṭhapetvā pana dvattiṃsa ākāram ca
translated: the third jhana in thirteen places, and the fourth jhana in fifteen places. How? In the ten kinds of foulness,

original: dasa asubhāni ca sesesu terasasu dutiyajjhānaṃ, tesuyeva ca tatiyajjhānaṃ samāpajji.
analyzed: dasa asubhāni ca sesesu terasasu dutiya jhānam ca tatiya jhānam samāpajji
translated: in the thirty-two aspects of the body, in the eight perception-spheres of mastery, in the four divine abidings, in mindfulness of breathing, and in the delimitation of space—in these twenty-four places he entered the first jhana. But omitting the thirty-two aspects of the body and the ten kinds of foulness, he entered the second jhana in the remaining thirteen places, and he entered the third jhana in those same thirteen places.

original: Aṭṭhasu pana kasiṇesu, upekkhābrahmavihāre, ānāpāne, paricchedākāse, catūsu arūpesūti
analyzed: aṭṭhasu pana kasiṇesu upekkhā brahmavihāre āna apāne pariccheda ākāse catūsu arūpesu uti
translated: But in the eight kasiṇas, in the divine abiding of equanimity, in mindfulness of breathing, in the delimitation of space, and in the four immaterial states—

original: imesu pannarasasu ṭhānesu catutthajjhānaṃ samāpajji. Ayampi ca saṅkhepakathāva. Nibbānapuraṃ
analyzed: imesu pannarasasu ṭhānesu catuttha jhānam samāpajji ayam pi ca saṅkhepa kathā va nibbāna puram
translated: He attained the fourth jhāna in these fifteen places. And this is a brief account.

original: pavisanto pana bhagavā dhammassāmī sabbāpi catuvīsatikoṭisatasahassasaṅkhyā samāpattiyo
analyzed: pavisantaḥ pana bhagavā dhammassāmī sabbā api catuvīsati koṭi sata sahassa saṅkhyā samāpattiyaḥ
translated: But when the Lord, the Master of the Dhamma, entered the city of Nibbāna, he entered it after first visiting all the twenty-four kinds of attainment,

original: pavisitvā videsaṃ gacchanto ñātijanaṃ āliṅgetvā viya sabbasamāpattisukhaṃ anubhavitvā paviṭṭho.🔽Catutthajjhānā vuṭṭhahitvā samanantarā bhagavā parinibbāyīti ettha jhānasamanantaraṃ,
analyzed: pavisitvā videsam gacchantaḥ ñāti janam āliṅgetvā viya sabba samāpatti sukham anubhavitvā paviṭṭhaḥ  catuttha jhānā vuṭṭhahitvā samanantarā bhagavā parinibbāyi iti ettha jhāna samanantaram
translated: as if embracing his kinsmen, and experiencing the happiness of all the attainments.

original: paccavekkhaṇāsamanantaranti dve samanantarāni. Tattha jhānā vuṭṭhāya bhavaṅgaṃ otiṇṇassa
analyzed: paccavekkhaṇā samanantaranti dve samanantarāni tattha jhānā vuṭṭhāya bhavaṅgam otiṇṇassa
translated: When the Blessed One had emerged from the fourth jhāna, he attained final Nibbāna immediately afterwards. Herein, ‘immediately afterwards’ is twofold, namely immediately after jhāna and immediately after reviewing.🔽Herein, when one who has emerged from a jhāna enters the life-continuum there,

original: tattheva parinibbānaṃ jhānasamanantaraṃ nāma. Jhānā vuṭṭhahitvā puna jhānaṅgāni paccavekkhitvā
analyzed: tattha iva parinibbānam jhāna samanantaram nāma jhānā vuṭṭhahitvā puna jhānaṅgāni paccavekkhitvā
translated: his final Nibbāna is called ‘immediately after jhāna’. But when one who has emerged from a jhāna reviews the jhāna factors and then enters the life-continuum there,

original: bhavaṅgaṃ otiṇṇassa tattheva parinibbānaṃ paccavekkhaṇāsamanantaraṃ nāma. Imānipi
analyzed: bhavaṅgam otiṇṇassa tattha iva parinibbānam paccavekkhaṇā samanantaram nāma imāni pi
translated: his final Nibbāna is called ‘immediately after reviewing’. These are the two kinds of ‘immediately afterwards’.

original: dve samanantarāneva. Bhagavā pana jhānaṃ samāpajjitvā jhānā vuṭṭhāya jhānaṅgāni paccavekkhitvā
analyzed: dve bhagavā pana jhānam samāpajjitvā jhānā vuṭṭhāya jhāna aṅgāni paccavekkhitvā
translated: But the Blessed One, after attaining jhāna, emerged from jhāna and reviewed the jhāna factors.

original: bhavaṅgacittena abyākatena dukkhasaccena parinibbāyi. Ye hi keci buddhā vā paccekabuddhā🔽vā ariyasāvakā vā antamaso kunthakipillikaṃ upādāya sabbe bhavaṅgacitteneva abyākatena
analyzed: bhavaṅga cittena abyākatena dukkha saccena parinibbāyi ye hi keci buddhāḥ vā paccekabuddhāḥ  vā ariya sāvakāḥ vā antamasaḥ kuntha kipillikam upādāya sabbe bhavaṅga cittena iva abyākatena
translated: Then he attained parinibbāna with the neutral mind of the life-continuum, which is the truth of suffering.

original: dukkhasaccena kālaṅkarontīti. Mahābhūmicālādīni vuttanayānevāti.
analyzed: dukkha saccena kālaṅkaronti iti mahā bhūmi cāla ādīni vutta nayāni eva ati
translated: For all Buddhas, Paccekabuddhas, and Noble Disciples, starting with the ant-lion, attain parinibbāna with the neutral mind of the life-continuum, which is the truth of suffering. The great earth quaking, etc., are as already stated.

original: 220. Bhūtāti sattā. Appaṭipuggaloti paṭibhāgapuggalavirahito. Balappattoti dasavidhañāṇabalaṃ patto.🔽221. Uppādavayadhamminoti uppādavayasabhāvā. Tesaṃ vūpasamoti tesaṃ saṅkhārānaṃ vūpasamo, asaṅkhataṃ nibbānameva sukhanti attho.
analyzed: bhūtā ati sattā appaṭi puggalo ti paṭibhāga puggala virahitaḥ bala patto ti dasavidha ñāṇa balam pattaḥ  uppāda vaya dhammino ti uppāda vayasa bhāvā tesam vūpasamaḥ iti tesam saṅkhārānam vūpasamaḥ asaṅkhatam nibbānam eva sukhanti attho
translated: Beings means living beings. Without a counterpart means without a counterpart person. Reached strength means reached the strength of the ten kinds of knowledge.🔽Having the nature of arising and passing away means having the nature of arising and passing away. Their stilling means the stilling of those formations. The meaning is: Nibbāna, which is unconditioned, is happiness.

original: 222. Nāhu assāsapassāsoti na jāto assāsapassāso. Anejoti taṇhāsaṅkhātāya ejāya abhāvena
analyzed: na ahu assāsa passāsaḥ na jātaḥ assāsa passāsaḥ anejaḥ iti taṇhā saṅkhātāya ejāya abhāvena
translated: No more in-breath and out-breath means no more arising of in-breath and out-breath. Motionless means without motion called craving.

original: anejo. Santimārabbhāti anupādisesaṃ nibbānaṃ ārabbha paṭicca sandhāya. Yaṃ kālamakarīti
analyzed: anejaḥ santim ārabbha ati anupādisesam nibbānam ārabbha paṭicca sandhāya yam kālam akari iti
translated: “Unperturbed”: with reference to, depending on, the Nibbāna-element without residue left. “When he had passed on”:

original: yo kālaṃ akari. Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti – “āvuso, yo mama satthā buddhamuni santiṃ gamissāmīti,
analyzed: yaḥ kālam akari idam vuttam hoti āvuso yaḥ mama satthā buddha muni santim gamissāmi iti
translated: when he had passed away. This is what is meant: “Friends, the Teacher, the Buddha-sage, who said, ‘I will go to peace,’

original: santiṃ ārabbha kālamakari, tassa ṭhitacittassa tādino idāni assāsapassāso na jāto,
analyzed: santim ārabbha kālam akari tassa ṭhita cittassa tādinaḥ idāni assāsa passāsaḥ na jātaḥ
translated: passed away with reference to peace. Now there is no more in-breath and out-breath for him, who was steadfast and resolute.

original: natthi, nappavattatī”ti.
analyzed: natthi na ppavattati iti
translated: There is none, it does not occur.”

original: Asallīnenāti alīnena asaṅkuṭitena suvikasiteneva cittena. Vedanaṃ ajjhavāsayīti vedanaṃ🔽adhivāsesi, na vedanānuvattī hutvā ito cito ca samparivatti. Vimokkhoti kenaci dhammena
analyzed: a sat līnena ati alīnena a saṅkuṭitena su vikasitena iva cittena vedanam ajjhavāsayi iti vedanam  adhivāsesi na vedanā anuvattī hutvā itas ca itas ca samparivatti vimokkho ti kenacid dhammena
translated: “Without wavering”: with a mind that was not wavering, not contracted, but well-expanded and well-released. “He endured feeling”: he endured feeling,

original: anāvaraṇavimokkho sabbaso apaññattibhāvūpagamo pajjotanibbānasadiso jāto.
analyzed: an āvaraṇa vimokkhaḥ sabbasas a paññatti bhāva upagamo pajjota nibbāna sadisaḥ jātaḥ
translated: he did not vacillate here and there, following after feeling. “Liberation”: liberation from any state by the non-obstruction of any state, the complete attainment of the state of non-formulation, which is like the quenching of a flame.

original: 223. Tadāsīti “saha parinibbānā mahābhūmicālo”ti evaṃ heṭṭhā vuttaṃ bhūmicālameva sandhāyāha. Tañhi lomahaṃsanañca bhiṃsanakañca āsi. Sabbākāravarūpeteti sabbavarakāraṇūpete.
analyzed: tadā asi iti saha parinibbānā mahā bhūmicālo ti evam heṭṭhā vuttam bhūmicālam eva sandhāya āha tat hi lomahaṃsanam ca bhiṃsanakam ca āsi sabba ākāra vara upetā iti sabba vara kāraṇa upete
translated: “In every way perfect”: endowed with every excellence.

original: 224. Avītarāgāti puthujjanā ceva sotāpannasakadāgāmino ca. Tesañhi domanassaṃ appahīnaṃ.
analyzed: avīta rāgā ati puthujjanā ca iva sotāpanna sakadāgāmino ca tesañhi domanassam appahīnam
translated: “Not yet free from passion”: ordinary men and stream-enterers and once-returners. For they have not abandoned grief.

original: Tasmā tepi bāhā paggayha kandanti. Ubhopi hatthe sīse ṭhapetvā rodantīti sabbaṃ purimanayeneva veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: tasmā te pi bāhā paggayha kandanti ubho pi hatthe sīse ṭhapetvā rodanti iti sabbam purima nayena iva veditabbam
translated: Therefore they too throw up their arms and weep. They beat their breasts and weep. All this should be understood in the way already described.

original: 225. Ujjhāyantīti “ayyā attanāpi adhivāsetuṃ na sakkonti, sesajanaṃ kathaṃ samassāsessantī”ti🔽vadantiyo ujjhāyanti. Kathaṃbhūtā pana bhante āyasmā anuruddho devatā manasikarotīti
analyzed: ujjhāyanti iti ayyāḥ attanā api adhivāsetum na sakkonti sesa janam katham samassāsessanti iti  vadantiyaḥ ujjhāyanti kathaṃbhūtā pana bhante āyasmai anuruddhaḥ devatāḥ manasikaroti iti
translated: “They grumbled”: they said, “Venerable ones, they cannot even bear it themselves. How will they be able to comfort others?”🔽and so they grumbled.🔽“Venerable sir, what kind of deities does the venerable Anuruddha have in mind that he speaks thus?”

original: devatā, bhante, kathaṃbhūtā āyasmā anuruddho sallakkheti, kiṃ tā satthu parinibbānaṃ adhivāsentīti?
analyzed: devatāḥ bhante kathaṃbhūtāḥ āyasmai anuruddho sallakkheti kim tā satthu parinibbānam adhivāsenti iti
translated: “Venerable sir, what kind of deities does the venerable Anuruddha perceive that he speaks thus?”

original: Atha tāsaṃ pavattidassanatthaṃ thero santāvusotiādimāha. Taṃ vuttatthameva. Rattāvasesanti
analyzed: atha tāsam pavatti dassana attham thero santāvuso tiādim āha tam vutta ttham eva
translated: Then, in order to show how they occurred, the Elder said, “Friends, the remainder of the night was spent in talk about the Dhamma.” The meaning is self-evident.

original: balavapaccūse parinibbutattā rattiyā avasesaṃ cullakaddhānaṃ. Dhammiyā kathāyāti
analyzed: balava paccūse parinibbuta ttā rattiyāḥ avasesam culla kaddhānam dhammiyā kathāya ati
translated: In the remainder of the night: because the Buddha had attained final Nibbāna in the early morning, the remainder of the night was the latter part of the night.🔽In talk about the Dhamma:

original: aññā pāṭiyekkā dhammakathā nāma natthi, “āvuso sadevake nāma loke appaṭipuggalassa
analyzed: aññā pāṭiyekkā dhamma kathā nāma natthi āvuso sa devake nāma loke appaṭi puggalassa
translated: there is no other talk about the Dhamma apart from this. “Friends, this King of Death is not ashamed before the world with its gods,

original: satthuno ayaṃ maccurājā na lajjati, kimaṅgaṃ pana lokiyamahājanassa lajjissatī”ti
analyzed: satthunaḥ ayam maccu rājā na lajjati kimaṅgam pana lokiya mahājanassa lajjissati iti
translated: let alone before ordinary people, to seize the Teacher, who has no equal in the world.”🔽But they spent the remainder of the night in talk about the Dhamma connected with death.

original: evarūpāya pana maraṇapaṭisaṃyuttāya kathāya vītināmesuṃ. Tesañhi taṃ kathaṃ kathentānaṃ
analyzed: evarūpāya pana maraṇa paṭisaṃyuttāya kathāya vītināmesum tesam hi tam katham kathentānam
translated: As they were talking about this,

original: muhutteneva aruṇaṃ uggacchi.
analyzed: muhuttena iva aruṇam uggacchi
translated: the dawn came.🔽Then, as soon as the dawn came, the Elder said this to the Elder: “Friend, let us go to the Mallas’ meeting hall to sit down.”

original: 226. Atha khoti aruṇuggaṃ disvāva thero theraṃ etadavoca. Teneva karaṇīyenāti kīdisena
analyzed: atha khalu iti aruṇuggam theraḥ theram etat avoca tena iva karaṇīyena ati kīdisena
translated: With that business: “What kind of business?

original: nu kho parinibbānaṭṭhāne mālāgandhādisakkārena bhavitabbaṃ, kīdisena bhikkhusaṅghassa
analyzed: nu kho parinibbāna ṭhāne mālā gandha ādi sakkārena bhavitabbam kīdisena bhikkhu saṅghassa
translated: What kind of honour should be done at the place of final Nibbāna with garlands, etc.? What kind of honour should be done to the community of bhikkhus?

original: nisajjaṭṭhānena bhavitabbaṃ, kīdisena khādanīyabhojanīyena bhavitabbanti, evaṃ yaṃ
analyzed: nisajja ṭṭhānena bhavitabbam kīdisena khādanīya bhojanīyena bhavitabban ti evam yam
translated: and what kind of sitting place and what kind of food and drink there should be, and so on,

original: bhagavato parinibbutabhāvaṃ sutvā kattabbaṃ teneva karaṇīyena.
analyzed: bhagavataḥ parinibbuta bhāvam sutvā kattabbam tena iva karaṇīyena
translated: and he did what should be done on hearing of the Blessed One’s final extinction.

original: Buddhasarīrapūjāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: buddha sarīra pūjā vaṇṇanā
translated: The Description of the Worship of the Buddha’s Body

original: 227. Sabbañca tāḷāvacaranti sabbaṃ tūriyabhaṇḍaṃ. Sannipātethāti bheriṃ carāpetvā samāharatha. Te tatheva akaṃsu. Maṇḍalamāḷeti dussamaṇḍalamāḷe. Paṭiyādentāti sajjentā.
analyzed: sabbam ca tāḷa avacaranti sabbam tūriya bhaṇḍam sannipātetha ati bherim carāpetvā samāharatha te tathā iva akaṃsu maṇḍala māḷe iti dussa maṇḍala māḷe paṭiyādentā ati sajjentā
translated: And all the musical instruments: all the kinds of musical instruments. Let them assemble: let them gather them by beating the drum. They did so. The pavilion: the pavilion of cloth. They prepared: they made ready.

original: Dakkhiṇena dakkhiṇanti nagarassa dakkhiṇadisābhāgeneva dakkhiṇadisābhāgaṃ. Bāhirena🔽bāhiranti antonagaraṃ appavesetvā bāhireneva nagarassa bāhirapassaṃ haritvā. Dakkhiṇato
analyzed: dakkhiṇena dakkhiṇanti nagarassa dakkhiṇa disā bhāgena iva dakkhiṇa disā bhāgam bāhirena  bāhiranti antonagaram appavesetvā bāhirena iva nagarassa bāhira passam haritvā dakkhiṇatas
translated: To the south of the city: to the south of the city itself. Outside: outside the city.

original: nagarassāti anurādhapurassa dakkhiṇadvārasadise ṭhāne ṭhapetvā sakkārasammānaṃ katvā
analyzed: nagarassa ati anurādhapurassa dakkhiṇa dvāra sadise ṭhāne ṭhapetvā sakkāra sammānam katvā
translated: To the south of the city: having placed it in a place to the south of the southern gate of Anurādhapura, and having paid homage and respect to it,

original: jetavanasadise ṭhāne jhāpessāmāti attho.
analyzed: jetavana sadise ṭhāne jhāpessāma ati attho
translated: we will burn it in a place like Jetavana Monastery.

original: 228. Aṭṭha mallapāmokkhāti majjhimavayā thāmasampannā aṭṭhamallarājāno. Sīsaṃ nhātāti
analyzed: aṭṭha mallapāmokkhā ati majjhima vayā thāma sampannā aṭṭha malla rājāno sīsam nhāta ati
translated: Eight chieftains of the wrestlers: eight kings of wrestlers, who were in middle age and endowed with strength. Had their heads washed:

original: sīsaṃ dhovitvā nahātā. Āyasmantaṃ anuruddhanti therova dibbacakkhukoti pākaṭo, tasmā
analyzed: sīsam dhovitvā theraḥ uva dibba cakkhuko ti pākaṭaḥ tasmai
translated: had their heads washed and bathed. The venerable Anuruddha: the Elder was well known as having the divine eye, therefore

original: te santesupi aññesu mahātheresu – “ayaṃ no pākaṭaṃ katvā kathessatī”ti theraṃ pucchiṃsu.
analyzed: te santesu pi aññesu mahā theresu ayam no pākaṭam katvā kathessati iti theram pucchiṃsu
translated: though there were other great Elders, they asked the Elder, thinking, “He will explain to us, making himself evident.”

original: Kathaṃ pana, bhante, devatānaṃ adhippāyoti bhante, amhākaṃ tāva adhippāyaṃ jānāma.
analyzed: katham pana bhante devatānam adhippāyaḥ ti bhante amhākam tāva adhippāyam jānāma
translated: “How, venerable sir, is it the wish of the deities?” Venerable sir, we know our own wish.

original: Devatānaṃ kathaṃ adhippāyoti pucchanti. Thero paṭhamaṃ tesaṃ adhippāyaṃ dassento🔽tumhākaṃ khotiādimāha. Makuṭabandhanaṃ nāma mallānaṃ cetiyanti mallarājūnaṃ pasādhanamaṅgalasālāya
analyzed: devatānam katham adhippāyaḥ ti pucchanti theraḥ paṭhamam tesam adhippāyam dassento  tumhākam khoti ādim āha makuṭabandhanam nāma mallānam mallarājūnam
translated: They are asking, “How is it the wish of the deities?” The Elder, showing them their own wish first,🔽said: “Your wish, friends, is this.” The shrine of the Malla kings called the Head-anointing Shrine:

original: etaṃ nāmaṃ. Cittīkataṭṭhena panesā “cetiya”nti vuccati.
analyzed: etam nāmam cittīkata ṭṭhena pana esā cetiyanti vuccati
translated: this is the name of the auspicious hall of the Malla kings’ faith. But it is called a shrine in the sense of being a place of worship.

original: 229. Yāva sandhisamalasaṅkaṭīrāti ettha sandhi nāma gharasandhi. Samalaṃ nāma gūtharāsiniddhamanapanāḷi.
analyzed: ettha sandhi nāma ghara sandhi samalam nāma
translated: As far as the joints, the cracks, the hollows, and the holes: here a joint is a house joint; a crack is a drainpipe for carrying off the filth;

original: Saṅkaṭīraṃ nāma saṅkāraṭṭhānaṃ. Dibbehi ca mānusakehi ca naccehīti upari devatānaṃ🔽naccāni honti, heṭṭhā manussānaṃ. Esa nayo gītādīsu. Apica devatānaṃ antare manussā,
analyzed: saṅkaṭīram nāma saṅkāra ṭṭhānam dibbehi ca mānusakehi ca naccehi iti upari devatānam  naccāni honti heṭṭhā manussānam esa nayaḥ gīta ādīsu api ca devatānam antare manussā
translated: “The cremation ground” is the place where refuse is thrown away. “With divine and human dances” : the dances of the gods are above,🔽those of men below. The same applies to the singing, etc. Moreover, the men were in the midst of the gods,

original: manussānaṃ antare devatāti evampi sakkarontā pūjentā agamaṃsu. Majjhena majjhaṃ nagarassa
analyzed: manussānam antare devatā ati evam pi sakkarontā pūjentā agamaṃsu majjhena majjham nagarassa
translated: and the gods in the midst of the men. Thus honouring and worshipping the Blessed One, they came.

original: haritvāti evaṃ hariyamāne bhagavato sarīre bandhulamallasenāpatibhariyā mallikā nāma🔽– “bhagavato sarīraṃ āharantī”ti sutvā attano sāmikassa kālaṃ kiriyato paṭṭhāya aparibhuñjitvā🔽ṭhapitaṃ visākhāya pasādhanasadisaṃ mahālatāpasādhanaṃ nīharāpetvā – “iminā satthāraṃ
analyzed: haritvā ati evam hariyamāne bhagavatoḥ sarīre mallikā nāma  bhagavataḥ sarīram āharanti iti sutvā attanaḥ sāmikassa kālam kiriyataḥ paṭṭhāya a paribhuñjitvā  ṭhapitam visākhāya pasādhana sadisam mahā latā pasādhanam iminā satthāram
translated: “Having taken the middle portion of the city” : while the Blessed One’s body was being carried in this way, the wife of the general Bandhumara, named Mallika,🔽having heard that the Blessed One’s body was being brought in, had a great oil-lamp stand brought out, which had been set aside since the time of her husband’s death and which she had not used,

original: pūjessāmī”ti taṃ majjāpetvā gandhodakena dhovitvā dvāre ṭhitā.
analyzed: pūjessāmi iti tam majjā petvā gandha udakena dhovitvā dvāre ṭhitā
translated: thinking: “With this I will worship the Teacher.” She had it lit, washed it with perfumed water, and stood at the door.

original: Taṃ kira pasādhanaṃ tāsañca dvinnaṃ itthīnaṃ, devadāniyacorassa geheti tīsuyeva ṭhānesu
analyzed: tam kira pasādhanam tāsam ca dvinnam itthīnam deva dāniya corassa geha iti tīsu yeva ṭhānesu
translated: It is said that this lamp stand had been used by two women and a thief, the son of a god, in three places.

original: ahosi. Sā ca satthu sarīre dvāraṃ sampatte – “otāretha, tātā, satthusarīra”nti vatvā
analyzed: ahosi sā ca satthu sarīre dvāram sampatte  otāretha tātā satthu sarīran ti vatvā
translated: and when the door of the coffin had been closed, she said, “Take out the body of the Blessed One, dear friends.”

original: taṃ pasādhanaṃ satthusarīre paṭimuñci. Taṃ sīsato paṭṭhāya paṭimukkaṃ yāvapādatalāgataṃ.
analyzed: tam pasādhanam satthu sarīre paṭimuñci tam sīsataḥ paṭṭhāya paṭimukkam yāva pāda tala āgatam
translated: and she placed that ornament on the body of the Blessed One. It was placed on the head and then it went down to the soles of the feet.

original: Suvaṇṇavaṇṇaṃ bhagavato sarīraṃ sattaratanamayena mahāpasādhanena pasādhitaṃ ativiya
analyzed: suvaṇṇa vaṇṇam bhagavataḥ sarīram satta ratana mayena mahā pasādhanena pasādhitam
translated: The body of the Blessed One, which was the color of gold, was made even more resplendent by the great ornament of the seven precious substances.

original: virocittha. Taṃ sā disvā pasannacittā patthanaṃ akāsi – “bhagavā yāva vaṭṭe saṃsarissāmi,
analyzed: virocittha tam sā disvā pasanna cittā patthanam akāsi bhagavā yāva vaṭṭe saṃsarissāmi
translated: Seeing that, she, with a mind full of faith, made a wish: “As long as I shall wander in the round of rebirths,

original: tāva me pāṭiyekkaṃ pasādhanakiccaṃ mā hotu, niccaṃ paṭimukkapasādhanasadisameva sarīraṃ hotū”ti.
analyzed: tāva me pāṭiyekkam pasādhana kiccam mā hotu niccam paṭimukka pasādhana sadisam eva sarīram hotu uti
translated: may I not have to do the work of ornamenting separately; may my body always be like the body of the Blessed One, ornamented all over.”

original: Atha bhagavantaṃ sattaratanamayena mahāpasādhanena ukkhipitvā puratthimena dvārena

translated: The Story of the Elder Mahākassapa

analyzed: tattha uṭṭhāya āsanā ti nisinna āsanataḥ uṭṭhahitvā cakka ratana samīpam āgantvā suvaṇṇa bhiṅkāram  gahetvā iti hatthi soṇḍa sadisa panāḷim suvaṇṇa bhiṅkāram ukkhipitvā rājā mahāsudassanaḥ  saddhim caturaṅginiyā senāyā ati sabba cakkavattīnam hi udakena abbhuk kiritvā abhivijinātu

original: bhavaṃ cakkaratana”nti vacanasamanantarameva vehāsaṃ abbhuggantvā cakkaratanaṃ pavattati.

analyzed: tam anubandhamānaḥ iva rājā cakkavatti yāna varam āruyha vehāsam abbhut gacchati
translated: the king follows after it, mounting the foremost of chariots. Then

analyzed: chatta cāmara ādi hatthaḥ parijanaḥ ca iva antepura janaḥ ca tatas nānā ākāra kañcuka kavaca ādi sannāha vibhūsitena

analyzed: balakāyena saddhim vehāsam abbhuk gantvā rājānam eva parivārenti

original: Rājayuttā pana janasaṅgahatthaṃ nagaravīthīsu bheriyo carāpenti – “tātā, amhākaṃ
analyzed: rāja yuttā pana jana saṅga hattham nagara vīthīsu bheriyaḥ tātāḥ amhākam
translated: The king’s retinue had drums beaten in the streets of the city to assemble the people, saying: “Friends,

analyzed: raññaḥ cakka ratanam nibbattam attanaḥ vibhava anurūpena maṇḍita pasādhikā sannipatatha ati
translated: the king’s Wheel-Treasure has appeared. Assemble in the palace, each adorned according to his means.”

analyzed: mahājanaḥ pana pakatiyā cakkaratana saddena iva sabba kiccāni pahāya gandha puppha ādīni
translated: But the people, as if they had been told this by the sound of the Wheel-Treasure itself, left all their work and assembled,

original: ādāya sannipatitova sopi sabbo vehāsaṃ abbhuggantvā rājānameva parivāreti. Yassa
analyzed: ādāya sannipatitaḥ uva saḥ api sabbaḥ vehāsam abbhut gantvā rājānam eva parivāreti yassa
translated: taking perfumes, flowers, etc., and all went up into the air and surrounded the king.

original: yassa hi raññā saddhiṃ gantukāmatācittaṃ uppajjati, so so ākāsagatova hoti. Evaṃ
analyzed: yassa hi raññā saddhim gantu kāma tā cittam uppajjati saḥ saḥ ākāsa gataḥ va hoti evam
translated: For whoever had the thought of going with the king went up into the air.

original: dvādasayojanāyāmavitthārā parisā hoti. Tattha ekapurisopi chinnabhinnasarīro vā kiliṭṭhavattho🔽vā natthi. Suciparivāro hi rājā cakkavattī. Cakkavattiparisā nāma vijjādharapurisā🔽viya ākāse gacchamānā indanīlamaṇitale vippakiṇṇaratanasadisā hoti. Mahāsudassanassāpi
analyzed: dvādasa yojana āyāma vitthārā parisā hoti tattha eka purisaḥ api chinna bhinna sarīraḥ vā kiliṭṭha vattho  vā natthi suci parivāraḥ hi rājā cakkavattī cakkavatti parisā nāma vijjādhara purisā  viyaḥ ākāse gacchamānā inda nīla maṇi tale vippakiṇṇa ratana sadisā hoti mahāsudassanassa api
translated: The assembly was twelve leagues long and wide. There was not a single person there with a mutilated or mutilated body or with dirty clothes.

original: tatheva ahosi. Tena vuttaṃ – “anvadeva rājā mahāsudassano saddhiṃ caturaṅginiyā senāyā”ti.

translated: For the wheel-turning king is well surrounded. The assembly of the wheel-turning king is like the sky-going men who are holders of the knowledge of the Vedas, and is like a jewel scattered in the sky. It was so for Mahāsudassana too. Therefore it is said: “Then King Mahāsudassana went out with his four-constituent army.”

original: Taṃ pana cakkaratanaṃ rukkhaggānaṃ uparūpari nātiuccena nātinīcena gaganappadesena
analyzed: tam pana cakkaratanam rukkha aggānam upari upari na ati uccena na ati nīcena gagana ppadesena

analyzed: pavattati yathā rukkhānam puppha phala pallavehi atthikā tāni sukhena gahetum sakkonti
translated: so that those who need flowers and fruits from the trees can easily take them.

original: Yathā ca bhūmiyaṃ ṭhitā “esa rājā, esa uparājā, esa senāpatī”ti sallakkhetuṃ sakkonti.

translated: And so that those standing on the ground can observe: “This is the king, this is the chief queen, this is the chief minister, this is the commander-in-chief.”

original: Ṭhānādīsu ca iriyāpathesu yo yena icchati, so teneva gacchati. Cittakammādisippapasutā
analyzed: ṭhāna ādīsu ca iriyāpathesu yaḥ yena icchati saḥ tena iva gacchati citta kamma ādi sippa pasutā

analyzed: ca ittha attanaḥ attanaḥ kiccam karontāya iva gacchanti yathā iva hi bhūmiyam tathā tesam  sabba kiccāni ākāsā iva ijjhanti evam cakkavatti parisam gahetvā tam cakka ratanam vāma passena
translated: And just as on the ground, so also in the air,

analyzed: sinerum pahāya mahā samuddassa upari bhāgena satta sahassa yojana ppamāṇam pubbavideham gacchati

analyzed: tattha yaḥ vinibbedhena dvādasa yojanāya parikkhepataḥ chattiṃsa yojanāya parisāya sannivesa kkhamaḥ
translated: There it stops as if axle-locked on a site that is twelve leagues long and three leagues across, which is capable of containing a crowd,

analyzed: sulabha āhāra upakaraṇaḥ chāyā udaka sampanno suci sama talaḥ ramaṇīyaḥ bhūmi bhāgo tassa upari bhāge

original: taṃ cakkaratanaṃ akkhāhataṃ viya tiṭṭhati. Atha tena saññāṇena so mahājano otaritvā
analyzed: tam cakka ratanam akkha āhatam viya tiṭṭhati atha tena saññāṇena saḥ mahājanaḥ otaritvā

analyzed: yathāruci nahāna bhojana ādīni sabba kiccāni karontaḥ vāsam kappeti mahāsudassanassa api  sabbam tathā iva ahosi tena vuttam yasmin kho pana ānanda padese cakka ratanam patiṭṭhāti

analyzed: tattha saḥ rājā mahāsudassanaḥ vāsam upagacchi saddhim caturaṅginiyā senāyā ati
translated: Therefore it was said above, “Wherever the Wheel-Treasure stopped, there King Mahāsudassana took up his residence with his four-constituent army.”

analyzed: evam vāsam upagate cakkavattimhi ye tattha rājāno te para cakkam sutvā api

original: na balakāyaṃ sannipātetvā yuddhasajjā honti. Cakkaratanassa hi uppattisamanantarameva
analyzed: na balakāyam sannipātetvā yuddha sajjāḥ honti cakka ratanassa hi uppatti samanantaram eva
translated: For as soon as the Wheel-Treasure appears,

analyzed: natthi so satto nāma yaḥ paccatthika saññāya tam rājānam ārabbha āvudham ukkhipitum

original: visaheyya. Ayamānubhāvo cakkaratanassa.
analyzed: visaheyya cakkaratanassa
translated: This is the efficacy of the Wheel-Treasure.

original: Cakkānubhāvena hi tassa rañño,
analyzed: cakka anubhāvena hi tassa rañño
translated: For by the power of the Wheel

analyzed: arī asesāḥ damatham upenti

analyzed: arindamam nāma narādhipassa

analyzed: rājānam upagamma onata sirāḥ attanaḥ moḷi maṇi pabha abhisekena tassa pāda pūjam karontā  ehi kho mahā rāja ati ādīhi vacanehi tassa kiṃkāra paṭisāvitam āpajjanti mahāsudassanassa api

analyzed: tathā iva akaṃsu tena vuttam ye kho pana ānanda puratthimāya disāyape anusāsa mahā rājā iti  tattha svāgatanti su āgatam ekasmin hi āgate socanti gate nandanti ekasmin āgate
