analyzed: ekissāya iva paṇṇa sālāya nissandena nibbattāni caturāsīti pallaṅka sahassāni nipajjana tthāya  dinna mañcakassa nissandena nibbattāni caturāsīti hatthi sahassāni assa sahassāni ratha sahassāni
translated: were produced by the influence of the single leaf of the tree. The 84,000 couches🔽were produced by the influence of the single bed given for lying on. The 84,000 elephants, 84,000 horses, 84,000 chariots,

original: nisīdanatthāya dinnapīṭhassa nissandena nibbattāni. Caturāsīti maṇisahassāni ekadīpassa🔽nissandena nibbattāni. Caturāsīti pokkharaṇīsahassāni ekapokkharaṇiyā nissandena
analyzed: nisīdana atthāya dinna pīṭhassa nissandena nibbattāni caturāsīti maṇi sahassāni eka dīpassa  nissandena nibbattāni caturāsīti pokkharaṇī sahassāni eka pokkharaṇiyāḥ nissandena
translated: and 84,000 women were produced by the influence of the single chair given for sitting on. The 84,000 jewels were produced by the influence of the single jewel.

original: nibbattāni. Caturāsīti itthisahassāni puttasahassāni gahapatisahassāni paribhogabhājanapattathālaka
analyzed: nibbattāni caturāsīti itthi sahassāni putta sahassāni gahapati sahassāni paribhoga bhājana patta thālaka
translated: The 84,000 lotus ponds were produced by the influence of the single lotus pond. The 84,000 women, 84,000 children, 84,000 householders, and 84,000 sets of bowls, dishes, and pots🔽were produced by the influence of the single set of bowls, dishes, and pots given for use.

original: dhamakaraṇa parissāvana ārakaṇṭaka pipphalaka nakhacchedana kuñcikakaṇṇamalaharaṇī
analyzed: dhama karaṇa parissāvana ārakaṇṭaka pipphalaka nakha chedana kuñcika kaṇṇa mala haraṇī
translated: the eighty-four thousand meals, the eighty-four thousand wives.🔽. Thus the Blessed One, having told the story of Mahāsudassana’s prosperity in detail from the beginning, showed that all that prosperity was like children’s play in a sand-castle, and so he said: “Now, Ānanda, the Tathāgata, the Arahant, the Perfectly Enlightened One, lying down on his right side, having placed one foot on the other, mindful and clearly aware, after considering thus: ‘I shall not attain final Nibbāna until I have attained disciples who are mirrors of my enlightenment,’ attained final Nibbāna without remainder of conditions for rebirth.”🔽Herein, he passed away is the same as he attained final Nibbāna. He passed away without remainder of conditions for rebirth is the same as he attained final Nibbāna without remainder of conditions for rebirth. He passed away after bringing his own true knowledge to bear on the world is the same as he attained final Nibbāna without remainder of conditions for rebirth after bringing his own true knowledge to bear on the world.🔽 Translation: dhammakaraṇaṃ, parissāvanaṃ, ārakaṇṭakaṃ, pipphalakaṃ, nakhacchedanaṃ, kuñcikakaṇṇamalaharaṇī,

original: pādakathalika upāhana chatta kattarayaṭṭhidānassa nissandena nibbattāni. Caturāsīti
analyzed: nissandena nibbattāni catur āsīti
translated: pādakathalikaṃ, upāhanaṃ, chattaṃ, kattarayaṭṭhi,

original: dhenusahassāni gorasadānassa nissandena nibbattāni. Caturāsīti vatthakoṭisahassāni🔽nivāsanapārupanadānassa nissandena nibbattāni. Caturāsīti thālipākasahassāni bhojanadānassa
analyzed: dhenu sahassāni gorasa dānassa nissandena nibbattāni caturāsīti vattha koṭi sahassāni  nivāsana pārupana dānassa nissandena nibbattāni caturāsīti thālipāka sahassāni bhojana dānassa
translated: caturāsīti dhenusahassāni, caturāsīti vatthakoṭisahassāni,

original: nissandena nibbattānīti veditabbāni.
analyzed: nissandena nibbattāni iti veditabbāni
translated: caturāsīti thālipākasahassānīti veditabbāni |

original: 272. Evaṃ bhagavā mahāsudassanassa sampattiṃ ādito paṭṭhāya vitthārena kathetvā sabbaṃ🔽taṃ dārakānaṃ paṃsvāgārakīḷanaṃ viya dassento parinibbānamañcake nipannova passānandātiādimāha.
analyzed: evam bhagavā mahāsudassanassa sampattim āditas paṭṭhāya vitthārena kathetvā sabbam  tam dārakānam paṃsu āgāra kīḷanam viya dassentaḥ parinibbāna mañcake nipannaḥ uva passa ānanda iti ādim āha
translated: Evaṃ bhagavā mahāsudassanassa sampattiṃ ādito paṭṭhāya vitthāretvā sabbaṃ taṃ dārakānaṃ paṃsvāgārakīḷanaṃ viya dassento parinibbānamañcake nipannova passānandātiādimāha |

original: Tattha vipariṇatāti pakativijahanena nibbutapadīpo viya apaññattikabhāvaṃ gatā. Evaṃ
analyzed: tattha vipariṇatā ti pakati vijahanena nibbuta padīpaḥ viya apaññattika bhāvam gatā evam
translated: Tattha vipariṇatanti pakkhavijahanena nibbutapadīpo viya apaññattibhāva

original: aniccā kho, ānanda, saṅkhārāti evaṃ hutvā abhāvaṭṭhena aniccā.
analyzed: aniccā kho ānanda saṅkhārā ati evam hutvā abhāva ṭṭhena aniccā
translated: “Impermanent, Ānanda, are all formations”: they are impermanent in the sense of non-existence after having been.

original: Ettāvatā bhagavā yathā nāma puriso satahatthubbedhe campakarukkhe nisseṇiṃ bandhitvā
analyzed: ettāvatā bhagavā yathā nāma purisaḥ sata hatthu bedhe campaka rukkhe nisseṇim bandhitvā
translated: So far the Exalted One has descended like a man who climbs a tree of breadfruit, fastens a rope to a branch,

original: abhiruhitvā campakapupphaṃ ādāya nisseṇiṃ muñcanto otareyya, evameva nisseṇiṃ bandhanto
analyzed: abhiruhitvā campaka puppham ādāya nisseṇim muñcantaḥ otareyya evam eva nisseṇim bandhantaḥ
translated: climbs down, and then lets go of the tree.

original: viya anekavassakoṭisatasahassubbedhaṃ mahāsudassanasampattiṃ āruyha sampattimatthake
analyzed: viya aneka vassa koṭi sata sahassa ubbedham mahāsudassana sampattim āruyha sampatti matthake
translated: In the same way, the Exalted One has climbed the glory of the Great Sudassana, which is a hundred thousand leagues high,🔽and has taken the sign of impermanence, which is at the top of the glory. Then he has let go of the glory, just as the man lets go of the tree.

original: ṭhitaṃ aniccalakkhaṇaṃ ādāya nisseṇiṃ muñcanto viya otiṇṇo. Teneva pubbe vasabharājā
analyzed: ṭhitam anicca lakkhaṇam ādāya nisseṇim muñcantaḥ viya otiṇṇaḥ tena iva pubbe vasabha rājā
translated: Therefore, in the past, King Vasabha

original: dīghabhāṇakattherānaṃ lohapāsādassa pācīnapasse ambalaṭṭhikāyaṃ imaṃ suttaṃ sajjhāyantānaṃ
analyzed: dīghabhāṇaka therānam loha pāsādassa pācīna passe ambalaṭṭhikāyam imam suttam sajjhāyantānam
translated: heard the Elder Dīghabhāṇaka reciting this sutta in the Ambalaṭṭhikā on the eastern side of the Lohapāsāda.

original: sutvā – “kiṃ, bho, mayhaṃ ayyakena ettha vuttaṃ, attano khāditapītaṭṭhāne sampattimeva
analyzed: sutvā kim bho mayham ayyakena ettha vuttam attano khādita pīta ṭṭhāne sampattim eva
translated: Thinking, “What has my venerable done? He is speaking only of the glory of the place where he has eaten and drunk,”

original: kathetī”ti cintento – “evaṃ aniccā kho, ānanda, saṅkhārā”ti vuttakāle “imaṃ, bho,
analyzed: kathā iti iti cintentaḥ evam aniccāḥ kho ānanda saṅkhārāḥ ti vutta kāle imam bho
translated: he thought, “When he says, ‘So impermanent, Ānanda, are all formations,’ he is speaking🔽about the glory of the place where he has eaten and drunk.”

original: disvā pañcahi cakkhūhi cakkhumatā evaṃ vutta”nti vāmahatthaṃ samiñjitvā dakkhiṇahatthena
analyzed: disvā pañcahi cakkhūhi cakkhumatā evam vuttanti vāma hattham samiñjitvā dakkhiṇa hatthena
translated: and when he saw it with his five eyes, the Omniscient One said this.”

original: apphoṭetvā – “sādhu sādhū”ti tuṭṭhahadayo sādhukāraṃ adāsi.
analyzed: apphoṭetvā sādhu sādhu iti tuṭṭha hadayaḥ sādhukāram adāsi
translated: and after rubbing it with his right hand, he gave his approval with the words, “Good! Good!”

original: Evaṃ addhuvāti evaṃ udakapupphuḷādayo viya dhuvabhāvavirahitā. Evaṃ anassāsikāti evaṃ supinake pītapānīyaṃ viya anulittacandanaṃ viya ca assāsavirahitā.🔽Sarīraṃ nikkhipeyyāti sarīraṃ chaḍḍeyya. Idāni aññassa sarīrassa nikkhepo vā paṭijagganaṃ
analyzed: evam addhuvā ati evam udaka pupphuḷa ādayaḥ viya dhuva bhāva virahitā evam anassāsikā ati evam supinake pīta pānīyam viya anulitta candanam viya ca assāsa virahitā  sarīram nikkhipeyya ati sarīram chaḍḍeyya idāni aññassa sarīrassa nikkhepaḥ vā paṭijagganam
translated: Thus impermanent: thus devoid of permanence, like water bubbles, etc. Thus unsatisfying: thus devoid of satisfaction, like drinking salt water, or like anointing oneself with lac, etc.

original: vā natthi kilesapahīnattā, ānanda, tathāgatassāti vadati. Idaṃ pana vatvā puna theraṃ
analyzed: vā natthi kilesa pahīna ttā ānanda tathāgatassa ati vadati idam pana vatvā puna theram
translated: Will lay down the body: will cast off the body. Now, after the destruction of the defilements, there is no laying down of the body or taking up of another body. Therefore the Exalted One says, “Ānanda, the Tathāgata has destroyed the defilements.”

original: āmantesi, cakkavattino ānubhāvo nāma rañño pabbajitassa sattame divase antaradhāyati.
analyzed: āmantesi cakkavattino ānubhāvaḥ nāma raññaḥ pabbajitassa sattame divase antaradhāyati
translated: Having said this, he again addressed the Elder Ānanda: “Ānanda, the glory of a universal monarch disappears seven days after his death.

original: Mahāsudassanassa pana kālaṅkiriyato sattameva divase sattaratanapākārā sattaratanatālā
analyzed: mahāsudassanassa pana kālaṅkiriyato sattame eva divase satta ratana pākārā satta ratana tālā
translated: But seven days after the death of Mahāsudassana, the seven treasures and the ramparts of the seven treasures disappeared.”

original: caturāsīti pokkharaṇīsahassāni dhammapāsādo dhammapokkharaṇī cakkaratananti sabbametaṃ
analyzed: caturāsīti pokkharaṇī sahassāni dhamma pāsādaḥ dhammapokkharaṇī cakkaratanam ti sabbam etam
translated: The eighty-four thousand bathing tanks, the Dhamma Palace, the Dhamma bathing tank, and the Wheel Treasure all disappeared.

original: antaradhāyīti. Hatthiādīsu pana ayaṃ dhammatā khīṇāyukā saheva kālaṅkaronti. Āyusese🔽sati hatthiratanaṃ uposathakulaṃ gacchati, assaratanaṃ valāhakakulaṃ, maṇiratanaṃ
analyzed: antaradhāyi iti hatthi ādīsu pana ayam dhamma tā khīṇa āyukā saha iva kālaṅkaronti āyu sese  sati hatthi ratanam uposatha kulam gacchati assa ratanam valāhaka kulam maṇi ratanam
translated: But this is the nature of the elephant and the rest: when their life is exhausted they die at once. But if there is life left in them,🔽the elephant treasure goes to the Uposatha family, the horse treasure to the Valāhaka family, and the gem treasure to the Vepulla mountain.

original: vepullapabbatameva gacchati. Itthiratanassa ānubhāvo antaradhāyati. Gahapatiratanassa
analyzed: vepullapabbatam eva gacchati itthi ratanassa ānubhāvaḥ antaradhāyati gahapati ratanassa
translated: The power of the queen treasure disappears.🔽The eyes of the steward treasure are normal.

original: cakkhu pākatikameva hoti. Pariṇāyakaratanassa veyyattiyaṃ nassati.
analyzed: cakkhu pākatikam eva hoti pariṇāyaka ratanassa veyyattiyam nassati
translated: The work of the adviser treasure is lost.

original: Idamavoca bhagavāti idaṃ pāḷiyaṃ āruḷhañca anāruḷhañca sabbaṃ bhagavā avoca. Sesaṃ uttānatthamevāti.🔽Iti sumaṅgalavilāsiniyā dīghanikāyaṭṭhakathāyaṃ🔽Mahāsudassanasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽5. Janavasabhasuttavaṇṇanā🔽Nātikiyādibyākaraṇavaṇṇanā
analyzed: idam avoca bhagavā ati idam pāḷiyam āruḷham ca an āruḷham ca sabbam bhagavā avoca sesam uttānattham eva ati 🔽iti sumaṅgalavilāsiniyā dīgha nikāya ṭṭhakathā ayam 🔽mahāsudassana sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā 🔽janavasabha sutta vaṇṇanā 🔽na ati kiyā ādi byākaraṇa vaṇṇanā
translated: This did the Blessed One say. The rest is clear in meaning.

original: 273-275. Evaṃ me sutanti janavasabhasuttaṃ. Tatrāyaṃ anuttānapadavaṇṇanā – parito
analyzed: evam me sutam ti jana vasabha suttam tatra ayam anuttāna pada vaṇṇanā paritas
translated: “Thus have I heard” : the Janavasabha Sutta. Here is a commentary on the difficult passages.🔽All round the country : all round the country on every side.

original: parito janapadesūti samantā samantā janapadesu. Paricāraketi buddhadhammasaṅghānaṃ
analyzed: paritas janapadesu iti samantā samantā janapadesu paricāraka iti buddha dhamma saṅghānam
translated: Attendants : attendants on the Buddha, the Dhamma, and the Sangha.

original: paricārake. Upapattīsūti ñāṇagatipuññānaṃ upapattīsu. Kāsikosalesūti kāsīsu ca kosalesu
analyzed: paricārake upapattīsu uti ñāṇa gati puññānam upapattīsu kāsi kosalesu iti kāsīsu ca kosalesu
translated: In their reappearance : in their reappearance in the various kinds of knowledge, conduct, and merit.

original: ca, kāsiraṭṭhe ca kosalaraṭṭhe cāti attho. Esa nayo sabbattha. Aṅgamagadhayonakakambojaassakaavantiraṭṭhesu
analyzed: ca kāsi raṭṭhe ca kosala raṭṭhe ca ati attho esa nayo sabbattha aṅga magadha yonaka kamboja assaka avanti raṭṭhesu
translated: In Kasi and Kosala : in the country of Kasi and in the country of Kosala, in the kingdom of Kasi and in the kingdom of Kosala, is the meaning. The same method applies in all cases.🔽But he does not answer about the six kingdoms of Anga, Magadha, Yona, Kamboja, Asmaka, and Avanti.

original: pana chasu na byākaroti. Imesaṃ pana soḷasannaṃ mahājanapadānaṃ purimesu dasasuyeva
analyzed: pana chasu na byākaroti imesam pana mahā janapadānam purimesu
translated: But he answers about the first ten of these sixteen great countries.

original: byākaroti. Nātikiyāti nātikagāmavāsino.🔽Tenāti tena anāgāmiādibhāvena. Sutvāti sabbaññutaññāṇena paricchinditvā byākarontassa
analyzed: byākaroti  tena ati tena anāgāmi ādi bhāvena sutvā iti sabbaññuta ññāṇena paricchinditvā byākarontassa
translated: The people of Natika : the people of the village of Natika.🔽By that : by that of non-returner, etc.🔽Having heard : having heard the Blessed One’s answer to the question, having discerned it by the knowledge of omniscience,

original: bhagavato pañhābyākaraṇaṃ sutvā tesaṃ anāgāmiādīsu niṭṭhaṅgatā hutvā. Tena anāgāmiādibhāvena
analyzed: bhagavato pañha abyākaraṇam sutvā tesam anāgāmi ādīsu niṭṭhaṅga tā hutvā tena anāgāmi ādi bhāvena
translated: they were confirmed in their state of non-returner, etc. By that of non-returner, etc.

original: attamanā ahesuṃ. Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana tenāti te nātikiyāti vuttaṃ. Etasmiṃ atthe na-kāro nipātamattaṃ hoti.
analyzed: attamanāḥ ahesum aṭṭhakathāyam pana tena ati te na atikiyā iti vuttam etasmin atthe nakāraḥ nipāta mattam hoti
translated: and were satisfied. But in the Commentary it is said, “Ten” means “those of Nādika.” In this meaning the word na is merely a particle.

original: Ānandaparikathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: ānanda parikathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The Description of the Discussion with Ānanda

original: 277. Bhagavantaṃ kittayamānarūpoti aho buddho, aho dhammo, aho saṅgho; aho dhammo🔽svākkhātoti evaṃ kittayantova kālamakāsi. Bahujano pasīdeyyāti amhākaṃ pitā mātā
analyzed: bhagavantam kittayamāna rūpaḥ iti aho buddhaḥ aho dhammaḥ aho saṅghaḥ aho dhammo  su ākkhātaḥ iti evam kittayantaḥ uva kālam akāsi bahu janaḥ pasīdeyyāti amhākam pitā mātā
translated: “Praising the Blessed One”: he passed away while praising the Buddha, the Dhamma, and the Saṅgha, and the Dhamma thus: “How good the Buddha! How good the Dhamma! How good the Saṅgha! How well proclaimed the Dhamma!”

original: bhātā bhaginī putto dhītā sahāyako, tena amhehi saddhiṃ ekato bhuttā, ekato sayitā,
analyzed: bhātā bhaginī putto dhītā sahāyako tena amhehi saddhim ekatas bhuttā ekatas sayitā
translated: “Many people would be confirmed in faith”: “Our father, our mother, our brother, our sister, our son, our daughter, our friend—with him we have eaten, with him we have dwelt;

original: tassa idañcidañca manāpaṃ akarimha, so kira anāgāmī sakadāgāmī sotāpanno; aho sādhu,
analyzed: tassa idam ca idam ca manāpam akarimha saḥ kira anāgāmī sakadāgāmī sa utāpannaḥ aho sādhu
translated: we have done this and that to please him. He, it is said, is a non-returner, a once-returner, a stream-enterer. How good, how excellent!

original: aho suṭṭhūti evaṃ bahujano pasādaṃ āpajjeyya.
analyzed: aho suṭṭhu iti evam bahu janaḥ pasādam āpajjeyya
translated: ” In this way many people would be confirmed in faith.

original: 278. Gatinti ñāṇagatiṃ. Abhisamparāyanti ñāṇābhisamparāyameva. Addasā khoti kittake jane addasa? Catuvīsatisatasahassāni.
analyzed: gatim ti ñāṇa gatim abhisamparāyanti ñāṇa abhisamparāyam eva addasā kho ti kittake jane addasa catuvīsati sata sahassāni
translated: “The destination”: the destination of knowledge. “The further shore”: the further shore of knowledge. “He saw”: how many people did he see? Two hundred and twenty-five thousand.

original: 279. Upasantapadissoti upasantadassano. Bhātirivāti ativiya bhāti, ativiya virocati.🔽Indriyānanti manacchaṭṭhānaṃ indriyānaṃ. Addasaṃ kho ahaṃ ānandāti neva dasa, na
analyzed: upasanta padissaḥ ti upasanta dassanaḥ bhātiḥ iva ati ativiya bhāti ativiya virocati  indriyānam indriyānam addasam kho aham ānanda ati na iva dasa na
translated: Upasantapadisso : upasantadassano . Bhātiriva : shines exceedingly, shines forth exceedingly.🔽Indriyāni : the faculties, the six beginning with the mind.

original: vīsati, na sataṃ, na sahassaṃ, anūnādhikāni catuvīsatisatasahassāni addasanti āha.
analyzed: vīsati na satam na sahassam anūna adhikāni catuvīsati sata sahassāni addasanti āha
translated: Addasaṃ kho ahaṃ ānanda : I saw, Ānanda, not ten, not twenty, not a hundred, not a thousand, but more than twenty-one hundred thousand.

original: Janavasabhayakkhavaṇṇanā
translated: The Description of the Demon Janavasabha

original: 280. Disvā pana me ettako jano maṃ nissāya dukkhā pamuttoti balavasomanassaṃ uppajji,
analyzed: disvā pana me ettakaḥ janaḥ mam nissāya dukkhā pamuttaḥ ti balava somanassam uppajji
translated: But when I saw that so many people had been freed from suffering through me, I experienced a great joy,

original: cittaṃ pasīdi, cittassa pasannattā cittasamuṭṭhānaṃ lohitaṃ pasīdi, lohitassa pasannattā
analyzed: cittam pasīdi cittassa pasanna ttā citta samuṭṭhānam lohitam pasīdi lohitassa pasanna ttā
translated: my mind became serene, and because of the serenity of my mind the blood produced by the mind became serene,

original: manacchaṭṭhāni indriyāni pasīdiṃsūti sabbamidaṃ vatvā atha kho ānandātiādimāha. Tattha
analyzed: indriyāni pasīdiṃsu iti sabbam idam vatvā atha kho ānanda ati ādim āha tattha
translated: and because of the serenity of the blood the six faculties beginning with the mind became serene. Having said all this, he said, “Then, Ānanda,”

original: yasmā so bhagavato dhammakathaṃ sutvā dasasahassādhikassa janasatasahassassa jeṭṭhako
analyzed: yasmā saḥ bhagavataḥ dhamma katham sutvā dasa sahassa adhikassa jana sata sahassassa jeṭṭhakaḥ
translated: and so on. Herein, because he was the chief of the two hundred and ten thousand people who became stream-enterers after hearing the Exalted One’s Dhamma talk,

original: hutvā sotāpanno jāto, tasmā janavasabhotissa nāmaṃ ahosi.
analyzed: hutvā sa utāpannaḥ jātaḥ tasmā janavasabhotissa nāmam ahosi
translated: he was named Janavasabha .

original: Ito sattāti ito devalokā cavitvā satta. Tato sattāti tato manussalokā cavitvā satta.
analyzed: itas satta ati itas deva lokā cavitvā satta tatas satta ati tatas manussa lokā cavitvā satta
translated: ‘Seven times here’ means seven times from the deva world to this world. ‘Seven times there’ means seven times from the human world to the deva world.

original: Saṃsārāni catuddasāti sabbāpi catuddasakhandhapaṭipāṭiyo. Nivāsamabhijānāmīti jātivasena
analyzed: catuddasā ti sabbā api catuddasa khandha paṭipāṭiyaḥ nivāsam abhijānāmi iti jāti vasena
translated: ‘I know fourteen rebirths’ means all the fourteen rebirths in the cycle of existence. ‘I know the dwelling places’ means I know the dwelling places by way of birth.

original: nivāsaṃ jānāmi. Yattha me vusitaṃ pureti yattha devesu ca vessavaṇassa sahabyataṃ
analyzed: nivāsam jānāmi yattha me vusitam purā iti yattha devesu ca vessavaṇassa sahabyatam
translated: ‘Where I dwelt before’ means where I dwelt before, in the past, as a deva in the company of Vessavana,🔽and as a human being, a king, in this very existence.

original: upagatena manussesu ca rājabhūtena ito attabhāvato pureyeva mayā vusitaṃ. Pure evaṃ
analyzed: upagatena manussesu ca rāja bhūtena itas atta bhāvato purā iya iva mayā vusitam pure evam
translated: And because I dwelt there in the past,

original: vusitattā eva ca idāni sotāpanno hutvā tīsu vatthūsu bahuṃ puññaṃ katvā tassānubhāvena
analyzed: vusita ttā eva ca idāni sotāpannaḥ hutvā tīsu vatthūsu bahum puññam katvā tassa anubhāvena
translated: I was able to be reborn above, having become a stream-enterer and having made much merit in the three bases.

original: upari nibbattituṃ samatthopi dīgharattaṃ vusitaṭṭhāne nikantiyā balavatāya ettheva nibbatto.
analyzed: upari nibbattitum samatthaḥ api dīgharattam vusita ṭṭhāne nikantiyā balavatāya ettha iva nibbatto
translated: But because of my strong attachment to the place where I dwelt for a long time, I was reborn right here.

original: 281. Āsā ca pana me santiṭṭhatīti imināhaṃ sotāpannoti na suttappamattova hutvā kālaṃ
analyzed: āsā ca pana me santiṭṭhati iti iminā aham sotāpannaḥ ti na su tappa mattaḥ va hutvā kālam
translated: ‘My hope still stands’ means that I did not pass away in this existence merely as a stream-enterer.

original: vītināmesiṃ. Sakadāgāmimaggatthāya pana me vipassanā āraddhā. Ajjeva ajjeva paṭivijjhissāmīti
analyzed: sakadāgāmi magga atthāya pana me vipassanā āraddhā ajja iva ajja iva paṭivijjhissāmi iti
translated: But I had begun insight meditation for the purpose of the path of once-returning. ‘Today, today I will penetrate’ means

original: evaṃ saussāho viharāmīti dasseti. Yadaggeti laṭṭhivanuyyāne paṭhamadassane sotāpannadivasaṃ🔽sandhāya vadati. Tadagge ahaṃ, bhante, dīgharattaṃ avinipāto avinipātaṃ sañjānāmīti🔽taṃdivasaṃ ādiṃ katvā, ahaṃ, bhante, purimaṃ catuddasaattabhāvasaṅkhātaṃ dīgharattaṃ🔽avinipāto laṭṭhivanuyyāne sotāpattimaggavasena adhigataṃ avinipātadhammataṃ sañjānāmīti
analyzed: evam saussāhaḥ viharāmi iti dassa iti yat aggā iti laṭṭhi vanuyyāne paṭhama dassane sotāpanna divasam  sandhāya vadati tad agge aham bhante dīgharattam a vinipātaḥ a vinipātam sañjānāmi iti  tat divasam ādim katvā aham bhante purimam catuddasa atta bhāva saṅkhātam dīgharattam  avinipātaḥ laṭṭhi vanuyyāne sotāpatti magga vasena adhigatam avinipāta dhamma tam sañjānāmi iti
translated: “Thus I live with energy aroused” shows that he is energetic. “Since that time” refers to the day of his stream-entry in the Deer Park at Isipatana.🔽“Since that time, venerable sir, I have known no fall from that state” means that he has known no fall from the state of non-return, which he attained in the Deer Park at Isipatana, making that day the beginning.

original: attho. Anacchariyanti anuacchariyaṃ. Cintayamānaṃ punappunaṃ acchariyamevidaṃ yaṃ
analyzed: attha u an acchariyanti anu acchariyam cintayamānam punar punar acchariyam eva idam yam
translated: “For a long time” means for fourteen or seventeen existences. “It is not surprising” means it is not astonishing. “Thinking” means thinking again and again. “It is astonishing” means it is astonishing

original: kenacideva karaṇīyena gacchanto bhagavantaṃ antarāmagge addasaṃ. Idampi acchariyaṃ🔽yañca vessavaṇassa mahārājassa sayaṃparisāya bhāsato bhagavato diṭṭhasadisameva sammukhā
analyzed: kenacid eva karaṇīyena gacchantaḥ bhagavantam antarāmagge addasam idam pi  yat ca vessavaṇassa mahā rājassa sayaṃparisāya bhāsataḥ bhagavataḥ diṭṭha sadisam eva sammukhā
translated: that I saw the Blessed One on the road while going somewhere on some business. This is astonishing.

original: sutaṃ. Dve paccayāti antarāmagge diṭṭhabhāvo ca vessavaṇassa sammukhā sutaṃ ārocetukāmatā ca.
analyzed: sutam dve paccayā ati antarāmagge diṭṭha bhāvo ca vessavaṇassa sammukhā sutam ārocetu kāma tā ca
translated: And it is like seeing the Blessed One face to face that I have heard from the Great King Vessavana, who was speaking to his own assembly. “Two conditions” means the fact of seeing the Blessed One on the road and the desire to inform him.

original: Devasabhāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: deva sabhā vaṇṇanā
translated: The description of the divine assembly

original: 282. Sannipatitāti kasmā sannipatitā? Te kira catūhi kāraṇehi sannipatanti. Vassūpanāyikasaṅgahatthaṃ,
analyzed: sannipatitā ati kasmā sannipatitā te kira catūhi kāraṇehi sannipatanti vassu upanāyika saṅga hattham
translated: Why did they assemble? They assemble for four reasons: to make a collection for the Invitation ceremony,

original: pavāraṇāsaṅgahatthaṃ, dhammasavanatthaṃ, pāricchattakakīḷānubhavanatthanti. Tattha🔽sve vassūpanāyikāti āsāḷhīpuṇṇamāya dvīsu devalokesu devā sudhammāya devasabhāya🔽sannipatitvā mantenti asukavihāre eko bhikkhu vassūpagato, asukavihāre dve tayo cattāro
analyzed: pavāraṇā āsaṅgahattham dhamma savana ttham pāricchattaka kīḷā anubhavana ttham tattha  sve vassūpanāyikā ati āsāḷhīpuṇṇamāya dvīsu deva lokesu devā sudhammāya deva sabhāya  sannipatitvā mantenti asuka vihāre ekaḥ bhikkhu vassūpagataḥ asuka vihāre dve tayo cattāro
translated: to make a collection for the Rains residence, to hear the Dhamma, to enjoy the pleasure of the Pāricchattaka pleasure garden.

original: pañca dasa vīsati tiṃsaṃ cattālīsaṃ paññāsaṃ sataṃ sahassaṃ bhikkhū vassūpagatā,
analyzed: pañca dasa vīsati tiṃsam cattālīsam paññāsam satam sahassam bhikkhū vassūpagatā
translated: Herein, on the day before the Invitation ceremony, on the day of the full moon of the month of Āsāḷhi, the gods of the two heavenly worlds assemble in the Sudhamma Assembly Room of the gods and consult together: “In such-and-such a monastery one bhikkhu has entered upon the Rains; in such-and-such a monastery two, three, four, five, ten, twenty, thirty, forty, fifty, a hundred, a thousand bhikkhus have entered upon the Rains;

original: etthettha ṭhāne ayyānaṃ ārakkhaṃ susaṃvihitaṃ karothāti evaṃ vassūpanāyikasaṅgaho kato hoti.
analyzed: ettha ittha ṭhāne ayyānam ārakkham su saṃvihitam karotha ati evam vassūpanāyika saṅgahaḥ kataḥ hoti
translated: in such-and-such a place you should make the protection of the masters well prepared.” Thus the collection for the Invitation ceremony is made.

original: Tadāpi eteneva kāraṇena sannipatitā. Idaṃ tesaṃ hoti āsanasminti idaṃ tesaṃ catunnaṃ mahārājānaṃ āsanaṃ hoti. Evaṃ tesu nisinnesu atha pacchā amhākaṃ āsanaṃ hoti.
analyzed: tadā api etena iva kāraṇena sannipatitāḥ idam tesam hoti āsanasmin ti idam tesam catunnam mahārājānam āsanam hoti evam tesu nisinnesu atha pacchā amhākam āsanam hoti
translated: Then, for this reason, they assemble. This is their seat: this is the seat of those four Great Kings. When they are seated thus, then afterwards our seat is.

original: Yenatthenāti yena vassūpanāyikatthena. Taṃ atthaṃ cintayitvā taṃ atthaṃ mantayitvāti
analyzed: yena atthena ati yena vassūpanāyika tthena tam attham cintayitvā tam attham mantayitvā ati
translated: For this purpose: for the purpose of the Rains. Having considered that purpose, having discussed that purpose:🔽having considered the protection of the Order of monks who are living in the forest. Herein,

original: taṃ araññavāsino bhikkhusaṅghassa ārakkhatthaṃ cintayitvā. Etthettha vuṭṭhabhikkhusaṅghassa🔽ārakkhaṃ saṃvidahathāti catūhi mahārājehi saddhiṃ mantetvā. Vuttavacanāpi tanti tettiṃsa
analyzed: tam arañña vāsinaḥ bhikkhu saṅghassa ārakkha attham cintayitvā ettha ittha vuṭṭha bhikkhu saṅghassa  ārakkham saṃvidahatha ati catūhi mahārājehi saddhim mantetvā vutta vacanā api tanti tettiṃsa
translated: having made an agreement for the protection of the Order of monks who have come out,🔽the thirty-three devaputtas speak the words spoken by the Great Kings, and the Great Kings speak the words spoken by the thirty-three devaputtas.

original: devaputtā vadanti, mahārājāno vuttavacanā nāma. Tathā tettiṃsa devaputtā paccānusāsanti,
analyzed: deva puttāḥ vadanti mahā rājānaḥ vuttavacanāḥ nāma tathā tettiṃsa deva puttā paccā anusāsanti
translated: The thirty-three devaputtas instruct in return,

original: itare paccānusiṭṭhavacanā nāma. Padadvayepi pana tanti nipātamattameva. Avipakkantāti agatā.
analyzed: itare paccānusiṭṭhavacanāḥ nāma pada dvaye pi pana tanti nipāta mattam eva a vipakkantā ati a gatā
translated: and the others speak the words spoken by those who have instructed in return. But in both cases the word “then” is merely a particle. They have not come: they have not gone.

original: 283. Uḷāroti vipulo mahā. Devānubhāvanti yā sā sabbadevatānaṃ vatthālaṅkāravimānasarīrānaṃ
analyzed: uḷāraḥ ti vipulaḥ mahā yā sā sabba devatānam
translated: “Magnificent” means vast, great. “Divine splendor” is the splendor of all the divine beings’ clothes, ornaments, mansions, and bodies.

original: pabhā dvādasa yojanāni pharati. Mahāpuññānaṃ pana sarīrappabhā yojanasataṃ pharati.
analyzed: pabhā dvādasa yojanāni pharati mahā puññānam pana sarīra ppabhā yojana satam pharati
translated: “Exceeding the splendour of the gods”: the radiance of all the gods’ clothes, ornaments, palaces, and bodies extends twelve leagues. But the radiance of those of great merit extends a hundred leagues.

original: Taṃ devānubhāvaṃ atikkamitvā.
analyzed: tam deva anubhāvam atikkamitvā
translated: “Exceeding the splendour of the gods” means exceeding that radiance.

original: Brahmuno hetaṃ pubbanimittanti yathā sūriyassa udayato etaṃ pubbaṅgamaṃ etaṃ pubbanimittaṃ yadidaṃ aruṇuggaṃ, evameva brahmunopi etaṃ – “pubbanimitta”nti dīpeti.
analyzed: brahmunaḥ ha etam pubba nimittam ti yathā sūriyassa udayataḥ etam pubbaṅgamam etam pubba nimittam yat idam aruṇuggam evam eva brahmunaḥ api etam pubba nimittam ti dīpeti
translated: “It is a sign of Brahmā”: just as the dawn is a sign, a forerunner, of the rising of the sun, so too this is a sign of Brahmā.

original: Sanaṅkumārakathāvaṇṇanā
translated: The Story of Sanaṅkumāra

original: 284. Anabhisambhavanīyoti apattabbo, na taṃ devā tāvatiṃsā passantīti attho. Cakkhupathasminti
analyzed: an abhisambhavanīyaḥ ti a pattabbaḥ na tam devā tāvatiṃsā passanti iti attho cakkhu pathasmin ti
translated: “Incapable of being looked at”: it cannot be seen. The meaning is that the gods of the Tāvatiṃsa realm cannot see it.

original: cakkhupasāde āpāthe vā. So devānaṃ cakkhussa āpāthe sambhavanīyo pattabbo na hoti,
analyzed: cakkhu pasāde āpāthe vā so devānam cakkhussa āpāthe sambhavanīyo pattabbaḥ na hoti
translated: “Within the range of the eye”: within the range of the eye-sensitivity or within the range of the eye. It cannot be seen within the range of the eye of the gods.🔽What is meant is that it does not overpower .

original: na abhibhavatīti vuttaṃ hoti. Heṭṭhā heṭṭhā hi devatā uparūpari devānaṃ oḷārikaṃ
analyzed: na abhibhavati iti vuttam hoti heṭṭhā heṭṭhā hi devatā upari upari devānam oḷārikam
translated: For the gods lower down see the gods higher up as coarse.

original: katvā māpitameva attabhāvaṃ passituṃ sakkonti, vedapaṭilābhanti tuṭṭhipaṭilābhaṃ.
analyzed: katvā māpitam eva atta bhāvam passitum sakkonti veda paṭilābhanti tuṭṭhi paṭilābham
translated: and they are able to see their own bodies as they were made and fashioned. The attainment of knowledge is the attainment of satisfaction.

original: Adhunābhisitto rajjenāti sampati abhisitto rajjena. Ayaṃ panattho duṭṭhagāmaṇiabhayavatthunā dīpetabbo –
analyzed: adhunā abhisittaḥ rajjena ati sampati abhisittaḥ rajjena ayam pana atthaḥ duṭṭha gāmaṇi abhaya vatthunā dīpetabbaḥ
translated: Newly consecrated with sovereignty: consecrated with sovereignty at the present time. But this meaning should be illustrated by the story of the wicked village headman.

original: So kira dvattiṃsa damiḷarājāno vijitvā anurādhapure pattābhiseko tuṭṭhasomanassena
analyzed: saḥ kira dvattiṃsa damiḷa rājānaḥ vijitvā anurādha pure patta abhisekaḥ tuṭṭha somanassena
translated: It seems that after conquering thirty-two Dāmiḷa kings, he arrived at Anurādhapura and was consecrated. He was so pleased and happy that

original: māsaṃ niddaṃ na labhi, tato – “niddaṃ na labhāmi, bhante”ti bhikkhusaṅghassa ācikkhi.
analyzed: māsam niddam na labhi tatas niddam na labhāmi bhante ti bhikkhu saṅghassa ācikkhi
translated: he could not sleep for a month. Then he told the Community of Bhikkhus, “Venerable sirs, I cannot sleep.”

original: Tena hi, mahārāja, ajja uposathaṃ adhiṭṭhāhīti. So ca uposathaṃ adhiṭṭhāsi. Saṅgho
analyzed: tena hi mahā rāja ajja uposatham adhiṭṭhāhi iti saḥ ca uposatham adhiṭṭhāsi saṅghaḥ
translated: “Then, great king, make a Uposatha observance today.” He made a Uposatha observance. The Community of Bhikkhus

original: gantvā – “cittayamakaṃ sajjhāyathā”ti aṭṭha ābhidhammikabhikkhū pesesi. Te gantvā🔽– “nipajja tvaṃ, mahārājā,”ti vatvā sajjhāyaṃ ārabhiṃsu. Rājā sajjhāyaṃ suṇantova
analyzed: gantvā citta yamakam aṭṭha ābhidhammika bhikkhū pesesi te gantvā  nipajja tvam mahā rāja iti vatvā sajjhāyam ārabhiṃsu rājā sajjhāyam suṇantaḥ uva
translated: sent eight bhikkhus who were experts in the Abhidhamma, saying, “Recite the Citta Yamaka for him.” They went and🔽said, “Lie down, great king,” and they began the recitation. The king fell asleep while listening to the recitation. The elders

original: niddaṃ okkami. Therā – rājānaṃ mā pabodhayitthāti pakkamiṃsu. Rājā dutiyadivase sūriyuggamane
analyzed: niddam okkami therāḥ rājānam mā pabodhayittha ati pakkamiṃsu rājā dutiya divase sūri yuj gamane
translated: went away, saying, “Do not wake the king.” The king woke up at sunrise on the following day.

original: pabujjhitvā there apassanto – “kuhiṃ ayyā”ti pucchi. Tumhākaṃ niddokkamanabhāvaṃ
analyzed: pabujjhitvā there a passanto kuhim ayya iti pucchi tumhākam niddokkamana bhāvam
translated: and when he woke up and did not see the elders, he asked, “Where are the venerable ones?”🔽“They have gone, knowing that you were not yet awake.”

original: ñatvā gatāti. Natthi, bho, mayhaṃ ayyakassa dārakānaṃ ajānanakabhesajjaṃ nāma, yāva
analyzed: ñatvā gatā ati natthi bho mayham ayyakassa dārakānam ajānanaka bhesajjam nāma yāva
translated: “There is no medicine for my children that I do not know,

original: niddābhesajjampi jānanti yevāti āha.
analyzed: niddābhesajjampi jānanti yeva iti āha
translated: even the medicine of sleep they know.”

original: Pañcasikhoti pañcasikhagandhabbasadiso hutvā. Pañcasikhagandhabbadevaputtassa kira
analyzed: pañcasikhaḥ iti pañcasikha gandhabba sadisaḥ hutvā pañcasikha gandhabba deva puttassa kira
translated: Pañcasikho: he became like the gandhabba Pañcasikha. The gandhabba prince Pañcasikha, it seems,

original: sabbadevatā attabhāvaṃ mamāyanti. Tasmā brahmāpi tādisaṃyeva attabhāvaṃ nimminitvā
analyzed: sabba devatāḥ atta bhāvam mamāyanti tasmai brahmā api atta bhāvam nimminitvā
translated: all the deities are possessive of their own bodies. Therefore Brahmā too, having created a body like his own,

original: pāturahosi. Pallaṅkena nisīdīti pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā nisīdi.
analyzed: pātuḥ aho asi pallaṅkena nisīdi iti pallaṅkam ābhujitvā nisīdi
translated: sat down cross-legged.

original: Vissaṭṭhoti sumutto apalibuddho. Viññeyyoti atthaviññāpano. Mañjūti madhuro mudu.
analyzed: vissaṭṭhaḥ ti su muttaḥ apalibuddhaḥ viññeyyaḥ ti attha viññāpanaḥ mañju iti madhuraḥ mudu
translated: Clear: well released, unconfined. To be known: informative about the meaning. Sweet: honey-like, gentle.

original: Savanīyoti sotabbayuttako kaṇṇasukho. Bindūti ekagghano. Avisārīti suvisado avippakiṇṇo.
analyzed: savanīyaḥ ti sotabba yuttakaḥ kaṇṇa sukhaḥ bindu ti ekagghanaḥ avisārī iti su visadaḥ a vippakiṇṇaḥ
translated: Worthy of being heard: fit to be heard, pleasing to the ear. Drop by drop: as a single mass. Unbroken: very pure, not mixed with anything else.

original: Gambhīroti nābhimūlato paṭṭhāya gambhīrasamuṭṭhito, na jivhādantaoṭṭhatālumattappahārasamuṭṭhito.
analyzed: gambhīro ti nābhi mūlataḥ paṭṭhāya gambhīra samuṭṭhitaḥ na jivhā danta oṭṭha tālu matta ppahāra samuṭṭhitaḥ
translated: Deep: originating from the navel region, not originating from the mere contact of the tongue, teeth, lips and palate.

original: Evaṃ samuṭṭhito hi amadhuro ca hoti, na ca dūraṃ sāveti. Ninnādīti mahāmeghamudiṅgasaddo
analyzed: evam samuṭṭhitaḥ hi amadhuraḥ ca hoti na ca dūram ninnādī iti mahā megha mudiṅga saddaḥ
translated: It is resounding, like the sound of the drum of the great cloud.

original: viya ninnādayutto. Apicettha pacchimaṃ pacchimaṃ padaṃ purimassa purimassa atthoyevāti
analyzed: viya ninna āda yuttaḥ apica ittha pacchimam pacchimam padam purimassa purimassa
translated: And here the meaning of the last word should be understood in terms of the preceding word.

original: veditabbo. Yathāparisanti yattakā parisā, tattakameva viññāpeti. Anto parisāyaṃ yevassa
analyzed: veditabbaḥ yathāparisanti yattakā parisā tattakam eva viññāpeti antar parisāyam yeva assa
translated: It is known as far as the assembly extends: it is known only as far as the assembly extends.🔽The sound circulates only within the assembly; it does not spread outside.

original: saddo samparivattati, na bahiddhā vidhāvati. Ye hi kecīti ādi bahujanahitāya paṭipannabhāvadassanatthaṃ🔽vadati. Saraṇaṃ gatāti na yathā vā tathā vā saraṇaṃ gate sandhāya vadati. Nibbematikagahitasaraṇe
analyzed: saddo samparivattati na bahiddhā vidhāvati ye hi keci iti ādi bahu jana hitāya paṭipanna bhāva dassana ttham  vadati saraṇam gatā ati na yathā vā tathā vā saraṇam gate sandhāya vadati
translated: He speaks with reference to those who have set out for the welfare of many people.🔽He does not speak with reference to those who have gone for refuge in any way.🔽But he speaks with reference to those who have gone for refuge after careful consideration.

original: pana sandhāya vadati. Gandhabbakāyaṃ paripūrentīti gandhabbadevagaṇaṃ paripūrenti.
analyzed: pana sandhāya vadati gandhabba kāyam paripūrenti iti gandhabba deva gaṇam paripūrenti
translated: They fill the host of the devas: they fill the multitude of the devas.

original: Iti amhākaṃ satthu loke uppannakālato paṭṭhāya cha devalokādīsu piṭṭhaṃ koṭṭetvā
analyzed: iti amhākam satthu loke uppanna kālataḥ paṭṭhāya cha deva loka ādīsu piṭṭham koṭṭetvā
translated: Thus, from the time of our Teacher’s appearance in the world, the devas in the six divine worlds have been beating the drum of their joy.

original: pūritanāḷi viya saravananaḷavanaṃ viya ca nirantaraṃ jātaparisāti āha.
analyzed: pūrita nāḷi ca nirantaram āha
translated: and it is said that they are “born in him in abundance” because they are born in him without interval, like a filled bamboo tube or a reed bed.

original: Bhāvitaiddhipādavaṇṇanā
analyzed: bhāvita aiddhipāda vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the development of the bases of success

original: 287. Yāvasupaññattā cime tena bhagavatāti tena mayhaṃ satthārā bhagavatā yāva supaññattā🔽yāva sukathitā. Iddhipādāti ettha ijjhanaṭṭhena iddhi, patiṭṭhānaṭṭhena pādāti veditabbā.🔽Iddhipahutāyāti iddhipahonakatāya. Iddhivisavitāyāti iddhivipajjanabhāvāya, punappunaṃ
analyzed: yāvasu paññattāḥ cime tena bhagavatā ati tena mayham satthārā bhagavatā yāva su paññattā  yāva su kathitā iddhipādā ti ettha ijjhana ṭhena iddhi patiṭṭhāna ṭhena pādā ti veditabbā  iddhi pahutāya ati iddhi pahonaka tāya iddhi visavitāya ati iddhi vipajjana bhāvāya punappunam
translated: . As far as they are well proclaimed by him: as far as they are well proclaimed, well stated, by him, by my Master, the Blessed One. Bases of success: success in the sense of succeeding, and bases in the sense of foundation.🔽In the sense of abundance of success: in the sense of the abundance of success. In the sense of mastery of success: in the sense of the state of mastery of success. What is meant is: in the sense of the state of having reached mastery by repeated practice.🔽In the sense of the manifestation of success: in the sense of the state of the manifestation of success.🔽In the sense of the exhibition of success: in the sense of the state of the exhibition of success.

original: āsevanavasena ciṇṇavasitāyāti vuttaṃ hoti. Iddhivikubbanatāyāti iddhivikubbanabhāvāya,
analyzed: āsevana vasena ciṇṇa vasi tāya ati vuttam hoti iddhi vikubbana tāya ati iddhi vikubbana bhāvāya

translated: In the sense of the exhibition of success: in the sense of the state of the exhibition of success.🔽In the sense of the manifestation

original: Catukiccasādhakassa sammappadhānavīriyassetaṃ adhivacanaṃ. Samannāgatanti chandasamādhinā🔽ca padhānasaṅkhārena ca upetaṃ. Iddhipādanti nipphattipariyāyena ijjhanaṭṭhena vā,

translated: This is a term for right effort, which is energy accomplishing the fourfold task. Endowed with means endowed with zeal and concentration.

original: ijjhanti etāya sattā iddhā vuddhā ukkaṃsagatā hontīti iminā vā pariyāyena iddhīti🔽saṅkhyaṃ gatānaṃ abhiññācittasampayuttānaṃ chandasamādhipadhānasaṅkhārānaṃ adhiṭṭhānaṭṭhena

translated: Rapture is a term for the joy enlightenment factor. Tranquillity is a term for the tranquillity enlightenment factor.🔽Concentration is a term for the concentration enlightenment factor. Equanimity is a term for the equanimity enlightenment factor.

original: pādabhūto sesacittacetasikarāsīti attho. Vuttañhetaṃ – “iddhipādoti tathābhūtassa🔽vedanākkhandho, saññākkhandho, saṅkhārakkhandho viññāṇakkhandho”ti. Iminā nayena🔽sesesupi attho veditabbo. Yatheva hi chandaṃ adhipatiṃ karitvā paṭiladdhasamādhi
analyzed: attho vuttaṃ ha etam iddhipādo ti tathābhūtassa  vedanā kkhandho saññā kkhandho saṅkhāra kkhandho viññāṇa kkhandho ti iminā nayena  sesesu pi atthaḥ veditabbaḥ yathā iva hi chandam adhipatim karitvā paṭiladdha samādhi
translated: The expression of the four foundations of mindfulness is a term for the mindfulness enlightenment factor.🔽The expression of the four right endeavours is a term for the energy enlightenment factor.🔽The expression of the four bases of success is a term for the concentration enlightenment factor.

original: chandasamādhīti vutto, evaṃ vīriyaṃ, cittaṃ, vīmaṃsaṃ adhipatiṃ karitvā paṭiladdhasamādhi
analyzed: chanda samādhi iti vuttaḥ evam vīriyam cittam vīmaṃsam adhipatim karitvā paṭiladdha samādhi
translated: The expression of the four paths is a term for the understanding enlightenment factor.🔽The expression of the four fruits is a term for the relinquishment of the four kinds of clinging.

original: vīmaṃsāsamādhīti vuccati. Apica upacārajjhānaṃ pādo, paṭhamajjhānaṃ iddhi. Saupacāraṃ
analyzed: vīmaṃsā samādhi iti vuccati apica upacāra jhānam pādaḥ paṭhama jhānam
translated: Furthermore, the access jhāna is the “foot,” and the first jhāna is the “success.”

original: paṭhamajjhānaṃ pādo, dutiyajjhānaṃ iddhīti evaṃ pubbabhāge pādo, aparabhāge iddhīti
analyzed: paṭhama jhānam pādaḥ dutiya jhānam iddhi iti evam pubba bhāge pādaḥ apara bhāge iddhi iti
translated: The first jhāna together with its access is the “foot,” and the second jhāna is the “success.”

original: evamettha attho veditabbo. Vitthārena iddhipādakathā visuddhimagge ca vibhaṅgaṭṭhakathāya ca vuttā.
analyzed: evam ettha atthaḥ veditabbaḥ vitthārena iddhipāda kathā visuddhi magge ca vibhaṅga aṭṭhakathāya ca vuttā
translated: Thus the meaning should be understood here in this way. The explanation of the bases of success in detail is given in the Path of Purification in the Description of the Bases of Success and in the commentary on the Description of the Bases of Success in the Dhammasanganī.

original: Keci pana “nipphannā iddhi. Anipphanno iddhipādo”ti vadanti, tesaṃ vādamaddanatthāya
analyzed: keci pana nipphannā iddhi anipphannaḥ iddhipādo ti vadanti tesam vāda maddana tthāya
translated: But some say that success is what is accomplished and the basis of success is what is not yet accomplished.

original: abhidhamme uttaracūḷikavāro nāma ābhato – “cattāro iddhipādā chandiddhipādo, vīriyiddhipādo,🔽cittiddhipādo, vīmaṃsiddhipādo. Tattha katamo chandiddhipādo? Idha bhikkhu yasmiṃ
analyzed: abhidhamme uttaracūḷikavāraḥ nāma ābhataḥ cattāro iddhipādā chandiddhipādaḥ vīriyiddhipādaḥ  citta iddhipādaḥ vīmaṃsiddhipādo tattha katamo chandiddhipādo idha bhikkhu yasmin
translated: In order to refute them, the “higher grammatical analysis” has been brought in here, namely: “The four bases of success are the basis of success that is will, the basis of success that is energy,🔽the basis of success that is consciousness, and the basis of success that is inquiry. Herein, what is the basis of success that is will? On an occasion when a bhikkhu develops the supramundane jhāna that leads out from the round, turns away from the round, and is not linked to the round,

original: samaye lokuttaraṃ jhānaṃ bhāveti niyyānikaṃ apacayagāmiṃ diṭṭhigatānaṃ pahānāya paṭhamāya
analyzed: samaye lokuttaram jhānam bhāveti niyyānikam apacaya gāmim diṭṭhi gatānam pahānāya paṭhamāya

original: bhūmiyā pattiyā vivicceva kāmehi paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati dukkhāpaṭipadaṃ
analyzed: bhūmiyā pattiyā vivicca iva kāmehi paṭhamam jhānam upasampajja viharati dukkha apaṭipadam

original: dandhābhiññaṃ. Yo tasmiṃ samaye chando chandikatā kattukamyatā kusalo dhammacchando,
analyzed: dandha abhiññam yaḥ tasmin samaye chando chandika tā kattu kamya tā kusalaḥ dhammacchando
translated: “Whatever at that time is will, volition, the act of willing, the state of being willing,🔽this is called the road to power that is swift in producing the attainment of absorption, but difficult in practice.

original: ayaṃ vuccati chandiddhipādo, avasesā dhammā chandiddhipādasampayuttā”ti. Ime pana
analyzed: ayam vuccati chanda iddhipādaḥ avasesā dhammā chanda iddhipāda sampayuttā ati ime pana

original: lokuttaravaseneva āgatā. Tattha raṭṭhapālatthero chandaṃ dhuraṃ katvā lokuttaraṃ
analyzed: lokuttara vasena iva āgatā tattha raṭṭhapāla thero chandam dhuram katvā lokuttaram

analyzed: dhammam nibbattesi soṇa theraḥ vīriyam dhuram katvā sambhūta theraḥ cittam dhuram

translated: The venerable Mogharaja produced them making investigation the dominant factor.🔽“Suppose that there are four friends who go to visit a fifth friend.

translated: and he won a post by pleasing the king. As he did, so should the one who is a creator of the supramundane profitable by means of zeal be understood.

original: Eko pana – “divase divase upaṭṭhātuṃ ko sakkoti, uppanne kicce parakkamena ārādhessāmī”ti
analyzed: ekaḥ pana divase divase upaṭṭhātum ko sakkoti uppanne kicce parakkamena ārādhessāmi iti

analyzed: suṇāti iti satthu sammukhā bhikkhu bhikkhunī ādīhi vā desiyamānam suṇāti yonisas manasikaroti iti  upāyataḥ pathataḥ kāraṇataḥ manasi karoti yonisaḥ manasikāraḥ nāma

analyzed: oḷārikā ati ettha kāya vacī saṅkhārā tāva oḷārikāḥ hontu citta saṅkhārā katham oḷārikā iti

analyzed: appahīna ttā kāya saṅkhārāḥ hi catuttha jhānena pahīyanti vacī saṅkhārāḥ dutiya jhānena
translated: Because they are not abandoned. For bodily formations are abandoned by the fourth jhāna, verbal formations by the second jhāna,

analyzed: citta saṅkhārāḥ nirodha samāpattiyai iti kāya vacī saṅkhāresu pahīnesu pi te tiṭṭhanti yeva ati  pahīne upādāya appahīna ttā oḷārikā nāma jātā nirodhā vuṭṭhahantassa uppannam

Happiness: the happiness of the fourth jhāna that has arisen in one who has emerged from the attainment of cessation.

original: catutthajjhānikaphalasamāpattisukhaṃ. Sukhā bhiyyo somanassati phalasamāpattito vuṭṭhitassa🔽aparāparaṃ somanassaṃ. Dutiyo okāsādhigamoti catutthajjhānaṃ sukhaṃ dukkhaṃ vikkhambhetvā

original: panettha catutthe gahite gahitāneva hontīti visuṃ na vuttānīti.

translated: But the second and third jhānas are included when the fourth is mentioned, so they are not mentioned separately here.

original: Idaṃ kusalantiādīsu kusalaṃ nāma dasakusalakammapathā. Akusalanti dasaakusalakammapathā.
analyzed: idam kusalanti ādīsu kusalam nāma dasa kusala kammapathāḥ akusalanti dasa akusala kammapathāḥ
translated: As regards the words profitable, etc., the profitable is the ten profitable courses of action. The unprofitable is the ten unprofitable courses of action.

original: Sāvajjadukādayopi etesaṃ vaseneva veditabbā. Sabbañceva panetaṃ kaṇhañca sukkañca
analyzed: etesam vasena iva veditabbā sabbam ca iva pana itam kaṇham ca sukkam ca
translated: And all this is dark and bright,

original: sappaṭibhāgañcāti kaṇhasukkasappaṭibhāgaṃ. Nibbānameva hetaṃ appaṭibhāgaṃ. Avijjā
analyzed: sappaṭibhāgam ca ati kaṇha sukka sappaṭibhāgam nibbānam eva ha etam appaṭibhāgam avijjā
translated: and it has an opposite, thus it is “with an opposite.” But only Nibbāna has no opposite.🔽“Ignorance is abandoned” means that the ignorance which covers the round is abandoned.

original: pahīyatīti vaṭṭapaṭicchādikā avijjā pahīyati. Vijjā uppajjatīti arahattamaggavijjā🔽uppajjati. Sukhanti arahattamaggasukhañceva phalasukhañca. Sukhā bhiyyo somanassanti
analyzed: pahīyati iti vaṭṭa paṭicchādikā avijjā pahīyati vijjā uppajjati iti arahatta magga vijjā  uppajjati sukhanti arahatta magga sukhañca iva phala sukhañca sukhā bhiyyas somanassanti
translated: “Clear vision arises” means that the knowledge of the path of arahatship arises.🔽“Happiness” means the happiness of the path of arahatship and the happiness of the fruition of arahatship.🔽“More joy” means the successive joys of one who has emerged from fruition attainment.

original: phalasamāpattito vuṭṭhitassa aparāparaṃ somanassaṃ. Tatiyo okāsādhigamoti arahattamaggo
analyzed: phala samāpattitaḥ vuṭṭhitassa apara aparam somanassam tatiyaḥ okāsa adhigamaḥ ti arahatta maggo
translated: The third kind of penetration of opportunity is the path of arahatship.

original: sabbakilese vikkhambhetvā attano okāsaṃ gahetvā tiṭṭhati, tasmā “tatiyo okāsādhigamo”ti
analyzed: sabba kilese vikkhambhetvā attanaḥ okāsam gahetvā tiṭṭhati tasmā tatiyaḥ okāsa adhigamaḥ ti
translated: It stands having taken its own opportunity by suppressing all defilements, and therefore it is called “the third kind of penetration of opportunity.”

original: vutto. Sesamaggā pana tasmiṃ gahite antogadhā evāti visuṃ na vuttā.
analyzed: vuttaḥ sesa maggā pana tasmin gahite antogadhā evā iti visum na vuttā
translated: But the other paths are included in it, and therefore they are not mentioned separately.

original: Ime pana tayo okāsādhigamā aṭṭhatiṃsārammaṇavasena vitthāretvā kathetabbā. Kathaṃ?
analyzed: ime pana tayo okāsa adhigamā aṭṭhatiṃsa ārammaṇa vasena vitthāretvā kathetabbā katham
translated: But these three kinds of penetration of opportunity should be told in detail by way of the thirty-eight objects. How?

original: Sabbāni ārammaṇāni visuddhimagge vuttanayeneva upacāravasena ca appanāvasena ca vavatthapetvā🔽catuvīsatiyā ṭhānesu paṭhamajjhānaṃ “paṭhamo okāsādhigamo”ti kathetabbaṃ. Terasasu🔽ṭhānesu dutiyatatiyajjhānāni, pannarasasu ṭhānesu catutthajjhānañca nirodhasamāpattiṃ
analyzed: sabbāni ārammaṇāni visuddhi magge vutta nayena iva upacāra vasena ca appanā vasena ca vavatthapetvā  catuvīsatiyāḥ ṭhānesu paṭhamajjhānam paṭhamaḥ okāsa adhigamaḥ ti kathetabbam terasasu  ṭhānesu dutiya tatiya jhānāni pannarasasu ṭhānesu catuttha jhānam ca nirodha samāpattim
translated: All these objects should be defined by way of access and absorption in the way described in the Path of Purification.🔽Then the first jhāna should be spoken of in twenty-four instances as “the first opportunity for the exercise of the direct-knowledge of supernormal power.” The second and third jhānas should be spoken of in thirteen instances,

original: pāpetvā “dutiyo okāsādhigamo”ti kathetabbaṃ. Dasa upacārajjhānāni pana maggassa padaṭṭhānabhūtāni🔽tatiyaṃ okāsādhigamaṃ bhajanti. Apica tīsu sikkhāsu adhisīlasikkhā paṭhamaṃ okāsādhigamaṃ
analyzed: pāpetvā dutiyaḥ okāsa adhigamaḥ ti kathetabbam dasa upacāra jhānāni pana maggassa padaṭṭhāna bhūtāni  tatiyam okāsa adhigamam bhajanti apica tīsu sikkhāsu adhi sīla sikkhā paṭhamam okāsa adhigamam
translated: and the fourth jhāna and the attainment of cessation in fifteen instances as “the second opportunity for the exercise of the direct-knowledge of supernormal power.”🔽But the ten kinds of access jhāna are the third opportunity for the exercise of the direct-knowledge of supernormal power, being the footing for the path.

original: bhajati, adhicittasikkhā dutiyaṃ, adhipaññāsikkhā tatiyanti evaṃ sikkhāvasenapi kathetabbaṃ.
analyzed: bhajati adhicitta sikkhā dutiyam adhipaññā sikkhā tatiyam ti evam sikkhā vasena api kathetabbam
translated: Moreover, the training in the higher virtue is the first opportunity for the exercise of the direct-knowledge of supernormal power, the training in the higher consciousness is the second, and the training in the higher understanding is the third.

original: Sāmaññaphalepi cūḷasīlato yāva paṭhamajjhānā paṭhamo okāsādhigamo, dutiyajjhānato
analyzed: sāmañña phale pi cūḷasīlataḥ paṭhama jhānā paṭhamaḥ okāsa adhigamaḥ dutiya jhānato
translated: And in the Fruits of the Homeless Life too, from the lesser virtue up to the first jhāna is the first opportunity for the exercise of the direct-knowledge of supernormal power, from the second jhāna

original: yāva nevasaññānāsaññāyatanā dutiyo, vipassanāto yāva arahattā tatiyo okāsādhigamoti
analyzed: yāva nevasaññānāsaññāyatanā dutiyaḥ vipassanātaḥ yāva arahattā tatiyaḥ okāsa adhigamo ti
translated: The second is the opportunity of the path from the first jhāna up to the base consisting of neither perception nor non-perception. The third is the opportunity of the path from insight up to arahatship.🔽So it can be told by means of the Fruits of the Life of a Householder.

original: evaṃ sāmaññaphalasuttantavasenapi kathetabbaṃ. Tīsu pana piṭakesu vinayapiṭakaṃ paṭhamaṃ
analyzed: evam sāmañña phala suttanta vasena api kathetabbam tīsu pana piṭakesu vinaya piṭakam paṭhamam
translated: But in the three Piṭakas the Vinaya Piṭaka comes first,

original: okāsādhigamaṃ bhajati, suttantapiṭakaṃ dutiyaṃ, abhidhammapiṭakaṃ tatiyanti evaṃ
analyzed: okāsa adhigamam bhajati suttanta piṭakam dutiyam abhidhamma piṭakam tatiya nti evam
translated: and it is the opportunity of the first. The Sutta Piṭaka is the second, and it is the opportunity of the second. The Abhidhamma Piṭaka is the third, and it is the opportunity of the third.

original: piṭakavasenapi kathetabbaṃ.🔽Pubbe kira mahātherā vassūpanāyikāya imameva suttaṃ paṭṭhapenti. Kiṃ kāraṇā? Tīṇi
analyzed: piṭaka vasena api kathetabbam  pubbe kira mahā therāḥ vassūpanāyikāya imam eva suttam paṭṭhapenti kim kāraṇā tīṇi
translated: So it can be told by means of the Piṭakas.

original: piṭakāni vibhajitvā kathetuṃ labhissāmāti. Tepiṭakena hi samodhānetvā kathentassa
analyzed: piṭakāni vibhajitvā kathetum labhissāma ati tepiṭakena hi samodhānetvā kathentassa
translated: Formerly, it seems, the senior elder monks recited this sutta at the Invitation ceremony. Why? So that they might be able to tell it by dividing it into the three Piṭakas. For if someone tells it by combining it with the three Piṭakas,

original: dukkathitanti na sakkā vattuṃ. Tepiṭakaṃ bhajāpetvā kathitameva idaṃ suttaṃ sukathitaṃ hotīti.
analyzed: dukkathitanti na sakkā vattum tepiṭakam bhajāpetvā kathitam eva idam suttam su kathitam hoti iti
translated: it cannot be said that he tells it badly. Only when he tells it after dividing it into the three Piṭakas can it be said that he tells it well.

original: Catusatipaṭṭhānavaṇṇanā
analyzed: catusati paṭṭhāna vaṇṇanā
translated: The four foundations of mindfulness

original: 289. Kusalassādhigamāyāti maggakusalassa ceva phalakusalassa ca adhigamatthāya. Ubhayampi
analyzed: kusalassa adhigamāya ati magga kusalassa ca iva phala kusalassa ca adhigama tthāya ubhayam pi
translated: For the attainment of the profitable: for the attainment of the profitable path and the profitable fruition. Both are called “profitable” because of the absence of what is unprofitable in them.

original: hetaṃ anavajjaṭṭhena khemaṭṭhena vā kusalameva. Tattha sammāsamādhiyatīti tasmiṃ🔽ajjhattakāye samāhito ekaggacitto hoti. Bahiddhā parakāye ñāṇadassanaṃ abhinibbattetīti
analyzed: anavajja ṭṭhena khema ṭṭhena vā kusalam eva tattha sammāsamādhiyati iti tasmin  ajjhatta kāye samāhitaḥ ekagga cittaḥ hoti bahiddhā parakāye ñāṇa dassanam abhinibbatteti iti
translated: and that is only profitable in the sense of being blameless and in the sense of being safe. Herein, he is concentrated in the body : he is concentrated, one-pointed, in the body that is his own. He generates knowledge and vision externally in the bodies of others :

original: attano kāyato parassa kāyābhimukhaṃ ñāṇaṃ peseti. Esa nayo sabbattha. Sabbattheva🔽ca satimāti padena kāyādipariggāhikā sati, lokoti padena pariggahitakāyādayova loko.
analyzed: attano kāyataḥ parassa kāya abhimukham ñāṇam peseti esa nayaḥ sabbattha sabbattha iva  ca satimā iti padena kāya ādi pariggāhikā satī lokā iti padena pariggahita kāya ādayaḥ uva lokaḥ
translated: and that is profitable only in the sense of being blameless or in the sense of being safe. Herein, he is concentrated in mind in the body means that he is concentrated in mind, one-pointed, in the body. He generates knowledge and vision externally in another’s body means that he sends knowledge out from his own body to the other’s body. The same method of explanation applies in each instance. And in all instances the words with mindfulness well established mean that the mindfulness that discerns the body, etc., is well established. The words the world means the body, etc., that have been discerned.

original: Cattāro cete satipaṭṭhānā lokiyalokuttaramissakā kathitāti veditabbā.
analyzed: cattāro ca ete sati paṭṭhānā lokiya lokuttara missakā kathitā iti veditabbā
translated: And these four foundations of mindfulness should be understood as taught in the way beginning, “One abides contemplating the body as a body internally, ardent, fully aware, and mindful, after removing avarice and sorrow regarding the world” .

original: Sattasamādhiparikkhāravaṇṇanā
analyzed: satta samādhi parikkhāra vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the four foundations of mindfulness🔽As regards the words “requisites of concentration” , there are three kinds of requisites: requisites as adornment, requisites as attendants, and requisites as equipment.

original: 290. Samādhiparikkhārāti ettha tayo parikkhārā. “Ratho sīlaparikkhāro jhānakkho cakkavīriyo”ti🔽hi ettha alaṅkāro parikkhāro nāma. “Sattahi nagaraparikkhārehi suparikkhataṃ hotī”ti
analyzed: samādhi parikkhārā ti ettha tayo parikkhārā ratho sīla parikkhāro jhāna kkho cakka vīriyaḥ ti  hi ettha alaṅkāro parikkhāro nāma sattahi nagara parikkhārehi su parikkhatam hoti iti
translated: For in the passage, “The chariot is endowed with requisites, namely, with wheels, etc.,” it is requisites as adornment that are called “requisites.”🔽And in the passage, “A city is well supplied with requisites when it is well supplied with the seven requisites of a great city” , it is requisites as attendants that are called “requisites.”

original: ettha parivāro parikkhāro nāma. “Gilānapaccayajīvitaparikkhāro”ti ettha sambhāro
analyzed: ettha parivāro parikkhāro nāma gilāna paccaya jīvita parikkhāro ti ettha sambhāro
translated: And in the passage, “The requisites for the life of one who has entered upon the way are the four requisites of a bhikkhu” , it is requisites as equipment that are called “requisites.”

original: parikkhāro nāma. Idha pana parivāraparikkhāravasena “satta samādhiparikkhārā”ti vuttaṃ.🔽Parikkhatāti parivāritā. Ayaṃ vuccati so ariyo sammāsamādhīti ayaṃ sattahi ratanehi
analyzed: parikkhāraḥ nāma idha pana parivāra parikkhāra vasena satta samādhi parikkhārā ti vuttam  parikkhatā ati parivāritā ayam vuccati so ariyo sammāsamādhi iti ayam sattahi ratanehi
translated: Requisites: here they are called the seven requisites of concentration in the sense of equipment and requisites.

original: parivuto cakkavattī viya sattahi aṅgehi parivuto “ariyo sammāsamādhī”ti vuccati.🔽Saupaniso itipīti saupanissayo itipi vuccati, saparivāro yevāti vuttaṃ hoti. Sammādiṭṭhissāti
analyzed: parivutaḥ cakkavattī viya sattahi aṅgehi parivutaḥ ariyo sammāsamādhī iti vuccati  saupanisaḥ itipi iti saupanissayaḥ itipi vuccati sa parivāraḥ yeva āti vuttam hoti sammādiṭṭhissa ati
translated: Surrounded: surrounded by. This is called the Noble One’s right concentration: this is called the Noble One’s right concentration surrounded by the seven requisites like a universal monarch surrounded by the seven treasures.🔽With its supports: it is also called “with its supports” . It is said to have its supports in that it has a following.

original: sammādiṭṭhiyaṃ ṭhitassa. Sammāsaṅkappo pahotīti sammāsaṅkappo pavattati. Esa nayo
analyzed: sammādiṭṭhiyam ṭhitassa sammāsaṅkappo pahoti iti sammāsaṅkappo pavattati esa nayo
translated: In right view: in right view as a path. Right thinking is purified: right thinking occurs. The same method of explanation applies in each instance.

original: sabbapadesu. Ayaṃ panattho maggavasenāpi phalavasenāpi veditabbo. Kathaṃ? Maggasammādiṭṭhiyaṃ
analyzed: sabba padesu ayam pana atthaḥ magga vasena api phala vasena api veditabbaḥ katham magga sammādiṭṭhiyam
translated: But the meaning should be understood in terms of the path and in terms of fruition. How in terms of the path?

original: ṭhitassa maggasammāsaṅkappo pahoti…pe… maggañāṇe ṭhitassa maggavimutti pahoti. Tathā
analyzed: ṭhitassa magga sammāsaṅkappo pahoti pe magga ñāṇe ṭhitassa magga vimutti pahoti tathā
translated: When established in right view as a path, right thinking as a path is purified. … When established in path knowledge, path deliverance is purified.

original: phalasammādiṭṭhiyaṃ ṭhitassa phalasammāsaṅkappo pahoti…pe… phalasammāñāṇe ṭhitassa
analyzed: phala sammādiṭṭhiyam ṭhitassa phala sammāsaṅkappo pahotipe phala sammāñāṇe ṭhitassa
translated: And how in terms of fruition? When established in right view as fruition, right thinking as fruition is purified. … When established in fruition knowledge, fruition deliverance is purified.

original: phalavimutti pahotīti.
analyzed: phala vimutti pahoti iti
translated: he attains the freedom that is the fruit.

original: Svākkhātotiādīni visuddhimagge vaṇṇitāni. Apārutāti vivaṭā. Amatassāti nibbānassa. Dvārāti pavesanamaggā. Aveccappasādenāti acalappasādena. Dhammavinītāti sammāniyyānena niyyātā.
analyzed: svākkhātā ti ādīni visuddhi magge vaṇṇitāni apārutā ati vivaṭā amatassa ati nibbānassa dvārā ati pavesana maggā avecca pasādena ati acala ppasādena dhamma vinītā ati sammā niyyānena niyyātā
translated: Well-proclaimed: etc. as in the Visuddhimagga. Open: revealed. Door to the deathless: to Nibbāna. Way of entry: path of approach. With perfect confidence: with unshakable confidence. Disciplined in Dhamma: led to the right.🔽The other kind of person is one who has attained the state of non-returner.

original: Atthāyaṃ itarā pajāti anāgāmino sandhāyāha, anāgāmino ca atthīti vuttaṃ hoti. Puññabhāgāti
analyzed: attha ayam itarā pajāti anāgāmino sandhāya āha anāgāmino ca atthi iti vuttam hoti puññabhāgā ti
translated: The word “also” implies that there are non-returners too.🔽Born in a family of merit: born in a family that is a store of merit.🔽Ashamed: ashamed of lying.

original: puññakoṭṭhāsena nibbattā. Ottappanti ottappamāno. Tena kadāci nāma musā assāti musāvādabhayena
analyzed: puñña koṭṭhāsena nibbattā ottappanti ottappamāno tena kadāci nāma musā assa ati musāvāda bhayena
translated: I cannot tell a lie, thinking: “Perhaps I might lie on some occasion,”

original: saṅkhātuṃ na sakkomi, na pana mama saṅkhātuṃ balaṃ natthīti dīpeti.
analyzed: saṅkhātum na sakkomi na pana mama saṅkhātum balam natthi iti dīpeti
translated: but I am not without the power to tell it.

original: 291. Taṃ kiṃ maññati bhavanti iminā kevalaṃ vessavaṇaṃ pucchati, na panassa evarūpo satthā nāhosīti vā na bhavissatīti vā laddhi atthi. Sabbabuddhānañhi abhisamaye viseso natthi.
analyzed: tam kim maññati bhavanti iminā kevalam vessavaṇam pucchati na pana assa evarūpaḥ satthā na ahosi iti vā na bhavissati iti vā laddhi atthi sabba buddhānam hi abhisamaye visesaḥ natthi
translated: What do you think of this? : he is asking only Vessavaṇa this, not that he has any opinion that there was or was not such a teacher. For there is no difference in the realization of all Buddhas.

original: 292. Sayaṃparisāyanti attano parisāyaṃ. Tayidaṃ brahmacariyanti taṃ idaṃ sakalaṃ sikkhattayabrahmacariyaṃ. Sesaṃ uttānameva. Imāni pana padāni dhammasaṅgāhakattherehi ṭhapitānīti.
analyzed: sayaṃparisāyanti parisāyam tayidam ti tam idam sakalam sikkhattaya brahmacariyam sesam uttānam eva imāni pana padāni dhammasaṅgāhaka therehi ṭhapitāni iti
translated: In his own assembly: in his own following. This is the whole: this whole spiritual life consisting of the three trainings. The rest is clear. But these words are set out in the Dhamma-Compendium section.

original: Iti sumaṅgalavilāsiniyā dīghanikāyaṭṭhakathāyaṃ
analyzed: iti sumaṅgalavilāsiniyā dīgha nikāya ṭṭhakathā ayam
translated: So in the Long Division of the Dhamma,

original: Janavasabhasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: janavasabha sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Janavasabha Sutta is finished.

original: 6. Mahāgovindasuttavaṇṇanā🔽293. Evaṃ me sutanti mahāgovindasuttaṃ. Tatrāyamanuttānapadavaṇṇanā – pañcasikhoti
analyzed: evam me sutam ti mahāgovindasuttam tatra ayam anuttāna pada vaṇṇanā
translated: The Great Steward Sutta

original: pañcacūḷo pañcakuṇḍaliko. So kira manussapathe puññakammakaraṇakāle daharo pañcacūḷakadārakakāle🔽vacchapālakajeṭṭhako hutvā aññepi dārake gahetvā bahigāme catumaggaṭṭhānesu sālaṃ
analyzed: pañcacūḷaḥ pañcakuṇḍaliko so kira manussa pathe puñña kamma karaṇa kāle daharaḥ pañcacūḷaka dāraka kāle  vaccha pālaka jeṭṭhakaḥ hutvā aññe api dārake gahetvā bahigāme catu magga ṭṭhānesu sālam
translated: Thus I heard. The Great Steward Sutta . Herein, the word-commentary on the uncommon words is this: Pañcasikha . He had five tufts and five curls, it seems. When he was doing meritorious deeds in the human world, he was a young boy of five tufts and five curls.🔽He was the eldest of a number of boys who were looking after cattle.🔽Taking the other boys with him, he made a rest-house at the crossroads outside the village,

original: karonto pokkharaṇiṃ khaṇanto setuṃ bandhanto visamaṃ maggaṃ samaṃ karonto yānānaṃ
analyzed: karontaḥ pokkharaṇim khaṇantaḥ setum bandhantaḥ visamam maggam samam karontaḥ yānānam
translated: dug a lotus-pond, built a bridge, and made a level path where the road was uneven.

original: akkhapaṭighātanarukkhe harantoti evarūpāni puññāni karonto vicaritvā daharova kālamakāsi.
analyzed: akkha paṭighātana rukkhe harantaḥ ti evarūpāni puññāni karontaḥ vicaritvā daharaḥ uva kālam akāsi
translated: “He was a young man who had been in the habit of doing such meritorious deeds as giving gifts, and he died young.

original: Tassa so attabhāvo iṭṭho kanto manāpo ahosi. So kālaṃ katvā cātumahārājikadevaloke🔽navutivassasatasahassappamāṇaṃ āyuṃ gahetvā nibbatti. Tassa tigāvutappamāṇo suvaṇṇakkhandhasadiso
analyzed: tassa saḥ atta bhāvaḥ iṭṭhaḥ kantaḥ manāpaḥ ahosi saḥ kālam katvā cātumahārājika deva loke  navuti vassa sata sahassa ppamāṇam āyum gahetvā nibbatti tassa tiga avuta ppamāṇaḥ suvaṇṇa kkhandha sadiso
translated: His form was pleasing, lovely, and attractive. He died and was reborn in the world of the Four Great Kings,🔽where he lived for nine hundred thousand years. His form was like a mass of gold, three gavutas in extent.

original: attabhāvo ahosi. So sakaṭasahassamattaṃ ābharaṇaṃ pasādhetvā navakumbhamatte gandhe🔽vilimpitvā dibbarattavatthadharo rattasuvaṇṇakaṇṇikaṃ piḷandhitvā pañcahi kuṇḍalakehi
analyzed: atta bhāvaḥ ahosi saḥ sakaṭa sahassa mattam ābharaṇam pasādhetvā nava kumbha matte gandhe  vilimpitvā dibba ratta vattha dharaḥ ratta suvaṇṇa kaṇṇikam piḷandhitvā pañcahi kuṇḍalakehi
translated: He wore a thousand ornaments, and he anointed himself with perfumes in a hundred and eight jars.

original: piṭṭhiyaṃ vattamānehi pañcacūḷakadārakaparihāreneva vicarati. Tenetaṃ “pañcasikho” tveva sañjānanti.
analyzed: piṭṭhiyam vattamānehi pañcacūḷaka dāraka parihārena iva vicarati tena itam pañcasikho tu eva sañjānanti
translated: He wore divine red garments and a red gold earring, and he moved about with five curls on his back, like a child of five years. Therefore they called him “Pañcasikha.”

original: Abhikkantāya rattiyāti abhikkantāya khīṇāya rattiyā, ekakoṭṭhāsaṃ atītāyāti attho.

original: Abhikkantavaṇṇoti atiiṭṭhakantamanāpavaṇṇo. Pakatiyāpi hesa kantavaṇṇo, alaṅkaritvā🔽āgatattā pana abhikkantavaṇṇo ahosi. Kevalakappanti anavasesaṃ samantato. Anavasesattho
analyzed: abhikkanta vaṇṇaḥ ti ati iṭṭha kanta manāpa vaṇṇaḥ pakatiyā api ha isa kanta vaṇṇaḥ alaṅkaritvā  āgata ttā pana abhikkanta vaṇṇaḥ ahosi anavasesam samantataḥ anavasesa tthaḥ
translated: He was of surpassing beauty: he was of very lovely and pleasing appearance. For he was naturally of lovely appearance, but now that he had come🔽adorned, he was of surpassing beauty. The whole of: the meaning of ‘the whole’ here is ‘the entire’;

original: ettha kevalasaddo. Kevalaparipuṇṇanti ettha viya. Samantato attho kappasaddo, kevalakappaṃ🔽jetavanantiādīsu viya. Obhāsetvāti ābhāya pharitvā, candimā viya sūriyo viya ca ekobhāsaṃ

translated: Having lit it up: having pervaded it with radiance, made it one radiance, one illumination, as the moon and as the sun do. This is the meaning.

original: Devasabhāvaṇṇanā🔽294. Sudhammāyaṃ sabhāyanti sudhammāya nāma itthiyā ratanamattakaṇṇikarukkhanissandena🔽nibbattasabhāyaṃ. Tassā kira phalikamayā bhūmi, maṇimayā āṇiyo, suvaṇṇamayā thambhā,
analyzed: deva sabhā vaṇṇanā  sudhammāyam sabhāyanti sudhammāya nāma itthiyāḥ ratana matta kaṇṇika rukkha nissandena  nibbatta sabhāyam tassā kira phalika mayā bhūmi maṇi mayāḥ āṇiyaḥ suvaṇṇa mayāḥ thambhā
translated: The description of the divine assembly

original: rajatamayā thambhaghaṭikā ca saṅghātā ca, pavāḷamayāni vāḷarūpāni, sattaratanamayā
analyzed: rajata mayā thambha ghaṭikā ca saṅghātā ca pavāḷa mayāni vāḷa rūpāni satta ratana mayā

original: gopānasiyo ca pakkhapāsakā ca mukhavaṭṭi ca, indanīlaiṭṭhakāhi chadanaṃ, sovaṇṇamayaṃ
analyzed: gopānasiyo ca pakkhapāsakā ca mukhavaṭṭi ca inda nīla eṭṭhakāhi chadanam sovaṇṇa mayam
translated: and the roof-beams, the roof-tiles, the roof-ridge, the golden roof,

translated: and nine hundred leagues in circumference, and five hundred leagues in height.

original: Dhataraṭṭhotiādīsu dhataraṭṭho gandhabbarājā gandhabbadevatānaṃ koṭisatasahassena🔽parivuto koṭisatasahassasuvaṇṇamayāni phalakāni ca suvaṇṇasattiyo ca gāhāpetvā puratthimāya

translated: In such a Sudhamma Assembly as this, Dhataraṭṭha, the king of the gandhabbas, surrounded by a hundred thousand koṭis of gandhabbas,

analyzed: virūḍhakaḥ kumbhaṇḍa rājā kumbhaṇḍa devatānam koṭi sata sahassena parivutaḥ koṭi sata sahassa rajata mayāni
translated: Virūḷhaka, the king of the kumbhaṇḍas, surrounded by a hundred thousand koṭis of kumbhaṇḍa deities, having had brought a hundred thousand koṭis of silver fans

analyzed: catubbidham eva tesu vassūpanāyika saṅgahaḥ vitthāritaḥ yathā pana vassūpanāyikāya  evam puṇṇama divase sannipatitvā ajja kattha gantvā kassa santike

original: pavāressāmā”ti mantenti. Tattha sakko devānamindo yebhuyyena piyaṅgudīpamahāvihārasmiṃyeva

translated: When the pāricchattaka flowers, they go to wait upon it for a year. They are pleased with its change from green to yellow and so on. As it is said:

analyzed: hoti attamanāḥ bhikkhave devā tāvatiṃsā tasmin samaye honti  paṇḍu palāsaḥ kho
translated: the Tāvatiṃsa devas are elated, ‘The coral tree has turned brown.

analyzed: dāni pāricchattakaḥ koviḍāraḥ na cirassa iva panna palāsaḥ bhavissati iti yasmim bhikkhave

translated: Before long it will be in full bloom.’

analyzed: sabbapāliphullassa kho pana bhikkhave pāricchattakassa koviḷārassa samantā paññāsa
translated: When the coral tree of the Tāvatiṃsa devas is in full bloom, the Tāvatiṃsa devas,

translated: and the fragrance of its flowers goes with the wind for a hundred leagues. Such is the power of the Pāricchattaka coral tree.”🔽When the Pāricchattaka coral tree is in full bloom, there is no need for anyone to climb it to pick the flowers or to bend it down or to shake it.

analyzed: hatthe deti mātali saṅgāhakaḥ sakkassa deva raññaḥ deti
translated: He gives it to Mātali, the charioteer, and he gives it to Sakka, the king of the gods.

original: Yadā puññakammakārakā bahū na honti, potthako khuddako hoti, taṃ disvāva devā – “pamatto,
analyzed: yadā puñña kamma kārakāḥ bahū na honti potthako khuddakaḥ hoti tam disvā ava devā pamattaḥ
translated: When there are not many people who do meritorious deeds, the pot is small. When the gods see that, they are dissatisfied, thinking:

original: vata bho mahājano viharati, cattāro apāyā paripūrissanti, cha devalokā tucchā bhavissantī”ti
analyzed: vata bho mahā janaḥ viharati cattāraḥ apāyā paripūrissanti cha deva lokā tucchā bhavissanti iti
translated: “Oh, people are living carelessly. The four lower worlds will be full, and the six divine worlds will be empty.”

original: anattamanā honti. Sace pana potthako mahā hoti, taṃ disvāva devā – “appamatto, vata
analyzed: anattamanāḥ honti sace pana potthakaḥ mahā hoti tam disvā ava devāḥ appamattaḥ vata
translated: But when the pot is big, they are satisfied, thinking:

original: bho, mahājano viharati, cattāro apāyā suññā bhavissanti, cha devalokā paripūrissanti,
analyzed: bho mahā janaḥ viharati cattāro apāyā suññāḥ bhavissanti cha deva lokā paripūrissanti
translated: “Oh, people are living carefully. The four lower worlds will be empty, and the six divine worlds will be full.

original: buddhasāsane puññāni karitvā āgate mahāpuññe purakkhatvā nakkhattaṃ kīḷituṃ labhissāmā”ti

original: attamanā honti. Taṃ potthakaṃ gahetvā sakko devarājā vāceti. Tassa pakatiniyāmena
analyzed: attamanāḥ honti tam potthakam gahetvā sakkaḥ devarājā vācā iti tassa pakati niyāmena

analyzed: anāgate pi na samanupassāma etarahi pana aññassa satthuno abhāvato yeva aññatra tena  bhagavatā na samanupassāma ati ayam ettha atthaḥ aṭṭhakathāyam pi hi atīta anāgatāḥ buddhāḥ  amhākam satthārā sadisāya iva kim sakkaḥ katheti iti vicāretvā etarahi bahu jana hitāya
translated: The meaning here is this: we do not see anyone else in the past or in the future or in the present who is more helpful to the multitude than the Blessed One.

original: paṭipanno satthā amhākaṃ satthāraṃ muñcitvā añño koci natthi, tasmā na passāmāti
analyzed: paṭipannaḥ satthā amhākam satthāram muñcitvā añño koci natthi tasmā na passāma ati
translated: In the commentary too it is said: “The Buddhas of the past and the future are equal to our Teacher. What can Sakka say? ” Having reflected thus, he said: “The Teacher is engaged in the welfare of the multitude in the present. Apart from our Lord, there is no one else. Therefore we do not see anyone else.”

original: kathetī”ti vuttaṃ. Yathā ca ettha, evaṃ ito paresupi padesu ayamattho veditabbo.

original: rasenapi saṃsandati sameti, majjhe bhinnasuvaṇṇaṃ viya ekasadisameva hoti, na mahāsamuddaudakena
analyzed: rasena api saṃsandati sameti majjhe bhinna suvaṇṇam viya eka sadisam eva hoti na mahā samudda audakena
