original: cintayitvā mahāgovindo “sammodamānā rājāno ciraṃ rajjamanusāsantū”ti evaṃ paṭṭhapesi.
analyzed: cintayitvā mahāgovindo sammodamānāḥ rājānaḥ ciram rajjam anusāsantu iti evam paṭṭhapesi
translated: Thinking of this, the Great Steward established the cities in this way, thinking, “May the kings live long, governing their kingdoms in harmony.”

original: “Dantapuraṃ kaliṅgānaṃ, assakānañca potanaṃ;
analyzed: dantapuram kaliṅgānam assakānam ca potanam
translated: “Dantapura for the Kaliṅgas, Potana for the Assakas,

original: Māhissati avantīnaṃ, sovīrānañca rodukaṃ.
analyzed: avantīnam rodukam
translated: Māhissati for the Avantīs, Roduka for the Sovira people.

original: Mithilā ca videhānaṃ, campā aṅgesu māpitā;
analyzed: mithilā ca videhānam campā aṅgesu māpitā
translated: Mithilā for the Videhans, Campā was built for the Aṅgas,

original: Bārāṇasī ca kāsīnaṃ, ete govindamāpitā”ti. –
analyzed: bārāṇasī ca kāsīnam ete
translated: Bārāṇasī for the Kāsis, these were built for Mahāgovinda.”

original: Etāni satta nagarāni mahāgovindeneva tesaṃ rājūnaṃ atthāya māpitāni.
analyzed: etāni satta nagarāni mahāgovindena iva tesam rājūnam atthāya māpitāni
translated: These seven cities were built by Mahāgovinda for the benefit of these kings.

original: “Sattabhū brahmadatto ca, vessabhū bharato saha;
analyzed: sattabhū brahmadatto ca vessabhū bharato saha
translated: “Sattabhū and Brahmadatta, Vessabhū and Bharata together,

original: Reṇu dve ca dhataraṭṭhā, tadāsuṃ satta bhāradhā”ti. –
analyzed: dve ca dhataraṭṭhā satta bhāradhāti
translated: Reṇu and two Dhataraṭṭhas, these were the seven Bhāradvājas.”

original: Imāni tesaṃ sattannampi nāmāni. Tesu hi eko sattabhū nāma ahosi, eko brahmadatto
analyzed: imāni tesam nāmāni tesu hi ekaḥ nāma ahosi ekaḥ brahmadatto
translated: These are the names of those seven. For one was called Sattabhū, one Brahmadatta,

original: nāma, eko vessabhū nāma, eko teneva saha bharato nāma, eko reṇu nāma, dve pana dhataraṭṭhāti
analyzed: nāma ekaḥ vessabhū nāma ekaḥ tena iva saha bharataḥ nāma ekaḥ reṇu nāma dve pana
translated: one Vessabhū, one together with him Bharata, one Reṇu, and two Dhataraṭṭhas.

original: ime satta jambudīpatale bhāradhā mahārājāno ahesunti.
analyzed: ime satta jambudīpa tale bhāradhāḥ mahā rājānaḥ ahesunti
translated: These seven were the great kings of the Bhāradvāja clan on the face of Jambudīpa.

original: Paṭhamabhāṇavāravaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: paṭhama bhāṇa vāra vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The first recitation section is finished.

original: Kittisaddaabbhuggamanavaṇṇanā
translated: The description of the spreading of his fame

original: 311. Upasaṅkamiṃsūti “amhākaṃ ayaṃ issariyasampatti na aññassānubhāvena, mahāgovindassānubhāvena
analyzed: upasaṅkamiṃsu iti amhākam ayam issariya sampatti na aññassa anubhāvena mahāgovindassa anubhāvena
translated: They approached him, thinking: “This our prosperity is not due to the power of anyone else, but to the power of Mahā-Govinda.

original: nipphannā. Mahāgovindo amhe satta rājāno samagge katvā jambudīpatale patiṭṭhāpesi,
analyzed: nipphannā mahāgovindo amhe satta rājānaḥ samagge katvā jambudīpa tale patiṭṭhāpesi
translated: Mahā-Govinda united us seven kings and established us in the sovereignty of the whole of Jambudīpa.

original: pubbūpakārissa pana na sukarā paṭikiriyā kātuṃ. Amhe sattapi jane esoyeva anusāsatu,
analyzed: pubbūpakārissa pana na sukarā paṭikiriyā kātum amhe satta pi jane anusāsatu
translated: But it is not easy to repay the benefits conferred by him. Let him alone instruct us seven people.

original: etaṃyeva senāpatiñca purohitañca karoma, evaṃ no vuddhi bhavissatī”ti cintetvā upasaṅkamiṃsu.
analyzed: etaṃyeva senāpatiñca purohitañca karoma evam naḥ vuddhi bhavissati iti cintetvā upasaṅkamiṃsu
translated: Let us make him our general and our chaplain. In this way our prosperity will increase.”

original: Mahāgovindopi – “mayā ete samaggā katā, sace etesaṃ añño senāpati purohito ca bhavissati,🔽tato attano attano senāpatipurohitānaṃ vacanaṃ gahetvā aññamaññaṃ bhindissanti, adhivāsemi
analyzed: mahāgovindaḥ pi mayā ete samaggā katā sace etesam añño senāpati purohito ca bhavissati  tatas attanaḥ attanaḥ senāpati purohitānam vacanam gahetvā aññam aññam bhindissanti adhivāsemi
translated: Mahā-Govinda thought: “I have united them. If they were to have another general and chaplain,🔽they would take the advice of their own general and chaplain and would split up again. I will accept their offer.

original: nesaṃ senāpatiṭṭhānañca purohitaṭṭhānañcā”ti cintetvā “evaṃ bho”ti paccassosi.
analyzed: na īsam senāpati ṭṭhānañca purohita ṭṭhānañca ati cintetvā evam bhoti paccassosi
translated: I will be their general and their chaplain.” And he consented, saying: “So be it.”

original: Satta ca brāhmaṇamahāsāleti “ahaṃ sabbaṭṭhānesu sammukho bhaveyyaṃ vā na vā, yatthāhaṃ
analyzed: satta ca brāhmaṇa mahāsāla iti aham sabba ṭṭhānesu sammukhaḥ bhaveyyam vā na vā yatthā aham
translated: And seven great brahmin householders: he appointed seven chief brahmins, thinking, “Whether I am present or not, they will do what is to be done

original: sammukho na bhavissāmi, tattheva te kattabbaṃ karissantī”ti satta anupurohite ṭhapesi.
analyzed: sammukhaḥ na bhavissāmi tattha eva te kattabbam karissanti iti satta anupurohite ṭhapesi
translated: where I am not present.”🔽With reference to them it is said: “And seven great brahmin householders.”

original: Te sandhāya idaṃ vuttaṃ – “satta ca brāhmaṇamahāsāle”ti. Divasassa dvikkhattuṃ vā🔽sāyaṃ pāto vā nahāyantīti nahātakā. Vatacariyapariyosāne vā nahātā, tato paṭṭhāya
analyzed: te sandhāya idam vuttam satta ca brāhmaṇa mahāsālā iti divasassa dvi khattum vā  sāyam pātaḥ vā nahāyanti iti nahātakāḥ vata cariya pariyosāne vā nahātā tatas paṭṭhāya
translated: They bathed twice a day, in the morning and in the evening,

original: brāhmaṇehi saddhiṃ na khādanti na pivantīti nahātakā.
analyzed: brāhmaṇehi saddhim na khādanti na pivanti iti nahātakā
translated: or they bathed once a day and then did not eat or drink with the brahmins.

original: 312. Abbhuggacchīti abhiuggacchi. Tadā kira manussānaṃ “na brahmunā saddhiṃ amantetvā
analyzed: abbhuggacchi iti abhiuggacchi tadā kira manussānam na brahmunā saddhim a mantetvā
translated: He approached: he went to. At that time, it seems, the people were sitting here and there discussing the matter thus: “Without inviting Brahma,

original: sakkā evaṃ sakalajambudīpaṃ anusāsitu”nti nisinnanisinnaṭṭhāne ayameva kathā pavattittha.
analyzed: sakkā evam sakala jambudīpam anusāsitun ti nisinna nisinna ṭṭhāne ayam eva kathā
translated: it is not possible to rule the whole of Jambudīpa.”

original: Na kho panāhanti mahāpuriso kira – “ayaṃ mayhaṃ abhūto vaṇṇo uppanno, vaṇṇuppatti
analyzed: na kho pana ahanti mahā purisaḥ kira ayam mayham abhūtaḥ vaṇṇaḥ uppannaḥ vaṇṇa uppatti
translated: But he: the Great Man, it seems, thought, “This false report has arisen about me. It is not proper for me to remain here.

original: kho pana na bhāriyā, uppannassa vaṇṇassa rakkhanameva bhāriyaṃ, ayañca me acintetvā
analyzed: kho pana na bhāriyā uppannassa vaṇṇassa rakkhanam eva bhāriyam ayaṃ ca me a cintetvā
translated: but it is not heavy, the protection of the arisen beauty is heavy, and this (beauty) is not thought of by me,

original: amantetvā karontasseva vaṇṇo uppannova, cintetvā mantetvā karontassa pana vitthārikataro
analyzed: a mantetvā karontassa iva vaṇṇaḥ uppannaḥ iva cintetvā mantetvā karontassa pana vitthārikataro
translated: But it is not the making that is difficult; it is the preserving of the colour that is difficult. And this colour has appeared in me without my thinking about it or consulting anyone. But if I were to think about it and consult others, the colour would be more extensive still.”

original: bhavissatī”ti brahmadassane upāyaṃ pariyesanto taṃ disvā sutaṃ kho pana metantiādiatthaṃ parivitakkesi.🔽313. Yena reṇu rājā tenupasaṅkamīti evaṃ me antarā daṭṭhukāmo vā sallapitukāmo vā
analyzed: bhavissati iti brahma dassane upāyam pariyesantaḥ tam disvā sutam kho pana me tat ti ādi attham parivitakkesi  yena reṇu rājā tena upasaṅkamīti evam me antarā daṭṭhu kāmaḥ vā sallapitu kāmaḥ vā
translated: So he sought a means of seeing Brahmā. And when he saw him, he reflected on the meaning of the verse beginning, “Now that I have seen Brahmā with my own eyes.”

original: na bhavissati, yato chinnapalibodho sukhaṃ viharissāmīti palibodhupacchedanatthaṃ
analyzed: na bhavissati yatas chinna palibodhaḥ sukham viharissāmi iti palibodha upacchedana attham
translated: “I will go to King Reṇu”: he thought, “I will not be able to see him or speak to him. But when I have cut off the hindrances, I will be able to live happily.”

original: upasaṅkami, esa nayo sabbattha.
analyzed: upasaṅkami esa nayo sabbattha
translated: So he went to him in order to cut off the hindrances. The same method applies in all the other cases.

original: 316. Sādisiyoti samavaṇṇā samajātikā.🔽317. Navaṃ sandhāgāraṃ kāretvāti rattiṭṭhānadivāṭṭhānacaṅkamanasampannaṃ vassike
analyzed: sā adisiyā iti sama vaṇṇā sama jātikā  navam sandhāgāram kāretvā ati ratti ṭṭhāna divāṭṭhāna caṅkamana sampannam vassike
translated: “A suitable wife”: one of the same social class.

original: cattāro māse vasanakkhamaṃ bahi naḷaparikkhittaṃ vicittaṃ āvasathaṃ kāretvā. Karuṇaṃ
analyzed: cattāraḥ māse vasana khamam bahi naḷa parikkhittam vicittam āvasatham kāretvā karuṇam
translated: “Having had a new reception hall built”: he had a reception hall built with a walking-path for the rainy season and for the day, suitable for living in for the four months of the rainy season, surrounded outside with reeds, and decorated inside.

original: jhānaṃ jhāyīti karuṇāya tikacatukkajjhānaṃ jhāyi, karuṇāmukhena panettha avasesāpi🔽tayo brahmavihārā gahitāva. Ukkaṇṭhanā paritassanāti jhānabhūmiyaṃ ṭhitassa anabhiratiukkaṇṭhanā
analyzed: jhānam jhāyi iti karuṇāya tika catukka jhānam jhāyi karuṇā mukhena pana ittha avasesā api  tayaḥ brahmavihārāḥ ukkaṇṭhanā paritassanā ati jhāna bhūmiyam ṭhitassa an abhirati ukkaṇṭhanā
translated: He meditates on the jhāna: he meditates on the three or four jhānas classed as “with compassion” . But in this stanza the other three divine abidings are included too, since they are all classed as “divine abidings” . Discontent and anxiety : discontent with the jhāna plane and anxiety about the sensual-sphere plane.

original: vā bhayaparitassanā vā natthi, brahmuno pana āgamanapatthanā āgamanataṇhā ahūti attho.
analyzed: vā bhaya paritassanā vā natthi brahmuno pana āgamana patthanā āgamana taṇhā ahū ti attho
translated: He meditates on the meditation, that is, he meditates on the three and four jhānas through compassion. But here the other three divine abidings are included too, by implication, through compassion. He has no discontent or anxiety: he has no discontent or dissatisfaction or anxiety or fear in being established in the jhāna plane. The meaning is that he has no craving for the arrival of Brahmā, no desire for his arrival.

original: Brahmunāsākacchāvaṇṇanā🔽318. Bhayanti cittutrāsabhayameva. Ajānantāti ajānamānā. Kathaṃ jānemu taṃ mayanti🔽mayaṃ kinti taṃ jānāma, ayaṃ katthavāsiko, kinnāmo, kiṃ gottotiādīnaṃ ākārānaṃ kena
analyzed: brahmu nāsā kaccha vaṇṇanā  bhayanti cittu trāsa bhayam eva a jānanta ati a jānamānā katham tam  mayam kinti tam jānāma ayam katthavāsikaḥ kinnāmo kim gotto ti ādīnam kena
translated: The explanation of the discussion with Brahmā is finished.🔽Fear: only fear as fright of the mind. Not knowing: not knowing. How should we know him?

original: ākārena taṃ dhārayāmāti attho.
analyzed: ākārena tam dhārayāma ati attho
translated: The meaning is, how should we know him thus: “He is such and such a one from such and such a place, he is named so-and-so, he is of such and such a clan, and so on?”

original: Maṃ ve kumāraṃ jānantīti maṃ “kumāro”ti “daharo”ti jānanti. Brahmaloketi seṭṭhaloke.
analyzed: mam kumāram jānanti iti mam kumāra uti dahara uti jānanti brahma loka iti seṭṭha loke
translated: They know me as a young god: they know me as a “young god,” as a “boy.” In the Brahmā-world: in the best world.

original: Sanantananti ciratanaṃ porāṇakaṃ. Ahaṃ so porāṇakumāro sanaṅkumāro nāma brahmāti
analyzed: ciratanam porāṇakam aham saḥ porāṇa kumāraḥ sanaṅkumāraḥ nāma brahmā ati
translated: Eternal: long-standing, ancient. I am that ancient young god, the ancient boy, the Brahmā named Sanaṅkumāra.

original: dasseti. Evaṃ govinda jānāhīti govinda paṇḍita, tvaṃ evaṃ jānāhi, evaṃ maṃ dhārehi.
analyzed: dassa iti evam govinda jānāhi iti govinda paṇḍita tvam evam jānāhi evam mama dhārehi
translated: thus, Govinda, you should understand me.

original: “Āsanaṃ udakaṃ pajjaṃ, madhusākañca brahmuno;
analyzed: āsanam udakam pajjam madhu sākam ca brahmunaḥ
translated: Seat, water, and a foot-stool, honey and curds,🔽we ask you, sir, to name your fee,

original: Agghe bhavantaṃ pucchāma, agghaṃ kurutu no bhava”nti. –
analyzed: agghe bhavantam pucchāma aggham kurutu naḥ bhavanti
translated: please name your fee.

original: Ettha agghanti atithino upanāmetabbaṃ vuccati. Teneva idamāsanaṃ paññattaṃ, ettha
analyzed: ettha agghanti atithinaḥ upanāmetabbam vuccati tena iva idam āsanam paññattam ettha
translated: Here, “fee” means what is to be offered to a guest. Therefore, “This seat is prepared,

original: nisīdatha, idaṃ udakaṃ parisuddhaṃ, ito pānīyaṃ pivatha, pāde dhovatha, idaṃ pajjaṃ
analyzed: nisīdatha idam udakam parisuddham itas pānīyam pivatha pāde dhovatha idam pajjam
translated: please sit here. This water is pure, please drink it. Please wash your feet. This foot-salve

original: pādānaṃ hitatthāya abhisaṅkhataṃ telaṃ, ito pāde makkhetha, idaṃ madhusākanti. Bodhisattassa
analyzed: pādānam hita tthāya abhisaṅkhatam telam itas pāde makkhetha idam madhu sākam ti bodhisattassa
translated: is prepared for the benefit of your feet, please anoint your feet with it. This is honey and curds.”

original: brahmacariyaṃ na aññesaṃ brahmacariyasadisaṃ hoti, na so “idaṃ sve, idaṃ tatiyadivase
analyzed: brahmacariyam na aññesam brahmacariya sadisam hoti na so idam sve idam tatiya divase
translated: The Bodhisatta’s celibacy is not like that of others. He does not make a store of things, thinking, “This is for tomorrow, this will be for the third day.”

original: bhavissatī”ti sannidhiṃ nāma karoti. Madhusākaṃ pana aloṇaṃ adhūpanaṃ atakkaṃ udakena
analyzed: bhavissati iti sannidhim nāma karoti madhu sākam pana a loṇam a dhūpanam a takkam udakena
translated: But the honey and curds are unsalted, unseasoned, and unmixed with water.

original: seditasākaṃ, taṃ sandhāyesa – “idaṃ paribhuñjathā”ti vadanto “agghe bhavantaṃ pucchāmā”tiādimāha.
analyzed: tam sandhāya īse idam paribhuñjatha ati vadantaḥ agghe bhavantam puccha amāti ādim āha
translated: He said this, thinking of the vegetables, “Eat this,” and so on.

original: Ime sabbepi agghā brahmuno atthi. Te agghe bhavantaṃ pucchāma. Evaṃ pucchantānañca
analyzed: ime sabbe api agghā brahmunaḥ atthi te agghe bhavantam pucchāmaḥ evam pucchantānam ca
translated: All these prices are in the possession of Brahmā. We ask you, sir, to set a price on them.🔽And when we ask you in this way,

original: agghaṃ kurutu no bhavaṃ, paṭiggaṇhātu no bhavaṃ idamagghanti vuttaṃ hoti. Kiṃ panesa🔽– “ito ekampi brahmā na bhuñjatī”ti idaṃ na jānātīti. No na jānāti, jānantopi attano
analyzed: aggham kurutu naḥ bhavam paṭiggaṇhātu naḥ bhavam idam aggham ti vuttam hoti kim pana esa  itas ekam pi brahmā na bhuñjati iti idam na jānāti iti no na jānāti jānantaḥ api
translated: please set a price on them for us. Please accept this price, sir.🔽But why does he not know that even one Brahmā does not eat this?

original: santike āgato atithi pucchitabboti vattasīsena pucchati.
analyzed: santike āgataḥ atithi pucchitabbo ti vatta sīsena pucchati
translated: He does not not know. Although he knows, he asks in the manner of one who is a host and who should be asked by a guest who has come to his house.🔽Then Brahmā thought, “Why does this wise man ask me this?

original: Atha kho brahmā – “kiṃ nu kho paṇḍito mama paribhogakaraṇābhāvaṃ ñatvā pucchati,🔽udāhu kohaññe ṭhatvā pucchatī”ti samannāharanto “vattasīse ṭhito pucchatī”ti ñatvā
analyzed: atha kho brahmā kim nu kho paṇḍitaḥ mama paribhoga karaṇa abhāvam ñatvā pucchati  udāhu kohaññe ṭhatvā pucchati iti samannāharantaḥ vatta sīse ṭhito pucchati iti ñatvā
translated: Does he know that I do not use these things,🔽or does he ask out of mere curiosity?”🔽Realizing that he was asking out of mere curiosity, Brahmā thought, “Now it is proper for me to accept them.”

original: paṭiggaṇhituṃ dāni me vaṭṭatīti paṭiggaṇhāma te agghaṃ, yaṃ tvaṃ govinda bhāsasīti
analyzed: paṭiggaṇhitum dāni me vaṭṭati iti paṭiggaṇhāma te aggham yam tvam govinda bhāsasi iti
translated: So he said, “We accept the price you set, Gotama.

original: āha. Yaṃ tvaṃ govinda bhāsasi – “idamāsanaṃ paññattaṃ, ettha nisīdathā”tiādi, tatra🔽te mayaṃ āsane nisinnā nāma homa, pānīyaṃ pītā nāma homa, pādāpi me dhotā nāma hontu,
analyzed: āha yam tvam govinda bhāsasi idam āsanam paññattam ettha nisīdatha atiādi tatra  te mayam āsane nisinnāḥ nāma homa pānīyam pītāḥ nāma homa pādā api me dhotāḥ nāma hontu
translated: He said: “What you say, Gotama, is this seat prepared, sit down here, etc., there🔽we are sitting on the seat, we have drunk the water, our feet have been washed,

original: telenapi makkhitā nāma hontu, udakasākampi paribhuttaṃ nāma hotu, tayā dinnaṃ adhivāsitakālato
analyzed: telena api makkhitāḥ nāma hontu udaka sākam pi paribhuttam nāma hotu tayā dinnam adhivāsita kālataḥ
translated: we have been anointed with oil, we have eaten the meal, from the time you gave us permission

original: paṭṭhāya yaṃ yaṃ tvaṃ bhāsasi, taṃ taṃ mayā paṭiggahitameva hoti. Tena vuttaṃ – “paṭiggaṇhāma
analyzed: paṭṭhāya yam yam tvam bhāsasi tam tam mayā paṭiggahitam eva hoti tena vuttam paṭiggaṇhāma
translated: we have accepted whatever you have said. Therefore it is said: ‘We accept

original: te agghaṃ, yaṃ tvaṃ govinda bhāsasī”ti. Evaṃ pana agghaṃ paṭiggaṇhitvā pañhassa okāsaṃ
analyzed: te aggham yam tvam govinda bhāsasi iti evam pana aggham paṭiggaṇhitvā pañhassa okāsam
translated: your fee, what you say, Gotama.’ Having thus accepted the fee, he made an opportunity for the question

original: karonto diṭṭhadhammahitatthāyātiādimāha.
analyzed: karontaḥ diṭṭha dhamma hita tthāya iti ādim āha
translated: by saying ‘for the welfare of the world’ and so on.

original: Kaṅkhī akaṅkhiṃ paravediyesūti ahaṃ savicikiccho bhavantaṃ parena sayaṃ abhisaṅkhatattā parassa pākaṭesu paravediyesu pañhesu nibbicikicchaṃ.
analyzed: kaṅkhī akaṅkhim para vediyesu iti aham sa vicikicchaḥ bhavantam parena sayam parassa pākaṭesu para vediyesu pañhesu nibbicikiccham
translated: ‘In doubt, free from doubt, I have understood others’ questions’ means: I was doubtful, Gotama, but now I am free from doubt, having understood by myself the questions of others which are clear to others.

original: Hitvā mamattanti idaṃ mama, idaṃ mamāti upakaraṇataṇhaṃ cajitvā. Manujesūti sattesu,
analyzed: hitvā idam mama idam mama ati upakaraṇa taṇham cajitvā manujesu iti sattesu
translated: ‘Having abandoned self-love’: having given up the craving for requisites, thinking ‘This is mine, this I am, this is my self.’ ‘Among men’: among beings.

original: manujesu yo koci manujo mamattaṃ hitvāti attho. Ekodibhūtoti ekībhūto, eko tiṭṭhanto
analyzed: manujesu yaḥ koci manujaḥ mamattam hitvā iti attho ekodibhūto ti ekībhūto eko tiṭṭhanto
translated: ‘Any man’: any human being. ‘Having abandoned self-love’: the meaning is, having abandoned the conceit ‘I am.’ ‘Alone’: having become one, standing alone,

original: eko nisīdantoti. Vacanattho panettha eko udeti pavattatīti ekodi, tādiso bhūtoti
analyzed: ekaḥ nisīdanto ti vacana atthaḥ pana ittha ekaḥ udeti pavattati iti ekodi tādisaḥ bhūtoti
translated: sitting alone. But the meaning of the words is as follows: ‘Alone’ is that which arises and occurs as one ; one who is such is ‘alone-become’ .

original: ekodibhūto. Karuṇedhimuttoti karuṇājhāne adhimutto, taṃ jhānaṃ nibbattetvāti attho.
analyzed: ekodibhūtaḥ karuṇā adhimuttaḥ ti karuṇā jhāne adhimuttaḥ tam jhānam nibbattetvā ati attho
translated: ‘Intent on compassion’: intent on the jhana of compassion. The meaning is, having produced that jhana.

original: Nirāmagandhoti vissagandhavirahito. Ettha ṭhitoti etesu dhammesu ṭhito. Ettha ca🔽sikkhamānoti etesu dhammesu sikkhamāno. Ayamettha saṅkhepo, vitthāro pana upari mahāgovindena
analyzed: nirāma gandho ti vissa gandha virahitaḥ ettha ṭhitaḥ ti etesu dhammesu ṭhitaḥ ettha ca  sikkhamāno ti etesu dhammesu sikkhamāno ayam ettha saṅkhepaḥ vitthāraḥ pana upari mahāgovindena
translated: ‘Odourless’: devoid of bad smells. ‘Standing here’: standing in these states. And here

original: ca brahmunā ca vuttoyeva.
analyzed: ca brahmunā ca
translated: ‘training’: training in these states. This is the brief treatment. The detailed treatment is given by the Great Steward and by Brahma in the Maha-Govinda-sutta .

original: 320. Tattha ete avidvāti ete āmagandhe ahaṃ avidvā, na jānāmīti attho. Idha brūhi
analyzed: tattha ete avidvā iti ete āmagandhe aham avidvā na jānāmi iti attho idha brūhi
translated: Herein, ‘I am unskilled in this’ means ‘I am unskilled in these bad odours, I do not know them.’ ‘Herein, speak out’ means ‘speak out about these bad odours.’

original: dhīrāti te me tvaṃ idha dhīra paṇḍita, brūhi, vada. Kenāvaṭā vāti pajā kurutūti katamena🔽kilesāvaraṇena āvaritā pajā pūtikā vāyati. Āpāyikāti apāyūpagā. Nivutabrahmalokāti🔽nivuto pihito brahmaloko assāti nivutabrahmaloko. Katamena kilesena pajāya brahmalokūpago🔽maggo nivuto pihito paṭicchannoti pucchati.🔽Kodho mosavajjaṃ nikati ca dubbhoti kujjhanalakkhaṇo kodho ca, paravisaṃvādanalakkhaṇo
analyzed: te me tvam dhīra paṇḍita brūhi vada kena avaṭā vāti pajā kurutu uti katamena  kilesa āvaraṇena āvaritā pajā pūtikā vāyati āpāyikā ati apāyu upagā nivuta brahma lokā ati  nivutaḥ pihitaḥ brahmalokaḥ assa ati nivuta brahmalokaḥ katamena kilesena pajāya brahmaloka upago  maggaḥ nivutaḥ pihitaḥ paṭicchannaḥ ti pucchati  kodhaḥ mosa vajjam ca kujjhana lakkhaṇo kodho ca para visaṃvādana lakkhaṇo
translated: “Wise One,” he said, “you are wise here, so tell me, speak. By what is the world covered that it stinks and stinks?”

original: musāvādo ca, sadisaṃ dassetvā vañcanalakkhaṇā nikati ca, mittadubbhanalakkhaṇo dubbho🔽ca. Kadariyatā atimāno usūyāti thaddhamacchariyalakkhaṇā kadariyatā ca, atikkamitvā🔽maññanalakkhaṇo atimāno ca, parasampattikhīyanalakkhaṇā usūyā ca. Icchā vivicchā
analyzed: musāvādaḥ ca sadisam dassetvā vañcana lakkhaṇā nikati ca mitta dubbhana lakkhaṇaḥ dubbhaḥ 🔽ca kadariya tā atimānaḥ usūyāti thaddhamat śariya lakkhaṇā kadariya tā ca atikkamitvā 🔽maññana lakkhaṇo atimāno ca para sampatti khīyana lakkhaṇā usūyā ca icchā vivicchā

original: paraheṭhanā cāti taṇhālakkhaṇā icchā ca, macchariyalakkhaṇā vivicchā ca, vihiṃsālakkhaṇā🔽paraheṭhanā ca. Lobho ca doso ca mado ca mohoti yattha katthaci lubbhanalakkhaṇo
analyzed: para heṭhanā ca ati taṇhā lakkhaṇā icchā ca macchariya lakkhaṇā vivicchā ca vihiṃsā lakkhaṇā  para heṭhanā ca lobho ca doso ca mado ca moho ti yattha katthaci lubbhana lakkhaṇo
translated: and also the harming of others.🔽Greed, hate, conceit, and delusion: wherever there is the characteristic of greed, that is greed;

original: lobho ca, dussanalakkhaṇo doso ca, majjanalakkhaṇo mado ca, muyhanalakkhaṇo moho
analyzed: lobho ca dussana lakkhaṇaḥ doso ca majjana lakkhaṇaḥ mado ca muyhana lakkhaṇaḥ moho
translated: wherever there is the characteristic of hate, that is hate; wherever there is the characteristic of conceit, that is conceit; wherever there is the characteristic of delusion, that is delusion.

original: ca. Etesu yuttā anirāmagandhāti etesu cuddasasu kilesesu yuttā pajā nirāmagandhā🔽na hoti, āmagandhā sakuṇapagandhā pūtigandhāyevāti vadati. Āpāyikā nivutabrahmalokāti
analyzed: ca etesu yuttā a nirāma gandhā ati etesu cuddasasu kilesesu yuttā pajā nirāma gandhā  na āma gandhā sa kuṇapa gandhā pūti gandhāya iva ati vadati āpāyikā nivuta brahma lokā iti
translated: Those who are entangled in these are not free from stench: the people who are entangled in these fourteen defilements are not free from stench,🔽they are not free from the stench of the birds and the stench of the corpse, they are just stinking.🔽They are bound for ruin, the path to the Brahmā-world is blocked:🔽but they are bound for ruin and the path to the Brahmā-world is blocked.

original: esā pana āpāyikā ceva hoti, paṭicchannabrahmalokamaggā cāti. Idaṃ pana suttaṃ kathentena
analyzed: esā pana āpāyikā ca iva hoti paṭicchanna brahma loka maggā ca ati idam pana suttam kathentena
translated: When he expounds this sutta,

original: āmagandhasuttena dīpetvā kathetabbaṃ, āmagandhasuttampi iminā dīpetvā kathetabbaṃ.
analyzed: āmagandha suttena dīpetvā kathetabbam āmagandha suttam pi iminā dīpetvā kathetabbam
translated: he should expound it by means of the “Stench Sutta,” and the “Stench Sutta” should be expounded by means of this one.

original: Te na sunimmadayāti te āmagandhā sunimmadayā sukhena nimmadetabbā pahātabbā na honti,
analyzed: te na sunimmadayā ati te āma gandhā sunimmadayā sukhena nimmadetabbā pahātabbā na honti
translated: They are not easily removed: these stenches are not easily removed, they are not easily got rid of, they are not easily done away with,

original: duppajahā dujjayāti attho. Yassa dāni bhavaṃ govindo kālaṃ maññatīti “yassā pabbajjāya
analyzed: duppajahā dujjayā ti atthaḥ yassa dāni bhavam govindo kālam maññati iti yassā pabbajjāya
translated: the meaning is, hard to abandon, hard to conquer. Now, good Gotama, the time you think fit is the time for me to go.🔽The meaning is, ‘Now, good Gotama, the time you think fit for your going forth is the time for me to go.

original: bhavaṃ govindo kālaṃ maññati, ayameva hotu, evaṃ sati mayhampi tava santike āgamanaṃ
analyzed: bhavam govindo kālam maññati ayam eva hotu evam sati mayham pi tava santike āgamanam
translated: Let it be so. If it is so, then my coming to you will be a good coming,

original: svāgamanaṃ bhavissati, kathitadhammakathā sukathitā bhavissati, tvaṃ tāta sakalajambudīpe
analyzed: su āgamanam bhavissati kathita dhamma kathā su kathitā bhavissati tvam tāta sakala jambudīpe
translated: and the talk on the Dhamma that you will give will be well given. You, sir, are the foremost man in the whole of India,

original: aggapuriso daharo paṭhamavaye ṭhito, evaṃ mahantaṃ nāma sampattisirivilāsaṃ pahāya
analyzed: agga purisaḥ daharaḥ paṭhama vaye ṭhitaḥ evam mahantam nāma sampatti siri vilāsam pahāya
translated: young, in the first stage of life, and you have abandoned such great prosperity, glory, and luxury,

original: tava pabbajanaṃ nāma gandhahatthino ayabandhanaṃ chinditvā gamanaṃ viya atiuḷāraṃ,
analyzed: tava pabbajanam nāma gandhahatthinaḥ aya bandhanam chinditvā gamanam viya ati uḷāram
translated: and your going forth is like an elephant in rut breaking its fetters and going away.

original: buddhatanti nāmesā”ti mahāpurisassa daḷhīkammaṃ katvā brahmā sanaṅkumāro brahmalokameva gato.🔽Reṇurājaāmantanāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: buddhatanti nāma isā ati mahā purisassa daḷhīkammam katvā brahmā sanak kumāraḥ brahma lokam eva gataḥ
translated: It is a great thing, sir, that you have done. It is a great thing, sir, that you have done.’ And after thus strengthening the Great Man’s resolve, the brahma Sanankumara went to the brahma world.

original: 321. Mahāpurisopi “mama itova nikkhamitvā pabbajanaṃ nāma na yuttaṃ, ahaṃ rājakulassa
analyzed: mahā purisaḥ api mama itas va nikkhamitvā pabbajanam nāma na yuttam aham rāja kulassa
translated: The Great Man thought: ‘It is not proper for me to go forth from here. I should go forth from the royal family.

original: atthaṃ anusāsāmi, tasmā rañño ārocessāmi. Sace sopi pabbajissati, sundarameva. No🔽ce pabbajissati, purohitaṭṭhānaṃ niyyātetvā ahaṃ pabbajissāmī”ti cintetvā rājānaṃ
analyzed: attham anusāsāmi tasmai raññaḥ ārocessāmi sace so api pabbajissati sundaram eva no  ce pabbajissati purohita ṭṭhānam niyyātetvā aham pabbajissāmi iti cintetvā rājānam
translated: I will advise him. If he goes forth, it will be good. If not,

original: upasaṅkami, tena vuttaṃ – “atha kho bho mahāgovindo,…pe… nāhaṃ porohacce rame”ti.
analyzed: upasaṅkami tena vuttam atha kho bho mahāgovinda upe na aham porohacce rameti
translated: I will give him the position of chaplain and then I will go forth.” After thinking thus, he approached the king. Therefore it is said: “Then, Master Mahāgovinda … ‘I do not delight in the chaplaincy.’“

original: Tattha tvaṃ pajānassu rajjenāti tava rajjena tvameva jānāhi. Nāhaṃ porohicce rameti ahaṃ purohitabhāve na ramāmi, ukkaṇṭhitosmi, aññaṃ anusāsakaṃ jānāhi, nāhaṃ porohicce rameti.
analyzed: tattha tvam pajānassu rajjena ati tava rajjena tvam eva jānāhi na aham porohicce rame iti aham purohita bhāve na ramāmi ukkaṇṭhitaḥ asmi aññam anusāsakam jānāhi na aham porohicce rame iti
translated: Herein, you should know about the kingdom means you should know about the kingdom yourself. I do not delight in the chaplaincy means I do not delight in the position of chaplain; I am dissatisfied with it; find another adviser; I do not delight in the chaplaincy.

original: Atha rājā – “dhuvaṃ cattāro māse paṭisallīnassa brāhmaṇassa gehe bhogā mandā jātā”ti
analyzed: atha rājā dhuvam cattāraḥ māse paṭisallīnassa brāhmaṇassa gehe bhogāḥ mandāḥ jātā ati
translated: Then the king thought: “Certainly the brahmin’s wealth has diminished during the four months he has been in seclusion.”

original: cintetvā dhanena nimantento – “sace te ūnaṃ kāmehi. Ahaṃ paripūrayāmi te”ti vatvā
analyzed: cintetvā dhanena sace te ūnam kāmehi aham paripūrayāmi te iti vatvā
translated: Thinking thus, he invited him with wealth, saying: “If your desires are incomplete, I will fulfill them for you.”

original: puna – “kinnu kho esa ekako viharanto kenaci vihiṃsito bhaveyyā”ti cintetvā,
analyzed: punar kinnu kho esaḥ ekakaḥ viharantaḥ kenacid vihiṃsitaḥ bhaveyya iti cintetvā
translated: Then he thought: “Perhaps he has been harmed by someone while living alone.”

original: “Yo taṃ hiṃsati vāremi, bhūmisenāpati ahaṃ;
analyzed: yaḥ tam hiṃsati vāremi bhūmi senāpati aham
translated: “I’ll protect him who harms you, I’m the lord of the earth’s army;

original: Tuvaṃ pitā ahaṃ putto, mā no govinda pājahī”ti. –
analyzed: tuvam pitā aham puttaḥ mā naḥ govinda pājahi iti
translated: You are the father, I am the son, don’t abandon us, O Govinda.”

original: Āha. Tassattho – yo taṃ hiṃsati, taṃ vāremi, kevalaṃ tumhe “asuko”ti ācikkhatha,
analyzed: āha tassa atthaḥ yaḥ tam hiṃsati tam vā āremi kevalam tumhe asukaḥ iti ācikkhatha
translated: The meaning is: I’ll protect him who harms you, just tell me who he is,

original: ahamettha kattabbaṃ jānissāmīti. Bhūmisenāpati ahanti atha vā ahaṃ pathaviyā sāmī,
analyzed: aham ettha kattabbam jānissāmi iti bhūmi senāpati ahanti atha vā aham pathaviyā sāmī
translated: I’ll know what to do. I’m the lord of the earth’s army,

original: svāhaṃ imaṃ rajjaṃ tumheyeva paṭicchāpessāmi. Tuvaṃ pitā ahaṃ puttoti tvaṃ pitiṭṭhāne🔽ṭhassasi, ahaṃ puttaṭṭhāne. So tvaṃ mama manaṃ haritvā attanoyeva manaṃ govinda,
analyzed: svāham imam rajjam paṭicchāpessāmi tuvam pitā aham putto ti tvam pitiṭṭhāne  ṭhassasi aham putta ṭṭhāne so tvam mama manam haritvā manam govinda
translated: I’ll give you this kingdom. You are the father, I am the son, you will be🔽in the position of father, I in the position of son. So you, having taken my mind, take your own mind, O Govinda,

original: pājehi; yathā icchasi tathā pavattassu. Ahaṃ pana tava manaṃyeva anuvattanto tayā
analyzed: yathā icchasi tathā aham pana tava tayā
translated: and abandon us, act as you wish. But I, following your mind,

original: dinnapiṇḍaṃ paribhuñjanto taṃ asicammahattho vā upaṭṭhahissāmi, rathaṃ vā te pājessāmi.
analyzed: dinna piṇḍam paribhuñjantaḥ tam asi camma hatthaḥ vā upaṭṭhahissāmi ratham vā te pājessāmi
translated: will serve you, either as a sword-bearer or as a charioteer, and will eat the food you give me.

original: “Mā no govinda, pajahī”ti vā pāṭho. Tassattho – tvaṃ pitiṭṭhāne tiṭṭha, ahaṃ puttaṭṭhāne
analyzed: mā naḥ govinda pajahi iti vā pāṭhaḥ tassa atthaḥ tvam piti ṭṭhāne tiṭṭha aham putta ṭṭhāne
translated: “Don’t abandon us, O Govinda,” is another reading. The meaning is: you be in the position of father, I in the position of son,

original: ṭhassāmi. Mā no tvaṃ bho govinda, pajahi, mā pariccajīti. Atha mahāpuriso yaṃ rājā🔽cintesi, tassa attani abhāvaṃ dassento –
analyzed: ṭhassāmi mā naḥ tvam bho govinda pajahi mā pariccaji iti atha mahā purisaḥ yam rājā  cintesi tassa attani abhāvam dassentaḥ
translated: “I will stay, good Gotama, do not abandon me, do not leave me.” Then the Great Man, showing the king that he did not have what the king had thought he had, said:

original: “Na matthi ūnaṃ kāmehi, hiṃsitā me na vijjati;
analyzed: na matthi ūnam kāmehi hiṃsitā me na vijjati
translated: “I have no lack of sensual desires, I have no one who is harmed,

original: Amanussavaco sutvā, tasmāhaṃ na gahe rame”ti. –
analyzed: amanussa vacaḥ sutvā tasmā aham na gahe rama iti
translated: Having heard the words of a non-human, therefore I do not delight in a home.”

original: Āha. Tattha na matthīti na me atthi. Gaheti gehe. Atha naṃ rājā pucchi –
analyzed: āha tattha na matthi iti na me atthi gahe iti gehe atha nam rājā pucchi
translated: He said. Herein, I have no lack means I have no lack of. Home means in a home. Then the king asked:

original: “Amanusso kathaṃ vaṇṇo, kiṃ te atthaṃ abhāsatha;
analyzed: amanussaḥ katham vaṇṇaḥ kim te attham abhāsatha
translated: “What was the appearance of the non-human, what did he say to you;

original: Yañca sutvā jahāsi no, gehe amhe ca kevalī”ti.
analyzed: yat ca sutvā jahāsi naḥ gehe amhe ca kevalī iti
translated: And having heard what, did you abandon us, and the home, and all?”

original: Tattha jahāsi no, gehe amhe ca kevalīti brāhmaṇassa sampattibharite gehe saṅgahavasena
analyzed: tattha jahāsi naḥ gehe amhe ca kevalī iti brāhmaṇassa sampatti bharite gehe saṅgaha vasena
translated: Herein, did you abandon us, and the home, and all means having made the home of the brahmin, which was filled with prosperity, his own home, through the means of inclusion,

original: attano gehe karonto yaṃ sutvā amhākaṃ gehe ca amhe ca kevalī sabbe aparisese jambudīpavāsino jahāsīti vadati.
analyzed: attanaḥ gehe karontaḥ yam sutvā amhākam gehe ca amhe ca kevalī sabbe aparisese jambudīpa vāsinaḥ jahāsi iti vadati
translated: having heard what, did you abandon us, and the home, and all, and all the people living in the Rose-Apple Island without exception, is what is said.

original: Athassa ācikkhanto mahāpuriso upavutthassa me pubbetiādimāha. Tattha upavutthassāti
analyzed: athassa ācikkhantaḥ mahā purisaḥ upavutthassa me pubba iti ādim āha tattha upavutthassa ati
translated: Then the Great Man, explaining to him, said: “When I was living the spiritual life,” and so on. Herein, when I was living the spiritual life means

original: cattāro māse ekībhāvaṃ upagantvā vutthassa. Yiṭṭhakāmassa me satoti yajitukāmassa🔽me samānassa. Aggi pajjalito āsi, kusapattaparitthatoti kusapattehi paritthato sappidadhimadhuādīni
analyzed: cattāraḥ māse ekībhāvam upagantvā vutthassa yiṭṭha kāmassa me sato ti yajitu kāmassa  me samānassa aggi pajjalitaḥ āsi kusa patta paritthato ti kusa pattehi paritthataḥ sappi dadhi madhu ādīni
translated: “I was one who wished to sacrifice”: I was one who wished to make a sacrifice.🔽“The fire was burning, covered with kusagrass”: The fire was burning, covered with kusagrass, and he had begun to light it, having put in it ghee, honey, etc.

original: pakkhipitvā aggi jalayitumāraddho āsi, evaṃ aggiṃ jāletvā “mahājanassa dānaṃ dassāmī”ti
analyzed: pakkhipitvā aggi jalayitum āraddhaḥ āsi evam aggim jāletvā mahājanassa dānam dassāmi iti
translated: In this way, having lit the fire, he thought, “I will give a gift to the people,”

original: evaṃ cintetvā ṭhitassa mamāti ayamettha attho.
analyzed: evam cintetvā ṭhitassa mama ati ayam ettha attho
translated: and he stood there. This is the meaning here.

original: Sanantanoti sanaṅkumāro brahmā. Tato rājā sayampi pabbajitukāmo hutvā saddahāmītiādimāha.
analyzed: sanantano ti sanam kumāraḥ brahmā tatas rājā sayam pi pabbajitu kāmaḥ hutvā saddahāmi iti ādim āha
translated: “Sanantanā” is Sanankumāra Brahmā. Then the king, having become desirous of going forth himself, said, “I believe,” etc.

original: Tattha kathaṃ vattetha aññathāti kathaṃ tumhe aññathā vattissatha. Te taṃ anuvattissāmāti
analyzed: tattha katham vattetha aññathā ati katham tumhe aññathā vattissatha te tam anuvattissāma ati
translated: Herein, how will you act otherwise? —how will you act differently? We will follow you —

original: te mayampi tumheyeva anuvattissāma, anupabbajissāmāti attho. “Anuvajissāmā”tipi pāṭho,
analyzed: te mayam pi tumheyeva anuvattissāma anupabbajissāma ati atthaḥ anuvajissāma atipi pāṭhaḥ
translated: we too will follow you, the meaning is that we will go forth after you. The reading anuvajissāma is also allowable;

original: tassa anugacchissāmāti attho. Akācoti nikkāco akakkaso. Govindassānusāsaneti tava
analyzed: tassa anugacchissāma ati atthaḥ akācaḥ iti nikkācaḥ akakkasaḥ govindassa anusāsanā iti tava
translated: the meaning is that we will go after you. Akāco — without deceit, without fraud. In the instruction of Govinda —

original: govindassa sāsane. Bhavantaṃ govindameva satthāraṃ karitvā carissāmāti vadati.
analyzed: govindassa sāsane bhavantam govindam eva satthāram karitvā carissāma ati vadati
translated: in the Dispensation of the Buddha Gotama. I will go forth under the Teacher Gotama.”

original: Cha khattiyaāmantanāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: cha khattiya āmantanā vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the six nobles’ invitations

original: 322. Yena te cha khattiyā tenupasaṅkamīti reṇuṃ rājānaṃ “sādhu mahārāja rajjaṃ nāma
analyzed: yena te cha khattiyā tena upasaṅkamīti reṇum rājānam sādhu mahā rāja rajjam nāma
translated: “He approached the six nobles” means that he approached the six nobles in order to encourage King Reṇu, thinking: “Great King, you have given up such a great royal glory

original: mātaraṃ pitaraṃ bhātibhaginīādayopi māretvā gaṇhantesu sattesu evaṃ mahantaṃ rajjasiriṃ
analyzed: mātaram pitaram bhāti bhaginī ādayaḥ api māretvā gaṇhantesu sattesu evam mahantam rajja sirim
translated: and wish to go forth, even though people who have killed their mother, father, and brother, sister, etc.,

original: pahāya pabbajitukāmena uḷāraṃ mahārājena kata”nti upatthambhetvā daḷhataramassa ussāhaṃ
analyzed: pahāya pabbajitu kāmena uḷāram mahā rājena katanti upatthambhetvā daḷhataram assa ussāham
translated: can still take it up again. You have done something very great.” He approached them in order to encourage him and to make his enthusiasm even stronger.

original: katvā upasaṅkami. Evaṃ samacintesunti rañño cintitanayeneva kadāci brāhmaṇassa bhogā
analyzed: katvā upasaṅkami evam samacintesunti rañño cinti tanayena iva kadāci brāhmaṇassa bhogā
translated: “They thought thus” means that they thought: “Sometimes the brahmin’s wealth might be lost.”

original: parihīnā bhaveyyunti maññamānā samacintesuṃ. Dhanena sikkheyyāmāti upalāpeyyāma saṅgaṇheyyāma.
analyzed: parihīnāḥ bhaveyyunti maññamānā samacintesum dhanena sikkheyyāma ati upalāpeyyāma saṅgaṇheyyāma
translated: “I will train him with wealth” means I will flatter him and win him over.

original: Tāvatakaṃ āharīyatanti tāvatakaṃ āharāpiyatu gaṇhiyatu, yattakaṃ icchatha, tattakaṃ
analyzed: tāvatakam tāvatakam āhara āpiyatu gaṇhiyatu yattakam icchatha tattakam
translated: “Let it be brought to that extent” means let it be brought, let it be taken to that extent, as much as you wish.

original: gaṇhathāti vuttaṃ hoti. Bhavantānaṃyeva vāhasāti bhavante paccayaṃ katvā, tumhehi
analyzed: gaṇhatha ati vuttam hoti bhavantānam yeva vāhasā ti bhavante paccayam katvā tumhehi
translated: “Take” is said. Or else: “Having made you the condition, you should exist.

original: dinnattāyeva pahūtaṃ sāpateyyaṃ jātaṃ.🔽323. Sace jahatha kāmānīti sace vatthukāme ca kilesakāme ca pariccajatha. Yattha
analyzed: dinnattāya iva pahūtam sāpateyyam jātam  sace jahatha kāmāni iti sace vatthu kāme ca kilesa kāme ca pariccajatha yattha
translated: “Take” means “accept.” “Through your having” means “through your having given them.”🔽“If you abandon sense desires” means “if you give up sense desires as objects and sense desires as defilements.”

original: satto puthujjanoti yesu kāmesu puthujjano satto laggo laggito. Ārambhavho daḷhā hothāti🔽evaṃ sante vīriyaṃ ārabhatha, asithilaparakkamataṃ adhiṭṭhāya daḷhā bhavatha. Khantībalasamāhitāti
analyzed: satto puthujjano ti yesu kāmesu puthujjanaḥ sattaḥ laggaḥ laggitaḥ ārambha vhaḥ daḷhāḥ hotha ati  evam sante vīriyam ārabhatha asithila parakkamatam adhiṭṭhāya daḷhāḥ bhavatha khantī bala samāhitā ati
translated: “Wherein the worldling is caught” means “wherein the ordinary man is caught, stuck, and entangled.”🔽“Be strong” means “in that case, be strong by undertaking unshakable valor.”

original: khantibalena samannāgatā bhavathāti rājūnaṃ ussāhaṃ janeti.🔽Esa maggo ujumaggoti esa karuṇājhānamaggo ujumaggo nāma. Esa maggo anuttaroti eseva
analyzed: khanti balena samannāgatāḥ bhavatha ati rājūnam ussāham janeti  esa maggo uju maggo ti esa karuṇā jhāna maggaḥ uju maggaḥ nāma esa maggaḥ anuttaraḥ ti eṣā iva
translated: “Endowed with the strength of patience” means “endowed with the strength of patience.” Thus he encourages the kings.

original: brahmalokūpapattiyā asadisamaggo uttamamaggo nāma. Saddhammo sabbhi rakkhitoti eso
analyzed: brahma loka upapattiyāḥ asadisa maggaḥ uttama maggaḥ nāma saddhammo sabbhi rakkhito ti eso
translated: “This is the straight path” means “this path of the jhāna of compassion is the straight path.” “This is the unsurpassed path” means “this is the unequalled path to rebirth in the Brahma-world, the supreme path.”

original: eva ca buddhapaccekabuddhasāvakehi sabbhirakkhitadhammo nāma. Iti karuṇājhānassa
analyzed: eva ca buddha paccekabuddha sāvakehi sabbhirakkhita dhammaḥ nāma iti karuṇā jhānassa
translated: “The true Dhamma is guarded by all” means “this Dhamma is guarded by Buddhas, Paccekabuddhas, and disciples, the Dhamma guarded by all.” Thus he encourages the kings.

original: vaṇṇabhaṇanenāpi tesaṃ anivattanatthāya daḷhīkammameva karoti.
analyzed: vaṇṇa bhaṇanena api tesam a nivattana atthāya daḷhīkammam eva karoti
translated: and by praising their beauty he strengthens them still further to prevent their turning back.🔽“Who, indeed, knows about life? “

original: Ko nu kho pana bho jānāti jīvitānanti bho jīvitaṃ nāma udakapupphuḷūpamaṃ tiṇagge
analyzed: kaḥ nu kho pana bho jānāti jīvitānanti bho jīvitam nāma udaka pupphuḷu upamam tiṇagge
translated: Life is like a water bubble, like a dewdrop on the grass,

original: ussāvabindūpamaṃ taṅkhaṇaviddhaṃsanadhammaṃ, tassa ko gatiṃ jānāti, kismiṃ khaṇe
analyzed: ussāva bindu upamam taṅkhaṇa viddha ṃsana dhammam tassa kaḥ gatim jānāti kismin khaṇe
translated: perishing at the very moment it comes into existence. Who knows its course? In what moment

original: bhijjissati? Gamanīyo samparāyoti paraloko pana avassaṃ gantabbova, tattha paṇḍitena
analyzed: bhijjissati gamanīyaḥ samparāyaḥ ti para lokaḥ pana avassam gantabbaḥ uva tattha paṇḍitena
translated: will it break up? “ ‘One must go to the next world’ means that one must certainly go to the other world. There the wise

original: kulaputtena mantāyaṃ boddhabbaṃ. Mantā vuccati paññā, tāya mantetabbaṃ bujjhitabbaṃ,
analyzed: kula puttena mantā ayam boddhabbam mantā vuccati paññā tāya mantetabbam bujjhitabbam
translated: noble disciple should reflect. ‘Reflection’ means wisdom. One should reflect, should understand,

original: upaparikkhitabbañca jānitabbañcāti attho. Karaṇatthe vā bhummaṃ. Mantāyaṃ boddhabbanti
analyzed: upaparikkhitabbam ca jānitabbam ca ati atthaḥ karaṇa tthe vā bhummam mantā ayam boddhabbanti
translated: should investigate, and should know. This is the meaning. Or it is in the locative case in the sense of instrument. ‘One should reflect’ means

original: mantāya bujjhitabbaṃ, ñāṇena jānitabbanti attho. Kiṃ bujjhitabbaṃ? Jīvitassa dujjānatā,
analyzed: mantāya bujjhitabbam ñāṇena jānitabbanti attho kim bujjhitabbam jīvitassa dujjāna tā
translated: one should understand by reflection, should know by knowledge. What should one understand? The difficulty of knowing life

original: samparāyassa ca avassaṃ gamanīyatā, bujjhitvā ca pana sabbapalibodhe chinditvā kattabbaṃ
analyzed: samparāyassa ca a vassam gamanīya tā bujjhitvā ca pana sabba palibodhe chinditvā kattabbam
translated: and the certainty of having to go to the other world. And having understood, one should cut off all hindrances and do what should be done.

original: kusalaṃ caritabbaṃ brahmacariyaṃ. Kasmā? Yasmā natthi jātassa amaraṇaṃ.
analyzed: kusalam caritabbam brahmacariyam kasmai yasmai natthi jātassa amaraṇam
translated: The life of purity is to be lived because there is no surmounting the inevitable.

original: Brāhmaṇamahāsālādīnaṃ āmantanāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: brāhmaṇa mahāsāla ādīnam āmantanā vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the invitation to the magnanimous brahmans, etc.

original: 324. Appesakkhā ca appalābhā cāti bho pabbajjā nāma appayasā ceva, pabbajitakālato
analyzed: appesakkhā ca appalābhā ca ati bho pabbajjā nāma appayasā ca iva pabbajita kālato
translated: “And the life of a wanderer is of little fruit and little profit”: for, from the time of going forth,

original: paṭṭhāya hi rajjaṃ pahāya pabbajitaṃ viheṭhetvā viheṭhetvā lāmakaṃ anāthaṃ katvāva
analyzed: paṭṭhāya hi rajjam pahāya pabbajitam viheṭhetvā viheṭhetvā lāmakam anātham katvā ava
translated: the wanderer is despised, despised, and made helpless by those who, having given up a kingdom, go forth.

original: kathenti. Appalābhā ca, sakalagāmaṃ caritvāpi ajjhoharaṇīyaṃ dullabhameva. Idaṃ pana
analyzed: kathenti appalābhā ca sakala gāmam caritvā api ajjhoharaṇīyam dullabham eva idam pana
translated: And it is of little profit, for even after wandering through the whole village, it is hard to get what is needed for sustenance.

original: brahmaññaṃ mahesakkhañca mahāyasattā, mahālābhañca lābhasakkārasampannattā. Bhavañhi🔽etarahi sakalajambudīpe aggapurohito sabbattha aggāsanaṃ aggodakaṃ aggabhattaṃ aggagandhaṃ🔽aggamālaṃ labhatīti.
analyzed: brahmaññam mahesakkham ca mahāyasa ttā mahā lābham ca lābha sakkāra sampanna ttā bhavan hi  etarahi sakala jambudīpe agga purohitaḥ sabbattha agga āsanam agga udakam agga bhattam agga gandham  agga mālam labhati iti
translated: But this brahmin life is of great fruit and great profit, for it is endowed with gain and honour.

original: Rājāva raññanti ahañhi bho etarahi pakatiraññaṃ majjhe cakkavattirājā viya. Brahmāva
analyzed: rājā ava raññanti ahañhi bho etarahi pakati raññam majjhe cakkavatti rājā viya brahmā ava
translated: For you, Master Gotama, are now the chief priest in all the country of the Rose-apple Wood, and you get the chief seat, the chief water, the chief food, the chief dwelling, the chief medicines that are needed.

original: brahmānanti pakatibrahmānaṃ majjhe mahābrahmasadiso. Devatāva gahapatikānanti avasesagahapatikānaṃ
analyzed: brahmānam anti pakati brahmānam majjhe mahābrahma sadisaḥ gahapatikānam anti avasesa gahapatikānam
translated: “Brahmā” is the ordinary Brahmās, like the Great Brahmā in the middle. “The gods and the householders” are the remaining householders.

original: panamhi sakkadevarājasadiso.
analyzed: sakka devarāja sadisaḥ
translated: The Brahmins were like the ordinary Brahmins, but he was like the Great Brahma in their midst. The other householders were like Sakka, King of the Gods, in my presence.

original: Bhariyānaṃ āmantanāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: bhariyānam āmantanā vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the exhortation to his wives.

original: 325. Cattārīsā bhariyā sādisiyoti sādisiyova cattārīsā bhariyā, aññā panassa tīsu vayesu nāṭakitthiyo bahukāyeva.
analyzed: cattārīsā bhariyā sādisiyā ti sādisiyā uva cattārīsā bhariyā aññā panassa tīsu vayesu nāṭakitthiyaḥ bahu kāya iva
translated: He had forty wives who were his equals: he had only forty wives who were his equals, but he had many hundreds of thousands of dancing-girls in the three watches of the night.

original: Mahāgovindapabbajjāvaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of Mahā-Govinda’s going forth.

original: 326. Cārikaṃ caratīti gāmanigamapaṭipāṭiyā cārikaṃ carati, gatagataṭṭhāne buddhakolāhalaṃ
analyzed: cārikam carati iti gāma nigama paṭipāṭiyā cārikam carati gata gata ṭṭhāne buddha kolāhalam
translated: He went on a tour: he went on a tour in regular order from village to village. Wherever he went there was a great commotion about the Buddha,

original: viya hoti. Manussā “mahāgovindapaṇḍito kira āgacchatī”ti sutvā puretarameva maṇḍapaṃ
analyzed: viya hoti manussāḥ mahāgovinda paṇḍitaḥ kiraḥ āgacchati iti sutvā puretaram eva maṇḍapam
translated: and when the people heard that “the wise man Mahā-Govinda is coming,” they had a pavilion erected beforehand,

original: kāretvā maggaṃ alaṅkaritvā paccuggantvā gaṇhitvā enti, mahālābhasakkāro mahogho viya
analyzed: kāretvā maggam alaṅkaritvā paccuggantvā gaṇhitvā enti mahā lābha sakkāraḥ mahā oghaḥ viya
translated: decorated the road, went out to meet him, took him, and went along. The great gain and honour that arose was like a great flood

original: ajjhottharanto uppajji. Sattapurohitassāti sattannaṃ rājūnaṃ purohitassa. Iti yathā
analyzed: ajjhottharantaḥ uppajji satta purohitassa ati sattannam rājūnam purohitassa iti yathā
translated: breaking in. The seven priests: the priests of the seven kings.

original: etarahi evarūpesu vā ṭhānesu kismiñcideva dukkhe uppanne “namo buddhassā”ti vadanti,
analyzed: etarahi evarūpesu vā ṭhānesu kismiñcid eva dukkhe uppanne namaḥ buddhassa ati vadanti
translated: At the present time, when some sort of suffering arises in such places as these, they say, “Honour to the Buddha!”

original: evaṃ tadā “namatthu mahāgovindassa brāhmaṇassa, namatthu sattapurohitassā”ti vadanti.
analyzed: evam tadā mahāgovindassa brāhmaṇassa namatthu satta purohitassa ati vadanti
translated: In the same way, at that time they said, “Honour to the Great Steward, the brahmin, honour to the priest of the seven clans.”

original: 327. Mettāsahagatenātiādinā nayena pāḷiyaṃ brahmavihārāva āgatā, mahāpuriso pana
analyzed: mettā sahagatena ati ādinā nayena pāḷiyam brahmavihārā ava āgatāḥ mahā purisaḥ pana
translated: The divine abidings are given in the text in the way beginning, “Endowed with loving-kindness” ,

original: sabbāpi aṭṭha samāpattiyo ca pañca ca abhiññāyo nibbattesi. Sāvakānañca brahmalokasahabyatāya
analyzed: sabbā api aṭṭha samāpattiyaḥ ca pañca ca abhiññāyaḥ nibbattesi sāvakānam ca brahma loka sahabya tāya
translated: but the Great Man produced all the eight liberations and the five kinds of supernormal knowledge.🔽And he taught the path to his disciples for companionship with the Brahmā-world,

original: maggaṃ desesīti brahmaloke brahmunā sahabhāvāya maggaṃ kathesi.
analyzed: maggam desesi iti brahma loke brahmunā sahabhāvāya maggam kathesi
translated: for companionship with Brahmā in the Brahmā-world.

original: 328. Sabbenasabbanti ye aṭṭha ca samāpattiyo pañca ca abhiññāyo nibbattesuṃ. Ye na
analyzed: sabbena sabbanti ye aṭṭha ca samāpattiyaḥ pañca ca abhiññāyaḥ nibbattesum ye na
translated: “All in every way”: those who produced the eight liberations and the five kinds of supernormal knowledge,🔽and those who did not understand the whole of the Dispensation,

original: sabbena sabbaṃ sāsanaṃ ājāniṃsūti ye aṭṭhasu samāpattīsu ekasamāpattimpi na jāniṃsu,
analyzed: sabbena sabbam sāsanam ājāniṃsu iti ye aṭṭhasu samāpattīsu eka samāpattim pi na jāniṃsu
translated: who did not know even one of the eight liberations,

original: na sakkhiṃsu nibbattetuṃ. Amoghāti savipākā. Avañjhāti na vañjhā. Sabbanihīnaṃ pasavanti
analyzed: na sakkhiṃsu nibbattetum amoghā ati sa vipākāḥ avañjhā ati na vañjhā sabba nihīnam pasavanti
translated: and were unable to produce it. “Not barren”: not fruitless. “Not barren”: not barren. “They produce the whole of what is low”:

original: gandhabbakāyaṃ pasavi. Saphalāti avasesadevalokūpapattīhi sātthā. Saudrayāti brahmalokūpapattiyā savuḍḍhi.
analyzed: gandhabba kāyam avasesa deva loka upapattīhi sātthā brahma loka upapattiyā
translated: and the host of gandhabbas. ‘With fruit’ means with the purpose of rebirth in the remaining divine worlds. ‘With increase’ means with the purpose of rebirth in the Brahma-world.

original: 329. Sarāmahanti sarāmi ahaṃ pañcasikha, iminā kira padena ayaṃ suttanto buddhabhāsito
analyzed: sarāmahanti sarāmi aham pañcasikhaḥ iminā kira padena ayam suttantaḥ buddha bhāsito
translated: ‘I delight in it’ means I delight in it, Pañcasikha, with this expression, it seems, this sutta came to be called ‘The Delight in the Dhamma’.

original: nāma jāto. Na nibbidāyāti na vaṭṭe nibbindanatthāya. Na virāgāyāti na vaṭṭe virāgatthāya.
analyzed: nāma jātaḥ na nibbidāya ati na vaṭṭe nibbindana tthāya na virāgāya ati na vaṭṭe virāga tthāya
translated: ‘Not for disenchantment’ means not for the purpose of disenchantment with the round. ‘Not for dispassion’ means not for the purpose of dispassion towards the round.

original: Na nirodhāyāti na vaṭṭassa nirodhatthāya. Na upasamāyāti na vaṭṭassa upasamanatthāya.
analyzed: na nirodhāya ati na vaṭṭassa nirodha tthāya na upasamāya ati na vaṭṭassa upasamana tthāya
translated: ‘Not for cessation’ means not for the purpose of the cessation of the round. ‘Not for peace’ means not for the purpose of the pacification of the round.

original: Na abhiññāyāti na vaṭṭaṃ abhijānanatthāya. Na sambodhāyāti na kilesaniddāvigamena
analyzed: na abhiññāya ati na vaṭṭam abhijānana tthāya na sambodhāya ati na kilesa niddā vigamena
translated: ‘Not for direct knowledge’ means not for the purpose of the direct knowledge of the round. ‘Not for full understanding’ means not for the purpose of awakening from the sleep of defilements

original: vaṭṭato pabujjhanatthāya. Na nibbānāyāti na amatanibbānatthāya.
analyzed: vaṭṭataḥ pabujjhana tthāya na nibbānāya ati na amata nibbāna tthāya
translated: and for arousing from the round. ‘Not for Nibbāna’ means not for the purpose of the deathless Nibbāna.

original: Ekantanibbidāyāti ekantameva vaṭṭe nibbindanatthāya. Ettha pana nibbidāyāti vipassanā.
analyzed: ekanta nibbidāya ati ekantam eva vaṭṭe nibbindana tthāya ettha pana nibbidāya ati vipassanā
translated: ‘For complete disenchantment’ means for the purpose of complete disenchantment with the round. Herein, ‘for disenchantment’ is insight;

original: Virāgāyāti maggo. Nirodhāya upasamāyāti nibbānaṃ. Abhiññāya sambodhāyāti maggo. Nibbānāyāti
analyzed: virāgāya ati maggaḥ nirodhāya upasamāyāti nibbānam abhiññāya sambodhāya ati maggaḥ nibbānāya ati
translated: ‘for dispassion’ is the path; ‘for cessation’ and ‘for peace’ are Nibbāna. ‘For direct knowledge’ and ‘for full understanding’ are the path. ‘For Nibbāna’ is

original: nibbānameva. Evaṃ ekasmiṃ ṭhāne vipassanā, tīsu maggo, tīsu nibbānaṃ vuttanti evaṃ
analyzed: nibbānam eva evam ekasmin ṭhāne vipassanā tīsu maggo tīsu nibbānam vuttan ti evam
translated: and Nibbāna. Thus insight is spoken of in one place, the path in three, and Nibbāna in three. This is how the exposition should be understood here.

original: vavatthānakathā veditabbā. Pariyāyena pana sabbānipetāni maggavevacanānipi nibbānavevacanānipi
analyzed: vavatthāna kathā veditabbā pariyāyena pana magga vevacanāni pi nibbāna vevacanāni pi
translated: But all these terms are also synonyms for the path and for Nibbāna.

original: hontiyeva. Sammādiṭṭhiādīsu yaṃ vattabbaṃ, taṃ visuddhimagge saccavaṇṇanāyaṃ vuttameva.🔽330. Ye na sabbenasabbanti ye cattāropi ariyamagge paripūretuṃ na jānanti, tīṇi vā
analyzed: sammādiṭṭhi ādīsu yam vattabbam tam visuddhimagge sacca vaṇṇanāyam vuttam eva  ye na ye cattāraḥ api ariya magge paripūretum na jānanti tīṇi vā
translated: What should be said about right view, etc., has already been said in the Description of the Truths.🔽“Those who do not fulfill all four noble paths or three or two or one” are those who do not know how to fulfill all four noble paths or three or two or one and who produce only one.

original: dve vā ekaṃ vā nibbattenti. Sabbesaṃyeva imesaṃ kulaputtānanti brahmacariyaciṇṇakulaputtānaṃ.
analyzed: dve vā ekam vā nibbattenti sabbesam yeva imesam kula puttānam ti brahmacariya ciṇṇa kula puttānam
translated: “Of all these sons of good family” who have practiced the holy life.

original: Amoghā…pe… saphalā saudrayāti arahattanikūṭena desanaṃ niṭṭhāpesi.
analyzed: amoghāpe saphalā saudrayāti arahatta nikūṭena desanam niṭṭhāpesi
translated: “Not in vain” … “fruitful and of great benefit” : he concluded the teaching with the peak of the arahants.

original: Bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvāti bhagavato dhammadesanaṃ cittena sampaṭicchanto
analyzed: bhagavantam abhivādetvā padakkhiṇam katvā ati bhagavataḥ dhamma desanam cittena sampaṭicchanto
translated: “Having paid homage to the Blessed One and circumambulating him, keeping him to his right” : approving of the Blessed One’s teaching with his mind,

original: abhinanditvā vācāya pasaṃsamāno anumoditvā mahantaṃ añjaliṃ sirasmiṃ patiṭṭhapetvā
analyzed: abhinanditvā vācāya pasaṃsamānaḥ anumoditvā mahantam añjalim sirasmim patiṭṭhapetvā
translated: or rejoicing in it with speech, he placed his folded hands on his head and

original: mutto muttaparivāro ativiya virocatīti. Vaṇṇabhūmi nāmesā, yattakaṃ sakkoti, tattakaṃ
analyzed: muttaḥ mutta parivāraḥ ativiya virocati iti vaṇṇabhūmi nāma esā yattakam sakkoti tattakam
translated: free from passion, with a retinue free from passion, free from hate, with a retinue free from hate, free from delusion, with a retinue free from delusion, free from longing, with a retinue free from longing, free from defilements, with a retinue free from defilements, calm, with a calm retinue, tamed, with a tamed retinue, liberated, with a liberated retinue, shone forth all the more. This is called the plane of beauty. As much as one can,

analyzed: vattabbam iti ime bhikkhū sandhāya vuttam pañcamattehi bhikkhu satehi sabbehi eva arahantehi iti  yebhuyyena ati bahutarā sannipatitā mandā na sannipatitā asaññā arūpāvacara devatā
translated: “It should be said thus: ‘With five hundred bhikkhus, all of them arahants.’🔽“For the most part” means that more assembled, but a few did not assemble. The immaterial-sphere deities and the deities of the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception were in attainment.

original: samāpannadevatā ca. Tatrāyaṃ sannipātakkamo mahāvanassa kira sāmantā devatā caliṃsu
analyzed: samāpanna devatā ca tatra ayam sannipāta kkamaḥ mahā vanassa kira sāmantāḥ devatāḥ caliṃsu
translated: The order of their assembly was this. Deities from all around the Great Wood began to stir,

original: – “āyāma, bho buddhadassanaṃ nāma bahūpakāraṃ, dhammassavanaṃ bahūpakāraṃ, bhikkhusaṅghadassanaṃ
analyzed: āyāma bho buddhadassanam nāma bahu upakāram dhammassavanam bahu upakāram bhikkhu saṅgha dassanam
translated: saying: “Come, friends, seeing the Buddha is very helpful, hearing the Dhamma of the bhikkhu Saṅgha is very helpful,

original: bahūpakāraṃ, āyāma āyāmā”ti mahāsaddaṃ kurumānā āgantvā bhagavantañca taṃmuhuttaṃ🔽arahattappattakhīṇāsave ca vanditvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhaṃsu. Eteneva upāyena tāsaṃ tāsaṃ
analyzed: bahu upakāram āyāmaḥ āyāma iti mahā saddam kurumānāḥ āgantvā bhagavantam ca tat muhuttam  arahatta patta khīṇa āsave ca vanditvā ekamantam etena iva upāyena tāsam tāsam
translated: Come, friends, come!” Making a great noise, they came and worshipped the Blessed One and the newly-become arahants and the bhikkhus who had destroyed the taints.🔽Then they stood at one side. In the same way, hearing the noise of those deities,

original: saddaṃ sutvā saddantaraaḍḍhagāvutagāvutaaḍḍhayojanayojanādivasena tiyojanasahassavitthate
analyzed: saddam sutvā ti yojana sahassa vitthate
translated: other deities from a distance of half a league, a league, a league and a half, two leagues, three leagues, four leagues, five leagues, ten leagues, twenty leagues, thirty leagues, forty leagues, fifty leagues, a hundred leagues, two hundred leagues, three hundred leagues, four hundred leagues, five hundred leagues, a thousand leagues, and even from a distance of two thousand leagues, came and worshipped the Blessed One and the newly-become arahants and the bhikkhus who had destroyed the taints.

original: himavante, tikkhattuṃ tesaṭṭhiyā nagarasahassesu, navanavutiyā doṇamukhasatasahassesu,🔽channavutiyā paṭṭanakoṭisatasahassesu, chapaṇṇāsāya ratanākaresūti sakalajambudīpe,
analyzed: himavante tikkhattum tesaṭṭhiyāḥ nagara sahassesu nava navutiyāḥ doṇa mukha sata sahassesu  channavutiyā paṭṭana koṭi sata sahassesu ratanākaresu uti sakala jambudīpe
translated: in the Himalayas, in the thirty-six thousand cities, in the nine hundred and ninety-two thousand and eighty million villages,🔽in the sixty-five hundred thousand and eight hundred million towns, in the ninety-six hundred thousand and eight hundred million markets, in the ninety-six hundred thousand and eight hundred million fairs, in the ninety-six hundred thousand and eight hundred million countries, in the ninety-six hundred thousand and eight hundred million provinces, in the ninety-six hundred thousand and eight hundred million districts, in the ninety-six hundred thousand and eight hundred million villages, in the ninety-six hundred thousand and eight hundred million cities, in the ninety-six hundred thousand and eight hundred million royal cities, in the ninety-six hundred thousand and eight hundred million countries of the Rose-Apple Island,

original: pubbavidehe, aparagoyāne, uttarakurumhi, dvīsu parittadīpasahassesūti sakalacakkavāḷe,🔽tato dutiyatatiyacakkavāḷeti evaṃ dasasahassacakkavāḷesu devatā sannipatitāti veditabbā.
analyzed: pubbavidehe aparagoyāne uttarakurumhi dvīsu paritta dīpa sahassesu uti sakala cakkavāḷe  tatas dutiya tatiya cakkavāḷā iti evam dasa sahassa cakkavāḷesu devatā sannipatitā ati veditabbā
translated: in the countries of the Further-Indies, in the countries of Uttarakuru, in the two thousand small islands—in the whole universe,🔽and then in the second and third universes, and so on—in the ten thousand universes, the deities assembled.

original: Dasasahassacakkavāḷañhi idha dasalokadhātuyoti adhippetā. Tena vuttaṃ – “dasahi ca🔽lokadhātūhi devatā yebhuyyena sannipatitā hontī”ti.
analyzed: dasa sahassa cakkavāḷam hi idha dasa lokadhātuyaḥ ti adhippetā tena vuttam dasahi ca  devatāḥ yebhuyyena sannipatitāḥ honti iti
translated: For the ten thousand universes here are intended by the expression “ten world-spheres.” Hence it is said, “The deities of the ten world-spheres have assembled in the great system of a thousand million worlds.”

original: Evaṃ sannipatitāhi devatāhi sakalacakkavāḷagabbhaṃ yāva brahmalokā sūcighare nirantaraṃ
analyzed: evam sannipatitāhi devatāhi sakala cakkavāḷa gabbham yāva brahma lokā sūci ghare nirantaram
translated: And when the deities have assembled in this way, the whole of the universe, including the Brahmā-world, is filled as if by a swarm of locusts.

original: pakkhittasūcīhi viya paripuṇṇaṃ hoti. Tatra brahmalokassa evaṃ uccattanaṃ veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: pakkhitta sūcīhi viya paripuṇṇam hoti tatra brahma lokassa evam uccattanam veditabbam
translated: The height of the Brahmā-world should be understood thus.

original: Lohapāsāde kira sattakūṭāgārasamo pāsāṇo brahmaloke ṭhatvā adho khitto catūhi māsehi
analyzed: loha pāsāde kira satta kūṭāgāra samaḥ pāsāṇaḥ brahma loke ṭhatvā adhas khitto catūhi māsehi
translated: It seems that a stone the size of a domed granary would take four months to reach the earth if dropped from the Brahmā-world.

original: pathaviṃ pāpuṇāti. Evaṃ mahante okāse yathā heṭṭhā ṭhatvā khittāni pupphāni vā dhūmo
analyzed: pathavim pāpuṇāti evam mahante okāse yathā heṭṭhā ṭhatvā khittāni pupphāni vā dhūmaḥ
translated: So great was the space between the gods, yet just as flowers or smoke thrown down from above

original: vā upari gantuṃ, upari vā ṭhatvā khittasāsapā heṭṭhā otarituṃ antaraṃ na labhanti,
analyzed: vā upari gantum upari vā ṭhatvā khitta sāsapāḥ heṭṭhā otaritum antaram na labhanti
translated: cannot go through the space and reach the earth below, or as mustard seeds thrown down from above cannot go through the space and reach the earth below,🔽so too the gods were so close together that there was no space between them.

original: evaṃ nirantaraṃ devatā ahesuṃ. Yathā kho pana cakkavattirañño nisinnaṭṭhānaṃ asambādhaṃ
analyzed: evam nirantaram devatāḥ ahesum yathā kho pana cakkavatti raññaḥ nisinna ṭṭhānam a sambādham
translated: And just as the place where a universal monarch sits is not crowded

original: hoti, āgatāgatā mahesakkhā khattiyā okāsaṃ labhantiyeva, parato parato pana atisambādhaṃ🔽hoti, evameva bhagavato nisinnaṭṭhānaṃ asambādhaṃ, āgatāgatā mahesakkhā devatā ca
analyzed: hoti āgata āgatāḥ mahesakkhāḥ khattiyāḥ okāsam paratas paratas pana ati sambādham  hoti evam eva bhagavataḥ nisinna ṭhānam asambādham āgata āgatā mahesakkhā devatā ca
translated: though mighty nobles come and get a place,

original: mahābrahmāno ca okāsaṃ labhantiyeva. Apisudaṃ bhagavato āsannāsannaṭṭhāne mahāparinibbāne
analyzed: mahābrahmāno ca okāsam bhagavato āsanna āsanna ṭhāne mahā parinibbāne
translated: so too the place where the Blessed One sat was not crowded though mighty gods and Great Brahmās came and got a place.

original: vuttanayeneva vālaggakoṭinitudanamatte padese dasapi vīsampi sabbaparato tiṃsampi
analyzed: vutta nayena iva vālagga koṭi nitudana matte padese dasa pi vīsam pi sabba paratas tiṃsam pi
translated: And in the place near the Blessed One, in the space of a plough-yoke, thirty gods of the same age and thirty more of different ages

original: devatā sukhume sukhume attabhāve māpetvā aṭṭhaṃsu. Saṭṭhi saṭṭhi devatā aṭṭhaṃsu.🔽Suddhāvāsakāyikānanti suddhāvāsavāsīnaṃ. Suddhāvāsā nāma suddhānaṃ anāgāmikhīṇāsavānaṃ
analyzed: devatā sukhume sukhume attabhāve māpetvā aṭṭhaṃsu saṭṭhi saṭṭhi devatāḥ aṭṭhaṃsu  suddhāvāsa kāyikānam ti suddhāvāsa vāsīnam suddhāvāsāḥ nāma suddhānam anāgāmi khīṇāsavānam
translated: and they assumed subtle and very subtle bodies and stood there. Sixty deities stood there.🔽“The deities of the Suddhāvāsa realm”: those who dwell in the Suddhāvāsa realms. The Suddhāvāsa realms are the five Brahma worlds of the non-returners and those with cankers destroyed.

original: āvāsā pañca brahmalokā. Etadahosīti kasmā ahosi? Te kira brahmāno samāpattiṃ samāpajjitvā
analyzed: pañca brahma lokāḥ etat ahosi iti kasmai ahosi te kira brahmānaḥ samāpattim samāpajjitvā
translated: “This occurred”: why did it occur? It seems that those Brahmās, after attaining jhāna,

original: yathāparicchedena vuṭṭhitā brahmabhavanaṃ olokentā pacchābhatte bhattagehaṃ viya
analyzed: yathā paricchedena vuṭṭhitā brahmabhavanam olokentā pacchābhatte bhatta geham viya
translated: emerged from it after the time they had intended and, looking at the Brahma mansions, saw them empty, like a house after the guests have departed.

original: suññataṃ addasaṃsu. Tato “kuhiṃ brahmāno gatā”ti āvajjantā mahāsamāgamaṃ ñatvā –
analyzed: suññatam addasaṃsu tatas kuhim brahmānaḥ gatāti āvajjantāḥ mahā samāgamam ñatvā
translated: Then, wondering, “Where have the Brahmās gone?” they became aware of the great gathering and thought,

original: “ayaṃ samāgamo mahā, mayaṃ ohīnā, ohīnakānaṃ okāso dullabho hoti, tasmā gacchantā
analyzed: ayam samāgamaḥ mahā mayam okāsaḥ dullabhaḥ hoti tasmai gacchantā
translated: “This gathering is great. We have been left out. It is difficult to get a place among those who have been left out. Therefore, when we go,

original: atucchahatthā hutvā ekekaṃ gāthaṃ abhisaṅkharitvā gacchāma. Tāya mahāsamāgame ca
analyzed: a tuccha hatthāḥ hutvā ekekam gātham abhisaṅkharitvā gacchāma tāya mahā samāgame ca
translated: we will go after composing each a verse, not going empty-handed. In that way we will make known our presence at the great gathering

original: attano āgatabhāvaṃ jānāpessāma, dasabalassa ca vaṇṇaṃ bhāsissāmā”ti. Iti tesaṃ samāpattito
analyzed: attanaḥ āgata bhāvam jānāpessāma dasabalassa ca vaṇṇam bhāsissāma ati iti tesam samāpattitaḥ
translated: and we will extol the qualities of the One of Ten Powers.” Thus, when they emerged from jhāna,

original: vuṭṭhāya āvajjitattā etadahosi.
analyzed: vuṭṭhāya āvajjita ttā etat ahosi
translated: and he thought thus because he had adverted to it after emerging from it.

original: 332. Bhagavato purato pāturahesunti pāḷiyaṃ bhagavato santike abhimukhaṭṭhāneyeva
analyzed: bhagavato puratas pāḷiyam bhagavato santike
translated: ‘He will appear in the presence of the Blessed One’: in the text this is said as if he had descended in the very place where the Blessed One was;

original: otiṇṇā viya katvā vuttā, na kho panettha evaṃ attho veditabbo. Te pana brahmaloke🔽ṭhitāyeva gāthā abhisaṅkharitvā eko puratthimacakkavāḷamukhavaṭṭiyaṃ otari, eko dakkhiṇacakkavāḷamukhavaṭṭiyaṃ,
analyzed: otiṇṇāḥ viya katvā vuttāḥ na kho pana ittha evam atthaḥ veditabbo te pana brahma loke  ṭhitāya iva gāthāḥ abhisaṅkharitvā ekaḥ puratthima cakkavāḷa mukha vaṭṭiyam otari ekaḥ dakkhiṇa cakkavāḷa mukha vaṭṭiyam
translated: but the meaning should not be regarded in this way. For they remained in the Brahmā-world itself

original: eko pacchimacakkavāḷamukhavaṭṭiyaṃ, eko uttaracakkavāḷamukhavaṭṭiyaṃ otari. Tato
analyzed: ekaḥ pacchima cakkavāḷa mukha vaṭṭiyam ekaḥ uttara cakkavāḷa mukha vaṭṭiyam otari tato
translated: and composed the stanzas, one of them descending in the eastern direction at the rim of the world-sphere, one in the southern direction, one in the western direction, and one in the northern direction.

original: puratthimacakkavāḷamukhavaṭṭiyaṃ otiṇṇabrahmā nīlakasiṇaṃ samāpajjitvā nīlarasmiyo
analyzed: puratthima cakkavāḷa mukha vaṭṭiyam otiṇṇa brahmā nīlakasiṇam samāpajjitvā nīla rasmiyaḥ
translated: Then the Brahmā who had descended in the eastern direction entered upon the blue kasiṇa jhāna and emitted blue rays

original: vissajjitvā dasasahassacakkavāḷadevatānaṃ maṇicammaṃ paṭimuñcanto viya attano āgatabhāvaṃ
analyzed: vissajjitvā dasa sahassa cakkavāḷa devatānam maṇi cammam paṭimuñcantaḥ viya attanaḥ āgata bhāvam
translated: and announced his arrival to the deities of the ten thousand world-systems as if he were putting out a notice to say that the jewel of his own person was for sale.🔽The Buddha’s path, however, cannot be entered by anyone;

original: jānāpetvā buddhavīthi nāma kenaci ottharituṃ na sakkā, tasmā pahaṭabuddhavīthiyāva
analyzed: jānāpetvā buddhavīthi nāma kenacid ottharitum na sakkā tasmā pahaṭa buddhavīthiyā ava
translated: so he announced his arrival only as far as the Buddha’s path.

original: āgantvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhāsi. Ekamantaṃ ṭhito attanā abhisaṅkhataṃ gāthaṃ abhāsi.
analyzed: āgantvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam aṭṭhāsi ekamantam ṭhitaḥ attanā abhisaṅkhatam gātham abhāsi
translated: and after worshipping the Fortunate One he stood at one side. While standing there he recited the verse he had composed.

original: Dakkhiṇacakkavāḷamukhavaṭṭiyaṃ otiṇṇabrahmāpi pītakasiṇaṃ samāpajjitvā pītarasmiyo
analyzed: dakkhiṇa cakkavāḷa mukha vaṭṭiyam otiṇṇa brahmā api pīta kasiṇam samāpajjitvā pīta rasmiyaḥ
translated: The Brahmā who had descended from the Eastern Direction of the Universe, after attaining the yellow kasiṇa, released yellow rays

original: suvaṇṇapabhaṃ muñcitvā dasasahassacakkavāḷadevatānaṃ suvaṇṇapaṭaṃ pārupento viya
analyzed: suvaṇṇa pabham muñcitvā dasa sahassa cakkavāḷa devatānam suvaṇṇa paṭam pārupentaḥ viya
translated: and after emitting a golden radiance, as if he was covering the ten thousand world-element with a golden cloth,

original: attano āgatabhāvaṃ jānāpetvā tatheva aṭṭhāsi. Pacchimacakkavāḷamukhavaṭṭiyaṃ otiṇṇabrahmāpi
analyzed: attanaḥ āgata bhāvam jānāpetvā tathā iva aṭṭhāsi pacchima cakkavāḷa mukha vaṭṭiyam otiṇṇa brahmā api
translated: after making known his arrival, stood there in the same place. The Brahmā who had descended from the Western Direction of the Universe, after attaining the red kasiṇa, released red rays

original: lohitakasiṇaṃ samāpajjitvā lohitarasmiyo muñcitvā dasasahassacakkavāḷadevatānaṃ rattavarakambalena
analyzed: lohita kasiṇam samāpajjitvā lohita rasmiyaḥ muñcitvā dasa sahassa cakkavāḷa devatānam ratta vara kambalena
translated: and after emitting a red radiance, as if he was covering the ten thousand world-element with a red blanket,

original: parikkhipanto viya attano āgatabhāvaṃ jānāpetvā tatheva aṭṭhāsi. Uttaracakkavāḷamukhavaṭṭiyaṃ
analyzed: parikkhipantaḥ viya attanaḥ āgata bhāvam jānāpetvā tathā iva aṭṭhāsi uttara cakkavāḷa mukha vaṭṭiyam
translated: after making known his arrival, stood there in the same place. The Brahmā who had descended from the Northern Direction of the Universe, after attaining the white kasiṇa, released white rays

original: otiṇṇabrahmāpi odātakasiṇaṃ samāpajjitvā odātarasmiyo muñcitvā dasasahassacakkavāḷadevatānaṃ
analyzed: otiṇṇabrahmā api odāta kasiṇam samāpajjitvā odāta rasmiyaḥ muñcitvā dasa sahassa cakkavāḷa devatānam
translated: and after emitting a white radiance, as if he was covering the ten thousand world-element with a white blanket,

original: sumanapaṭaṃ pārupanto viya attano āgatabhāvaṃ jānāpetvā tatheva aṭṭhāsi.
analyzed: sumana paṭam pārupantaḥ viya attanaḥ āgata bhāvam jānāpetvā tathā iva aṭṭhāsi
translated: and stood there as if to announce his arrival by wearing a flower-garland.

original: Pāḷiyaṃ pana “bhagavato purato pāturahesuṃ. Atha kho tā devatā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā🔽ekamantaṃ aṭṭhaṃsū”ti evaṃ ekakkhaṇaṃ viya purato pātubhāvo ca abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ
analyzed: pāḷiyam pana bhagavataḥ puratas atha khalu tāḥ devatāḥ bhagavantam abhivādetvā  ekamantam evam eka khaṇam viya puratas pātubhāvaḥ ca abhivādetvā ekamantam
translated: But in the text it is said: “They appeared in front of the Blessed One. Then those deities saluted the Blessed One and

original: ṭhitabhāvo ca vutto, so iminā anukkamena ahosi, ekato katvā pana dassito. Gāthābhāsanaṃ
analyzed: ṭhita bhāvaḥ ca vutto so iminā anukkamena ahosi ekatas katvā pana dassitaḥ gāthā bhāsanam
translated: stood at one side” . The appearance in front at one moment and the saluting and standing at one side are stated separately in the text, but they occurred in this sequence. They are shown as one because they are stated separately in the text.

original: pana pāḷiyaṃ visuṃ visuṃyeva vuttaṃ.🔽Tattha mahāsamayoti mahāsamūho. Pavanaṃ vuccati vanasaṇḍo. Ubhayenapi bhagavā imasmiṃ
analyzed: pana pāḷiyam visum visum yeva vuttam  tattha mahā samayaḥ ti mahā samūho pavanam vuccati vana saṇḍaḥ ubhayena api bhagavā imasmin
translated: But the utterance of the stanzas is stated separately in the text.🔽Herein, great gathering means a great multitude. A forest grove is what is meant by wood. With both words the Blessed One means to say: “Today there is a great multitude, a great gathering, in this wood.”

original: vanasaṇḍe ajja mahāsamūho mahāsannipātoti āha. Tato yesaṃ so sannipāto, te dassetuṃ
analyzed: vana saṇḍe ajja mahā samūhaḥ mahā sannipāto ti āha tatas yesam saḥ sannipāto te dassetuṃ
translated: Then, in order to show those who are the gathering, he said:

original: devakāyā samāgatāti āha. Tattha devakāyāti devaghaṭā. Āgatamha imaṃ dhammasamayanti
analyzed: deva kāyā samāgatā iti āha tattha deva kāyā ati deva ghaṭāḥ āgatamha imam dhammasamayan ti
translated: “The hosts of gods have come together.” Herein, hosts of gods is a gathering of gods. We have come to this Dhamma gathering.

original: evaṃ samāgate devakāye disvā mayampi imaṃ dhammasamūhaṃ āgatā. Kiṃ kāraṇā? Dakkhitāye
analyzed: evam samāgate deva kāye disvā mayam pi imam dhamma samūham āgatā kim kāraṇā
translated: Having seen the assembly of gods thus gathered, we too have come to this collection of Dhamma. Why?

original: aparājitasaṅghaṃ, kenaci aparājitaṃ ajjeva tayo māre madditvā vijitasaṅgāmaṃ imaṃ
analyzed: aparājita saṅgham kenacid aparājitam ajjā iva vijita saṅgāmam imam
translated: To see the invincible Saṅgha, which is invincible by anyone. Today, having crushed the three Māras, having won the battle, we have come to see this invincible Saṅgha.

original: aparājitasaṅghaṃ dassanatthāya āgatamhāti attho. So pana brahmā imaṃ gāthaṃ bhāsitvā
analyzed: aparājita saṅgham dassana thāya āgatamha ati attho saḥ pana brahmā imam gātham bhāsitvā
translated: The meaning is: we have come to see the Saṅgha which is invincible. Having spoken this verse,

original: dassanatthāya āgato.
analyzed: dassana tthāya āgataḥ
translated: Kumbhīro rājagahiko, Sopāgā samitiṃ vanaṃ: That Kumbhīra, together with his retinue, has come to this forest to see the assembly of bhikkhus.
